original: de nas slob dpon gyis slob ma lag pa g-yon pa nas bskyod cing las kyi rdo rje can dang lhan cig bskor ba byas nas byang gi sgor khrid do der lus rnam par dag pa'i don du sgrol ma la sogs pa lha mo rnams kyi sngags kyis bum
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis slob ma lag pa g-yon pa nas bskyod cing las kyi rdo rje can dang lhan cig bskor ba byas nas byang gi sgor khrid do der lus rnam par dag pa'i don du sgrol ma la sogs pa lha mo rnams kyi sngags kyis bum
translated: Then the master, moving from the left hand, should lead the disciple around, together with the vajra master, and lead him to the northern door.🔽There, for the sake of purifying the body, the disciple should drink the vase water with the mantra of Tārā and so forth.🔽

original: pa thams cad nas chu blangs la rnam par rgyal ba'i dung du blugs nas slar yang skye ba'i gnas lngar sngags 'dis chu'i dbang gis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: pa thams cad nas chu blangs la rnam par rgyal ba'i dung du blugs nas slar yang skye ba'i gnas lngar sngags 'dis chu'i dbang gis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Then the master, moving from the disciple’s left hand, should circumambulate with the disciples and the vajra master, and lead them to the northern door. There, for the sake of purifying the body, the disciple should be empowered with the water of all the vases, taking up the water with the mantra of Tārā and so forth, the goddesses, and pouring it into the victorious conch. Again, in the five places of birth, he should be empowered with the water empowerment with this mantra:

original: aom a'a a'i r'i a'u l'i panytsa dh'a tu bi sho dha ni sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
analyzed: aom a'a a'i r'i a'u l'i panytsa dh'a tu bi sho dha ni sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
translated: “Oṃ ā ī rī ū lī pañca dhātu viśodhani svāhā.”

original: de nas cod pan gyi dbang la skye ba'i gnas lngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas cod pan gyi dbang la skye ba'i gnas lngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Then, for the crown empowerment, in the five places of birth, he should be empowered with this mantra:

original: aom aa ai ri au li panytsa ta th'a ga ta pa ri shuda dha sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
analyzed: aom aa ai ri au li panytsa ta th'a ga ta pa ri shuda dha sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
translated: “Oṃ a ai ri u li pañca tathāgata pariśuddha svāhā.”

original: de nas rin po che dang gser gyi cod pan nam gos kyi cod pan bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rin po che dang gser gyi cod pan nam gos kyi cod pan bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then he should be bound with a crown of jewels and gold or a crown of cloth.

original: de ltar dbang bskur gnyis kyis khams dang phung po yongs su dag pas sku rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dbang bskur gnyis kyis khams dang phung po yongs su dag pas sku rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the two empowerments purify the elements and the aggregates, and the pure body will arise.

original: sku'i zhal gyi sa la sku dag par byas te /
analyzed: sku'i zhal gyi sa la sku dag par byas te /
translated: Having purified the body on the ground of the face of the body,

original: de nas g-yas skor gyis slar yang lho'i sgor slob ma khrid nas gsung rnam par dag pa'i don du dar dpyangs kyi dbang la skye ba'i gnas sngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas g-yas skor gyis slar yang lho'i sgor slob ma khrid nas gsung rnam par dag pa'i don du dar dpyangs kyi dbang la skye ba'i gnas sngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: then, again, having led the disciple to the southern door in a clockwise direction, for the sake of the pure speech, the empowerment of the hanging silk, the place of birth, should be empowered with this mantra:

original: aom aa a'a aam aa: ha @150b h'a ham ha: ho: phrem da sha p'a ra mi t'a pa ri p'u ra ne sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
analyzed: aom aa a'a aam aa: ha @150b h'a ham ha: ho: phrem da sha p'a ra mi t'a pa ri p'u ra ne sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
translated: Oṃ a ā aṃ aḥ ha hā ham hāḥ hoḥ phaṭ daśa pāramitā pāra pūrṇe svāhā.

original: de nas rin po che'i patta dang gser gyi patta'am ma rnyed na me tog gi phreng ba dang dpral bar bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rin po che'i patta dang gser gyi patta'am ma rnyed na me tog gi phreng ba dang dpral bar bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the jeweled patra and the golden patra should be tied to the forehead with a flower garland if they are not available.

original: de nas rdo rje dril bu'i dbang la skye ba'i nas lngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje dril bu'i dbang la skye ba'i nas lngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Then, for the empowerment of the vajra and bell, the place of birth, should be empowered with this mantra:

original: aom hum ho:s'u rya tsandra bi sho dha ka sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
analyzed: aom hum ho:s'u rya tsandra bi sho dha ka sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
translated: Oṃ huṃ hoḥ sūrya candra viśodhaka svāhā.

original: de nas rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu spyi bor bzhag nas dung gi chus dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu spyi bor bzhag nas dung gi chus dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having placed the vajra and the vajra-bell on the crown of his head, he should confer the empowerment with the water of the conch.

original: dbang bskur gnyis kyis gsung rdo rje sbyangs te /
analyzed: dbang bskur gnyis kyis gsung rdo rje sbyangs te /
translated: Having purified the vajra of speech with the two empowerments,

original: rdo rje'i mthe bo byin nas slar yang g-yas skor gyis bskor ba byas shing shar gyi sgor thugs rdo rje sbyang ba'i don du rdo rje brtul zhugs kyi dbang la skye ba'i gnas lngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i mthe bo byin nas slar yang g-yas skor gyis bskor ba byas shing shar gyi sgor thugs rdo rje sbyang ba'i don du rdo rje brtul zhugs kyi dbang la skye ba'i gnas lngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: having given the vajra to the thumb, he should again circle to the right, and for the sake of purifying the vajra of mind at the eastern door, he should confer the empowerment of the vajra-vow with this mantra, in the five places of origin of the empowerment:🔽oṃ a ā aḥ i ī u ū ri rī lu lū e ai o au aṃ aḥ

original: aom aa a'a ae aee aa ra a'ar ao aoo aa la a'a la aam aa:bi sha ye na dri ya bi sho dha ni sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
analyzed: aom aa a'a ae aee aa ra a'ar ao aoo aa la a'a la aam aa:bi sha ye na dri ya bi sho dha ni sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
translated: viśaye dṛśa-viśodhani svāhā.

original: de nas rna ba la sogs pa la me tog bkod nas slar yang ming gi dbang la skye ba'i gnas lngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rna ba la sogs pa la me tog bkod nas slar yang ming gi dbang la skye ba'i gnas lngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Then, having placed the flowers on the ears, etc., he should again confer the empowerment of the name with this mantra, in the five places of origin of the empowerment:🔽oṃ ha ha ya ya ra ra wa wa la la

original: aom ha h'a ya y'a ra r'a wa w'a la l'a tsa tu ra brahma bi h'a ra bi shuda dha sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
analyzed: aom ha h'a ya y'a ra r'a wa w'a la l'a tsa tu ra brahma bi h'a ra bi shuda dha sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
translated: catur-brahma-vihāra-viśuddha svāhā.

original: de nas lag pa dang rkang pa dag la gdu bu dang rkang gdub la sogs pa'am de dag med na me tog gi phreng ba bcings la de nas dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas lag pa dang rkang pa dag la gdu bu dang rkang gdub la sogs pa'am de dag med na me tog gi phreng ba bcings la de nas dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Then, having bound on the bracelets and anklets, etc. to the hands and feet, or if they do not have those, having bound on a garland of flowers, then one should confer initiation.

original: khyod ni rdo rje che ge mo zhes byas nas lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod ni rdo rje che ge mo zhes byas nas lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: Having said, You are the great vajra so-and-so, one should give the prophecy.🔽 Having purified the mind vajra with the two initiations, then again, having led the disciple to the west door, one should confer the initiation of permission for the sake of the purity of pristine awareness.

original: dbang bskur gnyis kyis thugs rdo rje sbyangs te de nas slar yang g-yas skor gyis slob ma nub kyi sgor khrid cing ye shes rnam par dag pa'i don du rjes su gnang ba'i dbang la skye ba'i gnas lngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur gnyis kyis thugs rdo rje sbyangs te de nas slar yang g-yas skor gyis slob ma nub kyi sgor khrid cing ye shes rnam par dag pa'i don du rjes su gnang ba'i dbang la skye ba'i gnas lngar sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: One should confer initiation with this mantra at the five places of birth:

original: aom ham ksha:dha rmma tsakra pra brta ka sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
analyzed: aom ham ksha:dha rmma tsakra pra brta ka sv'a h'a zhes pas so //
translated: Om ham kshom, turn the wheel of the doctrine, svâhâ.

original: dbang bskur byin pas sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi rdo rje rnams dbang bdun gyis rnam par sbyangs te /
analyzed: dbang bskur byin pas sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi rdo rje rnams dbang bdun gyis rnam par sbyangs te /
translated: Having conferred the initiation, the body, speech, mind, and pristine awareness vajras are purified by the seven initiations.

original: de nas slob ma la lag par rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu byin nas rdo rje che ge mo zhes slob dpon gyis brjod cing rdo rje dril bur rab tu byin nas rab mchog snying rje dag gis dag pa'i chos ni bstan par bya'o //🔽'di lta ste nges par rdo rje'i rigs dag la ni srog gcod bya ste zhes pa la sogs pa nas dkyil 'khor du ni yang dag rab sbyin bya zhes pa'i mthar thug pa phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'dis so //
analyzed: de nas slob ma la lag par rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu byin nas rdo rje che ge mo zhes slob dpon gyis brjod cing rdo rje dril bur rab tu byin nas rab mchog snying rje dag gis dag pa'i chos ni bstan par bya'o // 'di lta ste nges par rdo rje'i rigs dag la ni srog gcod bya ste zhes pa la sogs pa nas dkyil 'khor du ni yang dag rab sbyin bya zhes pa'i mthar thug pa phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'dis so //
translated: Then, having given the vajra and the bell to the disciple, the master should say, “Vajra so-and-so,” and having given the vajra and the bell, he should teach the Dharma that is pure with the highest compassion.

original: dkyil @151a * //
analyzed: dkyil @151a * //
translated: This is as follows: “In the Vajra family, one should kill, and so on, up to ‘one should give the maṇḍala.’ With these two and a half verses,

original: 'khor la dbang bdun gyi cho ga byas te de nas slob ma la sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor la dbang bdun gyi cho ga byas te de nas slob ma la sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: having performed the rite of the seven empowerments in the maṇḍala, one should then imagine that the disciple is blessed by the buddhas.

original: rdo rje slob dpon gyis rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i don du lo la sogs pa rab tu bsgrag par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gyis rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i don du lo la sogs pa rab tu bsgrag par bya ste /
translated: The vajra master should proclaim the year, and so on, for the sake of the elder and the younger.

original: 'dir lo che ge mo dang rigs ldan gyi rgyal po che ge mo chos ston pa dang zla ba che ge mo dang nya che ge mo dang gza' che ge mo dang / tshes che ge mo dang skar ma che ge mo dang sbyor ba che ge mo dang byed pa che ge mo la rdo rje slob dpon che ge mo bdag gis slob ma che ge mo mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas sam dkyil 'khor gzhan du dbang bdun gyis
analyzed: 'dir lo che ge mo dang rigs ldan gyi rgyal po che ge mo chos ston pa dang zla ba che ge mo dang nya che ge mo dang gza' che ge mo dang / tshes che ge mo dang skar ma che ge mo dang sbyor ba che ge mo dang byed pa che ge mo la rdo rje slob dpon che ge mo bdag gis slob ma che ge mo mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas sam dkyil 'khor gzhan du dbang bdun gyis
translated: Here, on such and such a year, such and such a king of the lineage, such and such a month, such and such a day, such and such an asterism, such and such a planet, such and such a lunar mansion, such and such a yoga, such and such a karana, the vajra master such and such conferred the seven empowerments on the disciple such and such, either in the mandala of the supreme primordial buddha or another mandala.🔽I prophesy and grant permission for the sake of attaining the worldly siddhis, such as the summit of existence, and for the sake of attaining the result of merit and pristine consciousness, by becoming the guide of all sentient beings.

original: dbang bskur te 'og min gyi srid pa'i mthar thug pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'dren pa nyid kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'bras bu thob pa'i slad du bdag gis lung bstan zhing rjes su gnang ngo zhes pa ste dbang bdun gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur te 'og min gyi srid pa'i mthar thug pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'dren pa nyid kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'bras bu thob pa'i slad du bdag gis lung bstan zhing rjes su gnang ngo zhes pa ste dbang bdun gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the seven empowerments.

original: 'dir rgyud gzhan dang gzhan las byis pa'i skye bo gzhug pa'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dag pas dbang lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dir rgyud gzhan dang gzhan las byis pa'i skye bo gzhug pa'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dag pas dbang lnga ste /
translated: Here, in order to introduce childish beings to other tantras, the five initiations are conferred by the five pure tathagatas.🔽Akṣobhya confers the water initiation and Ratnasambhava confers the crown initiation.

original: mi bskyod pas chu'i dbang dang rin chen 'byung ldan gyis cod pan no zhes gang gsungs pa de la snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal te rgyud thams cad las dkyil 'khor du me tog dor bas slob ma'i rigs kyi lha gang yin pa des cod pan dang de'i
analyzed: mi bskyod pas chu'i dbang dang rin chen 'byung ldan gyis cod pan no zhes gang gsungs pa de la snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal te rgyud thams cad las dkyil 'khor du me tog dor bas slob ma'i rigs kyi lha gang yin pa des cod pan dang de'i
translated: This contradicts the earlier and later statements, because all tantras state that the flower cast into the mandala indicates the deity of the disciple’s family, and that deity confers the crown initiation.

original: rigs kyi phyag rgyas de'i dngos grub bo zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi phyag rgyas de'i dngos grub bo zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān’s definitive statement is that the disciple’s spiritual powers are conferred by the consort of that deity’s family.

original: des na mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las /
analyzed: des na mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las /
translated: Therefore, the Praise in One Hundred and Fifty Verses states:

original: sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan can //
translated: You are crowned with the five buddhas.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gang du me tog lhung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa de cod pan du 'gyur gyi thams cad du rin chen 'byung ldan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gang du me tog lhung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa de cod pan du 'gyur gyi thams cad du rin chen 'byung ldan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the tathāgata upon whom the flower falls becomes the crown, but in all cases it is not Ratnasambhava alone.

original: de bzhin du bsdus pa'i rgyud las chu la sogs pa'i dag pa med de cho ga gzhan stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsdus pa'i rgyud las chu la sogs pa'i dag pa med de cho ga gzhan stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, in the Condensed Tantra, the purities of water and so forth are not [taught], because the other rites are more powerful.

original: da ni nges par rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par dag pa'i chos bstan pa gsungs pa 'dir srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: da ni nges par rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par dag pa'i chos bstan pa gsungs pa 'dir srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the pure Dharma, [the Bhagavān] declares beginning with “vajra” and so forth. Here, the commitments of killing and so forth are twofold:

original: drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid do //
translated: those of provisional meaning and those of definitive meaning, which are external and internal.

original: de la phyi rol du bcom ldan 'das kyis srog gcod pa bya ba gang yin pa de ni mtshams med pa lnga byed pa rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa @151b la gnod pa byed pa rnams dang dam tshig 'dral ba rnams so zhes pa nges pa ste
analyzed: de la phyi rol du bcom ldan 'das kyis srog gcod pa bya ba gang yin pa de ni mtshams med pa lnga byed pa rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa @151b la gnod pa byed pa rnams dang dam tshig 'dral ba rnams so zhes pa nges pa ste
translated: There, externally, the Bhagavān has declared that the one who should kill is the one who commits the five acts of immediate retribution, the one who harms the doctrine of the Buddha, and the one who breaks the commitments.

original: mtshams med pa lnga po de nyid sngon dang phyi mar shes nas so //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga po de nyid sngon dang phyi mar shes nas so //
translated: Having understood those five acts of immediate retribution in the past and future,

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig sngar mtshams med pa lnga byed pa po phyis bsod nams byed pa por 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig sngar mtshams med pa lnga byed pa po phyis bsod nams byed pa por 'gyur te /
translated: Here, some say: One who previously commits the five heinous actions later becomes one who makes merit,

original: gtum po mya ngan med pa dang chos rgyal mya ngan med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gtum po mya ngan med pa dang chos rgyal mya ngan med pa bzhin no //
translated: like the compassionate Aśoka and the righteous Aśoka.

original: de'i phyir de la gnod pa byas na dmyal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gnod pa byas na dmyal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if one harms him, one goes to hell.

original: sngags pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mantra practitioner does not fully understand virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: des na ji srid du mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan par ma gyur pa de srid du sngags pas zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa ma gtogs pa drag po'i las mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na ji srid du mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan par ma gyur pa de srid du sngags pas zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa ma gtogs pa drag po'i las mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, as long as one does not possess the five superknowledges, the mantra practitioner should not perform wrathful actions except for pacifying, increasing, controlling, and summoning.

original: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba dang ma byin par len pa dang gzhan gyi bud med 'phrog pa dang dam tshig bsten pa dang rigs dang rigs ma yin pa la mngon par 'gro ba dang rang gi lus kyi mthar thug pa sbyin pa yang gzhan la phan🔽pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba dang ma byin par len pa dang gzhan gyi bud med 'phrog pa dang dam tshig bsten pa dang rigs dang rigs ma yin pa la mngon par 'gro ba dang rang gi lus kyi mthar thug pa sbyin pa yang gzhan la phan🔽pa'i phyir te /
translated: Similarly, lying, stealing, taking another's wife, observing the commitments, engaging in what is proper and improper, and giving one's own body up to the end are for the benefit of others.

original: rang gi don du ni ma yin no zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don du ni ma yin no zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: but not for one’s own sake.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe 'chi ba'i mtha'i bar du mtshams med pa lnga byed pa de'i tshe khro bo'i rigs las sngar bsgrubs pa'i sngags dang mi bskyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gsang bar bya'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe 'chi ba'i mtha'i bar du mtshams med pa lnga byed pa de'i tshe khro bo'i rigs las sngar bsgrubs pa'i sngags dang mi bskyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gsang bar bya'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi drang ba'i don to //
translated: Here, when one is about to commit the five sins of immediate effect up to the point of death, then one should conceal oneself with the mantra previously accomplished from the wrathful class and with the concentration of Akshobhya. This is the interpretable meaning explanation of the Bhagavān.

original: de bzhin du lam ma yin par lhung ba rnams mngon par gdon pa'i slad du brdzun gyi tshig smra bar bya ste rang gi don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam ma yin par lhung ba rnams mngon par gdon pa'i slad du brdzun gyi tshig smra bar bya ste rang gi don du ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, one should speak false words in order to rescue those who have fallen into the wrong path, but not for one’s own sake.

original: de bzhin du ma byin par len pa ni yi dags kyi 'gro bar 'gro ba bzlog pa'i don du ste rang gi don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma byin par len pa ni yi dags kyi 'gro bar 'gro ba bzlog pa'i don du ste rang gi don du ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, one should take what is not given in order to turn away the destiny of hungry ghosts, but not for one’s own sake.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi bud med 'phrog pa ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su 'gro ba bzlog pa'i don du ste rang gi don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi bud med 'phrog pa ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su 'gro ba bzlog pa'i don du ste rang gi don du ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, one should take the wives of others in order to turn away the destiny of animals, but not for one’s own sake.

original: rigs su 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i slad du bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs su 'dzin pa rnam par gzhig pa'i slad du bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams bsten par bya'o //
translated: In order to destroy the grasping at caste, one should rely on the commitments of the five nectars and so forth.

original: de bzhin du las kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub kyi don du g-yung mo la sogs pa'i bud med rnams la smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du las kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub kyi don du g-yung mo la sogs pa'i bud med rnams la smad par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in order to attain the power of the karma consort, one should not disparage women such as the untouchable woman.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi slad du sbyin pa chen po sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi slad du sbyin pa chen po sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In order to accumulate merit, one should give great gifts.

original: de ltar ral gri'i rigs dang rin po che'i rigs dang padma'i rigs dang / 'khor lo'i rigs dang gri gug gi rigs la sngags rnams bsgrubs nas nus pa dang ldan par gyur @152a * //
analyzed: de ltar ral gri'i rigs dang rin po che'i rigs dang padma'i rigs dang / 'khor lo'i rigs dang gri gug gi rigs la sngags rnams bsgrubs nas nus pa dang ldan par gyur @152a * //
translated: Thus, having accomplished the mantras in the sword family, jewel family, lotus family, wheel family, and curved knife family, and having become endowed with power,

original: pa na rnal 'byor pas thams cad bya ste ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i bzhad gad du mi 'gyur pa'o zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa na rnal 'byor pas thams cad bya ste ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i bzhad gad du mi 'gyur pa'o zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
translated: the yogī should do everything, so that it does not become a worldly joke. This is the interpretable meaning.

original: da ni nges pa'i don brjod par bya ste 'dir rang gi lus la srog bkag pa ni srog gcod pa ste /
analyzed: da ni nges pa'i don brjod par bya ste 'dir rang gi lus la srog bkag pa ni srog gcod pa ste /
translated: Now, the definitive meaning will be explained. Here, restraining the life force in one's body is killing.

original: rdo rje'i rigs dag la ni zhes pa gtsug tor du dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs dag la ni zhes pa gtsug tor du dgag par bya'o //
translated: In the Vajra family, one should block at the uṣṇīṣa.

original: srog gcod pa des rnal 'byor pa'i khu ba steng du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa des rnal 'byor pa'i khu ba steng du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: By that killing, the yogin's semen is aroused.

original: ral gri la yang bden pa min pa'i tshig ni 'dir bden pa min pa zhes bya ba rab tu mi gnas pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: ral gri la yang bden pa min pa'i tshig ni 'dir bden pa min pa zhes bya ba rab tu mi gnas pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Also, with regard to the sword, untrue words are words that are not true, that is, nonabiding words.

original: drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis sems can thams cad kyi skad kyi tshig tu cig car sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang de nyid snying khar gzhom du med pa'i sgra'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis sems can thams cad kyi skad kyi tshig tu cig car sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang de nyid snying khar gzhom du med pa'i sgra'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The definitive meaning is the Dharma is taught to sentient beings simultaneously in the language of all sentient beings, and that itself is the indestructible sound at the heart.

original: rin chen la ni gzhan nor dbrog bya zhes pa la 'dir gzhan ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rin chen la ni gzhan nor dbrog bya zhes pa la 'dir gzhan ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: With regard to the jewel, one should take the wealth of others, and here the others are Vajrasattva.

original: de'i nor ni rin po che ste yid bzhin gyi nor bu'o //
analyzed: de'i nor ni rin po che ste yid bzhin gyi nor bu'o //
translated: His wealth is the jewel, the wish-fulfilling gem.

original: de 'phrog pa ni rin chen rigs la ste mgrin par sa brgyad pa'i gnas su'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de 'phrog pa ni rin chen rigs la ste mgrin par sa brgyad pa'i gnas su'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Taking that is in the jewel family, at the throat, in the place of the eighth stage.

original: mchog gi padma'i rigs nyid la yang gzhan gyi bud med dbrog ces pa la gzhan gyi bud med ni phyag rgya chen mo ste de 'phrog pa ni gzhan gyi bud med 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: mchog gi padma'i rigs nyid la yang gzhan gyi bud med dbrog ces pa la gzhan gyi bud med ni phyag rgya chen mo ste de 'phrog pa ni gzhan gyi bud med 'phrog pa'o //
translated: Also, in the supreme lotus family, “one should steal another’s wife” means that another’s wife is the great seal, and stealing her is stealing another’s wife.

original: dbrog pa de ni mchog gi padma'i rigs la ste dpral bar sa bcu pa'i gnas su steng du khu ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbrog pa de ni mchog gi padma'i rigs la ste dpral bar sa bcu pa'i gnas su steng du khu ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: That stealing is in the supreme lotus family, in the forehead, on the tenth stage, the semen above.

original: chad dang sgron ma sangs rgyas rnams dang bzang po'i yul rnams mtha' dag 'khor lo la ni bsten par bya zhes pa la 'dir chang ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: chad dang sgron ma sangs rgyas rnams dang bzang po'i yul rnams mtha' dag 'khor lo la ni bsten par bya zhes pa la 'dir chang ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: “One should rely on the wheel, the liquor, the lamps, the buddhas, and the entire field of the good.” Here, the liquor is the innate joy.

original: sgron ma ni go ku la sogs pa ste nang du dbang po lnga'o //
analyzed: sgron ma ni go ku la sogs pa ste nang du dbang po lnga'o //
translated: The lamps are the five sense organs, cow’s milk, etc., internally.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni bdud rtsi lnga'o ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni bdud rtsi lnga'o ;
translated: The buddhas are the five nectars.

original: /'khor lo la ni ste lte ba'i padmar bsten par bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: /'khor lo la ni ste lte ba'i padmar bsten par bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should rely on the wheel, i.e., the navel lotus, i.e., one should eat.

original: bshad pa dang gci ba dang khu ba phyi rol du mi 'dzag par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: bshad pa dang gci ba dang khu ba phyi rol du mi 'dzag par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: One should not let the feces, urine, and semen leak out externally. This is the definitive meaning.

original: g-yung mo la sogs pa'i bud med rnams ni gri gug la ste gsang ba'i padmar smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: g-yung mo la sogs pa'i bud med rnams ni gri gug la ste gsang ba'i padmar smad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not copulate with women such as the śūdra woman, etc., in the sword, i.e., in the secret lotus.

original: mkha' yi padmar te skye gnas su bsrubs pa la phyi rol du khu ba mi 'pho ba'i tshangs par spyod pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' yi padmar te skye gnas su bsrubs pa la phyi rol du khu ba mi 'pho ba'i tshangs par spyod pa nges pa'o //
translated: One should not copulate in the lotus of the sky, i.e., in the vulva, but in the lotus of the heart, i.e., in the mind.

original: sems can don gyi slad du sbyin par bya ste nor dang bcas pa bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu rang gi lus bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du rab tu sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can don gyi slad du sbyin par bya ste nor dang bcas pa bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu rang gi lus bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du rab tu sbyin par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, one should give one’s own body, along with one’s wealth, children, wife, etc., for the sake of the accumulation of merit.

original: de bzhin du tshul @152b khrims kyi tshogs kyi don du bud med rnams kyi mkha' yi padmar smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul @152b khrims kyi tshogs kyi don du bud med rnams kyi mkha' yi padmar smad par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, for the sake of the accumulation of morality, one should not copulate in the lotus of the sky, i.e., in the vulva, of women.

original: de'i phyir bsod nams dang tshul khrims kyi tshogs dag las ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsod nams dang tshul khrims kyi tshogs dag las ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: Therefore, from the accumulations of merit and morality, there is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de ltar tshogs gsum gyis kyi rigs kyi bu khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar tshogs gsum gyis kyi rigs kyi bu khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, O son of noble family, you will become a perfect buddha through the three accumulations.

original: gzhan du mtha' yas bskal pas min par gang rgyal bas gsungs pa'o zhes pa ste rgyud thams cad las rnam par dag pa'i chos bstan pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du mtha' yas bskal pas min par gang rgyal bas gsungs pa'o zhes pa ste rgyud thams cad las rnam par dag pa'i chos bstan pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, it is not in infinite eons, as the Victor has said. This is the certainty of the teaching of the pure Dharma in all tantras.

original: da ni chu ni sgrol ma la sogs lha mo zhes pa la sogs pas dbang gi rnam par dag pa gsungs te 'dir chu'i dbang gang yin pa de ni rlung la sogs pa'i khams lnga rnam par dag cing sgrib pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: da ni chu ni sgrol ma la sogs lha mo zhes pa la sogs pas dbang gi rnam par dag pa gsungs te 'dir chu'i dbang gang yin pa de ni rlung la sogs pa'i khams lnga rnam par dag cing sgrib pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Now, in order to teach the purity of the empowerment, [the Bhagavān] declares water, Locanā, and so on. Here, the water empowerment is the purity of the five elements such as wind, and the absence of obscuration.

original: de bzhin du cod pan gyi dbang ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du cod pan gyi dbang ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the crown empowerment is the purity of the five aggregates such as consciousness.

original: dpa' bo'i dar dpyangs kyi dbang ni pha rol du phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i nus ma bcu'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i dar dpyangs kyi dbang ni pha rol du phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i nus ma bcu'o //
translated: The hero's ribbon empowerment is the ten powers such as generosity for the sake of perfecting the perfections.

original: rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu'i dbang ni la la n'a dang ra sa n'a rnam par dag pa ste zla ba dang nyi ma sgrib pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu'i dbang ni la la n'a dang ra sa n'a rnam par dag pa ste zla ba dang nyi ma sgrib pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The vajra and bell empowerment is the purity of lalana and rasanā, the absence of obscuration of the moon and sun.

original: brtul zhugs kyi dbang ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnam par dag pa ste lha'i mig la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs kyi dbang ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnam par dag pa ste lha'i mig la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The empowerment of spiritual discipline is the purification of the sense objects such as form and the sense faculties such as the eyes, which is the entry into the divine eye and so forth.

original: ming gi dbang ni byams pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba tshangs pa'i gnas bzhis gnas pa la dus thams cad du 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ste sgrib pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ming gi dbang ni byams pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba tshangs pa'i gnas bzhis gnas pa la dus thams cad du 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ste sgrib pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The empowerment of name is the purification of attachment, aversion, and so forth at all times for one who abides in the four divine abodes such as love, which is the absence of obscurations.

original: rjes gnang gi dbang ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub dpal mo chos kyi 'khor lo skor zhing chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: rjes gnang gi dbang ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub dpal mo chos kyi 'khor lo skor zhing chos ston pa'o //
translated: The empowerment of permission is the turning of the wheel of the Dharma and the teaching of the Dharma of glorious perfect enlightenment.

original: de yang srid pa'i 'jigs 'joms te gzhan la phan pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang srid pa'i 'jigs 'joms te gzhan la phan pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is the destruction of the fears of existence, because it benefits others.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo rjes su rig pa ni mi 'pho ba'i bde ba rjes su rig pa ste stong pa nyid ston pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo rjes su rig pa ni mi 'pho ba'i bde ba rjes su rig pa ste stong pa nyid ston pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the wheel of time is the knowledge of unchanging bliss, which is the teaching of emptiness.

original: de ltar sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i dbang bskur bdun po 'di rnams dkyil 'khor du ni yang dag rab sbyin bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i dbang bskur bdun po 'di rnams dkyil 'khor du ni yang dag rab sbyin bya ste /
translated: Thus, these seven initiations that steal the stains of sin should be given in the mandala to the disciples by the master.

original: slob dpon gyis slob ma rnams la'o zhes pa ni rdo rje slob dpon rnams kyi dbang bskur bdun sbyin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis slob ma rnams la'o zhes pa ni rdo rje slob dpon rnams kyi dbang bskur bdun sbyin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule of the Tathagata for the bestowal of the seven initiations of the vajra master to the disciples.

original: da ni dbang zhes pa la sogs pas dbang bskur ba'i 'bras bu gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dbang zhes pa la sogs pas dbang bskur ba'i 'bras bu gsungs te /
translated: Now, the result of the initiation is stated beginning with “initiation” and so forth.

original: 'dir dbang bdun rnams kyis @153a * //🔽dkyil 'khor chen por mngon par dbang bskur bar gyur pa na dge ba'i dbang gis sa bdun gyi ni dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir dbang bdun rnams kyis @153a * // dkyil 'khor chen por mngon par dbang bskur bar gyur pa na dge ba'i dbang gis sa bdun gyi ni dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Here, by means of the seven initiations,🔽when one is actually initiated into the great mandala, one becomes a lord of the seven levels by the power of virtue.

original: gal te dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mngon sum du byed na de'i tshe lus 'di nyid kyis sa bdun gyi dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mngon sum du byed na de'i tshe lus 'di nyid kyis sa bdun gyi dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one actualizes the mandala wheel, then at that time one becomes a lord of the seven levels with this very body.

original: ci ste mi dge ba bcu dang bral te shi bar gyur na de'i tshe de nas dge ba'i dbang gis sa bdun gyi dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa ste bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis so //
analyzed: ci ste mi dge ba bcu dang bral te shi bar gyur na de'i tshe de nas dge ba'i dbang gis sa bdun gyi dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa ste bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis so //
translated: But if he should die free from the ten non-virtues, then he becomes a lord of the seven worlds by the power of virtue, thus is the certainty.

original: bum pa gsang bas mngon par dbang bskur slar yang phyir mi ldog pa sogs su nges par rab tu 'jug ces pa ni 'dir bum pa dang gsang pa dag gis mngon par dbang bskur ba ni tshul khrims kyi dbang gis phyir mi ldog pa mi g-yo bar 'gyur
analyzed: bum pa gsang bas mngon par dbang bskur slar yang phyir mi ldog pa sogs su nges par rab tu 'jug ces pa ni 'dir bum pa dang gsang pa dag gis mngon par dbang bskur ba ni tshul khrims kyi dbang gis phyir mi ldog pa mi g-yo bar 'gyur
translated: By the accumulation of merit. By the vase and secret initiations he again enters into the certainty of irreversibility, etc. Here, by the vase and secret initiations, by the power of morality, he becomes irreversible, unshakable.

original: te sogs pa'i sgras legs pa'i blo gros su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te sogs pa'i sgras legs pa'i blo gros su 'gyur ro //
translated: By the word etc. is meant that he becomes a Good Intelligence.

original: mi g-yo ba na skye gnas su bsrubs pa la byang chub kyi sems mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba na skye gnas su bsrubs pa la byang chub kyi sems mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: When he is unshakable, the bodhicitta is unshakable in the womb.

original: legs pa'i blo gros zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i sems so //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i sems so //
translated: Good Intelligence is the mind of great bliss.

original: 'dir shes rab ye shes dag gis mngon par dbang bskur na tshul khrims kyi tshogs kyi stobs kyi srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa 'jam dbyangs nyid du 'gyur zhes pa ni chos kyi sprin du 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir shes rab ye shes dag gis mngon par dbang bskur na tshul khrims kyi tshogs kyi stobs kyi srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa 'jam dbyangs nyid du 'gyur zhes pa ni chos kyi sprin du 'gyur pa ste /
translated: Here, if one is consecrated with the wisdom-knowledge initiation, one becomes Manjusri, who conquers the fear of existence by the power of the accumulation of morality. This is the Cloud of Dharma.

original: chos kyi sprin ni bde ba chen po'i char gyis rang dang gzhan gyi don byed pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin ni bde ba chen po'i char gyis rang dang gzhan gyi don byed pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The Cloud of Dharma is the performance of one's own and others' aims by the rain of great bliss. This is the ascertainment.

original: de ltar bsod nams dang tshul khrims kyi tshogs sngon du 'gro ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams dang tshul khrims kyi tshogs sngon du 'gro ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: Thus, the accumulation of wisdom is preceded by the accumulations of merit and morality.

original: de las sa bcu gnyis pa la rnal 'byor pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid do zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de las sa bcu gnyis pa la rnal 'byor pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid do zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: From that, the yogis attain buddhahood on the twelfth stage. This is the ascertainment of the Tathagata.

original: gal te g-yo sgyu'i dbang gis zhes pa mi dge ba bcu la zhugs pa'i dbang gis 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung na 'dir nams mtha' dag dmyal bar sdug bsngal du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te g-yo sgyu'i dbang gis zhes pa mi dge ba bcu la zhugs pa'i dbang gis 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung na 'dir nams mtha' dag dmyal bar sdug bsngal du 'gyur te /
translated: If one commits the root downfalls, which will be explained, under the influence of deceit, one will experience suffering in hell for a long time.

original: de'i dbang la sogs pa phyin ci log gi dbang gis so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang la sogs pa phyin ci log gi dbang gis so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The statement “by the power of that and so on” is certain.

original: da ni rtsa ba'i lhur pa zhes pa la sogs pas rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rtsa ba'i lhur pa zhes pa la sogs pas rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “the root downfalls,” he teaches the purification of the root downfalls.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na de'i tshe dbang bdun la gnas pa dag gis sngags bzlas pa stong phrag sum cu rtsa drug gis dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na de'i tshe dbang bdun la gnas pa dag gis sngags bzlas pa stong phrag sum cu rtsa drug gis dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, when the root downfalls that will be explained occur, then those abiding in the seven empowerments will be purified by reciting the mantra thirty-six thousand times.

original: yon tan ldan pa zhes pa phyis mi byed pa'i sdom pa @153b la gnas pa yi'o //
analyzed: yon tan ldan pa zhes pa phyis mi byed pa'i sdom pa @153b la gnas pa yi'o //
translated: Those “endowed with good qualities” are those abiding in the vow not to commit them again.

original: bum pa gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba la gnas pa la gang gi tshe rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na de'i tshe gal te na brtul zhugs nges pa'i dbang gis zhes pa bsod nams dang tshul khrims kyi tshogs kyi dbang gis rnam par dag par 'gyur te
analyzed: bum pa gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba la gnas pa la gang gi tshe rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na de'i tshe gal te na brtul zhugs nges pa'i dbang gis zhes pa bsod nams dang tshul khrims kyi tshogs kyi dbang gis rnam par dag par 'gyur te
translated: When the root downfalls occur for those abiding in the vase and secret empowerments, then if they are “abiding in the conduct,” that is, by the power of the accumulations of merit and ethics, they will be purified.

original: de nyid la slob dpon gyis brtul zhugs kyi nges pas chad pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la slob dpon gyis brtul zhugs kyi nges pas chad pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The master should give the punishment by the rule of spiritual deportment to that very person.

original: gong ma la ni dag pa med ces pa ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba la gang gi tshe rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na de'i tshe dag pa med do //
analyzed: gong ma la ni dag pa med ces pa ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba la gang gi tshe rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na de'i tshe dag pa med do //
translated: As for the higher, there is no purification, when the consecration of the wisdom-knowledge is given, if the root downfall occurs, then there is no purification.

original: don ci zhe na /
analyzed: don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: de la slob dpon gyis 'di'i chad pa sbyin par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la slob dpon gyis 'di'i chad pa sbyin par mi bya ste /
translated: The master should not give the punishment to that person.

original: rang gi bsod nams dang tshul khrims kyi stobs kyis bdag nyid kyis sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byin brlabs dang bcas pa'i gnas su song ste /
analyzed: rang gi bsod nams dang tshul khrims kyi stobs kyis bdag nyid kyis sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byin brlabs dang bcas pa'i gnas su song ste /
translated: Having himself confessed the sin, etc., by the power of his own merit and morality, he should go to a place blessed by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

original: bdag nyid dag pa 'thob bo zhes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dag pa 'thob bo zhes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi bzhed pa'o //
translated: and he will obtain purification. This is the opinion of the Buddhas.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung ba gang zhig dag pa'i slad du slar yang dkyil 'khor 'dir ni 'jug bya ste zhes pa ni 'dir gang gi tshe dbang bdun la gnas pa'am bum pa dang gsang ba'i dbang la gnas pa la rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung ba gang zhig dag pa'i slad du slar yang dkyil 'khor 'dir ni 'jug bya ste zhes pa ni 'dir gang gi tshe dbang bdun la gnas pa'am bum pa dang gsang ba'i dbang la gnas pa la rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na
translated: When one who is established in the seven initiations or who is established in the vase and secret initiations incurs a root downfall,

original: / de'i tshe de dag pa'i slad du dkyil 'khor 'di bris nas slar mi byed pa'i don du slar yang dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: / de'i tshe de dag pa'i slad du dkyil 'khor 'di bris nas slar mi byed pa'i don du slar yang dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: then in order to purify that, having drawn this mandala, one should again enter the mandala and so forth in order not to do it again.

original: de nas rjes su gnang ba thob nas slar yang tshogs kyi 'dus par zhes pa rigs kyi dbus su sngar thu bo'i ming gang yin pa de ni chung ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rjes su gnang ba thob nas slar yang tshogs kyi 'dus par zhes pa rigs kyi dbus su sngar thu bo'i ming gang yin pa de ni chung ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Then, having obtained permission, again in the assembly of the clan, the name of the eldest one in the center of the clan becomes the youngest.

original: gzhon pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa slar mi byed pa'i sdom pa'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa ste /
analyzed: gzhon pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa slar mi byed pa'i sdom pa'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa ste /
translated: It becomes youthful, in order not to do it again. This is the rule of the Tathagata.

original: slob ma rnams kyis gdon mi za bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma rnams kyis gdon mi za bar bya'o //
translated: The disciples should definitely do it.

original: da ni dpal ldan zhes pa la sogs pas rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dpal ldan zhes pa la sogs pas rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnams gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “the glorious one,” the root downfalls are taught.

original: 'dir rgyud thams cad las rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyud thams cad las rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu bzhi'o //
translated: Here, there are fourteen root downfalls in all tantras.

original: de rnams las ji ltar so sor 'gyur pa de bzhin du gsungs pa bu rnams te dbang bskur ba'i slob ma rnams kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba ri bong 'dzin pa zhes pa dang por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams las ji ltar so sor 'gyur pa de bzhin du gsungs pa bu rnams te dbang bskur ba'i slob ma rnams kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba ri bong 'dzin pa zhes pa dang por 'gyur te /
translated: As for those, the root downfalls of the disciples who have been initiated are stated to be just as they occur, “the rabbit holder,” and so on.

original: dpal ldan bla ma'i thugs dkrugs pa las zhes pa la 'dir bla ma rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dpal ldan bla ma'i thugs dkrugs pa las zhes pa la 'dir bla ma rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “ The glorious guru’s mind is disturbed” means that here there are two kinds of gurus:

original: bla ma dam pa dang bla ma dam pa ma yin pa'o //🔽de dag gi thugs dkrugs pa yang rnam pa @154a * //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa dang bla ma dam pa ma yin pa'o // de dag gi thugs dkrugs pa yang rnam pa @154a * //
translated: the sublime guru and the non-sublime guru.

original: gnyis te gzhan gyi don dang rang gi don las so //
analyzed: gnyis te gzhan gyi don dang rang gi don las so //
translated: Their minds are disturbed in two ways: for the sake of others and for one’s own sake.

original: de la gzhan gyi don las gang gi thugs 'khrug pa de ni dpal ldan bla ma'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi don las gang gi thugs 'khrug pa de ni dpal ldan bla ma'o //
translated: Of those, the one whose mind is disturbed for the sake of others is the glorious guru.

original: rang gi don las gang gi thugs 'khrug pa de ni bla ma dam pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don las gang gi thugs 'khrug pa de ni bla ma dam pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The one whose mind is disturbed for one’s own sake is the non-sublime guru.

original: 'dir slob ma mi dge ba bcu la zhugs pas dpal ldan bla ma'i thugs dkrugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir slob ma mi dge ba bcu la zhugs pas dpal ldan bla ma'i thugs dkrugs par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, a disciple who has engaged in the ten nonvirtues causes the mind of the glorious guru to be disturbed.

original: thugs dkrugs pa de las rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs dkrugs pa de las rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that disturbance, there is a root downfall.

original: rang gi don la zhugs pa'i bla ma ni mi dge ba bcu la zhugs pa las ma yin no zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don la zhugs pa'i bla ma ni mi dge ba bcu la zhugs pa las ma yin no zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: A guru who is engaged in his own aim is not disturbed by engaging in the ten nonvirtues.🔽This is the certainty.

original: de yi bka' la 'gongs pas gzhan rtsa ba'i ltung ba gnyis par 'gyur te //
analyzed: de yi bka' la 'gongs pas gzhan rtsa ba'i ltung ba gnyis par 'gyur te //
translated: By transgressing his command, there is the second root downfall,

original: bla ma'i lkog tu gyur par mi dge ba bcu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla ma'i lkog tu gyur par mi dge ba bcu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the guru is hidden in the ten nonvirtues.

original: de bzhin du spun la khros pas gsum par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du spun la khros pas gsum par 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, there is the third root downfall by being angry with a vajra sibling.

original: gang gi tshe rdo rje'i spun rgan po'am gzhon nu bslab pa dang ldan pa la rab tu khro bar byed na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdo rje'i spun rgan po'am gzhon nu bslab pa dang ldan pa la rab tu khro bar byed na'o //
translated: When one is angry with an elder or younger vajra sibling who possesses the trainings.🔽By giving up love, there is the fourth.

original: byams pa btang bas bzhi par 'gyur te zhes pa la 'dir byams pa btang ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byams pa btang bas bzhi par 'gyur te zhes pa la 'dir byams pa btang ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here, giving up love is of four types,

original: chung du dang 'bring po dang chen po dang shin tu chen po'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: chung du dang 'bring po dang chen po dang shin tu chen po'i dbye bas so //
translated: because of the distinctions of lesser, medium, greater, and very great.

original: de la chung du ni skad cig tsam byams pa btang zhing de nas ldog par 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la chung du ni skad cig tsam byams pa btang zhing de nas ldog par 'gyur pa ste /
translated: The small is when one gives up love for just a moment and then returns to it,

original: chu la dbyug pa'i ri mo lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu la dbyug pa'i ri mo lta bu'o //
translated: like a drawing on water.

original: 'bring po ni bye ma'i ri mo slar yang rlung gis mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: 'bring po ni bye ma'i ri mo slar yang rlung gis mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur pa lta bu'o ;
translated: The medium is like a drawing in sand, which is leveled by the wind.

original: / chen po'i bdag nyid ni sa gas pa slar yang dbyar gyi chus mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: / chen po'i bdag nyid ni sa gas pa slar yang dbyar gyi chus mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur pa lta bu'o //
translated: The great is like a crack in the earth, which is healed by the waters of spring.

original: de bzhin du byams pa med pa'i sems shin tu chen po'i bdag nyid ni yongs su smin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byams pa med pa'i sems shin tu chen po'i bdag nyid ni yongs su smin pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the mind without love is very great, and it is fully ripened.

original: dper na rdo tha dad pa slar yang 'ga' zhig tu yongs su rdzogs par ro mnyam par mi 'gyur pa'am dper na 'bras bu smin pa shing la mi gnas pa de bzhin du sems can rnams la byams pa yongs su gtong ba ste /
analyzed: dper na rdo tha dad pa slar yang 'ga' zhig tu yongs su rdzogs par ro mnyam par mi 'gyur pa'am dper na 'bras bu smin pa shing la mi gnas pa de bzhin du sems can rnams la byams pa yongs su gtong ba ste /
translated: For example, different stones do not become fully equal in some places, or for example, a ripe fruit does not remain on the tree. In the same way, one gives up love for sentient beings.

original: des rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: des rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: By that, there is the fourth root downfall. This is the determination.

original: mda' zhes pa lnga par 'gyur te byang chub sems ni rab tu nyams pa las zhes pa la 'dir byang chub kyi sems ni khu ba ste /
analyzed: mda' zhes pa lnga par 'gyur te byang chub sems ni rab tu nyams pa las zhes pa la 'dir byang chub kyi sems ni khu ba ste /
translated: The word “arrow” is the fifth, from “the bodhicitta is greatly damaged.” Here, bodhicitta is semen.

original: de nyams pa las 'pho ba med pa'i bde bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyams pa las 'pho ba med pa'i bde bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: From its damage, there is no bliss of nonemission.

original: de'i phyir de kho na nyid med pa dbang po gnyis kyi bde bas sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pa rnams la rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid med pa dbang po gnyis kyi bde bas sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pa rnams la rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, for those who desire buddhahood through the bliss of the two organs, which is devoid of reality, there is a root downfall.

original: drug pa grub pa'i mtha' la smod pa ste grub pa'i mtha' ni shes rab kyi @154b pha rol tu phyin pa dang sngags kyi tshul la de kho na nyid kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: drug pa grub pa'i mtha' la smod pa ste grub pa'i mtha' ni shes rab kyi @154b pha rol tu phyin pa dang sngags kyi tshul la de kho na nyid kyi le'u'o //
translated: The sixth is the condemnation of the philosophical position. The philosophical position is the chapter on reality in the perfection of wisdom and the mantra vehicle.

original: de la smod pa gang yin pa de ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: de la smod pa gang yin pa de ni drug pa'o //
translated: The condemnation of that is the sixth.

original: ri bo zhes pa bdun par 'gyur te ma smin pa'i mi nyan thos kyi lam la gnas pa la gsang ba byin las zhes pa bde ba chen po byin pa las slob dpon rnams la ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ri bo zhes pa bdun par 'gyur te ma smin pa'i mi nyan thos kyi lam la gnas pa la gsang ba byin las zhes pa bde ba chen po byin pa las slob dpon rnams la ltung ba'o //
translated: The word “mountain” is the seventh, from “to the unripened person who is not a listener.” It is a downfall for the masters from giving the secret, that is, the great bliss, to those who are not vessels.

original: phung po nyon mongs pa las klu zhes pa brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: phung po nyon mongs pa las klu zhes pa brgyad pa ste /
translated: The eighth is the nāga, from the aggregates and afflictions.

original: phung po nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ni bsnyung bar gnas pa la bkod pa la sogs pa dang lus gcod pa la sogs par brjod de de las brgyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ni bsnyung bar gnas pa la bkod pa la sogs pa dang lus gcod pa la sogs par brjod de de las brgyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The aggregates, afflictions, and so on are said to be the “abode of illness” and so on, and the “cutting of the body” and so on, and from that, the eighth.

original: slar yang dgu pa ni dag pa'i chos te stong pa nyid kyi chos la ma dad par gyur pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: slar yang dgu pa ni dag pa'i chos te stong pa nyid kyi chos la ma dad par gyur pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: Again, the ninth is the pure Dharma, which is the lack of faith in the Dharma of emptiness.

original: / sgyu yi byams pa ni kha nas tshig gzhan 'don zhing snying la gzhan sems pa ste /
analyzed: / sgyu yi byams pa ni kha nas tshig gzhan 'don zhing snying la gzhan sems pa ste /
translated: The love of deception is speaking one thing with the mouth, while thinking another in the heart.

original: sgyu yi byams pa gang yin pa de ni phyogs zhes pa bcu pa'o /
analyzed: sgyu yi byams pa gang yin pa de ni phyogs zhes pa bcu pa'o /
translated: The love of deception is the “direction,” which is the tenth.

original: ming sogs bral ba bde ba ste ral zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i de kho na nyid la rtog pa gang yin pa de ni drag po zhes pa ste bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: ming sogs bral ba bde ba ste ral zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i de kho na nyid la rtog pa gang yin pa de ni drag po zhes pa ste bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: The bliss free from name and so on is the “sword,” and the one who imagines the reality of the tathāgatas is “Bhairava,” which is the eleventh.

original: dag pa'i sems can dag la ste rnal 'byor pa la skyon brjod pa las nyi ma zhes pa bcu gnyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag pa'i sems can dag la ste rnal 'byor pa la skyon brjod pa las nyi ma zhes pa bcu gnyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who criticizes pure sentient beings, that is, the yogi, is the “sun,” which is the twelfth.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lor dam tshig thob par gyur pa gtong ba las gzhan te bcu gsum par 'gyur ro //🔽bud med thams cad la smod pa gang yin pa de ni nges par te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lor dam tshig thob par gyur pa gtong ba las gzhan te bcu gsum par 'gyur ro // bud med thams cad la smod pa gang yin pa de ni nges par te /
translated: The thirteenth is the opposite of giving the attainment of the pledge in the gaṇacakra.🔽The fourteenth is the definite, i.e., the inevitable, censure of all women.

original: gdon mi za bar ma nu zhes pa bcu bzhi par 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar ma nu zhes pa bcu bzhi par 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The fifteenth is the definite, i.e., the certain, “mānu” .

original: gang dag rdo rje'i theg par gnas pa rnams la ste dbang bskur ba rnams la'o zhes pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag rdo rje'i theg par gnas pa rnams la ste dbang bskur ba rnams la'o zhes pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The sixteenth is the definite, i.e., the certain, “vajradhara” .

original: ltung ba sbom po rnams ni du ma ste de rnams la chad pa shin tu chung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba sbom po rnams ni du ma ste de rnams la chad pa shin tu chung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The seventeenth is the definite, i.e., the certain, “many are the gross downfalls, and for them there is a very small punishment.”

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba'i mdor bsdus chen po ste bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba'i mdor bsdus chen po ste bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the great summary of the chapter on initiation in the maṇḍala, the fourth of the immaculate light, the commentary on the root tantra, the Kālacakra Tantra, the king of all tantras.

original: // / rab gnas byas nas lhar bcas lha min dbang po dang // klu dang mi dbang tshogs kyis gang la phyag byas pa //
analyzed: // / rab gnas byas nas lhar bcas lha min dbang po dang // klu dang mi dbang tshogs kyis gang la phyag byas pa //
translated: Having performed the consecration, he to whom the hosts of gods, demigods, nāgas, and human lords pay homage,

original: dus kyi 'khor lo de la spyi bos rab tu btud nas //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo de la spyi bos rab tu btud nas //
translated: having bowed my head to that Kālacakra,

original: sku gzugs la sogs rnams kyi rab gnas brjod par bya //🔽'dir dpal mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las rab tu gnas pa'i cho ga 'jam @155a * //
analyzed: sku gzugs la sogs rnams kyi rab gnas brjod par bya // 'dir dpal mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las rab tu gnas pa'i cho ga 'jam @155a * //
translated: I will explain the consecration of images and so forth.

original: dpal gyis tshigs su bcad pa bzhi lhag pa'i brgya pa la sogs pa phyung ba ni rgyas 'grel gyis dgrol bar bya'o //🔽klu dang zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'dir dang por 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang bskur ba rnams kyis mngon par dbang bskur te de nas rgyud thams cad shes shing dam bca' ba la gnas pa'i slob ma ni rdo rje slob dpon bdag
analyzed: dpal gyis tshigs su bcad pa bzhi lhag pa'i brgya pa la sogs pa phyung ba ni rgyas 'grel gyis dgrol bar bya'o // klu dang zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'dir dang por 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang bskur ba rnams kyis mngon par dbang bskur te de nas rgyud thams cad shes shing dam bca' ba la gnas pa'i slob ma ni rdo rje slob dpon bdag
translated: Here, the consecration ritual was extracted from the Śrī-Paramādibuddha by Mañjuśrī in 104 verses and so forth, which should be unraveled by the extensive commentary.

original: po'i slad du bla mas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: po'i slad du bla mas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: As for the nāgas and so forth, here first the consecrations of the vase and so forth, which will be explained, are conferred. Then, the disciple who understands all tantras and abides by the commitments is consecrated by the guru for the sake of being the lord of the vajra master.

original: kye dpal ldan bla ma khyod kyi bka' drin las da ni bdag gis bde bar gshegs pa'i lam thams cad shes so zhes bla ma la zhus nas dam bca' ba bya ste dus 'di nas brtsams te khyod dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams spangs nas
analyzed: kye dpal ldan bla ma khyod kyi bka' drin las da ni bdag gis bde bar gshegs pa'i lam thams cad shes so zhes bla ma la zhus nas dam bca' ba bya ste dus 'di nas brtsams te khyod dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams spangs nas
translated: Having begun from this time, one should not abandon you, the buddhas, and the bodhisattvas, and

original: bla ma gzhan pa bsten par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: bla ma gzhan pa bsten par mi bgyi'o //
translated: I will not rely on another guru.

original: yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i slob ma dam bca' ba la gnas pa gzigs te de nas sngar brjod pa'i rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa rnams te de rnams klu zhes pa brgyad dang bzhi dang bum pa gcig gis bdag po rnam pa gsum
analyzed: yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i slob ma dam bca' ba la gnas pa gzigs te de nas sngar brjod pa'i rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa rnams te de rnams klu zhes pa brgyad dang bzhi dang bum pa gcig gis bdag po rnam pa gsum
translated: Having seen the disciple who is endowed with all good qualities and who abides in the vow, then the previously mentioned victorious and very victorious vases, which are eight, four, and one vase, respectively,

original: la sbyin par bya ste klu rnams kyis dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: la sbyin par bya ste klu rnams kyis dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: are given to the three types of lords. The nāgas give [the vases] to the monk vajra holder.

original: bzhi yis dge tshul la'o //
analyzed: bzhi yis dge tshul la'o //
translated: The four [give] to the novice.

original: gcig gis khyim pa la ste de ltar gsungs pa'i tshogs sman la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bum pa rnams kyis bkru ste /
analyzed: gcig gis khyim pa la ste de ltar gsungs pa'i tshogs sman la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bum pa rnams kyis bkru ste /
translated: One should bathe with the vases endowed with the assembly medicine and so forth as taught.

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i phyi rol du mnyam pa'i sa'i char khru bzhi pa la rab lnga'i re kh'a byas nas dbus su khru gnyis pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa mtshan ma lnga dang bral ba kha dog sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i phyi rol du mnyam pa'i sa'i char khru bzhi pa la rab lnga'i re kh'a byas nas dbus su khru gnyis pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa mtshan ma lnga dang bral ba kha dog sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: Here, outside the maṇḍala house, on a level piece of ground, having made a line with five cubits, in the center, one should draw a two cubit multicolored eight petaled lotus free from the five signs.

original: 'di nyid ni gdan gyi padma ste shing stan gyi steng du tshon sna lngas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni gdan gyi padma ste shing stan gyi steng du tshon sna lngas bri bar bya'o //
translated: This is the lotus seat, which should be drawn with five colored powders on top of the wooden seat.

original: padma de'i dbus kyi steng du dge slong bkod nas bum pa brgyad rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba dang bcas pa bcus khrus bya ste bu mo gzugs mdzes shing rgyan tham cad dang ldan pa bum pa skyes pa brgyad dang bzhon nu ma skye gnas ma nyams
analyzed: padma de'i dbus kyi steng du dge slong bkod nas bum pa brgyad rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba dang bcas pa bcus khrus bya ste bu mo gzugs mdzes shing rgyan tham cad dang ldan pa bum pa skyes pa brgyad dang bzhon nu ma skye gnas ma nyams
translated: Having arranged the bhikṣus on top of the center of that lotus, one should bathe with the ten vases together with the Jina and Vijaya. A girl with a beautiful form and endowed with all ornaments, eight vases, and a virgin should be placed in the four directions.

original: pa gnyis kyis mgo bor cod pan dar dbyangs dang phyag rgya drug dang bcas pa bcings te khrus bya'o //
analyzed: pa gnyis kyis mgo bor cod pan dar dbyangs dang phyag rgya drug dang bcas pa bcings te khrus bya'o //
translated: The two on the sides bind the diadem and the six symbolic gestures on the head, and one should bathe.

original: gdug pa sdigs par byed pa'i mchog //
analyzed: gdug pa sdigs par byed pa'i mchog //
translated: The supreme one who frightens the wicked,

original: gang gi dur smrig mthong ba yis //
analyzed: gang gi dur smrig mthong ba yis //
translated: by seeing whose saffron

original: lha min sa yi 'og tu 'gro //
analyzed: lha min sa yi 'og tu 'gro //
translated: the demigods go below the earth.

original: dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa bya zhes pa ste de ltar na klu rnams kyis ni dpal ldan cod pan bcing ste nor 'dab padmar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa bya zhes pa ste de ltar na klu rnams kyis ni dpal ldan cod pan bcing ste nor 'dab padmar zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the nāgas bind the glorious diadem, and the one called “lotus of wealth” should be made.

original: dge tshul la yang dar dpyangs @155b bcing bar bya ste bu mo bzhi dang gzhon nu ma gnyis kyis dar dpyangs phyag rgya dang bcas pa bcings te rdul tshon gyi padma spangs shing re kh'a lnga byas pa'i dbus su shing stan byin nas khrus bya'o //
analyzed: dge tshul la yang dar dpyangs @155b bcing bar bya ste bu mo bzhi dang gzhon nu ma gnyis kyis dar dpyangs phyag rgya dang bcas pa bcings te rdul tshon gyi padma spangs shing re kh'a lnga byas pa'i dbus su shing stan byin nas khrus bya'o //
translated: For the novice monk, the streamer should be bound, and the four girls and two maidens bind the streamer with the symbolic gestures, and one should bathe, having given a wooden seat in the center of the five lines without the sand-maṇḍala lotus.

original: de ltar slob dpon 'bring po'o //
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon 'bring po'o //
translated: Thus, it is the middling master.

original: de nas phyag rgya la ni zhes pa mthe bo'i rdo rje byin nas bum pa gcig dang rnam par rgyal bas bu mo gcig dang gzhon nu ma gcig gis khrus bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya la ni zhes pa mthe bo'i rdo rje byin nas bum pa gcig dang rnam par rgyal bas bu mo gcig dang gzhon nu ma gcig gis khrus bya'o //
translated: Then, having given the vajra of the thumb to the consort, the girl should be bathed by one with the vase and one with the victorious [bath].

original: re kh'a lnga spangs shing spyi'i byug pas re kh'a gsum byas nas thun mong gi gdan byin la khrus bya ste slob dpon tha ma'o //
analyzed: re kh'a lnga spangs shing spyi'i byug pas re kh'a gsum byas nas thun mong gi gdan byin la khrus bya ste slob dpon tha ma'o //
translated: Having abandoned the five lines and made three lines with the general unguent, the common seat should be given and the bath should be performed. This is the lowest master.

original: de ltar rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du khru bzhi pa dang khru gnyis pa dang khru gcig pa'i gdan byas nas dge slong dang dge tshul dang khyim pa rnams la rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang bskur ba dang rgyud bstan pa'i don du gsung ngam rjes su
analyzed: de ltar rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du khru bzhi pa dang khru gnyis pa dang khru gcig pa'i gdan byas nas dge slong dang dge tshul dang khyim pa rnams la rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang bskur ba dang rgyud bstan pa'i don du gsung ngam rjes su
translated: Thus, having made a seat of four cubits, two cubits, and one cubit, respectively, the vajra master should give permission to the monks, novices, and householders for the sake of the empowerment and teaching the tantra.

original: gnang ba sbyin par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: gnang ba sbyin par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule.

original: de nas dang por zhes pa la sogs pas dbang gi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa 'dir dang por dbang bdun po chu'i ming can dag la mngon par dbang bskur bar gyur pa ni sa bdun par lung bstan pa'i phyir dge bsnyen du brjod de des na dge
analyzed: de nas dang por zhes pa la sogs pas dbang gi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa 'dir dang por dbang bdun po chu'i ming can dag la mngon par dbang bskur bar gyur pa ni sa bdun par lung bstan pa'i phyir dge bsnyen du brjod de des na dge
translated: Then, the purity of the empowerment is stated beginning with “first,” and so on. Here, the seven water empowerments are conferred first. Since the seven are predicted on the seventh stage, they are called “upāsaka.”

original: bsnyen du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they become upāsaka.

original: bum pa la yang dge tshul dag tu 'gyur te mi g-yo bar lung bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sras po ste gzhon nu zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa la yang dge tshul dag tu 'gyur te mi g-yo bar lung bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sras po ste gzhon nu zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Also, the vase empowerment is the śrāmaṇera. Since the immutable is predicted, they are the sons of the Buddha, meaning “princes.”

original: de nas gsang ba'i dbang la dge slong du 'gyur te legs pa'i blo gros su lung bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi rgyal tshab po //
analyzed: de nas gsang ba'i dbang la dge slong du 'gyur te legs pa'i blo gros su lung bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi rgyal tshab po //
translated: Then, in the secret empowerment, they become bhikṣus. Since Susaṃmitā is predicted, they are the regent of the Buddha.

original: de nas gong ma gsum pa'i byed pa ste shes rab ye shes kyi dbang la mngon par dbang bskur pa ni gnas brtan zhes pa chos ston par byed pa dang slob ma sdud pa por 'gyur te chos kyi sprin la lung bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas gnyis pa
analyzed: de nas gong ma gsum pa'i byed pa ste shes rab ye shes kyi dbang la mngon par dbang bskur pa ni gnas brtan zhes pa chos ston par byed pa dang slob ma sdud pa por 'gyur te chos kyi sprin la lung bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas gnyis pa
translated: Then, the empowerment of the gnosis of the wisdom consort empowerment, which is the function of the third level, is the empowerment of the elder, who becomes a teacher of the dharma and a compiler of disciples, because the Buddha prophesied him as a second Buddha on the Cloud of Dharma.

original: nyid do // de bzhin du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: nyid do // de bzhin du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, the Bhagavat said in the Litany of the Names of Mañjuśrī:

original: 'jig rten gsum gcig gzhon nu'i sku //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gcig gzhon nu'i sku //
translated: The youth of the three worlds,🔽the elder, the old, the lord of beings,

original: gnas brtan rgan po skye dgu'i bdag / sum cu rtsa gnyis @156a * //🔽mtshan 'chang ba //
analyzed: gnas brtan rgan po skye dgu'i bdag / sum cu rtsa gnyis @156a * // mtshan 'chang ba //
translated: bearing the thirty-two marks,🔽beautiful, lovely in the three worlds.

original: sdug gu 'jig rten gsum mdzes pa zhes dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: sdug gu 'jig rten gsum mdzes pa zhes dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: phyir mi ldog pa phyir mi 'ong //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa phyir mi 'ong //
translated: The nonreturner, the once returner,

original: 'dren pa rang rgyal bse ru'i tshul //
analyzed: 'dren pa rang rgyal bse ru'i tshul //
translated: the leader, the rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddha,

original: nges 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba //
analyzed: nges 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba //
translated: arising from various liberations,

original: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig po //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig po //
translated: the single cause of the great elements,

original: dge slong dgra bcom zag pa zad //
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom zag pa zad //
translated: the bhikṣu, the arhat, the one with exhausted defilements,

original: 'dod chags bral ba dbang po thul //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba dbang po thul //
translated: the one free of desire, the one with subdued faculties,

original: bde ba rnyed pa 'jigs med thob //
analyzed: bde ba rnyed pa 'jigs med thob //
translated: He has attained bliss, fearlessness.

original: bsil bar gyur pa rnyog pa med ces pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pa rnyog pa med ces pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: He has attained coolness, non-turbidity, and so on.

original: mgo zlum brtul zhugs chen po 'chang //
analyzed: mgo zlum brtul zhugs chen po 'chang //
translated: He has the great vow of the shaven head.

original: tshangs par spyod pa brtul zhugs mchog //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa brtul zhugs mchog //
translated: He has the supreme vow of pure conduct.

original: dka' thub mthar phyin dka' thub che //
analyzed: dka' thub mthar phyin dka' thub che //
translated: He has perfected asceticism, great asceticism.

original: gtsang gnas dam pa goo ta ma //
analyzed: gtsang gnas dam pa goo ta ma //
translated: He is the holy pure abode, Gautama.

original: bram ze tshangs pa tshangs pa'i rig / mya ngan 'das pa tshangs pa thob //🔽grol ba thar pa rnam grol sku //
analyzed: bram ze tshangs pa tshangs pa'i rig / mya ngan 'das pa tshangs pa thob // grol ba thar pa rnam grol sku //
translated: He is the Brahmin, Brahma, the knowledge of Brahma, who has attained Brahma, Nirvana.🔽He is the liberated, the released, the body of the released.

original: rnam grol zhi ba zhi ba nyid ces pa ste slob dpon gyi dbang ngo //🔽de nas sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje byed pa'i slad du rdo rje sku'i phyag rgya sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grol zhi ba zhi ba nyid ces pa ste slob dpon gyi dbang ngo // de nas sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje byed pa'i slad du rdo rje sku'i phyag rgya sbyin par bya'o //
translated: He is the released, the peaceful, the peaceful itself.🔽This is the master empowerment.🔽Then, in order to make him a vajra body, speech, and mind, the vajra body seal should be given.

original: dar dpyangs cod pan sbyin pa bya ba ni khyab 'jug byed pa'i slad du ste thugs rdo rje byed pa'i slad du'o zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: dar dpyangs cod pan sbyin pa bya ba ni khyab 'jug byed pa'i slad du ste thugs rdo rje byed pa'i slad du'o zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: The giving of the hanging silk crown is for the sake of Vishnu, for the sake of making him a mind vajra.

original: / rdo rje mchod phyir thogs gser gyi rang bzhin nam skud pa'i rang bzhin ni tshangs pa byed pa'i slad du ste sku rdo rje byed pa'i slad du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje mchod phyir thogs gser gyi rang bzhin nam skud pa'i rang bzhin ni tshangs pa byed pa'i slad du ste sku rdo rje byed pa'i slad du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The vajra-emblem, made of gold or cloth, is given for the sake of making Brahmā, for the sake of making the vajra of body.

original: rgan po dang gzhon nu de rnams la slob dpon slad du rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis zhes pa me tog lhung ba'i dbang gis phyag rgya rnam par dag pa dbang bskur ba nyid sbyin par bya ba ni gsung gi rdo rje rnam par dag pa
analyzed: rgan po dang gzhon nu de rnams la slob dpon slad du rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis zhes pa me tog lhung ba'i dbang gis phyag rgya rnam par dag pa dbang bskur ba nyid sbyin par bya ba ni gsung gi rdo rje rnam par dag pa
translated: The consecration of the consort, pure by the fall of the flower, is given to them, the old and the young, for the sake of the master, by the power of one’s own buddha-family, for the sake of making the vajra of speech.

original: byed pa'i slad du ste dbang phyug chen po byed pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i slad du ste dbang phyug chen po byed pa'i slad du'o //
translated: The consecration is given for the sake of making Maheśvara.🔽Thus:

original: de ltar / tshangs pa sku yi rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: de ltar / tshangs pa sku yi rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: Brahmā is the vajra of body,

original: gsung gi rdo rje dbang phyug che //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje dbang phyug che //
translated: the vajra of speech is Maheśvara,

original: rgyal po thugs kyi rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: rgyal po thugs kyi rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: the king is the vajra of mind,

original: de yang khyab 'jug rdzu 'phrul che //
analyzed: de yang khyab 'jug rdzu 'phrul che //
translated: and Viṣṇu is the great miracle.

original: rdo rje slob dpon zhes dang / de bzhin du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /🔽gtsug phud phud bu lcang lo can //
