analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon zhes dang / de bzhin du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa / gtsug phud phud bu lcang lo can //
translated: Similarly, the Bhagavat declares in the Litany of Names:🔽He has a topknot and curly hair,

original: ral pa munydza @156b cod pan thogs //
analyzed: ral pa munydza @156b cod pan thogs //
translated: hair-locks and a crown-gem.

original: gdong lnga zur phud lnga dang ldan //
analyzed: gdong lnga zur phud lnga dang ldan //
translated: He has five faces and five locks of hair,🔽and is called Five-Locks-Flower-Skull.

original: zur phud lnga pa me tog thod ces pa ste rgyud gzhan thams cad la bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: zur phud lnga pa me tog thod ces pa ste rgyud gzhan thams cad la bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the Bhagavat's definition in all the other tantras.

original: 'dir ston pa po'i dbang la mngon par dbang bskur ba'i dge slong ngam dge tshul lam khyim pas g-yog la sogs pa'i chos dang khyim pa'i chos mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ston pa po'i dbang la mngon par dbang bskur ba'i dge slong ngam dge tshul lam khyim pas g-yog la sogs pa'i chos dang khyim pa'i chos mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the one who teaches should be a fully ordained monk or novice monk or lay practitioner who has been consecrated with the consecration of the master. He should not perform the duties of a servant, etc. or the duties of a householder.

original: gal te ral gri dang snag tsha dang tshong la sogs pa byed na de'i bka' bcag par 'gyur zhing bka' bcag pa las mnar med par 'gre bar 'gyur te slob dpon gyi chos rnam par bshig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te ral gri dang snag tsha dang tshong la sogs pa byed na de'i bka' bcag par 'gyur zhing bka' bcag pa las mnar med par 'gre bar 'gyur te slob dpon gyi chos rnam par bshig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If he performs the duties of a householder, such as swordsmanship, writing, or commerce, he breaks his word, and because he has broken his word, he will go to Avici Hell, because he has destroyed the Dharma of the master.

original: rdo rje slob dpon bdag po'i dbang gi cho ga'i rab tu gnas pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon bdag po'i dbang gi cho ga'i rab tu gnas pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the consecration of the master-of-the-rites consecration.

original: 'dir sku gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rab tu gnas pa ni steng du bla re bkod cing sa yi mthil gyi gnas dag tu yang ri mo gsum ni kun nas so zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa nas brtsams pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu
analyzed: 'dir sku gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rab tu gnas pa ni steng du bla re bkod cing sa yi mthil gyi gnas dag tu yang ri mo gsum ni kun nas so zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa nas brtsams pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu
translated: Here, the consecration of the images, etc. , is begun with the verse, “Having arranged the canopy above, and also the three lines on the ground, etc. ”

original: gnyis ni go sla ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni go sla ste /
translated: The twelve verses are easy to understand.

original: ji srid slob mas smon lam gdab pa dang yongs su sngo ba byed pa bsod nams 'di yis sems can rnams ni rnam gsum srid par gnas pa'i bla med byang chub thob par shog ces pa'i mthar thug pa rab tu gnas pa'i cho ga ni go sla'o //
analyzed: ji srid slob mas smon lam gdab pa dang yongs su sngo ba byed pa bsod nams 'di yis sems can rnams ni rnam gsum srid par gnas pa'i bla med byang chub thob par shog ces pa'i mthar thug pa rab tu gnas pa'i cho ga ni go sla'o //
translated: The consecration rite ends with the student’s aspirational prayer and dedication, “By this merit, may all sentient beings attain unsurpassed enlightenment, abiding in the three worlds. ” The consecration rite is easy to understand.

original: des na rgyas 'grel ma byas so //
analyzed: des na rgyas 'grel ma byas so //
translated: Therefore, I have not commented on it.

original: da ni ji srid phyogs kyi lo zhes pa la sogs pas dbang gong ma'i cho ga gsungs te 'dir bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang gi don du phyag rgya ni ji srid phyogs kyi lo zhes pa lo bcu'i bar ni spang bar bya ste gzhon nu ma'i phyir
analyzed: da ni ji srid phyogs kyi lo zhes pa la sogs pas dbang gong ma'i cho ga gsungs te 'dir bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang gi don du phyag rgya ni ji srid phyogs kyi lo zhes pa lo bcu'i bar ni spang bar bya ste gzhon nu ma'i phyir
translated: Now, beginning from “as long as the teeth” and so on, it explains the rite of the higher initiations. Here, in order to receive the vase and so on initiations, one should avoid a consort “as long as the teeth” last, that is, for ten years, because of the youthfulness of the girl.

original: ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gcig pu rnam pa bcur 'gyur te lo so sor sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gcig pu rnam pa bcur 'gyur te lo so sor sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is tenfold, and each year is purified by the perfection of generosity and so on.

original: de la yang ji srid so lhung bar ma gyur pa de srid du ye shes kyi khams te mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang ji srid so lhung bar ma gyur pa de srid du ye shes kyi khams te mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And as long as the teeth do not fall out, it is the element of wisdom, because it is inexhaustible.

original: de nas so lhung nas nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: de nas so lhung nas nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: Then, after the teeth have fallen out, it is the element of space.

original: de ltar khams gnyis kyis gzhon nu ma skye gnas ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar khams gnyis kyis gzhon nu ma skye gnas ma nyams pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the two elements, the girl is a womb that is not damaged.

original: des na de ni blta bar bya ba dang reg par bya ba dang mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de ni blta bar bya ba dang reg par bya ba dang mchod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, she should be seen, touched, and worshipped.

original: lo bcu po de nas lo bcu gcig pa @157a * //
analyzed: lo bcu po de nas lo bcu gcig pa @157a * //
translated: After those ten years, the eleventh year

original: dang por byas nas ji srid lo nyi shu'i mthar 'khyud par bya ste ro dang bcas pa'i chu gter zhes pa ni drug dang bcas pa'i bzhi'o //
analyzed: dang por byas nas ji srid lo nyi shu'i mthar 'khyud par bya ste ro dang bcas pa'i chu gter zhes pa ni drug dang bcas pa'i bzhi'o //
translated: Having first done this, one should embrace her for twenty years. The ocean with corpses means the four with the six.

original: g-yo ba la sogs te rlung la sogs pa rnams ni bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs te rlung la sogs pa rnams ni bsten par bya'o //
translated: One should rely on the wind and so forth, that is, the wind and so on.

original: de'i phyir lo bcu gcig ma la rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lo bcu gcig ma la rlung gi khams so //
translated: Therefore, the eleven-year-old is the wind element.

original: bcu gnyis ma la me dang bcu gsum ma la chu dang bcu bzhi ma la sa'o zhes pa ste bzhi'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis ma la me dang bcu gsum ma la chu dang bcu bzhi ma la sa'o zhes pa ste bzhi'o //
translated: The twelve-year-old is fire, the thirteen-year-old is water, and the fourteen-year-old is earth.

original: bcva lnga ma la sgra dang bcu drug ma la reg bya dang bcu bdun ma la ro dang bco brgyad ma la gzugs dang bcu dgu ma la dri dang nyi shu ma la chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: bcva lnga ma la sgra dang bcu drug ma la reg bya dang bcu bdun ma la ro dang bco brgyad ma la gzugs dang bcu dgu ma la dri dang nyi shu ma la chos kyi khams so //
translated: The fifteen-year-old is sound, the sixteen-year-old is tactility, the seventeen-year-old is taste, the eighteen-year-old is form, the nineteen-year-old is smell, and the twenty-year-old is the phenomena element.

original: de nas lo ni nyi shu yan chad phyag rgya mchog tu 'jigs byed ma ste khro bo 'byung po lha min cha ni 'dir lo nyi shu'i phyi nas nyi shu rtsa gcig nas brtsams te lo so so rnams ni grangs bzhin du shin tu sngon mo dang shin
analyzed: de nas lo ni nyi shu yan chad phyag rgya mchog tu 'jigs byed ma ste khro bo 'byung po lha min cha ni 'dir lo nyi shu'i phyi nas nyi shu rtsa gcig nas brtsams te lo so so rnams ni grangs bzhin du shin tu sngon mo dang shin
translated: Then, for twenty years, the supreme consort is Bhairavi, the wrathful one.

original: tu stobs ldan ma dang rmugs byed ma dang khengs ldan ma dang rengs byed ma dang 'od zer can ma dang tsun d'a dang khro gnyer can ma dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang drag spyan ma ste khro bo bcu'i lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: tu stobs ldan ma dang rmugs byed ma dang khengs ldan ma dang rengs byed ma dang 'od zer can ma dang tsun d'a dang khro gnyer can ma dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang drag spyan ma ste khro bo bcu'i lha mo rnams so //
translated: Then, beginning from the twenty-first year, the individual years are the goddesses of the ten wrathful ones, in order: Chattra, Chatravathi, Chatradharani, Chatradhara, Chatrahasta, Chatraketu, Chatrahasta, Chatrahasta, Chatrahasta, and Chatrahasta.

original: de nas lo sum cu rtsa gcig nas brgyad ni 'byung po'i cha ste /
analyzed: de nas lo sum cu rtsa gcig nas brgyad ni 'byung po'i cha ste /
translated: Then, from the thirty-first year to the thirty-eighth year, the part of the rakshasa is:

original: tsartsi k'a dang phag mo dang drag mo dang dbang mo dang tshangs ma dang dpal chen mo dang gzhon nu ma dang khyab 'jug ma'o //
analyzed: tsartsi k'a dang phag mo dang drag mo dang dbang mo dang tshangs ma dang dpal chen mo dang gzhon nu ma dang khyab 'jug ma'o //
translated: Cakravarmi, Varahi, Chandika, Isvari, Brahma, Mahakali, Kumari, and Visnu.

original: de nas lo sum cu rtsa dgu nas brgyad ni lha min gyi cha ste khyi gdong ma dang phag gdong ma dang stag gdong ma dang ce sbyang gdong ma dang mkha' lding gdong ma dang 'ug gdong ma dang bya rgod gdong ma dang bya rog gdong ma ste
analyzed: de nas lo sum cu rtsa dgu nas brgyad ni lha min gyi cha ste khyi gdong ma dang phag gdong ma dang stag gdong ma dang ce sbyang gdong ma dang mkha' lding gdong ma dang 'ug gdong ma dang bya rgod gdong ma dang bya rog gdong ma ste
translated: Then, from the thirty-ninth to the forty-eighth year, the eight goddesses of the yakshas, namely, the dog-faced, the pig-faced, the tiger-faced, the jackal-faced, the garuda-faced, the owl-faced, the vulture-faced, and the crow-faced goddesses.

original: ji srid lo bzhi bcu rtsa drug gi bar du ni phyag rgya bsgom pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: ji srid lo bzhi bcu rtsa drug gi bar du ni phyag rgya bsgom pa'i don du'o //
translated: Thus, for forty-six years, the seal is meditated upon.

original: dbang gi don du ni slar yang drug dang gsum ste bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba zhes pa me'i khams nas brtsams te ji srid chos kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dbang gi don du ni slar yang drug dang gsum ste bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba zhes pa me'i khams nas brtsams te ji srid chos kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: For the sake of consecration, again, for six and three years, the result of the bliss of equality is bestowed, beginning with the fire constituent and ending with the dharma constituent.

original: rlung gi khams ni rdul med pa nyid kyi phyir gzung bar mi bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni rdul med pa nyid kyi phyir gzung bar mi bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The wind constituent is not to be grasped because it is devoid of particles.

original: 'dir dbang gong ma ni rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni sems can gzhug pa'i don dang lam yongs su shes pa'i don dang rgyud nyan pa la dbang ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'dir dbang gong ma ni rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni sems can gzhug pa'i don dang lam yongs su shes pa'i don dang rgyud nyan pa la dbang ba'i don du'o //
translated: Here, the higher consecration is twofold: one for the sake of introducing the sentient beings, for the sake of knowing the path, and for the sake of listening to the tantra.

original: gzhan ni slob dpon chen po'i gnas sbyin pa @157b dang ston pa po byed pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni slob dpon chen po'i gnas sbyin pa @157b dang ston pa po byed pa'i slad du'o //
translated: The other is for the great master to give the place and to act as the teacher.

original: dang por dbang 'di la re zhig skrag pa dang 'khrul pa'i sems la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba lo bcu gnyis ma la sogs pa yongs su smin pa ni slob mas bla ma la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang por dbang 'di la re zhig skrag pa dang 'khrul pa'i sems la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba lo bcu gnyis ma la sogs pa yongs su smin pa ni slob mas bla ma la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: First, in this initiation, the disciple should offer to the master a fully mature girl, free from the faults of a frightened or confused mind, twelve years old and so on.

original: de nas gsol ba gdab pa la sogs pa byas nas slob mas bla ma la 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bstod pas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gsol ba gdab pa la sogs pa byas nas slob mas bla ma la 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bstod pas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then, having made a request and so on, the disciple should request the master with the praise that will be explained.

original: de nas bla ma mnyes pas 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis rang gi phyag rgya'i nu ma la reg par byed du gzhug ste des na bum pa'i dbang ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de nas bla ma mnyes pas 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis rang gi phyag rgya'i nu ma la reg par byed du gzhug ste des na bum pa'i dbang ni de nyid do //
translated: Then, the master, pleased, should cause the disciple to touch his own consort's breast with the conventional reality of the world. Then, that is the vase initiation.

original: de nas gsang ba'i mchod pa byas nas slob ma la bdud rtsi sbyin zhing phyag rgya'i bha ga yang gsal bar byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: de nas gsang ba'i mchod pa byas nas slob ma la bdud rtsi sbyin zhing phyag rgya'i bha ga yang gsal bar byed du gzhug go //
translated: Then, having made the secret offering, the master should give the disciple the elixir and cause him to illuminate the bhaga of the consort.

original: des na ri bong 'dzin pa myang ba dang lta ba dag gis gsang ba'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ri bong 'dzin pa myang ba dang lta ba dag gis gsang ba'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the tasting and seeing of the rabbit-holding moon are the secret initiation.

original: de nas shes rab ye shes dbang la aom yig la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams kyis rigs lnga'i cha dang ldan par bya zhing de nas bla mas rgyal ba ste rdo rje sems dpa' dbang du byas nas lag bcangs dang gnyis gnyis 'khyud pa byed pa'i ched du
analyzed: de nas shes rab ye shes dbang la aom yig la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams kyis rigs lnga'i cha dang ldan par bya zhing de nas bla mas rgyal ba ste rdo rje sems dpa' dbang du byas nas lag bcangs dang gnyis gnyis 'khyud pa byed pa'i ched du
translated: Then, for the wisdom-knowledge initiation, the seed syllables such as OṀ are used to endow the disciple with the five family natures. Then, the guru, having brought the Victor, that is, Vajrasattva, under his control, should give the disciple that consort for the purpose of hand-holding and embrace.

original: phyag rgya de slob ma la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya de slob ma la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The disciple should be given that consort.

original: ji ltar skal ba ngal pa'i sems can 'di ni sgom pa la sogs pa la dbang pa dang rgyud mnyan pa'i ched du ste sems can rnams la rgyud bstan pa dang dkyil 'khor bri ba'i ched du ni ma yin no zhes pa dang por slob ma gzhug pa
analyzed: ji ltar skal ba ngal pa'i sems can 'di ni sgom pa la sogs pa la dbang pa dang rgyud mnyan pa'i ched du ste sems can rnams la rgyud bstan pa dang dkyil 'khor bri ba'i ched du ni ma yin no zhes pa dang por slob ma gzhug pa
translated: This sentient being, who has the fortune, is empowered in meditation and so forth, and for the purpose of listening to the tantra, but not for the purpose of teaching the tantra and drawing the maṇḍala to sentient beings.

original: la dbang bskur ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: la dbang bskur ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of conferring empowerment on the disciple who is to be admitted first.

original: de bzhin du slob dpon ni rgod pa yon tan gnyis kyi bdag nyid khu ba'i bde ba rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du slob dpon ni rgod pa yon tan gnyis kyi bdag nyid khu ba'i bde ba rnam par dag pas so //
translated: Likewise, the master is the pure bliss of the semen, which is the nature of the two qualities of passion.

original: gsang ba zhes pa ni lta ba yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa ni lta ba yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The secret is the pure bliss of the semen, which is the nature of the three qualities of passion.

original: lag bcangs zhes pa ni yon tan bzhi'i bdag nyid rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: lag bcangs zhes pa ni yon tan bzhi'i bdag nyid rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The hand-holding is the pure bliss of the semen, which is the nature of the four qualities of passion.🔽The coupling is the pure bliss of the semen, which is the nature of the five qualities of passion.

original: gnyis gnyis zhes pa ni yon tan lnga'i bdag nyid khu ba'i bde ba rnam par dag pas so zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i le'u lnga pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis zhes pa ni yon tan lnga'i bdag nyid khu ba'i bde ba rnam par dag pas so zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i le'u lnga pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: This and more will be explained in the fifth chapter of the commentary, the chapter on the accomplishment of the supreme, unchanging wisdom.

original: sems can gzhug pa'i slad du 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi dbang rnam pa bzhi'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhug pa'i slad du 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi dbang rnam pa bzhi'i nges pa'o //
translated: In order to introduce sentient beings, there is the certainty of the four kinds of power of the relative truth of the world.

original: de nas rgyas 'grel dang bcas pa'i rgyud @158a * //
analyzed: de nas rgyas 'grel dang bcas pa'i rgyud @158a * //
translated: Then, the tantra together with the commentary

original: thams cad thos shing shes par gyur pa na bdag po chen po nyid kyi ched du go rims ji lta ba bzhin gsungs pa'i rig ma bcu po rnams khyim na gnas pa'i slob mas bla ma la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad thos shing shes par gyur pa na bdag po chen po nyid kyi ched du go rims ji lta ba bzhin gsungs pa'i rig ma bcu po rnams khyim na gnas pa'i slob mas bla ma la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: When all have heard and understood, the householder disciple should offer to the guru the ten knowledge consorts mentioned in order for the sake of the great lord.

original: 'dir rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the Bhagavān has said in the Root Tantra:🔽Sister’s daughter, daughter,

original: srid mo'i bu mo bu mo dang // sring mo de bzhin skyed byed ma //
analyzed: srid mo'i bu mo bu mo dang // sring mo de bzhin skyed byed ma //
translated: sister, and likewise mother,

original: de bzhin chung ma'i ma dang ni //
analyzed: de bzhin chung ma'i ma dang ni //
translated: and likewise wife’s mother,🔽and likewise mother’s sister,🔽and likewise father’s sister,

original: de bzhin zhang po'i bud med dang // pha yi spun zla'i chung ma dang // de bzhin pha yi sring mo dang // rang gi ma yi spun zla nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin zhang po'i bud med dang // pha yi spun zla'i chung ma dang // de bzhin pha yi sring mo dang // rang gi ma yi spun zla nyid //
translated: and likewise one’s own sister,

original: rang gi chung ma mchog gzugs can //
analyzed: rang gi chung ma mchog gzugs can //
translated: and likewise one’s own wife of supreme form,

original: sgrol ma la sogs chos khams mthar //
analyzed: sgrol ma la sogs chos khams mthar //
translated: Tārā, and so forth, up to the element of phenomena.

original: rang rigs las skyes rig ma bcu //🔽thar pa 'dod pa'i khyim pa yis //
analyzed: rang rigs las skyes rig ma bcu // thar pa 'dod pa'i khyim pa yis //
translated: These ten knowledge consorts born from one’s own class🔽are to be given by the householder who desires liberation

original: dbang gi dus su rab sbyin bya //
analyzed: dbang gi dus su rab sbyin bya //
translated: at the time of empowerment.

original: rig ma 'di rnams rigs bsrung phyir //
analyzed: rig ma 'di rnams rigs bsrung phyir //
translated: For the sake of protecting the family,

original: gal te bla mar mi 'bul na //
analyzed: gal te bla mar mi 'bul na //
translated: If you do not offer to the guru,

original: de tshe khyim na gnas rnams la //
analyzed: de tshe khyim na gnas rnams la //
translated: then you should not give to householders.

original: gzhan gyis dbang bskur sbyin mi bya //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dbang bskur sbyin mi bya //
translated: The consecration should not be given by others.

original: dkyil 'khor du ni dbang bskur ba'i //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ni dbang bskur ba'i //
translated: The consecration in the maṇḍala

original: dmangs rigs skyes sogs gzhan rnams kyis //🔽dge slong dge tshul rnams la ni //
analyzed: dmangs rigs skyes sogs gzhan rnams kyis // dge slong dge tshul rnams la ni //
translated: is for others, such as those born into the caste of servants.🔽The guru should give to the bhikṣus and śrāmaṇeras,🔽the lord of men,

original: bla mas sbyin bya mi yi bdag / rlung sogs rim pas dmangs rigs mo //
analyzed: bla mas sbyin bya mi yi bdag / rlung sogs rim pas dmangs rigs mo //
translated: the wind, and so on, in order.

original: rgyal rigs de bzhin bram ze mo //🔽rje mo g-yung mo nya pa mo //
analyzed: rgyal rigs de bzhin bram ze mo // rje mo g-yung mo nya pa mo //
translated: The kṣatriya is the brahmin woman,🔽the vaiśya is the queen, the fisherwoman,

original: gar med bzhin tshos mkhan mo //
analyzed: gar med bzhin tshos mkhan mo //
translated: the dancer, the washerwoman,

original: ko pags byed ma gtum mo ni //🔽mthar skyes chos khams ma ste bcu //
analyzed: ko pags byed ma gtum mo ni // mthar skyes chos khams ma ste bcu //
translated: the leather worker, the butcher,🔽and the one born at the end, the earth element.

original: rig ma chen mor yang dag brjod //
analyzed: rig ma chen mor yang dag brjod //
translated: These are said to be the ten great knowledge consorts.

original: longs spyod grol 'bras rab tu ster zhes pa ste de ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang dbang bcu dang sa bcu dang stobs bcu rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod grol 'bras rab tu ster zhes pa ste de ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang dbang bcu dang sa bcu dang stobs bcu rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ten perfections, the ten powers, the ten stages, and the ten strengths are completely purified by the sequence of the teaching in that way.

original: de bzhin du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bstod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bstod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, the Praise of the Dharmadhatu from the Recitation of the Names of Manjushri says:

original: sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che //
translated: The great Buddha Vairochana,

original: thub pa chen po thub chen ldan //
analyzed: thub pa chen po thub chen ldan //
translated: The great sage, the great sage,

original: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba //
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba //
translated: Arisen from the great way of mantra,

original: gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can //
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can //
translated: The very essence of the great way of mantra,

original: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste //
translated: The one who has attained the ten perfections,

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas //🔽pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas // pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
translated: The one who abides in the ten perfections,🔽The one who is pure in the ten perfections,

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
translated: The one who is the way of the ten perfections,

original: mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
translated: The lord of the ten grounds, the protector,

original: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
analyzed: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
translated: The one who abides on the ten grounds,

original: shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can //
analyzed: shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can //
translated: The one whose nature is the ten pure knowledges,

original: shes bcu rnam dag @158b 'chang ba po //
analyzed: shes bcu rnam dag @158b 'chang ba po //
translated: The one who bears the ten pure knowledges,

original: rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i don //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i don //
translated: The one with the ten aspects, the meaning of the ten meanings,

original: thub dbang stobs bcu khyab pa'i bdag / kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
analyzed: thub dbang stobs bcu khyab pa'i bdag / kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
translated: The one who is the lord of the ten powers, the sage, the one who pervades all, the one who does all meanings without exception.

original: rnam bcu dbang ldan che ba po zhes pa ste bdag po nyid byed pa'i slad du dkyil 'khor chen po'i slob dpon gyi go 'phang mngon par 'dod pas phyag rgya bcu dbul bar bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnam bcu dbang ldan che ba po zhes pa ste bdag po nyid byed pa'i slad du dkyil 'khor chen po'i slob dpon gyi go 'phang mngon par 'dod pas phyag rgya bcu dbul bar bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The one who is endowed with the ten mudras is Mahesvara, and in order to become the lord himself, one who aspires to the state of a great maṇḍala master should offer the ten mudras.🔽This is the rule of the tathāgatas.

original: de ltar slob mas bla ma la phyag rgya bcu phul te de nas bka' stsal don du gnyer bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar slob mas bla ma la phyag rgya bcu phul te de nas bka' stsal don du gnyer bar bya'o //
translated: In that way, the disciple offers the ten mudras to the guru and then should request the meaning of the command.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad thob bo //
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad thob bo //
translated: The disciple says, Oh Bhagavān, I have obtained all the perfections.🔽Now, what should I do? Then the master says, From among the ten, take this wife of mine and make a request to me with her.

original: da ni bdag gis ci zhig bgyi de nas slob dpon gyis gsungs pa bcu'i nang nas rang gi chung ma 'di bzung nas de dang lhan cig tu bdag la gsol ba gdab pa byos shig dge slong dang dge tshul rnams la ni gtum mo rang gi chung mar
analyzed: da ni bdag gis ci zhig bgyi de nas slob dpon gyis gsungs pa bcu'i nang nas rang gi chung ma 'di bzung nas de dang lhan cig tu bdag la gsol ba gdab pa byos shig dge slong dang dge tshul rnams la ni gtum mo rang gi chung mar
translated: To the bhikṣus and novices, give the fierce inner heat as your wife.

original: bya'o // de nas bla ma'i nges pas de bzung nas gnyis kyis gser la sogs pa'i me tog rnams kyis mandala byas te de nas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // de nas bla ma'i nges pas de bzung nas gnyis kyis gser la sogs pa'i me tog rnams kyis mandala byas te de nas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken it up with the conviction of the guru, one should make a maṇḍala with two handfuls of gold and so forth, and then make a supplication:🔽I bow to you, Kālacakra,

original: sgrib pa thams cad bcom pa yi //🔽dus kyi 'khor lo khyod la 'dud //🔽mchog tu mi 'gyur bdes gang ba //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad bcom pa yi // dus kyi 'khor lo khyod la 'dud // mchog tu mi 'gyur bdes gang ba //
translated: who has destroyed all obscurations.

original: ye shes sku khyod la phyag 'tshal //🔽stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
analyzed: ye shes sku khyod la phyag 'tshal // stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
translated: I bow to you, the jñānakāya,🔽who is filled with supreme changeless bliss.🔽The bodhicitta that is the inseparability

original: byang chub sems ni 'gyur med gang //🔽dbang bskur de yis bdag la ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni 'gyur med gang // dbang bskur de yis bdag la ni //
translated: of emptiness and compassion is unchanging.🔽O protector, please be kind

original: mgon po de ni bka' drin mdzod ;
analyzed: mgon po de ni bka' drin mdzod ;
translated: and confer that empowerment on me.

original: / bu dang chung ma sogs bcas pa //
analyzed: / bu dang chung ma sogs bcas pa //
translated: I and my sons, wives, and so on

original: bdag ni dus kun khyod kyi 'bangs //
analyzed: bdag ni dus kun khyod kyi 'bangs //
translated: are your servants at all times.

original: ji srid byang chub snying po'i mthar //
analyzed: ji srid byang chub snying po'i mthar //
translated: Until the essence of enlightenment,

original: bdag la skyabs gzhan yod ma yin zhes pas gsol ba btab par gyur pa'i slob ma chung ma dang bcas pa gzigs nas slob dpon gyis sgra rdo rje ma rgyan thams cad bkrol zhing gcer bur byas pa la 'khyud du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la skyabs gzhan yod ma yin zhes pas gsol ba btab par gyur pa'i slob ma chung ma dang bcas pa gzigs nas slob dpon gyis sgra rdo rje ma rgyan thams cad bkrol zhing gcer bur byas pa la 'khyud du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having seen the disciple and his wife who have supplicated with “I have no other refuge, O Lord,” the master should remove all the ornaments of Śabdavajrā, and should cause him to embrace her, who is naked.

original: khyim pa rnams ni chung ma'i ma la'o //🔽de nas shar sgrol ma dang lhor gos dkar mo dang byang du m'a ma k'i dang nub tu spyan ma dang mer reg bya rdo rje ma dang bden bral du rdo rje ma dang dbang ldan du gzugs rdo rje ma dang rlung du dri rdo rje ma ste
analyzed: khyim pa rnams ni chung ma'i ma la'o // de nas shar sgrol ma dang lhor gos dkar mo dang byang du m'a ma k'i dang nub tu spyan ma dang mer reg bya rdo rje ma dang bden bral du rdo rje ma dang dbang ldan du gzugs rdo rje ma dang rlung du dri rdo rje ma ste
translated: Householders should do it with the mother of the wife.🔽Then one should place Locanā in the west, Sparśavajrā in the southeast, Vajrī in the southwest, Rūpavajrā in the northwest, Gandhavajrā in the northeast, and the circle of Yoginīs, naked, with loose hair, holding flaying knives and skulls, in the east, south, west, and north.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo gcer mo skra grol ma phyag na gri gug dang thod pa can rnams dgod par bya ste rig ma dgu po rnams kyis rim pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo gcer mo skra grol ma phyag na gri gug dang thod pa can rnams dgod par bya ste rig ma dgu po rnams kyis rim pa bzhin du'o //
translated: The nine knowledge goddesses should be placed in order.

original: de ltar sngar dbang bskur ba ni chu la sogs pas rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: de ltar sngar dbang bskur ba ni chu la sogs pas rnam pa bdun no //
translated: Thus, the consecration is done with the seven forms, beginning with the water.

original: de nas gong ma'i dbang ni spyi'i las kyi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: de nas gong ma'i dbang ni spyi'i las kyi phyag rgyas so //
translated: Then, the higher empowerment is in general with the karma consort.🔽

original: gong ma'i @159a * //
analyzed: gong ma'i @159a * //
translated: Then, the higher consecration is with the action seal in general.

original: yang gong ma'i dbang ni dmangs rigs las skyes pa la sgos pa'i phyag rgya dbul ba'i don du sngar gsungs pa bcu po rnams so //
analyzed: yang gong ma'i dbang ni dmangs rigs las skyes pa la sgos pa'i phyag rgya dbul ba'i don du sngar gsungs pa bcu po rnams so //
translated: The higher consecration is for the purpose of offering the seal born from the śūdra caste.

original: klu ste bum pa brgyad dang rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa dag gis dge slong la 'khrus bya'o //
analyzed: klu ste bum pa brgyad dang rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa dag gis dge slong la 'khrus bya'o //
translated: The eight nāga vases and the victory vase and the supreme victory vase are for the monk.

original: dge tshul la de rnams kyi nang nas phyag rgya drug gis bum pa bzhi dang rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa dag gis khrus bya'o //
analyzed: dge tshul la de rnams kyi nang nas phyag rgya drug gis bum pa bzhi dang rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa dag gis khrus bya'o //
translated: The novice monk is consecrated with four vases from among those six seals and the victory vase and the supreme victory vase.

original: khyim na gnas pa la dgu po de rnams kyi nang nas gcig dang rang gi chung mas bum pa gcig dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pas mngon par dbang bskur bar bya ste sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas so //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa la dgu po de rnams kyi nang nas gcig dang rang gi chung mas bum pa gcig dang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pas mngon par dbang bskur bar bya ste sngar gsungs pa'i cho gas so //
translated: The lay practitioner is consecrated with one of those nine vases and his own wife’s vase and the supreme victory vase, according to the previously explained rite.

original: de nas phyag rgya gtad bya ste //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya gtad bya ste //
translated: Then, the seal is to be given.

original: bum dbang sbyin pa'i don du'o zhes pa 'dir ni rgyan rnams thams cad dang ldan zhun ma'i gser dang mtshungs shing bcu gnyis lo lon mdzes ma'i bu mo lo nyi shu'i mthar thug pa khrag ldan te rdul dang ldan pa la shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid dag
analyzed: bum dbang sbyin pa'i don du'o zhes pa 'dir ni rgyan rnams thams cad dang ldan zhun ma'i gser dang mtshungs shing bcu gnyis lo lon mdzes ma'i bu mo lo nyi shu'i mthar thug pa khrag ldan te rdul dang ldan pa la shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid dag
translated: Here, one should take a girl who is endowed with all ornaments, who is like refined gold, who is twelve years old, who is beautiful, who is twenty years old at the most, who is endowed with blood, that is, who is endowed with passion, and who is the nature of wisdom and method.

original: gis zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor gyis rang gi rdo rje nor bus 'dod spyad nas /
analyzed: gis zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor gyis rang gi rdo rje nor bus 'dod spyad nas /
translated: With the five, one should enjoy with one's vajra jewel, with the deity yoga that will be explained.

original: sa bon dang bcas rdo rje dag kyang gong ma'i dbang la slob ma dag par shes nas kha ru 'phang ba byas nas ni /
analyzed: sa bon dang bcas rdo rje dag kyang gong ma'i dbang la slob ma dag par shes nas kha ru 'phang ba byas nas ni /
translated: Having enjoyed with the seed and the vajra, having understood that the disciple is pure, one should raise the face.

original: phyi nas rang gi phyag rgya sbyin bya ste slob dpon gyis gang la 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas rang gi phyag rgya sbyin bya ste slob dpon gyis gang la 'khyud pa'o //
translated: Then, one should give one's consort, that is, the one with whom the master has united.

original: yang na bu'i chung ma la slob dpon rang gis mngon par bgrod de de nas dbang gi dus la bab pa na slob ma la slar yang rang gi chung ma gtad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bu'i chung ma la slob dpon rang gis mngon par bgrod de de nas dbang gi dus la bab pa na slob ma la slar yang rang gi chung ma gtad par bya'o //
translated: Or, the master himself should approach the son's wife. Then, when the time of the empowerment arrives, one should give one's own wife to the disciple.

original: 'dir bum pa'i dbang la shes rab kyi nu ma la thabs kyis reg par bya zhing bla mas slob ma'i chung ma'i nu ma la reg par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bum pa'i dbang la shes rab kyi nu ma la thabs kyis reg par bya zhing bla mas slob ma'i chung ma'i nu ma la reg par bya'o //
translated: Here, in the vase initiation, one should touch the breast of the wisdom [consort] with the means, and the guru should touch the breast of the disciple's wife.

original: gsang ba'i dbang la slob ma dang chung ma'i khar rdo rje gzhug par bya ste slob ma'i mig bcings nas bla mas shes rab kyi na ra n'a si ska gzhib par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang la slob ma dang chung ma'i khar rdo rje gzhug par bya ste slob ma'i mig bcings nas bla mas shes rab kyi na ra n'a si ska gzhib par bya'o //
translated: In the secret initiation, one should insert the vajra into the mouth of the disciple and his wife. Having bound the eyes of the disciple, the guru should massage the wisdom [consort's] vagina.

original: de nas shes rab ye shes kyi dbang gi ched du slob dpon gyis rang gi chung ma phyag rgyar gtad par bya'o zhes pa ni thams cad du bdag po chen po'i dbang gi cho ga'o //
analyzed: de nas shes rab ye shes kyi dbang gi ched du slob dpon gyis rang gi chung ma phyag rgyar gtad par bya'o zhes pa ni thams cad du bdag po chen po'i dbang gi cho ga'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of the initiation of the wisdom consort's wisdom, the guru should give his own wife as the seal to the disciple. This is the procedure of the great lord initiation in all cases.

original: gal te phyag rgya bcu yod na de'i tshe gang dang gang la 'dod pa spyod par nus pa'i slob ma la de dang de gtad par bya ste mtshan mo phyed nas chu tshod gnyis kyi rjes la nya ma 'chang ba ji srid par ro //
analyzed: gal te phyag rgya bcu yod na de'i tshe gang dang gang la 'dod pa spyod par nus pa'i slob ma la de dang de gtad par bya ste mtshan mo phyed nas chu tshod gnyis kyi rjes la nya ma 'chang ba ji srid par ro //
translated: If there are ten seals, then whichever one is able to enjoy desire with the disciple, that one should be given to him, and he should enjoy her from midnight until two hours after dawn.

original: de nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo gshegs tu gsol bar bya ste gshegs su gsol bar bya ste gshegs su gsol nas slob ma la sdom pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo gshegs tu gsol bar bya ste gshegs su gsol bar bya ste gshegs su gsol nas slob ma la sdom pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should request the gaṇacakra to depart, and having requested the departure, one should give the vow to the disciple.

original: khyad par dga' @159b ba'i mthar lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig bdag gis brjod pa gang yin pa 'di ni kun rdzob ste thig le gsum gyi mthar gang yin pa de ni don dam par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par dga' @159b ba'i mthar lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig bdag gis brjod pa gang yin pa 'di ni kun rdzob ste thig le gsum gyi mthar gang yin pa de ni don dam par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The ultimate is not the supreme joy that is said to be mine, which is the ultimate that is at the end of the three bindus.

original: don dam par rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bde ba ni 'pho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bde ba ni 'pho ba med pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is the bliss of the yogins that is not transferred.

original: des na bde ba chen po 'di ni khyod kyis bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na bde ba chen po 'di ni khyod kyis bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this great bliss should be protected by you.

original: de bzhin du dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du dang po'i sangs rgyas las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, in the Adibuddha, the Bhagavān said:🔽“In the application of the karma consort

original: las kyi phyag rgya'i rab sbyor dang // ye shes phyag rgya'i rjes chags la'ang //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'i rab sbyor dang // ye shes phyag rgya'i rjes chags la'ang //
translated: and in the pursuit of the gnosis consort,

original: bde ba chen po byang chub sems //
analyzed: bde ba chen po byang chub sems //
translated: the bodhicitta of great bliss

original: brtul zhugs brtan pos bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: brtul zhugs brtan pos bsrung bar bya //
translated: should be protected by the firm vow.

original: bha gar ling ga rab bzhag nas //
analyzed: bha gar ling ga rab bzhag nas //
translated: Having placed the liṅga in the bhaga,

original: byang chub sems ni spro mi bya //🔽khams gsum po ni ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni spro mi bya // khams gsum po ni ma lus pa'i //
translated: Do not give up the thought of awakening.🔽Meditate on the form of the Buddha

original: sangs rgyas gzugs ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs ni bsgom par bya //
translated: of the entire three realms without exception.

original: bsrungs pa 'di nyid kho na yis //
analyzed: bsrungs pa 'di nyid kho na yis //
translated: By merely observing this,

original: skye ba 'di la sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: skye ba 'di la sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: you will attain buddhahood in this life.

original: tshul khrims tshogs ni yang dag rdzogs //
analyzed: tshul khrims tshogs ni yang dag rdzogs //
translated: The accumulation of ethical discipline is perfected,

original: bsod nams ye shes yang dag ldan //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes yang dag ldan //
translated: endowed with merit and wisdom.

original: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa yi //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa yi //
translated: Having attained the ten perfections,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dus gsum 'jug //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dus gsum 'jug //
translated: you enter into the three times of perfect buddhahood.

original: 'di yis rdzogs sangs rgyas kun gyis //
analyzed: 'di yis rdzogs sangs rgyas kun gyis //
translated: By this, all perfect buddhas

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor //
translated: turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: rang dang gzhan don bsgrub pa'i slad //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan don bsgrub pa'i slad //
translated: In order to accomplish the welfare of self and other,

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
translated: emptiness and compassion are inseparable.

original: khams gsum dbang phyug ye shes ni //
analyzed: khams gsum dbang phyug ye shes ni //
translated: The lord of the three realms, the wisdom

original: 'di las gzhan pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa yod ma yin //
translated: that is not other than this,

original: skyob pa kun gyi sdom pa ni //
analyzed: skyob pa kun gyi sdom pa ni //
translated: the vow of all the protectors,

original: gal te khyod srung bdag gi bu ;
analyzed: gal te khyod srung bdag gi bu ;
translated: if you guard it, you are my child.

original: / de tshe sangs rgyas thams cad kyis //
analyzed: / de tshe sangs rgyas thams cad kyis //
translated: Then, through the blessings of all the buddhas,

original: byin brlabs rdzogs byang chub 'thob 'gyur //
analyzed: byin brlabs rdzogs byang chub 'thob 'gyur //
translated: you will attain perfect awakening.

original: ci ste chags pas zil mnan bdag / gtso bo'i mdun du blangs nas ni //
analyzed: ci ste chags pas zil mnan bdag / gtso bo'i mdun du blangs nas ni //
translated: But if, overcome by passion, I take it in front of the chief,

original: sngom pa skyong bar mi byed na //
analyzed: sngom pa skyong bar mi byed na //
translated: and do not keep the vow,

original: de tshe du 'bod du 'gro 'gyur //🔽dman pa'i sems las skye gnas su //
analyzed: de tshe du 'bod du 'gro 'gyur // dman pa'i sems las skye gnas su //
translated: then I will go to the Howling Hell.

original: gang tshe byang chub sems lhung gyur //
analyzed: gang tshe byang chub sems lhung gyur //
translated: Whenever the thought of enlightenment falls from the mind of the low-born,

original: de tshe phyag rgyar shes nas ni //
analyzed: de tshe phyag rgyar shes nas ni //
translated: then, knowing it to be the seal,

original: padma'i phyi rol rang lces blang zhes so //
analyzed: padma'i phyi rol rang lces blang zhes so //
translated: I will take it with my tongue outside the lotus.

original: skrag dang zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: skrag dang zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The words fear and so forth are easy to understand.

original: slob dpon gyis slob ma la sdom pa byin nas slob mas kyang bla ma la yon dbul lo //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis slob ma la sdom pa byin nas slob mas kyang bla ma la yon dbul lo //
translated: After the master has given the vow to the disciple, the disciple also should give a gift to the guru.

original: slar yang mandala byas nas gsol ba gdab par bya ste bcom ldan 'das bdag la dbang bskur ba'i rab tu byed pa'i bka' drin mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: slar yang mandala byas nas gsol ba gdab par bya ste bcom ldan 'das bdag la dbang bskur ba'i rab tu byed pa'i bka' drin mdzad du gsol //
translated: Again, having made a mandala, he should make a request: Blessed One, please be kind enough to perform the consecration of me.

original: de nas bla mas slob ma bos te bu khyod nyon cig kun rdzob ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi bde ba dga' ba bcu drug gi mtshan nyid ni tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i brgya pa la @160a
analyzed: de nas bla mas slob ma bos te bu khyod nyon cig kun rdzob ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi bde ba dga' ba bcu drug gi mtshan nyid ni tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i brgya pa la @160a
translated: Then the guru should call the disciple and say, “Son, listen! The characteristics of the sixteen joys, the common bliss of all sentient beings, just as it is, are taught in the twenty-two verses of the Cakrasaṃvara Tantra, and so on.🔽The supreme first buddha taught them to Mañjuvajra, who extracted them in the form of the text called the Arousing of Yoginī.

original: * // sogs pa rnams kyis mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las 'jam pa'i rdo rjes phyung ba 'dod pa skyod par zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir 'gro ba thams cad kyi yid la 'dod pa skyod par byed pa ni dang po dga' ba'o //
analyzed: * // sogs pa rnams kyis mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las 'jam pa'i rdo rjes phyung ba 'dod pa skyod par zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir 'gro ba thams cad kyi yid la 'dod pa skyod par byed pa ni dang po dga' ba'o //
translated: Here, the first joy is the arousal of the desire in the mind of all migrating beings.

original: de nas gang ba'i gnas skabs ni shes rab la 'khyud ba la sogs pas dpral bar byang chub kyi sems rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir gang ba nyid du 'gyur pa ste gnyis pa mchog dga'o //
analyzed: de nas gang ba'i gnas skabs ni shes rab la 'khyud ba la sogs pas dpral bar byang chub kyi sems rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir gang ba nyid du 'gyur pa ste gnyis pa mchog dga'o //
translated: Then, the state of fullness is the fullness that occurs because the bodhicitta is perfected in the forehead through the embrace of wisdom and so on. The second is the supreme joy.

original: gang ba yan lag mchog las ri bong 'dzin pa khu par byas nas thig le 'dzag pa ni 'khrig pa la 'bar ba'i gnas skabs te gsum pa khyad par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gang ba yan lag mchog las ri bong 'dzin pa khu par byas nas thig le 'dzag pa ni 'khrig pa la 'bar ba'i gnas skabs te gsum pa khyad par dga' bar byed do //
translated: The third, the special joy, is the time of the blazing of passion, when the rabbit-holder, the supreme branch, is filled, and the drop is emitted.

original: de nas ao dda'i gnas skabs ni thig le 'pho ba'i dus su sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi thig le rnams kyi mthar thig le bzhi pa 'byung ba'i dus na lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba byed do //
analyzed: de nas ao dda'i gnas skabs ni thig le 'pho ba'i dus su sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi thig le rnams kyi mthar thig le bzhi pa 'byung ba'i dus na lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba byed do //
translated: Then, at the time of the emission of the drop, the time of the Oḍḍiyāna place, the time of the arising of the fourth drop at the end of the drops of body, speech, and mind, is the innate joy.

original: de ltar tshes gcig la sogs pa'i cha lnga lnga bo nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i rang bzhin dga' ba dang bzang po dang rgyal ba dang stong pa dang rdzogs pa'i ming can aa ai ri au li ka / aa ae aar ao aa
analyzed: de ltar tshes gcig la sogs pa'i cha lnga lnga bo nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i rang bzhin dga' ba dang bzang po dang rgyal ba dang stong pa dang rdzogs pa'i ming can aa ai ri au li ka / aa ae aar ao aa
translated: Thus, the five parts of the first day of the month and so on are of the natures of space, wind, fire, water, and earth, and are called joy, excellence, victory, emptiness, and perfection. They are the vowels A I R U L, A E A R O A, and H Y R W L T.

original: la tsa // ha ya ra wa la ta ces pa'i dbyangs 'di dag gi chos can rnams kyis te de ltar lnga pa ni dga' ba rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: la tsa // ha ya ra wa la ta ces pa'i dbyangs 'di dag gi chos can rnams kyis te de ltar lnga pa ni dga' ba rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The five parts are the perfected joy.

original: bcu pa ni mchog dga' rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa ni mchog dga' rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the completion of supreme joy.

original: nya ni khyad par gyi dga' ba rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: nya ni khyad par gyi dga' ba rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The eleventh is the completion of special joy.🔽The twelfth is the completion of innate joy.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes pa ni cha bcu drug pa ste khams thams cad bsdus pa dang tshogs pa dang 'dus pa dang sngom pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes pa ni cha bcu drug pa ste khams thams cad bsdus pa dang tshogs pa dang 'dus pa dang sngom pa'o //
translated: The joy of innate bliss is the sixteenth part, the gathering of all constituents, the assembly, the union, and the embrace.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi sems kyi chags pa ni dkar po'i phyogs te chags bral ni nag po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi sems kyi chags pa ni dkar po'i phyogs te chags bral ni nag po'i phyogs so //
translated: Thus, the passion of bodhicitta is the bright fortnight, and the dispassion of bodhicitta is the dark fortnight.

original: de bzhin du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, the Bhagavān has said in the Sūtra of the Exalted Praise of the Dharmadhātu:

original: chags bral dang po chags pa che //
analyzed: chags bral dang po chags pa che //
translated: “Dispassion is the first passion,

original: kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od //
translated: the light of blazing various colors,

original: rdo rje rdzogs sangs rgyas pa'i gnas //
analyzed: rdo rje rdzogs sangs rgyas pa'i gnas //
translated: the abode of the perfect vajra buddha.🔽The bearer of the Dharma of the proclaimed buddha”

original: sangs rgyas brjod pa'i chos 'dzin pa zhes pa dang de bzhin du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas brjod pa'i chos 'dzin pa zhes pa dang de bzhin du /
translated: and similarly,

original: rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med //
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med //
translated: “Having all aspects, without aspects,

original: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang //
analyzed: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang //
translated: bearing the drop of the half of the half of the sixteenth,

original: cha med cha las 'das pa po //
analyzed: cha med cha las 'das pa po //
translated: partless, beyond parts,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'chang //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'chang //
translated: bearing the peak of the fourth concentration.”

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the Bhagavān.

original: de ltar don dam pas le'u lnga pa las phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes rgya cher brjod par bya ste des na 'dir @160b rgyas par ma byas so //
analyzed: de ltar don dam pas le'u lnga pa las phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes rgya cher brjod par bya ste des na 'dir @160b rgyas par ma byas so //
translated: Thus, the wisdom of the great seal should be extensively explained in the fifth chapter by means of the ultimate, and therefore it is not done here.

original: da ni 'dod pa zhes pa la sogs pas dga' ba bcu drug po rnams kyi sbyor ba bzhi gsungs pa 'dir sems can thams cad kyi sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i dbye bas sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes
analyzed: da ni 'dod pa zhes pa la sogs pas dga' ba bcu drug po rnams kyi sbyor ba bzhi gsungs pa 'dir sems can thams cad kyi sad pa dang rmi lam dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang bzhi pa'i dbye bas sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes
translated: Now, beginning with “desire,” the four applications of the sixteen joys are stated. Here, the four divisions of the waking, dreaming, deep sleep, and fourth states of all sentient beings are the applications of body, speech, mind, and gnosis.

original: kyi sbyor ba ste de dag kyang dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas bcu drug go //
analyzed: kyi sbyor ba ste de dag kyang dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas bcu drug go //
translated: Those are sixteen by the divisions of joy and so on.

original: de la 'dod pa zhes pa ni sku'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa zhes pa ni sku'i dga' ba'o //
translated: “Desire” is the joy of the body.

original: dga' ba zhes pa ni gsung gi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes pa ni gsung gi dga' ba'o //
translated: “Joy” is the joy of speech.

original: 'dar ba zhes pa ni thugs kyi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'dar ba zhes pa ni thugs kyi dga' ba'o //
translated: “Trembling” is the joy of the mind.

original: 'gyur med ces pa'i ming gis ye shes kyi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur med ces pa'i ming gis ye shes kyi dga' ba'o //
translated: “Unchanging” is the joy of gnosis by name.

original: de ltar bzhi po yis dga' ba'i sbyor ba gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar bzhi po yis dga' ba'i sbyor ba gcig go //
translated: Thus, those four are one application of joy.

original: de bzhin du gang ba zhes pa ni sku'i mchog dga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang ba zhes pa ni sku'i mchog dga'o //
translated: Likewise, “filled” is the supreme joy of the body.

original: 'dir mchog gi dga' ba la sogs pa gsum po rnams mtha' ma dang por byas nas gsung dang thugs dang ye shes rdo rje rnams te sdeb sbyor gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: 'dir mchog gi dga' ba la sogs pa gsum po rnams mtha' ma dang por byas nas gsung dang thugs dang ye shes rdo rje rnams te sdeb sbyor gyi dbang gis so //
translated: Here, the three, the supreme joy and so forth, are made the last first, and are the vajras of speech, mind, and gnosis, respectively, by the power of meter.

original: de'i phyir mchog gi dga' ba ni zhes pa gsung gi mchog dga'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog gi dga' ba ni zhes pa gsung gi mchog dga'o //
translated: Therefore, “supreme joy” is the supreme joy of speech.

original: skye ba zhes pa ni thugs kyi mchog dga'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes pa ni thugs kyi mchog dga'o //
translated: “Arisen” is the supreme joy of mind.

original: nus pa zhes pa ni ye shes kyi mchog dga' ste gnyis pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa zhes pa ni ye shes kyi mchog dga' ste gnyis pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: “Capable” is the supreme joy of gnosis, the second union.

original: 'bar ba zhes pa ni sku'i khyad par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba zhes pa ni sku'i khyad par dga' ba'o //
translated: “Blazing” is the special joy of the body.

original: khyad par dga' ba zhes pa ni gsung gi khyad par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par dga' ba zhes pa ni gsung gi khyad par dga' ba'o //
translated: “Special joy” is the special joy of speech.

original: gnyid yur zhes pa ni thugs kyi khyad par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gnyid yur zhes pa ni thugs kyi khyad par dga' ba'o //
translated: “Drowsiness” is the special joy of mind.

original: thig le zhes pa ni ye shes kyi khyad par dga' ba ste gsum pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: thig le zhes pa ni ye shes kyi khyad par dga' ba ste gsum pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: “Drop” is the special joy of gnosis, the third union.

original: de bzhin du aodda zhes pa ni sku'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du aodda zhes pa ni sku'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Likewise, “odour” is the innate joy of the body.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes pa ni gsung gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes pa ni gsung gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: The “joy of innate bliss” is the innate joy of speech.

original: gnyid ces pa ni thugs kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gnyid ces pa ni thugs kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: “ Sleep” is the innate joy of mind.

original: n'a da zhes pa ni ye shes kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: n'a da zhes pa ni ye shes kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: “ Ecstasy” is the innate joy of gnosis.

original: de bzhin du sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos dang ngo bo nyid kyi dbye bas sku rnam pa bzhi dang de bzhin du gsung rnam pa bzhi dang thugs rnam pa bzhi dang ye shes rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos dang ngo bo nyid kyi dbye bas sku rnam pa bzhi dang de bzhin du gsung rnam pa bzhi dang thugs rnam pa bzhi dang ye shes rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Similarly, there are four kinds of body, divided into emanation body, beatific body, reality body, and essence body; and similarly, there are four kinds of speech, four kinds of mind, and four kinds of gnosis.

original: de bzhin du dga' ba bcu drug gi dbye ba ni 'chad par 'gyur pa las rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dga' ba bcu drug gi dbye ba ni 'chad par 'gyur pa las rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the sixteen joys will be described in detail later.

original: bcu drug gi mthar lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: bcu drug gi mthar lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty is that the innate bliss is at the end of the sixteen.

original: da ni sems kyi zhes pa la sogs pas las kyi phyag rgya'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa 'dir rgyud thams cad las ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams thun mong gis gsungs te rnal 'byor pa rnam rjes su chags pa byed pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: da ni sems kyi zhes pa la sogs pas las kyi phyag rgya'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa 'dir rgyud thams cad las ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams thun mong gis gsungs te rnal 'byor pa rnam rjes su chags pa byed pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Now, “mind” and so on explain the purity of the karma consort. Here, all the tantras teach the consorts such as mother in common, in order to generate passion in the yogī.

original: @161a * // de yang byang chub kyi sems brtan par byas pa rnams kyi yin gyi gzhan rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @161a * // de yang byang chub kyi sems brtan par byas pa rnams kyi yin gyi gzhan rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, this is for those who have stabilized the bodhicitta, not for others.

original: gzhan rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang ldan pa'i bud med gnas skabs kyi dbye bas ma la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang ldan pa'i bud med gnas skabs kyi dbye bas ma la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: For others, the woman is a mother and so on by the division of her condition, in accordance with worldly convention.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa bud med la sems par byed na de'i tshe sems kyi bsam pa byas pas mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa bud med la sems par byed na de'i tshe sems kyi bsam pa byas pas mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, when the yogī thinks of a woman, then by the thought of the mind, she becomes a mother.

original: reg pas ni sring mo'o //
analyzed: reg pas ni sring mo'o //
translated: By touching, she becomes a sister.

original: rdo rje zhugs pas bu mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje zhugs pas bu mor 'gyur ro //
translated: By the vajra entering, she becomes a daughter.

original: byed pa dang bcas shin tu dga' bas sring mo'i bu mo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa dang bcas shin tu dga' bas sring mo'i bu mo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the action with great joy, she becomes the sister’s daughter.

original: thig le lhung bar gyur na chung ma'o //
analyzed: thig le lhung bar gyur na chung ma'o //
translated: If the drop falls, it is a wife.

original: gzhan gyi rigs la gnas pa gtum mo'i rnal 'byor mar ni 'dod chags nyams par gyur pa las te chags bral las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rigs la gnas pa gtum mo'i rnal 'byor mar ni 'dod chags nyams par gyur pa las te chags bral las 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of another family, the yoginī of fierce fire is from the loss of passion, that is, from being free of passion.

original: 'di rnams rnal 'byor phyag rgya drug ste rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams rnal 'byor phyag rgya drug ste rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: These are the six mudras of the yogin, the earth and so forth.

original: 'dir dang por sa'i khams 'khrug go //
analyzed: 'dir dang por sa'i khams 'khrug go //
translated: Here, first the earth element is disturbed.

original: de bzhin du chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams rnams 'khrug ste 'khrug pa rnams 'dzag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams rnams 'khrug ste 'khrug pa rnams 'dzag go //
translated: Similarly, the water, fire, wind, and space elements are disturbed, and the disturbances drip.

original: de'i phyir sa chu bsreg za rlung dang mkha' dang chad pa'i dngos rnams te gnas skabs drug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa chu bsreg za rlung dang mkha' dang chad pa'i dngos rnams te gnas skabs drug go //
translated: Therefore, there are six states: earth, water, fire, wind, space, and cessation.

original: de bzhin du g-yas dang g-yon gyi dkyil 'khor lnga zad pa yang 'pho pa'i dus su rig par bya ste ma la sogs pa rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas dang g-yon gyi dkyil 'khor lnga zad pa yang 'pho pa'i dus su rig par bya ste ma la sogs pa rnam par dag pas so //
translated: Similarly, the exhaustion of the five maṇḍalas of the right and left should be known at the time of the shift, by the purification of mother and so forth.

original: 'khor lo dang rna cha dang mgul rgyan dang lag gdub dang ske rags dang thal ba rnam par dag pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyag rgya rnams te de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par dag pas so zhes pa
analyzed: 'khor lo dang rna cha dang mgul rgyan dang lag gdub dang ske rags dang thal ba rnam par dag pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyag rgya rnams te de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par dag pas so zhes pa
translated: The yogis' seals are the wheel, earrings, necklace, armlets, belt, and ashes, and likewise the six perfections of generosity and so forth, which are pure.

original: ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definitive meaning.

original: da ni chu skyes zhes pa la sogs pas sku la sogs pa'i phyag rgya gsum gsungs te 'dir rgyud thams cad las phyi rol du drang ba'i don gyis dpral bar sku'i phyag rgya dang mgrin par gsung gi phyag rgya dang snying khar thugs kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: da ni chu skyes zhes pa la sogs pas sku la sogs pa'i phyag rgya gsum gsungs te 'dir rgyud thams cad las phyi rol du drang ba'i don gyis dpral bar sku'i phyag rgya dang mgrin par gsung gi phyag rgya dang snying khar thugs kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Now, beginning with lotus, he teaches the three seals of body and so forth. Here, in all tantras, the seal of body is on the forehead, the seal of speech is on the throat, and the seal of mind is on the heart, by the expedient meaning of drawing outward.

original: nges pa'i don gyis kyang chu skyes la ni rdo rje rab zhugs te rdo rje rtag tu langs pa ni sku'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyis kyang chu skyes la ni rdo rje rab zhugs te rdo rje rtag tu langs pa ni sku'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: And by the definitive meaning, the seal of body is the vajra always standing, the vajra fully entering the lotus.

original: rtse mo can la rlung dang zhes pa rtsa dbu ma la srog gi rlung rab tu zhugs pa gsung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rtse mo can la rlung dang zhes pa rtsa dbu ma la srog gi rlung rab tu zhugs pa gsung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The seal of speech is the life-force wind fully entering the central channel, the wind at the tip.

original: thig le mi ltung ba ni thugs kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: thig le mi ltung ba ni thugs kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The bindu that does not fall is the seal of mind.

original: 'di rnams rnal 'byor gsum gyi ste dbu ma la rten pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phyag rgya rnams su grangs bzhin du 'gyur ro //🔽de'i steng du chags dang chags bral mthar @161b gyur dang po zhes pa la chags pa ni dkar po'i phyogs te de'i mthar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams rnal 'byor gsum gyi ste dbu ma la rten pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phyag rgya rnams su grangs bzhin du 'gyur ro // de'i steng du chags dang chags bral mthar @161b gyur dang po zhes pa la chags pa ni dkar po'i phyogs te de'i mthar gyur pa'o //
translated: These are the three yogas. The seals of body, speech, and mind are based on the central nāḍī, respectively.

original: chags bral ni nag po'i phyogs te de'i dang po'o //
analyzed: chags bral ni nag po'i phyogs te de'i dang po'o //
translated: Above that, “the end of passion and the beginning of the absence of passion” means that passion is the bright fortnight, the end of which is the beginning of the dark fortnight.

original: de ltar chags dang chags bral mthar gyur dang po ni cha bcu drug par gnas pa ste ji srid mi 'dzag pa de srid du de ni mtha' dag yon tan gyi gter 'gyur pa med pa'i bde ba sbyin pa po rnal 'byor rnams kyis rtogs bya bzhi pa'o
analyzed: de ltar chags dang chags bral mthar gyur dang po ni cha bcu drug par gnas pa ste ji srid mi 'dzag pa de srid du de ni mtha' dag yon tan gyi gter 'gyur pa med pa'i bde ba sbyin pa po rnal 'byor rnams kyis rtogs bya bzhi pa'o
translated: Thus, the end of passion and the beginning of the absence of passion is the sixteenth phase. As long as there is no emission, that is the fourth that is to be realized by yogins and yoginīs, the unchanging bliss that grants the treasure of all qualities.

original: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yan lag drug gi sbyor ba kho nas rtogs par bya ba ste gzhan rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yan lag drug gi sbyor ba kho nas rtogs par bya ba ste gzhan rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: This is to be realized by yogins and yoginīs through the practice of the six-branched yoga alone, not by others.

original: phyag rgya rnams las te snga ma dang phyi ma dgu po rnams las de ni legs pa'i ma skyed byed mar mngal nas skyes pa'i dus nas brtsams te 'chi ba'i mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya rnams las te snga ma dang phyi ma dgu po rnams las de ni legs pa'i ma skyed byed mar mngal nas skyes pa'i dus nas brtsams te 'chi ba'i mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: From among the nine mudras, the first and last, she is the mother who gives rise to the good, from the time of birth from the womb until the end of death.

original: rnam bcu ni du ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas spyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste dpal ldan bla ma rdo rje sems dpa'i zhal 'di'o zhes pa ni ye shes kyi zhal bzhi pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam bcu ni du ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas spyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste dpal ldan bla ma rdo rje sems dpa'i zhal 'di'o zhes pa ni ye shes kyi zhal bzhi pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The ten aspects are the perfections of generosity and so forth, divided into smoke and so forth. This is the face of glorious Vajrasattva, the guru. This is the meaning of the four faces of wisdom.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i chos can no zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i chos can no zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: She is the one who has the nature of the svabhavikakaya. This is the conclusion.

original: de ltar slob ma dbang bskur ba'i don du phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid rab tu bstan nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i slad du bla mas nges pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar slob ma dbang bskur ba'i don du phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid rab tu bstan nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i slad du bla mas nges pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having fully taught the characteristics of the mudra for the sake of the disciple's empowerment, the guru should give the certainty for the sake of the ganacakra.

original: de la rigs sum cu rtsa drug gi lha mo rnams spyan drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la rigs sum cu rtsa drug gi lha mo rnams spyan drang bar bya ste /
translated: There, the goddesses of the thirty-six families should be invoked.

original: de nas nyin mo'i dus su gzhon nu dang gzhon nu ma bcu la'o thug la sogs pa mngar ba'i zas kyis ston mo byas te yon phul nas gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //🔽de nas chu tshod bdun pa la dge slong dang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun mngar ba'i kha zas sha dang bral ba rnams kyis yang dag par mchod cing sangs rgyas gtso bor byas nas dge 'dun la yon phul te 'phags pa'i dge 'dun chen po gtsug lag khang
analyzed: de nas nyin mo'i dus su gzhon nu dang gzhon nu ma bcu la'o thug la sogs pa mngar ba'i zas kyis ston mo byas te yon phul nas gshegs su gsol bar bya'o // de nas chu tshod bdun pa la dge slong dang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun mngar ba'i kha zas sha dang bral ba rnams kyis yang dag par mchod cing sangs rgyas gtso bor byas nas dge 'dun la yon phul te 'phags pa'i dge 'dun chen po gtsug lag khang
translated: Then, during the day, one should send off the ten young men and young women, having made an offering to them of sweet food such as milk-rice and so on.

original: du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, at the seventh hour, one should worship the community of monks and nuns with sweet food free from meat, having made the Buddha the chief, and having made an offering to the community, one should bring the great community of noble ones into the temple.

original: de nas skye bo dang bral ba'i khyim bug pa med par tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i tshogs dpa' bo dang dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyi gnas rnams bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas skye bo dang bral ba'i khyim bug pa med par tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i tshogs dpa' bo dang dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyi gnas rnams bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, in a house free from people, one should imagine the places of the hosts of heroes and heroines of the gaṇacakra without a door.

original: 'dir 'byor ba dang rjes su mthun pas gtso bo bla ma shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid ni dbus dang phyogs bzhi'i char rnal 'byor ma bzhi rnams te dbus su g-yung mo dang shar du dmangs rigs mo dang lhor rgyal rigs mo dang byang du bram ze
analyzed: 'dir 'byor ba dang rjes su mthun pas gtso bo bla ma shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid ni dbus dang phyogs bzhi'i char rnal 'byor ma bzhi rnams te dbus su g-yung mo dang shar du dmangs rigs mo dang lhor rgyal rigs mo dang byang du bram ze
translated: Here, in accord with the wealth of the world, the principal one is the guru, who is the nature of both wisdom and means, and the four yoginis are in the center and the four directions.

original: mo dang nub tu rje rigs ma ste tshogs kyi gtso bo lnga'i @162a * //🔽bdag nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: mo dang nub tu rje rigs ma ste tshogs kyi gtso bo lnga'i @162a * // bdag nyid kyi'o //
translated: In the center is the outcaste woman, in the east is the untouchable woman, in the south is the warrior woman, in the north is the Brahmin woman,🔽and in the west is the merchant woman.

original: 'di rnams kyi gdan ni mi'i pags pa dang khyi'i pags pa dang rta'i pags pa dang ba lang gi pags pa dang glang po che'i pags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi gdan ni mi'i pags pa dang khyi'i pags pa dang rta'i pags pa dang ba lang gi pags pa dang glang po che'i pags pa'o //
translated: Their seats are human skin, dog skin, horse skin, cow skin, and elephant skin.

original: de nas gnyis pa ni phyogs bral rnams su ste dbang ldan du gci ba'i snod dang rlung du bshang pa'i snod dang bden bral du khrag gi snod dang mer rkang gi snod do //
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa ni phyogs bral rnams su ste dbang ldan du gci ba'i snod dang rlung du bshang pa'i snod dang bden bral du khrag gi snod dang mer rkang gi snod do //
translated: Next, the second group is in the intermediate directions: in the northeast is the urine vessel, in the southeast is the feces vessel, in the southwest is the blood vessel, and in the northwest is the semen vessel.

original: de nas zlum skor gnyis pa thugs kyi 'khor lo'i gnas la shar du 'khar ba mkhan mo dang lhor 'od ma'i gar mkhan mo dang byang du nor bu mkhan ma dang nub tu khron pa mkhan ma dang mer thags mkhan ma dang bden bral du chang 'tshong ma
analyzed: de nas zlum skor gnyis pa thugs kyi 'khor lo'i gnas la shar du 'khar ba mkhan mo dang lhor 'od ma'i gar mkhan mo dang byang du nor bu mkhan ma dang nub tu khron pa mkhan ma dang mer thags mkhan ma dang bden bral du chang 'tshong ma
translated: Then, in the locations of the second circle, the wheel of the mind, are the eight yoginis: in the east is the potter yogini, in the south is the dancer yogini, in the north is the jeweler yogini, in the west is the well digger yogini, in the southeast is the weaver yogini, in the southwest is the barmaid yogini,

original: dang dbang ldan du gser mkhan ma dang rlung du phreng ba mkhan ma ste rnal 'byor ma brgyad do //
analyzed: dang dbang ldan du gser mkhan ma dang rlung du phreng ba mkhan ma ste rnal 'byor ma brgyad do //
translated: in the northeast is the goldsmith yogini, and in the northwest is the garland maker yogini.

original: 'di rnams kyi gdan rnams ni grangs bzhin du lug gi pags pa dang 'brog dgon pa'i khyi'i pags pa dang rnga mo'i pags pa dang 'dam seng gi pags pa dang ra'i pags pa dang ri dags kyi pags pa dang bong bu'i pags pa dang phag gi pags pa
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi gdan rnams ni grangs bzhin du lug gi pags pa dang 'brog dgon pa'i khyi'i pags pa dang rnga mo'i pags pa dang 'dam seng gi pags pa dang ra'i pags pa dang ri dags kyi pags pa dang bong bu'i pags pa dang phag gi pags pa
translated: The seats of these yoginis are, respectively, a sheep skin, a skin of a dog from a remote land, a camel skin, a skin of a swamp crocodile, a skin of a goat, a skin of a deer, a skin of an ass, and a skin of a pig.

original: rnams so // de nas zlum skor gsum pa gsung gi 'khor lo'i gnas la shar du sha 'tshong ma dang mer rdza mkhan ma dang lhor 'khur ba mkhan ma dang bden bral du smad 'tshong ma dang nub tu tshem bu ma dang rlung du nya pa mo dang /
analyzed: rnams so // de nas zlum skor gsum pa gsung gi 'khor lo'i gnas la shar du sha 'tshong ma dang mer rdza mkhan ma dang lhor 'khur ba mkhan ma dang bden bral du smad 'tshong ma dang nub tu tshem bu ma dang rlung du nya pa mo dang /
translated: Then, in the location of the wheel of enlightened speech in the third circle, there is a meat seller in the east, a potter in the south, a baker in the south, a prostitute in the west, a tailor in the north, a fisherman in the northeast, a sweeper in the southeast, a butcher in the southwest, and a hunter in the northwest.🔽

original: byang du gar mkhan ma dang dbang ldan du btso blag mkhan ma ste rnal 'byor ma brgyad do //
analyzed: byang du gar mkhan ma dang dbang ldan du btso blag mkhan ma ste rnal 'byor ma brgyad do //
translated: Then, in the location of the wheel of speech, which is the third circle, there are eight yoginis: in the east, the butcher woman; in the south, the potter woman; in the south, the cook woman; in the southwest, the prostitute; in the west, the tailor woman; in the northwest, the fisherwoman;🔽in the north, the dancer woman; and in the northeast, the washerwoman.

original: 'di rnams kyi gdan rnams ni kum bh'i ra'i pags pa dang 'gron bu'i phung po dang karka ta'i rus pa'i phung po dang / nya skam po dang / ma ka ra'i pags pa dang / sbal pa'i pags pa dang / rus sbal gyi khog pa dang dung rnams grangs bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi gdan rnams ni kum bh'i ra'i pags pa dang 'gron bu'i phung po dang karka ta'i rus pa'i phung po dang / nya skam po dang / ma ka ra'i pags pa dang / sbal pa'i pags pa dang / rus sbal gyi khog pa dang dung rnams grangs bzhin no //
translated: Their seats are, respectively, a skin of kum-bhira, a heap of oysters, a heap of bones of a crab, a dried fish, a skin of a makara, a skin of a frog, a tortoise shell, and a conch.

original: de nas zlum skor bzhi pa sku'i 'khor lo'i gnas la shar du lcags mkhan ma dang / lhor rgya skyegs mkhan ma dang / nub tu srin bal mkhan ma dang ; byang du til mar mkhan ma dang / mer smyug ma mkhan ma dang / bden bral du shing mkhan ma dang /🔽rlung du ko lpags mkhan ma dang / dbang ldan du 'dreg mkhan ma ste brgyad do //
analyzed: de nas zlum skor bzhi pa sku'i 'khor lo'i gnas la shar du lcags mkhan ma dang / lhor rgya skyegs mkhan ma dang / nub tu srin bal mkhan ma dang ; byang du til mar mkhan ma dang / mer smyug ma mkhan ma dang / bden bral du shing mkhan ma dang / rlung du ko lpags mkhan ma dang / dbang ldan du 'dreg mkhan ma ste brgyad do //
translated: Then, in the locations of the body wheel, there are four circles: In the east is the blacksmith, in the south is the lacqueworker, in the west is the cotton-carder, and in the north is the oilwoman.🔽In the southeast is the bamboo-worker, in the southwest is the carpenter, in the northwest is the leatherworker, and in the northeast is the barber.

original: 'di rnams kyi gdan rnams ni bse'i @162b pags pa dang / stag gi pags pa dang / dom gyi pags pa dang / ne'u le'i pags pa dang / 'bri'i pags pa dang / ce spyang gi pags pa dang / sram gyi pags pa dang / byi la'i pags pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi gdan rnams ni bse'i @162b pags pa dang / stag gi pags pa dang / dom gyi pags pa dang / ne'u le'i pags pa dang / 'bri'i pags pa dang / ce spyang gi pags pa dang / sram gyi pags pa dang / byi la'i pags pa rnams so //
translated: Their seats are of iron skin, tiger skin, bear skin, otter skin, fox skin, jackal skin, crocodile skin, and cat skin.

original: de nas zlum skor lnga pa dur khrod kyi gnas la /
analyzed: de nas zlum skor lnga pa dur khrod kyi gnas la /
translated: Then, in the locations of the charnel grounds, there are five circles.

original: shar du kla klo ma dang / lho ru 'phyag pa mo dang / nub tu gtum mo dang / byang du stag gzig ma dang / mer bsnyon thabs ma dang / bden bral du ro sreg ma dang / rlung du bhi ll'i dang dbang ldan du ri khrod ma ste rab gtum ma brgyad do //🔽'di rnams kyi gdan rnams ni go dh'a'i pags pa dang / byi ba'i pags pa dang / s'a la dz'a ta ka'i pags pa dang / spre'u'i pags pa dang / ri bong gi pags pa dang / gzungs mo byi dur gyi pags pa dang / a'i shu ka pa shu'i pags pa dang /
analyzed: shar du kla klo ma dang / lho ru 'phyag pa mo dang / nub tu gtum mo dang / byang du stag gzig ma dang / mer bsnyon thabs ma dang / bden bral du ro sreg ma dang / rlung du bhi ll'i dang dbang ldan du ri khrod ma ste rab gtum ma brgyad do // 'di rnams kyi gdan rnams ni go dh'a'i pags pa dang / byi ba'i pags pa dang / s'a la dz'a ta ka'i pags pa dang / spre'u'i pags pa dang / ri bong gi pags pa dang / gzungs mo byi dur gyi pags pa dang / a'i shu ka pa shu'i pags pa dang /
