translated: In the east is the barbarian woman, in the south is the broom woman, in the west is the fierce woman, in the north is the tiger woman, in the southeast is the woman of deception, in the southwest is the cremation ground woman, in the northwest is the bhillī woman, and in the northeast is the forest woman.🔽Their seats are the skins of a Godāvarī woman, a mouse, a sāla tree, a monkey, a rabbit, a human corpse, an aiśukapaśu,

original: rtsangs pa'i pags pa rnams so ;
analyzed: rtsangs pa'i pags pa rnams so ;
translated: and a lizard.

original: / pags pa 'di rnams med na shar dang mer khyi'i pags pa dang / lho dang bden bral du rta'i pags pa dang / nub dang rlung du glang po'i pags pa dang / byang dang dbang ldan du ba lang gi pags pa ste dbus su mi'i pags pa'o //
analyzed: / pags pa 'di rnams med na shar dang mer khyi'i pags pa dang / lho dang bden bral du rta'i pags pa dang / nub dang rlung du glang po'i pags pa dang / byang dang dbang ldan du ba lang gi pags pa ste dbus su mi'i pags pa'o //
translated: If these skins are not available, then in the east and southeast one should use a dog skin, in the south and southwest a horse skin, in the west and northwest an elephant skin, in the north and northeast an ox skin, and in the center a human skin.

original: de ltar gdan rnams bkod nas rnal 'byor ma rnams bzhugs su gsol bar bya'o //🔽pags pa 'di rnams kyi sder sbyin par bya ste de bzhin du skyogs rnams ni shar du nya phyis kyi snod de me ru yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar gdan rnams bkod nas rnal 'byor ma rnams bzhugs su gsol bar bya'o // pags pa 'di rnams kyi sder sbyin par bya ste de bzhin du skyogs rnams ni shar du nya phyis kyi snod de me ru yang de bzhin no //
translated: Having thus arranged the seats, one should invite the yoginis to sit on them.

original: lho dang bden bral du n'a ri ke la'i skyogs dang nub dang rlung du kham phor dang byang dang dbang ldan du mi'i thod pa dang dbus su shing gi snod do //
analyzed: lho dang bden bral du n'a ri ke la'i skyogs dang nub dang rlung du kham phor dang byang dang dbang ldan du mi'i thod pa dang dbus su shing gi snod do //
translated: One should offer the bowls on these skins: thus, in the east and southeast a shell bowl, in the south and southwest a bowl of narikela, in the west and northwest a human skull, in the north and northeast a wooden bowl, and in the center a clay bowl.

original: de nas chang la sogs pa phul nas bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa sgron ma dang bcas pa 'chang bar 'gyur pa chu dang mchod yon la sogs pa rnam pa bcu po phul te mandala byas nas /
analyzed: de nas chang la sogs pa phul nas bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa sgron ma dang bcas pa 'chang bar 'gyur pa chu dang mchod yon la sogs pa rnam pa bcu po phul te mandala byas nas /
translated: Then, having offered beer and so forth, having offered the ten articles such as water and drinking water, having made a maṇḍala,

original: slob mas las kyi rdo rje can dang lhan cig tu mchod pa'i rdzas dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob mas las kyi rdo rje can dang lhan cig tu mchod pa'i rdzas dbul bar bya'o //
translated: the disciple together with the karma vajra should offer the articles of offering.

original: de ltar na tshogs kyi 'khor lo la gnas dang rigs nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na tshogs kyi 'khor lo la gnas dang rigs nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the gaṇacakra, the place and caste are ascertained.

original: de nas le'u lnga pa las gsungs pa'i tshogs /
analyzed: de nas le'u lnga pa las gsungs pa'i tshogs /
translated: Then, the gaṇacakra is taught in chapter five.

original: kun du spyod pa dang 'khrig pa yang bya'o //🔽kun du spyod pa de la shes rab yum gyi nang nas tshogs kyi gtso mo de ni mchog @163a * //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa dang 'khrig pa yang bya'o // kun du spyod pa de la shes rab yum gyi nang nas tshogs kyi gtso mo de ni mchog @163a * //
translated: One should also perform the conduct and copulation.

original: gi yum zhes pa ste g-yung mo dang gtum mo'o //
analyzed: gi yum zhes pa ste g-yung mo dang gtum mo'o //
translated: In that conduct, the chief of the gaṇas from among the mothers of wisdom is the supreme mother, namely, the ḍākinī and the caṇḍālī.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo la thams cad du gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi spyan ma la sogs pa bzhi'i ni sring mo'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo la thams cad du gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi spyan ma la sogs pa bzhi'i ni sring mo'o //
translated: The four, namely, Buddhalocanā and so forth, of the yoginīs who are everywhere in the gaṇacakra are sisters.

original: sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug dang sngon mo dang drag spyan ma gnyis ni sring mo'i bu mo rnams so //
analyzed: sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug dang sngon mo dang drag spyan ma gnyis ni sring mo'i bu mo rnams so //
translated: The six beginning with Śabdavajrā and the two beginning with Nīlā and Canda are the daughters of the sisters.

original: phyugs kyi skye bo 'jigs ster tsartsi k'a sogs brgyad ni yang tsha mo'o //
analyzed: phyugs kyi skye bo 'jigs ster tsartsi k'a sogs brgyad ni yang tsha mo'o //
translated: The eight beginning with Cāmuṇḍā, the offspring of the cattle, are the granddaughters.

original: 'di rnams ni 'khor lo la gnas pa dus kun tu ni kun tu spyod pas gnas pa rang rigs sa la gnas pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni 'khor lo la gnas pa dus kun tu ni kun tu spyod pas gnas pa rang rigs sa la gnas pa rnams te /
translated: These, abiding in the wheel, are always engaged in conduct, abiding on the stage of their own class.

original: rnal 'byor pa yis bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis bsten par bya'o //
translated: They should be attended to by the yogī.

original: gnas dang zhing dang 'dus pa dang dur khrod de sa bcu gnyis la gnas pa rnams bsten par bya zhing skye bo dang bcas pa grong gi dbus dang tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang phyi rol skye bo med par nam yang dor bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni nges
analyzed: gnas dang zhing dang 'dus pa dang dur khrod de sa bcu gnyis la gnas pa rnams bsten par bya zhing skye bo dang bcas pa grong gi dbus dang tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang phyi rol skye bo med par nam yang dor bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni nges
translated: The place, field, assembly, and charnel ground, abiding on the twelve stages, should be attended to. The center of the village with people, the gaṇacakra, and outside, in the absence of people, should never be abandoned. This is the rule.

original: pa'o // gcer bu gos dang bral zhing skra grol ba lag na gri gug dang thod pa can de rnams thams cad yang dag par rgyu'o //
analyzed: pa'o // gcer bu gos dang bral zhing skra grol ba lag na gri gug dang thod pa can de rnams thams cad yang dag par rgyu'o //
translated: All of them are naked, free of clothing, with loose hair, holding a flaying knife and skull-cup.

original: de bzhin du dpal ldan rdo rje can ni slob dpon te g-yung po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal ldan rdo rje can ni slob dpon te g-yung po'o //
translated: Likewise, the glorious Vajra-holder is the master, the hero.

original: dpal ldan yab de nyid ni gtum po ste /
analyzed: dpal ldan yab de nyid ni gtum po ste /
translated: The glorious Father himself is Caṇḍa,

original: gtso bo nyid kyi phyir dang g-yung mo dang gtum mo'i lhag ma zab dang de dang 'khrig pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid kyi phyir dang g-yung mo dang gtum mo'i lhag ma zab dang de dang 'khrig pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the chief, and because he is the hero and the heroine, and because he copulates with her.

original: de ltar rigs rnam par dag pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rang gi ma la sogs pa dang rigs las skyes pa rang gi sar 'ongs pa rnams dor bar mi bya zhing de la ngo tsha bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rigs rnam par dag pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rang gi ma la sogs pa dang rigs las skyes pa rang gi sar 'ongs pa rnams dor bar mi bya zhing de la ngo tsha bar mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yogins should not reject their own mothers, etc., who are born in their own family, and who have come to their own stage, and they should not be ashamed of them.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis dpal ldan rdo rje can ni dpal ldan yab ste srid gsum skyed mdzad rdo rje sems dpa' bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis dpal ldan rdo rje can ni dpal ldan yab ste srid gsum skyed mdzad rdo rje sems dpa' bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the yoginīs should view the glorious Vajra-holder, the glorious Father, as Caṇḍa, the creator of the three worlds, like Vajrasattva.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ming po ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ming po ste /
translated: All the Buddhas are the brothers,

original: dmangs rigs la sogs pa dang 'phyag pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dmangs rigs la sogs pa dang 'phyag pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: the śūdra and so on, and the servants and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams ni tsha bo ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams ni tsha bo ste /
translated: The eyes and so on are the nephews,🔽and the ears and so on are the nieces.

original: 'khar ba mkhan la sogs pa rnams so //🔽yang tsha rnams ni brgyad de shan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khar ba mkhan la sogs pa rnams so // yang tsha rnams ni brgyad de shan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The blacksmiths and so on.

original: yang tsha'i bu ni lcags mkhan la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang tsha'i bu ni lcags mkhan la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The sons of the sons are the iron workers and so on.

original: skye bo dang bcas pa dang skye bo med par rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: skye bo dang bcas pa dang skye bo med par rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: The yoginīs should not abandon them, whether they are accompanied by people or not.

original: phan tshun sems rnam par dag pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun sems rnam par dag pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the pure mind of each other.🔽In that gaṇacakra, any woman with a moon-like face and eyes like blue lotuses, anointed with the scent of the best perfume,

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo de la bud med zla ba'i bzhin dang autpala mig can mchog gi dri yis rjes su byugs @163b pa gang su dag / bsod nams ngag gi rgyu ru dag pa gsum gyis slob dpon dpa' bo dang bcas pa la rdo rje'i mchod par 'bul
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo de la bud med zla ba'i bzhin dang autpala mig can mchog gi dri yis rjes su byugs @163b pa gang su dag / bsod nams ngag gi rgyu ru dag pa gsum gyis slob dpon dpa' bo dang bcas pa la rdo rje'i mchod par 'bul
translated: who offers the vajra offering to the master and the heroes with the three purities as the cause of merit and speech,

original: byed na // sa gzhi sbyin dang glang po rta dang shing rta du ma'i bu mo rab tu sbyin las bsod nams gang zhig 'gyur pa'i bsod nams de rnams thams cad rnal 'byor ma de la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed na // sa gzhi sbyin dang glang po rta dang shing rta du ma'i bu mo rab tu sbyin las bsod nams gang zhig 'gyur pa'i bsod nams de rnams thams cad rnal 'byor ma de la 'gyur ro //
translated: whatever merit would arise from giving the earth, elephants, horses, chariots, and one's own daughter, all that merit would be hers.

original: mi bdag ces pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi bdag ces pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The “lord of men” is the Tibetan.

original: mkhar gnas zla ba nyi ma'i mtshams su ste mi zad par zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mkhar gnas zla ba nyi ma'i mtshams su ste mi zad par zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The “fortress” is the place of the moon and sun, which means “imperishable.”

original: da ni sgrol ma zhes pa la sogs pas dmangs rigs la sogs pa'i rigs rnams sgrol ma la sogs pa'i rigs rnams su gsungs te ;
analyzed: da ni sgrol ma zhes pa la sogs pas dmangs rigs la sogs pa'i rigs rnams sgrol ma la sogs pa'i rigs rnams su gsungs te ;
translated: Now, beginning with “Tārā,” etc., the castes such as the śūdra are said to be the castes such as Tārā.

original: mi'i 'jig rten 'dir las kyi rjes su mthun pas rigs so //
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten 'dir las kyi rjes su mthun pas rigs so //
translated: In this world of men, the castes are in accordance with one’s karma.

original: de la dmangs rigs rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la dmangs rigs rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of śūdra:

original: sa gzhi rmo ba dang ba lang skyong ba dang 'jim pa'i las byed pa dang khyim la sogs pa'i gnas byed pa ste /
analyzed: sa gzhi rmo ba dang ba lang skyong ba dang 'jim pa'i las byed pa dang khyim la sogs pa'i gnas byed pa ste /
translated: those who plow the earth, those who tend cattle, those who do work with clay, and those who do work with houses, etc.

original: de ltar na sgrol ma dmangs mo rnam pa bzhi rus yi steng du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de ltar na sgrol ma dmangs mo rnam pa bzhi rus yi steng du 'gyur ro ;
translated: Thus, Tārā is the four types of śūdra.

original: / gos dkar mo ni rgyal rigs rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: / gos dkar mo ni rgyal rigs rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Pāṇḍarā is the four types of kṣatriya:

original: rgyal rigs kyi chos kyis rkang thang dang rta la zhon pa dang glang po che la zhon pa dang shing rta la zhon pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi chos kyis rkang thang dang rta la zhon pa dang glang po che la zhon pa dang shing rta la zhon pa'o //
translated: the kṣatriya who goes on foot, the kṣatriya who rides a horse, the kṣatriya who rides an elephant, and the kṣatriya who rides a chariot.

original: sa ste spyan ma ni rje rigs ma rnams te rje rigs kyi chos las rnam pa gsum ni tshong pa dang yig mkhan dang sman pa'o //
analyzed: sa ste spyan ma ni rje rigs ma rnams te rje rigs kyi chos las rnam pa gsum ni tshong pa dang yig mkhan dang sman pa'o //
translated: Earth is Locanā, the kṣatriya women. The three occupations of the kṣatriya are merchant, scribe, and physician.

original: m'a ma k'i ni gnyis skyes skye bo'i rigs skyes bram ze mo ste /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i ni gnyis skyes skye bo'i rigs skyes bram ze mo ste /
translated: Māmakī is the brahmin woman born of the mixed caste of a vaiśya and a kṣatriya.

original: gnyis skyes kyi chos las rnam pa bdun ni nges brjod kyi yal ga dang mchod sbyin gyi yal ga dang snyan ngag gi yal ga dang srid srung gi yal ga dang nags na rab tu gnas pa'i chung ma dang bdag po'i chung ma dang grol ba'i chung ma
analyzed: gnyis skyes kyi chos las rnam pa bdun ni nges brjod kyi yal ga dang mchod sbyin gyi yal ga dang snyan ngag gi yal ga dang srid srung gi yal ga dang nags na rab tu gnas pa'i chung ma dang bdag po'i chung ma dang grol ba'i chung ma
translated: The seven occupations of the mixed caste are the branches of grammar, the branches of sacrifice, the branches of poetry, the branches of logic, the wife of one who lives in the forest, the wife of the master, and the wife of the liberated one.

original: ste rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: ste rnam pa bdun no //
translated: These are the seven.

original: de bzhin du sgra rdo rje ma ni 'khar ba mkhan ma dang / ro rdo rje ma ni chang 'tshong ma dang / gzugs rdo rje ma ni gser mkhan ma dang / dri rdo rje ma ni phreng ba mkhan ma dang / reg bya rdo rje ma ni thags mkhan ma dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra rdo rje ma ni 'khar ba mkhan ma dang / ro rdo rje ma ni chang 'tshong ma dang / gzugs rdo rje ma ni gser mkhan ma dang / dri rdo rje ma ni phreng ba mkhan ma dang / reg bya rdo rje ma ni thags mkhan ma dang /
translated: Similarly, sound-vajra is the woman bell-metal worker, taste-vajra is the woman brewer, form-vajra is the woman goldsmith, smell-vajra is the woman garland maker, touch-vajra is the woman weaver,

original: chos kyi khams kyi rdo rje ma ni nor bu mkhan ma dang / drag spyan ma ni khron pa mkhan ma dang / shin tu sngon mo ni 'od ma'i gar mkhan ma ste /
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi rdo rje ma ni nor bu mkhan ma dang / drag spyan ma ni khron pa mkhan ma dang / shin tu sngon mo ni 'od ma'i gar mkhan ma ste /
translated: The Vajra Lady of the Element of Mental Objects is the prostitute, the Lady of Fierce Eyes is the well-digger, and the Very Blue Lady is the bamboo dancer.

original: g-yung mo'i gar mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: g-yung mo'i gar mkhan ma'o //
translated: The Bamboo Dancer is the procuress.

original: de bzhin du ts'a mund'a ni sha 'tshong ma dang / khyab 'jug ma ni rdza mkhan ma dang / phag mo ni 'khur ba mkhan ma dang / gzhon nu @164a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du ts'a mund'a ni sha 'tshong ma dang / khyab 'jug ma ni rdza mkhan ma dang / phag mo ni 'khur ba mkhan ma dang / gzhon nu @164a * //
translated: Similarly, the Chamundi Lady is the butcher, the Vishnu Lady is the potter, the Pig Lady is the baker, the Maiden Lady is the prostitute, the Power Lady is the tailor, the Brahma Lady is the fisherman, the Fierce Lady is the dancer, and the Glory Lady is the washerwoman.

original: ma ni smad 'tshong ma dang / dbang mo ni tshem bu ma dang / tshangs ma ni nya pa ma dang / drag mo ni gar mkhan ma dang / dpal mo ni btso blag mkhan ma ste brgyad do //
analyzed: ma ni smad 'tshong ma dang / dbang mo ni tshem bu ma dang / tshangs ma ni nya pa ma dang / drag mo ni gar mkhan ma dang / dpal mo ni btso blag mkhan ma ste brgyad do //
translated: These are the eight.

original: de bzhin du rmugs byed ma ni rgya skyegs mkhan ma dang / rengs byed ma ni srin bal mkhan ma dang / khengs ma ni til mar mkhan ma dang / shin tu stobs ma ni lcags mkhan ma dang / 'od zer can ni ko lpags mkhan ma dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rmugs byed ma ni rgya skyegs mkhan ma dang / rengs byed ma ni srin bal mkhan ma dang / khengs ma ni til mar mkhan ma dang / shin tu stobs ma ni lcags mkhan ma dang / 'od zer can ni ko lpags mkhan ma dang /
translated: Similarly, the Bewilderment Lady is the lac dye woman, the Paralysis Lady is the cotton-carder, the Arrogance Lady is the oil-woman, the Very Powerful Lady is the iron-smith, the Marici Lady is the leather-worker, the Very Fierce Lady is the garland-maker, the Very Joyful Lady is the barber, and the Very Joyful Lady is the prostitute.

original: khro gnyer can ni shing mkhan ma dang / tsun d'a ni 'dregs mkhan ma dang / rdo rje lcags sgrog ma ni smyug ma mkhan ma ste brgyad ni khro bo'i rigs can rnams so //
analyzed: khro gnyer can ni shing mkhan ma dang / tsun d'a ni 'dregs mkhan ma dang / rdo rje lcags sgrog ma ni smyug ma mkhan ma ste brgyad ni khro bo'i rigs can rnams so //
translated: The angry one is the woodcutter woman, the haughty one is the weaver woman, and the vajra chain woman is the bamboo worker woman. These eight are of the class of wrathful ones.

original: khyi gdong ma ni kla klo ma dang / phag gdong ma ni 'phyag pa mo dang / ce spyang gdong ma ni gtum mo dang / stag gdong ma ni stag gzig ma dang / bya rog gdong ma ni bsnyon thabs ma dang / bya rgod gdong ma ni ro sreg ma dang /
analyzed: khyi gdong ma ni kla klo ma dang / phag gdong ma ni 'phyag pa mo dang / ce spyang gdong ma ni gtum mo dang / stag gdong ma ni stag gzig ma dang / bya rog gdong ma ni bsnyon thabs ma dang / bya rgod gdong ma ni ro sreg ma dang /
translated: The dog-faced one is the barbarian woman, the pig-faced one is the sweeper woman, the jackal-faced one is the fierce one, the tiger-faced one is the tigress woman, the crow-faced one is the slanderer woman, the vulture-faced one is the cremation ground woman,

original: mkha' lding gdong ma ni bhi ll'i dang / 'ug gdong ma ni ri khrod ma ste brgyad ni rab gtum ma'o //
analyzed: mkha' lding gdong ma ni bhi ll'i dang / 'ug gdong ma ni ri khrod ma ste brgyad ni rab gtum ma'o //
translated: the garuḍa-faced one is the bhillī woman, and the owl-faced one is the mountain hermit woman. These eight are of the class of fierce ones.

original: de ltar na sum cu rtsa drug rigs kyi dbye bas sa gzhi'i gnas su rnal 'byor rnams dag gi rigs rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar na sum cu rtsa drug rigs kyi dbye bas sa gzhi'i gnas su rnal 'byor rnams dag gi rigs rnams te /
translated: Thus, by the division of the thirty-six classes, the yoginīs are the classes of the places on the ground.

original: zhing dang gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dang yul dang grong mchog dpal ldan nags su yang dag gnas rnams kyis //
analyzed: zhing dang gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dang yul dang grong mchog dpal ldan nags su yang dag gnas rnams kyis //
translated: The fields, abodes, and nearby abodes, the countries, and the supreme villages are the places of the glorious forest.

original: rmongs pa rnams ni 'ching bar byed cing rab mchog sa yi steng du rnal 'byor rnams la dngos grub ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa rnams ni 'ching bar byed cing rab mchog sa yi steng du rnal 'byor rnams la dngos grub ste zhes pa'o //
translated: They bind the ignorant, and for the yogis they are powers on the excellent earth.

original: slar yang 'di rnams kyi dbye ba ni bzhi ni dmangs rigs mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang 'di rnams kyi dbye ba ni bzhi ni dmangs rigs mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: Again, their division is fourfold: the four are the low-caste woman, etc.

original: drug ni sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: drug ni sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six are Sabdavajrā, etc.

original: de bzhin brgyad ni tsartsi k'a la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin brgyad ni tsartsi k'a la sogs pa'o //
translated: The eight are Caṇḍālī, etc.

original: bcu ni khro bo'i dbye ba rnams te /
analyzed: bcu ni khro bo'i dbye ba rnams te /
translated: The ten are the divisions of the wrathful ones.

original: de dag las gnyis ni sgra la sogs pa rnams la rab tu zhugs so //
analyzed: de dag las gnyis ni sgra la sogs pa rnams la rab tu zhugs so //
translated: Of those, two are engaged in sound, etc.

original: nor ni brgyad kyi dbye ba ste /
analyzed: nor ni brgyad kyi dbye ba ste /
translated: The eight are the divisions of the wealth.

original: khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: They are Śvānavaktrā, etc.

original: de bzhin du bzhi ni sangs rgyas kyi dbye ba rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzhi ni sangs rgyas kyi dbye ba rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the four are the divisions of the buddhas.

original: drug ni byang chub sems dpa'i rab tu dbye ba rnams so //
analyzed: drug ni byang chub sems dpa'i rab tu dbye ba rnams so //
translated: The six are the divisions of the bodhisattvas.

original: yi dags rnams ni brgyad kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: yi dags rnams ni brgyad kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: The eight are the divisions of the pretas.

original: khro bo rnams ni bcu'o //
analyzed: khro bo rnams ni bcu'o //
translated: The ten are the wrathful ones.

original: lha min rnams ni brgyad kyi dbye ba ste /
analyzed: lha min rnams ni brgyad kyi dbye ba ste /
translated: The eight are the divisions of the asuras.

original: gdengs can srid par gnas rnams zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi @164b dbye ba sum cu rtsa drug ste rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya'o //🔽gcig pu gcig ni sna tshogs gtso bo ste /
analyzed: gdengs can srid par gnas rnams zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi @164b dbye ba sum cu rtsa drug ste rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya'o // gcig pu gcig ni sna tshogs gtso bo ste /
translated: The “serpents dwelling in existence” are the thirty-six divisions of the yogins, which are to be known by the yogin.

original: srid gsum gnas su dpal ldan rigs rnams dag gi khyab byed de sum cu rtsa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: srid gsum gnas su dpal ldan rigs rnams dag gi khyab byed de sum cu rtsa bdun pa'o //
translated: The “one, the sole lord of the various” is the thirty-seventh, the pervader of the families of the glorious ones in the abodes of the three worlds.

original: de bzhin du sa 'og rnams su gtum mo brgyad de khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa 'og rnams su gtum mo brgyad de khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Similarly, in the underworld there are the eight fierce ones, beginning with the dog-faced one.

original: mi yi 'jig rten phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor la ni khro skyes rnams so //
analyzed: mi yi 'jig rten phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor la ni khro skyes rnams so //
translated: In the human world, in the maṇḍalas of the ten directions, there are the wrathful ones.

original: yi dags zhes bya brgyad ni yi dags 'jig rten du ste /
analyzed: yi dags zhes bya brgyad ni yi dags 'jig rten du ste /
translated: In the world of the pretas, there are the eight called “pretas.”

original: lhag mchog gnas su sgra yi rdo rje la sogs drug ces pa ni 'dod pa spyod pa drug go //
analyzed: lhag mchog gnas su sgra yi rdo rje la sogs drug ces pa ni 'dod pa spyod pa drug go //
translated: In the abode of the supreme gods, there are the six beginning with Śabdavajrā, who are the six gods of desire.

original: tshangs pa'i yul sar dpal ldan bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i yul sar dpal ldan bzhi ste /
translated: In the realm of Brahmā, there are the four glorious ones.

original: tshangs ris la sogs pa'i gzugs can zad par sa la sogs pa bsgoms pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshangs ris la sogs pa'i gzugs can zad par sa la sogs pa bsgoms pa rnams so //
translated: They are the Brahmakāyikas and so forth, who meditate on the totality of form and so forth.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni stong pa'i khams so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni stong pa'i khams so //
translated: The formless [absorptions] are the element of space.

original: rab mchog zhi ba'i grong du yum gcig ma ni ye shes kyi khams te /
analyzed: rab mchog zhi ba'i grong du yum gcig ma ni ye shes kyi khams te /
translated: The mother of the city of supreme peace is the element of consciousness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'o //
translated: She is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di rnams rab tu khros pa'i zhal rnams kyis sna tshogs te /
analyzed: 'di rnams rab tu khros pa'i zhal rnams kyis sna tshogs te /
translated: These [consorts] with various wrathful faces protect with the bodies of those who are delighted.

original: lus yang dag sdud byed dgyes pa rnams kyis ni skyong bar byed pa nyid do zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma'i rigs nges pa'o //
analyzed: lus yang dag sdud byed dgyes pa rnams kyis ni skyong bar byed pa nyid do zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma'i rigs nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the yoginī family.

original: da ni bu mo zhes pa la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub kyi don du rdo rje mchod pa'i nges pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bu mo zhes pa la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub kyi don du rdo rje mchod pa'i nges pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to attain the spiritual power of the karma consort for the yogī, [the Bhagavān] declares the ascertainment of the vajra worship with “girl” and so forth.

original: 'dir dben par tshogs kyi 'khor lo'am skye bo med par bsgom pa'i dus su bu mo rgan mo dar ma rnams sam /
analyzed: 'dir dben par tshogs kyi 'khor lo'am skye bo med par bsgom pa'i dus su bu mo rgan mo dar ma rnams sam /
translated: Here, in a secluded place, in the gaṇacakra or at a time of meditation without people, one should worship with a girl, an old woman, a young woman,

original: lus ni dri ma dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: lus ni dri ma dang bcas pa'am /
translated: a body with impurities,

original: bram ze mo'am /
analyzed: bram ze mo'am /
translated: a brahmin woman,

original: rgyal rigs mo'am /
analyzed: rgyal rigs mo'am /
translated: a kṣatriya woman,🔽a vaiśya woman,

original: rje mo'am / dmangs me'am ;🔽mthar skyes ma'am /
analyzed: rje mo'am / dmangs me'am ;🔽mthar skyes ma'am /
translated: or a śūdra woman.

original: mig dang lag pa dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: mig dang lag pa dang bral ba'am /
translated: Those who are without eyes, hands,

original: rna ba chad pa'am /
analyzed: rna ba chad pa'am /
translated: or who are deaf,

original: sna chad pa'am /
analyzed: sna chad pa'am /
translated: or who are without noses,

original: mchu chad pa'am zhes pa la sogs pa yan lag ma tshad ba rnams te /
analyzed: mchu chad pa'am zhes pa la sogs pa yan lag ma tshad ba rnams te /
translated: or who are without lips, and so forth, are those who are incomplete in their limbs.

original: mtha' dag ni byang chub rgyu ru mchog gi snying rjes shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyis bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: mtha' dag ni byang chub rgyu ru mchog gi snying rjes shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyis bsten par bya ste /
translated: All of them should be attended by the yoga of compassion, which is the nature of wisdom and means, as the cause of enlightenment.

original: slob dpon nam rnal 'byor pa dri ma dag dang rnam par bral te khengs pa la sogs pa'i skyon las grol zhing byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas pa chags pa dang phyi rol dang khyim gyi 'ching ba thams cad las grol ba rnams kyis so zhes pa🔽ni bcom ldan 'das @165a * //
analyzed: slob dpon nam rnal 'byor pa dri ma dag dang rnam par bral te khengs pa la sogs pa'i skyon las grol zhing byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas pa chags pa dang phyi rol dang khyim gyi 'ching ba thams cad las grol ba rnams kyis so zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das @165a * //
translated: The master or yogin, who is completely free from stains, liberated from the faults of pride and so forth, who is engaged in the conduct of enlightenment, and who is free from all attachments, external and internal bonds,🔽is the one who is

original: kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: kyi nges pa'o //
translated: the Bhagavān’s certainty.🔽Now, beginning with “first,” the four mudras are mentioned in the vajra

original: da ni dang por zhes pa la sogs pas rdo rje'i mchod pa la phyag rgya bzhi'i ming gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dang por zhes pa la sogs pas rdo rje'i mchod pa la phyag rgya bzhi'i ming gsungs te /
translated: worship.

original: 'dir dam tshig 'dus pa la ming rnam pa bzhi ni dang por shes rab bud med gang yin pa de ni gsang ba'i phyag rgyar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir dam tshig 'dus pa la ming rnam pa bzhi ni dang por shes rab bud med gang yin pa de ni gsang ba'i phyag rgyar brjod do //
translated: Here, in the Samajacaitya, the four kinds of names are as follows: First, the wisdom woman is called the secret seal.

original: dam tshig dpal ldan skyes pa ste rnal 'byor pa thabs ni mchog gi phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam tshig dpal ldan skyes pa ste rnal 'byor pa thabs ni mchog gi phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: The glorious man is the pledge, and the yogi's method is the supreme seal.

original: de dag 'dus pa'i rtsed mo la tsumba na la sogs pa ni las kyi phyag rgya zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa'i rtsed mo la tsumba na la sogs pa ni las kyi phyag rgya zhes brjod do //
translated: Their play of union, such as the cumbana kiss, and so on, is called the action seal.

original: dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba'i bde mnyam chos kyi phyag rgyar brjod de dam tshig gi skad rnam pa bzhi po 'di ni rdo rje'i mchod pa la gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba'i bde mnyam chos kyi phyag rgyar brjod de dam tshig gi skad rnam pa bzhi po 'di ni rdo rje'i mchod pa la gsungs so //
translated: The bliss of the union of the two organs is called the reality seal. These four kinds of pledge words are taught in the Vajra Offering.

original: da ni pho nya mo rnams zhes pa la sogs pas pho nya mo rnams kyi lus sam skye gnas la dri'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni pho nya mo rnams zhes pa la sogs pas pho nya mo rnams kyi lus sam skye gnas la dri'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in the verse beginning the messengers, the characteristics of the five smells in the bodies or wombs of the messengers are taught.

original: 'dir pho nya mo rnams dag gi dri lnga lus la gnas pa'am padma gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir pho nya mo rnams dag gi dri lnga lus la gnas pa'am padma gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the five smells of the messengers abide in the body or in the lotus.

original: de bzhin du de rnams kyi rigs rnam pa lnga ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de rnams kyi rigs rnam pa lnga ru 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, their types become fivefold.

original: de la rang bzhin ni nam mkha' la sogs pa ste de'i yon tan gyi dbang gis gla rtsi'i dri dang padma'i dri dang gci ba'i dri dang nya'i dri dang rang gi dri'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni nam mkha' la sogs pa ste de'i yon tan gyi dbang gis gla rtsi'i dri dang padma'i dri dang gci ba'i dri dang nya'i dri dang rang gi dri'o //
translated: The natures are space, etc. , and their qualities are the odors of musk, lotus, urine, fish, and one's own body.

original: grangs bzhin du dpal ldan bzang mo dang padma can ma dang dung can ma dang sna tshogs ma dang glang chen ma ste 'di rnams gla rtsi la sogs pa'i drir rim pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grangs bzhin du dpal ldan bzang mo dang padma can ma dang dung can ma dang sna tshogs ma dang glang chen ma ste 'di rnams gla rtsi la sogs pa'i drir rim pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: In order, they are the glorious good, the lotus lady, the conch lady, the variegated lady, and the elephant lady. These are the odors of musk, etc.

original: dpal ldan zhes pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ste /
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ste /
translated: The glorious one is Vajradhatviśvarī,

original: dpal ldan shin tu bzang mo'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan shin tu bzang mo'o //
translated: the glorious very good one.

original: sgrol ma ni padma can ma dang / gos dkar mo ni dung can ma dang / m'a ma k'i ni sna tshogs ma dang spyan ma ni glang chen ma'o //
analyzed: sgrol ma ni padma can ma dang / gos dkar mo ni dung can ma dang / m'a ma k'i ni sna tshogs ma dang spyan ma ni glang chen ma'o //
translated: Tārā is the lotus lady, Pāṇḍarā is the conch lady, Māmakī is the variegated lady, and Locanā is the elephant lady.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Similarly, the yogīśvaras are also fivefold,

original: seng ge dang ri dags dang rta dang khyu mchog dang glang po che ste rigs kyi dbye ba las so //
analyzed: seng ge dang ri dags dang rta dang khyu mchog dang glang po che ste rigs kyi dbye ba las so //
translated: the lion, the deer, the horse, the bull, and the elephant, by the division of the families.

original: mi bskyod pa ni nges ge dang don yod grub pa ni ri dags dang rin chen 'byung ldan ni rta dang snang ba mtha' yas ni khyu mchog dang rnam par snang mdzad ni glang po che'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ni nges ge dang don yod grub pa ni ri dags dang rin chen 'byung ldan ni rta dang snang ba mtha' yas ni khyu mchog dang rnam par snang mdzad ni glang po che'o //
translated: Akshobhya is the antelope, Ratnasambhava is the horse, Amitabha is the bull, and Vairochana is the elephant.

original: de'i phyir snga ma bzhin du dri'i nges pa dang rigs kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma bzhin du dri'i nges pa dang rigs kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, as before, there is the determination of smell and the determination of family.

original: da ni yan lag phra zhes pa la sogs pas lus kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni yan lag phra zhes pa la sogs pas lus kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Now, beginning with “the subtle limbs,” he teaches the characteristics of the body.

original: 'dir shin tu bzang mo ni yan lag phra ldan skra rnams phra zhing rkang lag 'jam la sems can la mnyes gshin @165b zhes pa ste rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: 'dir shin tu bzang mo ni yan lag phra ldan skra rnams phra zhing rkang lag 'jam la sems can la mnyes gshin @165b zhes pa ste rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: Here, “very good” is one with subtle limbs, with fine hair, soft hands and feet, and kind to sentient beings, that is, Vajradhatviśvarī.

original: de bzhin cung zad phra ba dang ldan la cung zad ring zhing mig ni g-yo ba med la skra ni 'khyog pa padma can zhes pa ste sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin cung zad phra ba dang ldan la cung zad ring zhing mig ni g-yo ba med la skra ni 'khyog pa padma can zhes pa ste sgrol ma'o //
translated: Similarly, “slightly subtle” is slightly tall, with unmoving eyes and curly hair, that is, Tārā.

original: de bzhin du ngo tsha med cing 'dod pa drag la rtsod mang la dga' skra ni shin tu chung bdud can ma zhes pa ste gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngo tsha med cing 'dod pa drag la rtsod mang la dga' skra ni shin tu chung bdud can ma zhes pa ste gos dkar mo'o //
translated: Likewise, one who is shameless, with strong desire, fond of much quarreling, and with very short hair is called “the one with the nature of a demoness,” that is, Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: ring zhing yan lag thams cad rdzogs la nges par yang ba'i yul dang skra ni ring ba sna tshogs ma zhes pa ste m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: ring zhing yan lag thams cad rdzogs la nges par yang ba'i yul dang skra ni ring ba sna tshogs ma zhes pa ste m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: One who is tall, with all limbs complete, and with long hair is called “the one with the nature of a variety,” that is, Māmakī.

original: de bzhin du sbom zhing thung la yan lag brtan ldan shing tu sra ba'i yul dang skra ni sbom pa glang chen ma zhes pa ste spyan ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbom zhing thung la yan lag brtan ldan shing tu sra ba'i yul dang skra ni sbom pa glang chen ma zhes pa ste spyan ma'o //
translated: Likewise, one who is stout, short, with firm limbs, and with stout hair is called “the one with the nature of an elephant,” that is, Lochanā.

original: de ltar pho nya ma rnams dag pa'i rigs ni 'ga' zhig dag tu 'dir 'gyur dus kun du ni 'dres pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar pho nya ma rnams dag pa'i rigs ni 'ga' zhig dag tu 'dir 'gyur dus kun du ni 'dres pa'i rigs so //
translated: Thus, the messengers are of some pure type here, but in all cases they are of mixed type.

original: pho nya mo sum cu rtsa drug gi rigs nges pa'o //
analyzed: pho nya mo sum cu rtsa drug gi rigs nges pa'o //
translated: The types of the thirty-six messengers are ascertained.

original: da ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: Now, the characteristics of the yogins are stated.

original: seng ge dag kyang 'brog na gnas shing yul dang rnam bral 'jigs pa med la gtong ba'i dang tshul can zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge dag kyang 'brog na gnas shing yul dang rnam bral 'jigs pa med la gtong ba'i dang tshul can zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The lion also lives in the forest, free from attachment, fearless, and of the nature of generosity.

original: ri dags mgyogs 'gro dang ldan 'gyur byed yang ba'i yul dang skrag pa'i sems te shin tu 'jigs pa'o zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: ri dags mgyogs 'gro dang ldan 'gyur byed yang ba'i yul dang skrag pa'i sems te shin tu 'jigs pa'o zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The deer is endowed with speed, movement, lightness, and a frightened mind, and is very fearful.

original: rta ni nges par 'dod la sred par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rta ni nges par 'dod la sred par 'gyur te /
translated: The horse is certainly attached to desire,

original: gzhan dbang gci ba'i dri dang gzhan don gnyer ba'o zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: gzhan dbang gci ba'i dri dang gzhan don gnyer ba'o zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: and is under the control of others, seeking the smell of urine and the welfare of others.

original: khyu mchog rengs pa'i mig dang dman par 'gro ldan rang bzhin yon tan blun po nya yi dri ru 'gyur zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: khyu mchog rengs pa'i mig dang dman par 'gro ldan rang bzhin yon tan blun po nya yi dri ru 'gyur zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The bull has eyes of paralysis, moves slowly, is naturally dull, and has the smell of fish.

original: glang chen 'dod ldan nges par dal bar 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: glang chen 'dod ldan nges par dal bar 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: The elephant is certainly slow-moving out of desire,

original: rang gi dri dang shin tu rmongs pa'o zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: rang gi dri dang shin tu rmongs pa'o zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: and has its own smell and is very confused.

original: de ltar 'ga' zhig tu rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dag pa'i rigs te thams cad du ni 'dres pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar 'ga' zhig tu rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dag pa'i rigs te thams cad du ni 'dres pa'i rigs so //
translated: Thus, in some cases, the yoginīs are of the pure type, but in all cases they are of the mixed type.

original: de ltar sum cu rtsa drug dbye bas phye ba sa yi steng gi gnas su rigs kyi dri yi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ltar sum cu rtsa drug dbye bas phye ba sa yi steng gi gnas su rigs kyi dri yi rang bzhin te /
translated: Thus, divided into thirty-six types, the yoginīs are of the nature of the smell type on the surface of the earth.

original: phan tshun 'dres pa las skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dres pa las skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: They are born from mutual mixing.

original: de'i phyir pho nya mo de rnams mchod pa'i don du 'dod pa'i bstan bcos yon tan mang po'i gnas ni rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya'o //🔽gang las ci'i phyir zhe na shin tu chags par 'gyur pas tshim pa med na rnal 'byor ma rnams rnal 'byor pa @166a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir pho nya mo de rnams mchod pa'i don du 'dod pa'i bstan bcos yon tan mang po'i gnas ni rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya'o // gang las ci'i phyir zhe na shin tu chags par 'gyur pas tshim pa med na rnal 'byor ma rnams rnal 'byor pa @166a * //
translated: Therefore, the yogin should know the treatise on desire, the abode of many qualities, for the sake of worshipping those yoginīs.

original: la dngos grub ster bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la dngos grub ster bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If, from what and why, one becomes very attached and is not satisfied, the yoginīs will not bestow spiritual power on the yogin.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi don du 'dod pa'i bstan bcos shes par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi don du 'dod pa'i bstan bcos shes par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should know the treatise on desire for the sake of mundane spiritual power. This is the determination.

original: da ni bzang mo zhes pa la sogs pas pho nya mo rnams kyi chos kyi khams la sogs pa'i rigs gsungs te 'dir bzang mo ni chos kyi khams ma'o //
analyzed: da ni bzang mo zhes pa la sogs pas pho nya mo rnams kyi chos kyi khams la sogs pa'i rigs gsungs te 'dir bzang mo ni chos kyi khams ma'o //
translated: Now, the good woman, etc., declares the types of the messenger women, such as the element of qualities, and so on. Here, the good woman is the element of qualities.

original: lha mo ni sgra rdo rje ma dang / sha za mo ni dri rdo rje ma dang / mi mo ni gzugs rdo rje ma dang srin mo ni ro rdo rje ma dang klu mo ni reg bya rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: lha mo ni sgra rdo rje ma dang / sha za mo ni dri rdo rje ma dang / mi mo ni gzugs rdo rje ma dang srin mo ni ro rdo rje ma dang klu mo ni reg bya rdo rje ma'o //
translated: The goddess is the sound-vajra woman, the flesh-eater is the smell-vajra woman, the human woman is the form-vajra woman, the demoness is the taste-vajra woman, and the naga woman is the touch-vajra woman.

original: de la bzang mo sems can phan pa byed ma brtul zhugs nges pa la dga' sdom dang bsam gtan dang tshul can /
analyzed: de la bzang mo sems can phan pa byed ma brtul zhugs nges pa la dga' sdom dang bsam gtan dang tshul can /
translated: The good woman is a benefactor of beings, delights in the certainty of spiritual deportment, and is endowed with vows and meditation.

original: lha mo longs spyod la ni rjes chags 'gyur te dri ma ldan zhing lhag ma la chags sha za mo //
analyzed: lha mo longs spyod la ni rjes chags 'gyur te dri ma ldan zhing lhag ma la chags sha za mo //
translated: The goddess is attached to enjoyment, is defiled, and is attached to the remainder. The flesh-eater is attached to sex.

original: mi mo 'dod la rjes su chags ma srin mo mi yi khrag la dga' zhing gsod pa'i sems ma ste /
analyzed: mi mo 'dod la rjes su chags ma srin mo mi yi khrag la dga' zhing gsod pa'i sems ma ste /
translated: The human woman is attached to desire. The demoness delights in human blood and has a murderous mind.

original: klu mo dag kyang 'o ma'i zas can rab mchog sa yi steng du rnal 'byor pa yis mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: klu mo dag kyang 'o ma'i zas can rab mchog sa yi steng du rnal 'byor pa yis mchod par bya ste /
translated: The naga woman is also a milk-eater. The supreme one on the surface of the earth should be worshipped by the yogi.

original: thams cad du gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rnams su'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rnams su'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Everywhere means in the places and neighboring places, etc.

original: de bzhin gzhan pa 'dres pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis rnal 'byor pa yis rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan pa 'dres pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis rnal 'byor pa yis rigs par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the others, of mixed nature, should be known by the yogi according to their nature and qualities.

original: tsartsi k'a la sogs pa rnams dang 'dod ma dang phyir 'dod ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis sgrub thabs kyi le'u las 'chad par 'gyur pa'i cho gas so //
analyzed: tsartsi k'a la sogs pa rnams dang 'dod ma dang phyir 'dod ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis sgrub thabs kyi le'u las 'chad par 'gyur pa'i cho gas so //
translated: By the nature of Cārvāka, etc., and of Kāminī, Parakāminī, etc., as will be explained in the Sadhana chapter.

original: de ltar sa yi steng gi gnas su mkha' spyod sa spyod rnams ni sum cu rtsa drug dbye bas phye ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar sa yi steng gi gnas su mkha' spyod sa spyod rnams ni sum cu rtsa drug dbye bas phye ba'o //
translated: Thus, the thirty-six divisions of the celestial and terrestrial abodes on the earth are distinguished.

original: da ni chang zhes pa la sogs pas ston pa po'i btung ba'i nges pa gsungs pa 'dir chang thams cad shes rab kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: da ni chang zhes pa la sogs pas ston pa po'i btung ba'i nges pa gsungs pa 'dir chang thams cad shes rab kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Now, the author declares the rule for drinking alcohol, etc. Here, all alcohol is of the nature of wisdom.

original: sbrang rtsi las skyes pa dang bu ram las skyes pa dang 'bras las skyes pa'am shing las skyes pa'am gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi las skyes pa dang bu ram las skyes pa dang 'bras las skyes pa'am shing las skyes pa'am gzhan pa'o //
translated: It is produced from honey, sugar, rice, wood, or other things.

original: phyag rgya dang bral slob dpon gang zhig 'thung byed de ni yul can du 'gyur te myos par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don te bdud kyi tshogs kyis bskor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang bral slob dpon gang zhig 'thung byed de ni yul can du 'gyur te myos par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don te bdud kyi tshogs kyis bskor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The master who is devoid of the seal becomes the subject, and he becomes intoxicated, that is, surrounded by the host of demons.

original: de phyir shes rab lhag ldan sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog cing sngags pa rnams la dngos grub sbyin par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de phyir shes rab lhag ldan sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog cing sngags pa rnams la dngos grub sbyin par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, endowed with superior wisdom, he takes away the stain of sin and grants power to the mantrins.

original: phyag rgya gang su rung ba chang 'thung ba'i dus 'dir ni dkyil 'khor dang tshogs @166b kyi 'khor lo med cing dam tshig gi rdzas dang rnam par bral yang btung ba'i slad du rab tu bya ste rdo rje mchod pa'i don du'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya gang su rung ba chang 'thung ba'i dus 'dir ni dkyil 'khor dang tshogs @166b kyi 'khor lo med cing dam tshig gi rdzas dang rnam par bral yang btung ba'i slad du rab tu bya ste rdo rje mchod pa'i don du'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: At this time of drinking wine, any seal, even in the absence of a mandala or ganacakra, and even in the absence of the pledge substances, is to be employed for the sake of drinking, for the sake of the vajra worship. This is the definitive meaning.

original: gang gis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dam tshig bzhi po bsten par gyur pa de'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dam tshig bzhi po bsten par gyur pa de'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: The qualities of him who relies on the four pledges of the yogins are stated:

original: rgyal po ri bong mtshan ma gcig pu 'chi ba'i 'jigs 'phrog byed pa thams cad dus su bsten par bya zhes pa mi 'pho ba'o bde ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po ri bong mtshan ma gcig pu 'chi ba'i 'jigs 'phrog byed pa thams cad dus su bsten par bya zhes pa mi 'pho ba'o bde ba'o //
translated: The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.

original: shes rab chos 'byung la gnas nyin mor byed pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems kyi khams phyi rol du shor ba zos pas kyang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog na rnal 'byor ldan pa dag ni smos ci dgos te mi 'pho bar byas pas so zhes pa'i don
analyzed: shes rab chos 'byung la gnas nyin mor byed pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems kyi khams phyi rol du shor ba zos pas kyang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog na rnal 'byor ldan pa dag ni smos ci dgos te mi 'pho bar byas pas so zhes pa'i don
translated: The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.🔽The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the right time.

original: to // mi bskyod pa ni gci ba dang don yod grub pa ni rkang dang rgyal ba mchog ni rnam par snang mdzad de de dang ldan pa ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: to // mi bskyod pa ni gci ba dang don yod grub pa ni rkang dang rgyal ba mchog ni rnam par snang mdzad de de dang ldan pa ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who is endowed with the practice should rely on the practice at the

original: de bzhin du khyi dang rta dang ba lang dang glang po che dang ldan pa dang gzhan yang brgyad pa shin tu drag po ni sha chen te dam tshig rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rdo rje dbyug pa dang skye bo phyugs la 'jigs pa ster ba'o
analyzed: de bzhin du khyi dang rta dang ba lang dang glang po che dang ldan pa dang gzhan yang brgyad pa shin tu drag po ni sha chen te dam tshig rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rdo rje dbyug pa dang skye bo phyugs la 'jigs pa ster ba'o
translated: Likewise, the eight pledges are the eight great commitments, which are dog, horse, ox, elephant, and the other four, and also the eight great commitments, which are human flesh, etc.

original: // de ltar bshang pa dang gci ba dang rkang dang sgrol ma lnga ni dam tshig brgyad de gnyis ni nyi ma dang zla ba dag go //
analyzed: // de ltar bshang pa dang gci ba dang rkang dang sgrol ma lnga ni dam tshig brgyad de gnyis ni nyi ma dang zla ba dag go //
translated: Thus, the five pledges of feces, urine, bone, marrow, and fat are the eight commitments, and the two, sun and moon, are the two, feces and urine.

original: da ltar bdud rtsi lnga dang sgrol ma lngas tshogs kyi 'khor lo la mchod pa rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar bdud rtsi lnga dang sgrol ma lngas tshogs kyi 'khor lo la mchod pa rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, with the five nectars and the five heroines, there are ten kinds of offerings for the ganacakra.

original: chang dang sha dang 'khrig pa dang bdud rtsi za ba zhes pa dam tshig bzhi ni slob dpon gyis bya ste /
analyzed: chang dang sha dang 'khrig pa dang bdud rtsi za ba zhes pa dam tshig bzhi ni slob dpon gyis bya ste /
translated: The four pledges of drinking alcohol, eating meat, engaging in sexual union, and consuming the nectars are to be performed by the master.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na bdud kyi phyogs kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na bdud kyi phyogs kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, they are to be seized by the side of Mara. This is the definitive statement of the Tathagata.

original: da ni khyi rta zhes la sogs pas rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi gzugs yongs su bsgyur pas dam tshig sum cu rtsa drug gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni khyi rta zhes la sogs pas rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi gzugs yongs su bsgyur pas dam tshig sum cu rtsa drug gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “dog, horse,” he declares the thirty-six pledges by means of the transformation of the yoginis’ forms.

original: 'dir khyi mo ni sgrol ma dang / rta mo ni gos dkar mo dang / ba lang mo ni m'a ma k'i dang glang chen mo ni spyan ma dang / rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ni gzugs thams cad 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir khyi mo ni sgrol ma dang / rta mo ni gos dkar mo dang / ba lang mo ni m'a ma k'i dang glang chen mo ni spyan ma dang / rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ni gzugs thams cad 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Here, the bitch is Tara, the mare is Pandaravasini, the cow is Mamaki, the elephant is Locana, and Vajradhatvi-svarl is the bearer of all forms.

original: lug mo ni sgra rdo rje ma dang / ra mo ni reg bya rdo rje ma dang / ri dags mo ni ro rdo rje ma dang / bong mo ni gzugs rdo rje dag phag mo ni dri rdo rje ma dang / rnga mo ni chos kyi khams kyi rdo rje ma ste /🔽sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi @167a * //
analyzed: lug mo ni sgra rdo rje ma dang / ra mo ni reg bya rdo rje ma dang / ri dags mo ni ro rdo rje ma dang / bong mo ni gzugs rdo rje dag phag mo ni dri rdo rje ma dang / rnga mo ni chos kyi khams kyi rdo rje ma ste / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi @167a * //
translated: The ewe is Shabdavijaya, the she-goat is SparshavajrI, the doe is Rasavajra, the she-ass is Rupavajra, the sow is GandhavajrI, and the camel is DharmadhatuvajrI.

original: dbye bas 'di rnams phyogs zhes pa ste bcu'o //
analyzed: dbye bas 'di rnams phyogs zhes pa ste bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten directions, divided into the families of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du kum bh'i ra mo ni tsartsi k'a dang / 'gron bu mo ni khyab 'jug ma dang / ku l'i ra mo ni phag mo dang / nya mo ni gzhon nu ma dang / ma ka ra mo ni dbang mo dang / sbal mo ni tshangs ma dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du kum bh'i ra mo ni tsartsi k'a dang / 'gron bu mo ni khyab 'jug ma dang / ku l'i ra mo ni phag mo dang / nya mo ni gzhon nu ma dang / ma ka ra mo ni dbang mo dang / sbal mo ni tshangs ma dang /
translated: In the same way, the female tortoise is Caṇḍī, the female oyster is Viṣṇu, the female porcupine is Vārāhī, the female fish is Kumārī, the female crocodile is Vaiṣṇavī, the female frog is Brahmāṇī,

original: rus sbal mo ni dbang phyug ma dang / dung mo ni dpal chen mo ste 'byung po las skyes pa brgyad do //🔽bse ru mo ni shin tu stobs ma dang stag mo ni rmugs byed ma dang / dom mo ni rengs byed ma dang ne le mo ni nga rgyal ma dang 'bri mo ni rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang ce sbyang mo ni khro gnyer can ma dang /
analyzed: rus sbal mo ni dbang phyug ma dang / dung mo ni dpal chen mo ste 'byung po las skyes pa brgyad do // bse ru mo ni shin tu stobs ma dang stag mo ni rmugs byed ma dang / dom mo ni rengs byed ma dang ne le mo ni nga rgyal ma dang 'bri mo ni rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang ce sbyang mo ni khro gnyer can ma dang /
translated: the female turtle is Īśvarī, and the female conch is Mahālakṣmī. These are the eight born from bhūtas.🔽The female rhinoceros is Caṇḍākṣī, the female tiger is Mohinī, the female bear is Stambhinī, the female otter is Māyā, the female leopard is Vajrāṅkuśī, the female hyena is Bhṛkuṭī,

original: sram mo ni 'od zer can ma dang / phyi la mo ni tsun d'a dang 'brog dgon pa'i khyi mo ni shin tu sngon mo dang 'brog dgon pa'i seng ge mo ni drag spyan ma ste khro bo las skyes pa bcu'o //
analyzed: sram mo ni 'od zer can ma dang / phyi la mo ni tsun d'a dang 'brog dgon pa'i khyi mo ni shin tu sngon mo dang 'brog dgon pa'i seng ge mo ni drag spyan ma ste khro bo las skyes pa bcu'o //
translated: the female otter is Mārajit, the female fox is Caṇḍālī, the female jackal is Pūtanā, the female wolf is Vikaṭā, the female lion is Cāmuṇḍā, the female dog of the wilderness is Kākāsyā, and the female lion of the wilderness is Rudhira-vaktrā. These are the ten born from krodhas.

original: de bzhin go dh'a ni khyi gdong ma dang byi ba mo ni phag gdong ma dang / sh'a li dza ta ka ni ce sbyang gdong ma dang spre'u mo ni stag gdong ma dang ri bong mo ni bya rog gdong ma dang / gzugs mo ni bya rgod gdong ma dang /
analyzed: de bzhin go dh'a ni khyi gdong ma dang byi ba mo ni phag gdong ma dang / sh'a li dza ta ka ni ce sbyang gdong ma dang spre'u mo ni stag gdong ma dang ri bong mo ni bya rog gdong ma dang / gzugs mo ni bya rgod gdong ma dang /
translated: Likewise, Ghodā is the face of a dog, Mūṣikā is the face of a pig, Śālijāṭī is the face of a jackal, Mārjārikā is the face of a tiger, Śaśikā is the face of a crow, and Gṛdhrī is the face of a vulture.

original: aishu ka ni mkha' lding gdong ma dang rtsangs pa mo ni 'ug gdong ma ste brgyad ni lha min las skyes pa rnams kyi dam tshig dang gzugs yongs su bsgyur pa'o //
analyzed: aishu ka ni mkha' lding gdong ma dang rtsangs pa mo ni 'ug gdong ma ste brgyad ni lha min las skyes pa rnams kyi dam tshig dang gzugs yongs su bsgyur pa'o //
translated: Iṣukā is the face of a garuḍa, and Godhā is the face of an owl. These eight are the pledges and the transformed forms of those born from the demigods.

original: de ltar sa la spyod pa dang chu la spyod pa'i dam tshig nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sa la spyod pa dang chu la spyod pa'i dam tshig nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the pledges of those who move on the earth and those who move in the water are ascertained.

original: da ni kheng ldan zhes pa la sogs pas mkha' la spyod pa rnams kyi dam tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni kheng ldan zhes pa la sogs pas mkha' la spyod pa rnams kyi dam tshig gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the pledges of those who move in the sky are stated beginning with “the haughty bird” and so on.

original: 'dir khyil sogs pa bzhi po ji lta ba de bzhin du khengs ldan 'dab chags te /
analyzed: 'dir khyil sogs pa bzhi po ji lta ba de bzhin du khengs ldan 'dab chags te /
translated: Here, the four beginning with “dog” are just as they are, and likewise, the haughty bird is the face of a garuḍa.

original: khug rta dang ne tsho dang khu byug dang ri skegs te gsal bar chu yi gter zhes pa dam tshig bzhi ste sgrol ma la sogs pa rnams so //🔽de bzhin du sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug ni l'a ba dang phug ron dang bya dkar dang mchil pa dang dur pa dang dang pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: khug rta dang ne tsho dang khu byug dang ri skegs te gsal bar chu yi gter zhes pa dam tshig bzhi ste sgrol ma la sogs pa rnams so // de bzhin du sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug ni l'a ba dang phug ron dang bya dkar dang mchil pa dang dur pa dang dang pa'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The four commitments of the water-born are the swan, the parrot, the cuckoo, and the myna, clearly the four commitments, the water treasure, Tara, and so on.🔽Thus, the six commitments of the sound-vajra and so on are the dove, the pigeon, the white bird, the sparrow, the duck, and the goose, respectively.

original: de bzhin du 'byung po las skyes pa'i dam tshig brgyad ni khrung khrung dang khu byug mig dang srin bya dag dang bha ga ba t'i zhes pa skyung ka dang sreg pa dang bzhad dang / chu la 'jug pa zhes pa chu'i bya rog dang chu skyar te nor rnams zhes pa brgyad ni ts'a mundala sogs pa rnams kyi ste rim pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung po las skyes pa'i dam tshig brgyad ni khrung khrung dang khu byug mig dang srin bya dag dang bha ga ba t'i zhes pa skyung ka dang sreg pa dang bzhad dang / chu la 'jug pa zhes pa chu'i bya rog dang chu skyar te nor rnams zhes pa brgyad ni ts'a mundala sogs pa rnams kyi ste rim pas rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the eight commitments born from the elements are the crane, the cuckoo, the owl, the Bhavavati, the goose, the partridge, the peacock, and the water-bird, the eight treasures, the Chamundi and so on, respectively.

original: de bzhin du khro bo las skyes pa rnams kyi dam tshig bcu ni bya rog dang bya rgod dang @167b 'ug pa dang ri dags dgra zhes pa hor pa chen po dang gtsug phud can dang bya gag dang / bhe dra zhes pa san tsa ka dang gh'a ra zhes pa'o la ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khro bo las skyes pa rnams kyi dam tshig bcu ni bya rog dang bya rgod dang @167b 'ug pa dang ri dags dgra zhes pa hor pa chen po dang gtsug phud can dang bya gag dang / bhe dra zhes pa san tsa ka dang gh'a ra zhes pa'o la ba dang /
translated: Similarly, the ten pledges of those born from wrathful deities are to eat crow, vulture, owl, and deer, that is, the great mongoose, topknot, cock, and bhedin, that is, the sancaka, and the cow, that is, the gavaya,

original: hor pa dang ljon shing dgra ste khro bo las skyes khro bo'i rigs rmugs byed la sogs pa rim pa ji lta bas so //
analyzed: hor pa dang ljon shing dgra ste khro bo las skyes khro bo'i rigs rmugs byed la sogs pa rim pa ji lta bas so //
translated: and the enemy tree.

original: de bzhin du khyi gdong ma la sogs pa lha min rnams kyi dam tshig brgyad ni mig sngon dang tsa ko ra dang aa ni la dang gu da mu kha zhes pa pha bang dang bug ki zhes pa d'a da p'u ha dang rkang ste nyal zhes pa
analyzed: de bzhin du khyi gdong ma la sogs pa lha min rnams kyi dam tshig brgyad ni mig sngon dang tsa ko ra dang aa ni la dang gu da mu kha zhes pa pha bang dang bug ki zhes pa d'a da p'u ha dang rkang ste nyal zhes pa
translated: Similarly, the eight pledges of the demigods such as Kshitigarbha are to eat the blue-eyed, the cakora bird, the anila, and the guduma, that is, the frog, the buki, that is, the dāḍim flower, and the foot, that is, the bed.

original: lcog dang / bhe runda dang aam pa ri ka ste mi yi bdag po bya rog gdong ma la sogs pa lha min mo rnams kyi mchog gi 'dab chags brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lcog dang / bhe runda dang aam pa ri ka ste mi yi bdag po bya rog gdong ma la sogs pa lha min mo rnams kyi mchog gi 'dab chags brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The eight supreme birds are the goddesses of the asuras, namely, Kākāsyā, and so on, namely, Kākāsyā, Ulūkāsyā, Śvānāsyā, Śūkarāsyā, Gṛdhrāsyā, Kunkunāsyā, Bheruṇḍā, and Ambapālikā.

original: de ltar sum cu rtsa drug rigs kyi dbye bas sa yi srid pa la gnas sa spyod mkha' la spyod rnams kyi rigs su gyur pa'i dam tshig ste dam tshig bdun cu rtsa gnyis po mtha' dag rnams ni mchod pa'i dus su rnal 'byor pas bza' bar bya'o
analyzed: de ltar sum cu rtsa drug rigs kyi dbye bas sa yi srid pa la gnas sa spyod mkha' la spyod rnams kyi rigs su gyur pa'i dam tshig ste dam tshig bdun cu rtsa gnyis po mtha' dag rnams ni mchod pa'i dus su rnal 'byor pas bza' bar bya'o
translated: Thus, the thirty-six pledges of the families of the earth-dwelling, sky-dwelling, and space-traveling yoginīs, which are divided into families, are the thirty-two pledges that the yogin should consume at the time of worship.

original: // de rnams kyang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis byin te rmongs pas gti mug dag las gal te tshogs kyi 'khor lo la dam tshig byin pa rnams spangs na de'i tshe myur du nyams par rab tu 'gyur te smad pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: // de rnams kyang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis byin te rmongs pas gti mug dag las gal te tshogs kyi 'khor lo la dam tshig byin pa rnams spangs na de'i tshe myur du nyams par rab tu 'gyur te smad pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: And if, out of delusion, the yoginīs give them to the deluded, and if they are abandoned in the gaṇacakra, then they will quickly be destroyed, due to their contemptuous attitude.

original: da ni so dang zhes pa la sogs pas lus kyi cha shas kyi dam tshig gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni so dang zhes pa la sogs pas lus kyi cha shas kyi dam tshig gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “the teeth,” he teaches the pledges of the parts of the body.

original: so dang skra dang pags pa dang sha dang chu rgyus dang rus pa dang snying dang / padma zhes pa skye gnas dang / shig dang ba spu dang / srin bu dang glo ba dang rgyu ma dang / chu so dang bad kan dang / mkhris pa dang chu dang rnag dang khrag dang rdul dang /
analyzed: so dang skra dang pags pa dang sha dang chu rgyus dang rus pa dang snying dang / padma zhes pa skye gnas dang / shig dang ba spu dang / srin bu dang glo ba dang rgyu ma dang / chu so dang bad kan dang / mkhris pa dang chu dang rnag dang khrag dang rdul dang /
translated: worms, lungs, intestines,🔽bladder, phlegm,🔽bile, water, pus, blood, and dirt,🔽fat, tears,🔽saliva, mucus,

original: tshil dang mchi ma dang / mchil ma dang snabs dang / dri chu dang chu ser dang zhag dang bshang ba rnams te /
analyzed: tshil dang mchi ma dang / mchil ma dang snabs dang / dri chu dang chu ser dang zhag dang bshang ba rnams te /
translated: urine, lymph, grease, and feces.

original: sna tshogs lus la gnas pa zhes pa sems can rnams kyi lus la gnas pa'i kha dog sna tshogs dang dri sna tshogs dang / lce dang mig dang rna ba dang sna dang ri bong can zhes pa khu ba dang nyin byed ces pa rdul te dam tshig gi rdzas 'di rnams kyis lha rnams mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs lus la gnas pa zhes pa sems can rnams kyi lus la gnas pa'i kha dog sna tshogs dang dri sna tshogs dang / lce dang mig dang rna ba dang sna dang ri bong can zhes pa khu ba dang nyin byed ces pa rdul te dam tshig gi rdzas 'di rnams kyis lha rnams mchod par bya ste /
translated: The various things that exist in the body are the various colors and smells that exist in the bodies of sentient beings, and the tongue, eyes, ears, nose, and rabbit, that is, semen, and sun, that is, menses.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The assembly wheel is for the yogins.

original: su cu rtsa drug yi ge rnams ni de dag gi rang gi rang bzhin yon tan dbang @168a * //
analyzed: su cu rtsa drug yi ge rnams ni de dag gi rang gi rang bzhin yon tan dbang @168a * //
translated: The thirty-six phonemes are their own nature, by the power of their qualities.

original: gis zhes pa nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams kyi dbang gis te /🔽nga gha ga kha ka /
analyzed: gis zhes pa nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams kyi dbang gis te / nga gha ga kha ka /
translated: By the power of the elements, space, etc.

original: nya dzha dza tsha tsa /
analyzed: nya dzha dza tsha tsa /
translated: Ka Kha Ga Gha Ṅa🔽Ca Cha Ja Jha Ṇa🔽Ṭa Ṭha Ḍa Ḍha Ṇa

original: na dha da tha ta /
analyzed: na dha da tha ta /
translated: Ta Tha Da Dha Na

original: ma bha ba pha pa /🔽na dha da tha ta /🔽thaka sha sha wa sa /
analyzed: ma bha ba pha pa / na dha da tha ta / thaka sha sha wa sa /
translated: Pa Pha Ba Bha Ma🔽Ya Ra La Va

original: ha ya ra wa la ksha zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ha ya ra wa la ksha zhes pa'o //
translated: Śa Ṣa Sa Ha Kṣa

original: 'di rnams ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang ste bcom ldan 'das ma dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang ste bcom ldan 'das ma dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: These are the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, together with the Bhagavatī.🔽Similarly, there are thirty-six divisions of the elements:🔽A Ā Ai Ai Ri Ri Ui U Ui Li Li Aṃ Aḥ A Ā Ai Ai Au Au Aṃ Aḥ Ya Ra La Va

original: de bzhin du sum cu rtsa drug khams kyi dbye ba ste aa a'a ai a'i ri r'i au a'u li l'i aom aa:aa a'a ae aee aa ra a'a ra ao aoo aa la a'a la ao aa:ha h'a ya y'a ra r'a wa w'a la l'a ho ha:zhes pa
analyzed: de bzhin du sum cu rtsa drug khams kyi dbye ba ste aa a'a ai a'i ri r'i au a'u li l'i aom aa:aa a'a ae aee aa ra a'a ra ao aoo aa la a'a la ao aa:ha h'a ya y'a ra r'a wa w'a la l'a ho ha:zhes pa
translated: Śa Ṣa Sa Ha Kṣa

original: sum cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: Thirty-six.

original: 'di rnams ni mtha' dag srid pa la gnas rigs rnams dang mtshan ma sum cu rtsa drug dang phyag rgya sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni mtha' dag srid pa la gnas rigs rnams dang mtshan ma sum cu rtsa drug dang phyag rgya sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: These are the thirty-six signs and thirty-six seals of all the families abiding in existence.

original: de bzhin du dbyangs dang bcas pa'i yi ge so sos bskyed pa rnams ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyangs dang bcas pa'i yi ge so sos bskyed pa rnams ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: Similarly, those generated by the individual syllables with vowels are the thirty-six Yoga Tantras.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma'i rigs kyi rgyud rnams te ;
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma'i rigs kyi rgyud rnams te ;
translated: Similarly, the Yoginī families are the Tantras.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma dang bcas pa thams cad sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma dang bcas pa thams cad sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, all the Bhagavatīs are to be known as having the nature of thirty-seven.

original: zhes pa ni sa gzhi dag la gnas pa rnams zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa gzhi dag la gnas pa rnams zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of those abiding on the ground.

original: lhag ma rnams ni dag pa'i rigs su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni dag pa'i rigs su mi 'gyur te /
translated: The remaining ones do not become pure families,

original: gsal byed sna tshogs kyi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal byed sna tshogs kyi chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they have the nature of various consonants.

original: de ltar rigs sum cu rtsa drug gi dkyil 'khor bri ba dang rnal 'byor ma rnams mchod pa ni nya so so la bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rigs sum cu rtsa drug gi dkyil 'khor bri ba dang rnal 'byor ma rnams mchod pa ni nya so so la bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the maṇḍala of the thirty-six families and the worship of the yoginīs should be done on each new moon day. This is the ascertainment of the Tathāgata.

original: da ni chu dang zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor lo 'dus pa la mchod yon la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni chu dang zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor lo 'dus pa la mchod yon la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the water and so forth refers to the offering water and so forth for the assembled wheel.🔽

original: chu'i snod dang mchod yon gyi snod dang dri'i snod dang / spos kyi snod dang me tog gi snod dang / 'bras bu'i snod dang 'bru ma nyams pa'i snod dang / mar me'i snod dang lha bshos kyi snod dang / gos kyi snod de de ltar mchod pa'i rdzas rnam pa bcu ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo la 'dus pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la mchod pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: chu'i snod dang mchod yon gyi snod dang dri'i snod dang / spos kyi snod dang me tog gi snod dang / 'bras bu'i snod dang 'bru ma nyams pa'i snod dang / mar me'i snod dang lha bshos kyi snod dang / gos kyi snod de de ltar mchod pa'i rdzas rnam pa bcu ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo la 'dus pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la mchod pa'i don du'o //
translated: Now, “water, etc.” refers to the water vessel, the vessel for the libation, the vessel for the perfume, the vessel for the incense, the vessel for the flowers, the vessel for the fruit, the vessel for the undamaged grain, the vessel for the lamp, the vessel for the food, and the vessel for the cloth. Thus, the ten types of offering substances are for the purpose of the assembly wheel and the worship of the mandala wheel.

original: de bzhin du nang gi rdzas rnam pa bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi rdzas rnam pa bcur 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, there are ten internal substances.

original: khu ba dang gci ba dang / rkang dang bshang ba dang sha dang / mchin pa dang mkhris pa dang khrag dang rgyu ma dang pags pa ste /
analyzed: khu ba dang gci ba dang / rkang dang bshang ba dang sha dang / mchin pa dang mkhris pa dang khrag dang rgyu ma dang pags pa ste /
translated: They are semen, urine, marrow, feces, flesh, liver, bile, blood, intestines, and skin.

original: rnam pa bcu ni 'khor lo 'dus pa @168b la lha mo rnams mchod pa'i don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ni 'khor lo 'dus pa @168b la lha mo rnams mchod pa'i don du 'gyur ro //
translated: The ten types are for the purpose of worshipping the goddesses in the assembly of the wheel.

original: rgyal po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The king is the Tibetan.

original: da ni sgrol ma la sogs pa'i rigs las sgyes pa rnams kyi mtshan ma sum cu rtsa drug gsungs te /🔽'dir tshogs kyi 'khor lo la zhugs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: da ni sgrol ma la sogs pa'i rigs las sgyes pa rnams kyi mtshan ma sum cu rtsa drug gsungs te / 'dir tshogs kyi 'khor lo la zhugs pa rnams sam /
translated: Now, the thirty-six signs of those born in the families of Tara and so forth are stated.🔽Here, the signs of those who enter the gaṇa cakra or of the yoginīs who dwell in the village or city are on the forehead or both shoulders or the left and right sides of the chest.

original: grong ngam grong khyer du gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dpral ba'am phrag pa gnyi ga'am g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i dpyi'i phyogs la gang gi tshe lus kyi kha dog las gang zhig kha dog gzhan dang gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur pa'i mtshan ma de ni kha🔽dog las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: grong ngam grong khyer du gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dpral ba'am phrag pa gnyi ga'am g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i dpyi'i phyogs la gang gi tshe lus kyi kha dog las gang zhig kha dog gzhan dang gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur pa'i mtshan ma de ni kha dog las rig par bya ste /
translated: When a color other than the color of the body is perceived, that sign is known from the color.

original: gang yang lag pa dang rkang pa'i mthil du 'gyur pa de ni ri mo rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang lag pa dang rkang pa'i mthil du 'gyur pa de ni ri mo rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Also, that which occurs on the palms of the hands and soles of the feet is known from the lines.

original: des na rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi lag pa gzung ba'i slad du bud med dang skyes pa'i mtshan nyid bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi lag pa gzung ba'i slad du bud med dang skyes pa'i mtshan nyid bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to grasp the hands of the yoginīs, the characteristics of women and men should be learned.

original: gang gis gzhan gyi bud med kyis rang gi lag pa yang mtshan yid kyi don du gtong du 'jug par byed na des zol gyis de rnams kyi lus la gnas pa dang lag pa dang rkang pa'i mthil na gnas pa dang khyim du bris pa'i mtshan ma rig
analyzed: gang gis gzhan gyi bud med kyis rang gi lag pa yang mtshan yid kyi don du gtong du 'jug par byed na des zol gyis de rnams kyi lus la gnas pa dang lag pa dang rkang pa'i mthil na gnas pa dang khyim du bris pa'i mtshan ma rig
translated: If someone is made to give even his own hand to another’s woman for the sake of sexual pleasure, he should know the signs on her body, on the palms of her hands and soles of her feet, and in her house.

original: par bya'o zhes pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: par bya'o zhes pa ni thabs so //
translated: This is the method.

original: de la gang gi skye ba'i gnas lnga rnams su kha dog las rdo rje mthong na de ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ste /
analyzed: de la gang gi skye ba'i gnas lnga rnams su kha dog las rdo rje mthong na de ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ste /
translated: There, if one sees a vajra in the five places of her birth, she is Vajradhātvīśvarī.

original: lag pa'i mthil lam rkang pa'i dag la ni ri mo rnams kyis so //
analyzed: lag pa'i mthil lam rkang pa'i dag la ni ri mo rnams kyis so //
translated: On the palms of her hands and soles of her feet, by the lines.

original: de bas na de ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rigs can ma'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rigs can ma'o //
translated: Therefore, she is of the Akṣobhya family.

original: de bzhin du sgrol ma'i ral gri dang gos dkar mo'i mnga' 'am rin po che dang m'a ma k'i'i padma 'dab ma brgya pa dang spyan ma'i lnga pa 'khor lo'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrol ma'i ral gri dang gos dkar mo'i mnga' 'am rin po che dang m'a ma k'i'i padma 'dab ma brgya pa dang spyan ma'i lnga pa 'khor lo'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: Similarly, the signs of Tārā are a sword, of Pāṇḍaravāsinī a banner or jewel, of Māmakī a hundred-petaled lotus, and of Locanā a five-spoked wheel.

original: de ltar rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i rigs las skyes pa rnams kyi mtshan ma rnams so //🔽de bzhin du sgra rdo rje ma'i rgyud mangs dang / gzugs rdo rje ma'i me long dang / ro rdo rje ma'i snod dang / dri rdo rje ma'i me tog phreng ba dang / reg bya rdo rje ma'i gos dang ; chos khams rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i rigs las skyes pa rnams kyi mtshan ma rnams so // de bzhin du sgra rdo rje ma'i rgyud mangs dang / gzugs rdo rje ma'i me long dang / ro rdo rje ma'i snod dang / dri rdo rje ma'i me tog phreng ba dang / reg bya rdo rje ma'i gos dang ; chos khams rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the signs of those born from the families of wind, fire, water, and earth are seen.🔽Likewise, the signs of those born from the families of the objects are seen in the five places of birth or in the hands and feet.🔽The signs of Śabdavajrā are seen in the lute, the signs of Rūpavajrā in the mirror, the signs of Rasavajrā in the vessel, the signs of Gandhavajrā in the flower garland, the signs of Sparśavajrā in the cloth, and the signs of Dharmadhātuvajrā in the dharma source.
