original: yul gyi rigs las skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas lnga rnams sam lag pa dang rkang pa rnams la mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: yul gyi rigs las skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas lnga rnams sam lag pa dang rkang pa rnams la mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The signs of Śabdavajrā and so on are seen in the lute and so forth.

original: de bzhin du nges par gri gug la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad @169a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du nges par gri gug la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad @169a * //
translated: Likewise, the signs of the eight, the flaying knife and so on, are seen in the hands and feet.

original: de de la tsartsi k'a'i gri gug dang khyab 'jug ma'i dum pa dang / phag mo'i bcu gzar dang gzhon nu ma'i gos ser po dang / dbang mo'i khab bam tho ba dang / tshangs ma'i nya rgya dang drag mo'i rtse gsum dang / dpal mo'i rdo gru bzhi ste /
analyzed: de de la tsartsi k'a'i gri gug dang khyab 'jug ma'i dum pa dang / phag mo'i bcu gzar dang gzhon nu ma'i gos ser po dang / dbang mo'i khab bam tho ba dang / tshangs ma'i nya rgya dang drag mo'i rtse gsum dang / dpal mo'i rdo gru bzhi ste /
translated: The eight signs are the razor of Cārvāka, the skull of Viṣṇu, the trident of Vārāhī, the yellow garment of Kumārī, the awl or hammer of Vāyu, the fish-net of Brahmāṇī, the trident of Rudrāṇī, and the square stone of Śrī.

original: mtshan ma brgyad po 'di ni 'byung po las skyes rnams kyi zhes pa 'chi med la sogs pa'i rigs las skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma brgyad po 'di ni 'byung po las skyes rnams kyi zhes pa 'chi med la sogs pa'i rigs las skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: These eight signs are for those born from the bhūta class, that is, those born from the class of immortality and so on.

original: de bzhin du khro bo las skyes pa rnams kyi bcu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du khro bo las skyes pa rnams kyi bcu ste /
translated: Similarly, there are ten signs for those born from the wrathful class.

original: de las rmugs byed ma'i smug rtsi'i snod de nyin mor byed pa dang mtshungs pa zlum po dang rengs byed ma'i dar gyi srin bu dang nga rgyal can ma'i ku sha dang / shin tu stobs ma'i chu gri dang 'od zer can ma'i mthil lha ma dang tsun d'a'i spu gri dang khro gnyer can ma'i shing lha ma dang /
analyzed: de las rmugs byed ma'i smug rtsi'i snod de nyin mor byed pa dang mtshungs pa zlum po dang rengs byed ma'i dar gyi srin bu dang nga rgyal can ma'i ku sha dang / shin tu stobs ma'i chu gri dang 'od zer can ma'i mthil lha ma dang tsun d'a'i spu gri dang khro gnyer can ma'i shing lha ma dang /
translated: The vessel of the black pigment of the mudgara born from that is round like the sun, the silk worm of the stambhana born from the mudgara is like the one with pride, the water knife of the mahabhairava is like kusha grass, the sandal of the marici is like a blade, the parasol of the vajrapani is like a razor, the table of the rudhirakshi is like a tree, the bamboo stick of the mahasukra is like a frown,

original: rdo rje'i lcags sgrog ma'i gdugs dang drag spyan ma'i tog tse dang shin tu sngon mo'i 'od ma'i dbyug pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i lcags sgrog ma'i gdugs dang drag spyan ma'i tog tse dang shin tu sngon mo'i 'od ma'i dbyug pa ste /
translated: and the flag of the vajrapani is like a tree.

original: de ltar bcu ni khro bo las skyes pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan ma rnam pa bcur 'gyur zhing rnam gnyis las kyi dbang po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar bcu ni khro bo las skyes pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan ma rnam pa bcur 'gyur zhing rnam gnyis las kyi dbang po rnams kyi'o //
translated: Thus, these ten are the ten signs of those born from the wrathful ones, and the two are the signs of the faculties of action.

original: de bzhin du lha min rnams kyi mtshan ma ni khyi gdong ma'i ba lang gi rva dang phag gdong ma'i kham por zhes pa sa'i phor pa dang / ci sbyang gdong ma'i rgyud ldan dang stag gdong ma'i 'phang dang bya rog gdong ma'i sha'i gsal shing dang bya rgod gdong ma'i rgyud mangs nye ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha min rnams kyi mtshan ma ni khyi gdong ma'i ba lang gi rva dang phag gdong ma'i kham por zhes pa sa'i phor pa dang / ci sbyang gdong ma'i rgyud ldan dang stag gdong ma'i 'phang dang bya rog gdong ma'i sha'i gsal shing dang bya rgod gdong ma'i rgyud mangs nye ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Likewise, the signs of the demigods are the cow's horn of the dog-faced one, the earthen bowl of the pig-faced one, the lute of the jackal-faced one, the meat skewer of the tiger-faced one, and the flute of the vulture-faced one, which are the secondary limbs.

original: mi'am ci mo dang mkha' lding gdong ma'i mda' dang 'ug gdong ma'i rma bya'i mjug ma ste /
analyzed: mi'am ci mo dang mkha' lding gdong ma'i mda' dang 'ug gdong ma'i rma bya'i mjug ma ste /
translated: The arrow of the kinnara-faced one and the peacock tail of the owl-faced one are the limbs.

original: mtshan ma brgyad po 'di ni kha la sogs pa sgro brgyad rnam par dag pas rigs brgyad po rnams la mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma brgyad po 'di ni kha la sogs pa sgro brgyad rnam par dag pas rigs brgyad po rnams la mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These eight signs are seen in the eight clans, by the purity of the eight channels of the mouth and so on.

original: de ltar mtshan ma sum cu rtsa drug gang la mthong ba de rnams ni de'i rigs can te mtshan ma nges shes nas mchod par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan ma sum cu rtsa drug gang la mthong ba de rnams ni de'i rigs can te mtshan ma nges shes nas mchod par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, those who see these thirty-six signs are of that clan. Having ascertained the signs, one should make offerings. This is the determination.

original: slar yang ste yang sgrol ma la sogs pa rnams kyi dmangs rigs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gsungs te /
analyzed: slar yang ste yang sgrol ma la sogs pa rnams kyi dmangs rigs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gsungs te /
translated: Again, the signs of the Shudra and so on of Tara and so on are taught.

original: 'dir dmangs rigs kyi yon tan gyi dbang gis sgrol ma'i rigs las skyes pa rnams kyi autpala 'am thong gshol ma thong bar 'gyur ro //🔽rgyal rigs ma ste gos dkar mo'i rigs las skyes pa'i rin chen patta'o //
analyzed: 'dir dmangs rigs kyi yon tan gyi dbang gis sgrol ma'i rigs las skyes pa rnams kyi autpala 'am thong gshol ma thong bar 'gyur ro // rgyal rigs ma ste gos dkar mo'i rigs las skyes pa'i rin chen patta'o //
translated: Here, by the power of the qualities of the Shudra, those born in the family of Tara will have an utpala or a plow.🔽The Kshatriya, born in the family of Pandaravasini, will have a jewel or a banner.

original: rje rigs @169b ma ste spyan ma'i rigs las skyes pa'i smyu gu dang rin chen phreng ba'o //
analyzed: rje rigs @169b ma ste spyan ma'i rigs las skyes pa'i smyu gu dang rin chen phreng ba'o //
translated: The Vaishya, born in the family of Lochana, will have a pen or a jewel rosary.

original: gnyis skyes ma ste m'a ma k'i'i rigs las skyes pa'i chu na rgyu ba dung dang zangs snod do //
analyzed: gnyis skyes ma ste m'a ma k'i'i rigs las skyes pa'i chu na rgyu ba dung dang zangs snod do //
translated: The hermaphrodite, born in the family of Mamaki, will have a water-born conch or a copper vessel.

original: de bzhin du snga ma dang phyi mar yum gyi mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du snga ma dang phyi mar yum gyi mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In the same way, the signs of the mother are of four kinds, earlier and later.

original: g-yung mo rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i rigs las skyes pa'i da ma ru dang rda chen no //
analyzed: g-yung mo rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i rigs las skyes pa'i da ma ru dang rda chen no //
translated: The eunuch, born in the family of Vajradhatvihsvari, will have a damaru or a small drum.

original: de bzhin du gtum mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i rigs las skyes pa'i cod pan dang bgrang phreng ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtum mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i rigs las skyes pa'i cod pan dang bgrang phreng ngo //
translated: Likewise, the crown and rosary are born from the family of the perfection of wisdom Caṇḍālī.

original: de ltar rang gi dbral ba'am phrag pa'am dbyi dang lag pa'am rkang pa rnams la mtshan ma gang zhig mthong ba'am khyim du bris shing mchod pa byed pa de ni de'i rigs can du rnal 'byor pas rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi dbral ba'am phrag pa'am dbyi dang lag pa'am rkang pa rnams la mtshan ma gang zhig mthong ba'am khyim du bris shing mchod pa byed pa de ni de'i rigs can du rnal 'byor pas rigs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yogin should know that the one who sees any sign on his forehead, shoulder, neck, hand, or foot, or who has it drawn in his house and worships it, belongs to that family.

original: des gang byin pa'i dam tshig gi rdzas de bza' bar bya zhing ji srid lan bdun du 'khor ba'i mthar thug pa de bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: des gang byin pa'i dam tshig gi rdzas de bza' bar bya zhing ji srid lan bdun du 'khor ba'i mthar thug pa de bsten par bya ste /
translated: He should eat the pledge substance given by her, and he should serve her as long as she circles seven times, ending with the end of cyclic existence.

original: dam tshig gi rdzas des mkha' la spyod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi rdzas des mkha' la spyod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: It is certain that by that pledge substance he will become a sky-farer.

original: da ni bshad pa la sogs pa dam tshig gi rdzas rnams las la sogs pa'i lha'i rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bshad pa la sogs pa dam tshig gi rdzas rnams las la sogs pa'i lha'i rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the purity of the deities such as Speech, and so on, from among the pledge substances such as explanation, and so on, is stated:

original: 'dir bshang ba dang gci ba dang khrag dang bcas pa dang / sha dang bcas pa ni grangs bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi lha rnams kyi bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir bshang ba dang gci ba dang khrag dang bcas pa dang / sha dang bcas pa ni grangs bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi lha rnams kyi bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the feces, urine, blood, and flesh are the four of the gods of earth, water, fire, and wind, respectively.

original: ma smos kyang khu ba ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma zhes pa nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: ma smos kyang khu ba ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma zhes pa nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: Although not mentioned, the semen is the goddess of the realm of space, Vajradhātvīśvarī.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang mig dang lce dang bshang lam dang / bha ga ni sgra dang dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya dang chos kyi khams kyi lha mo rnams kyi dam tshig drug ste sgra yi rdo rje la sogs drug ces so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang mig dang lce dang bshang lam dang / bha ga ni sgra dang dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya dang chos kyi khams kyi lha mo rnams kyi dam tshig drug ste sgra yi rdo rje la sogs drug ces so //
translated: Similarly, the ear, nose, eye, tongue, anus, and vagina are the six commitments of the goddesses of the sound, smell, form, taste, tactility, and phenomena realms, the six, such as Sound-vajra, and so on.

original: de bzhin du rang dang bad kan dang / shig dang srin bu dang chu ser dang zhag dang ba spu rnams dang skra rnams zhes pa dam tshig brgyad ni grangs bzhin du tsartsi k'a dang khyab 'jug ma dang / phag mo dang gzhon nu ma dang dbang mo dang tshangs ma dang drag mo dang dpal chen mo ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang dang bad kan dang / shig dang srin bu dang chu ser dang zhag dang ba spu rnams dang skra rnams zhes pa dam tshig brgyad ni grangs bzhin du tsartsi k'a dang khyab 'jug ma dang / phag mo dang gzhon nu ma dang dbang mo dang tshangs ma dang drag mo dang dpal chen mo ste /
translated: Likewise, the eight commitments are one's own body, phlegm, lice, insects, lymph, fat, body hair, and head hairs, which are, respectively, Carcika, Visvamata, Varahi, Kumari, Ambika, Brahmi, Rudrani, and Mahakali.

original: rnal 'byor ma 'byung po las skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma 'byung po las skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: These are the commitments of the yoginis born from the elements.

original: de bzhin du rgyu ma dang mkhris pa dang rus pa dang rkang dang sna tshogs lus la gnas pa zhes pa sems can thams cad kyi lus la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu ma dang mkhris pa dang rus pa dang rkang dang sna tshogs lus la gnas pa zhes pa sems can thams cad kyi lus la gnas pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the commitments are the intestines, bile, bones, marrow, and the various bodies, which are located in the bodies of all sentient beings.

original: mchin pa @170a * //
analyzed: mchin pa @170a * //
translated: The liver,

original: dang glo ba dang rtsa dang pags pa dang snying dang tshil bu ste de ltar bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang glo ba dang rtsa dang pags pa dang snying dang tshil bu ste de ltar bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: the lungs, the channels, the skin, the heart, and the suet, making ten.

original: rgyu ma la sogs pa'i tshul bu'i mthar thug pa ni grangs bzhin du rmugs byed ma dang rengs byed ma dang nga rgyal can ma dang shin tu stobs ma dang / rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang khro gnyer can dang tsun d'a dang 'od zer can dang drag spyan ma dang shin tu sngon mo ste /
analyzed: rgyu ma la sogs pa'i tshul bu'i mthar thug pa ni grangs bzhin du rmugs byed ma dang rengs byed ma dang nga rgyal can ma dang shin tu stobs ma dang / rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang khro gnyer can dang tsun d'a dang 'od zer can dang drag spyan ma dang shin tu sngon mo ste /
translated: The ultimate sons, such as the intestines, are, in order, Yaśodharā, Rudrāṇī, Māyā, Mahābalā, Vajrāṅkuśī, Bhṛkuṭī, Cundā, Māmakī, Caṇḍālī, and Kālasyā.

original: khro bo'i lha mo 'di rnams kyi dam tshig bcu'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i lha mo 'di rnams kyi dam tshig bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten commitments of the goddesses of wrath.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i dri ma dang sna'i dri ma dang mig gi dri ma dang lce'i dri ma dang / bshang lam gyi dri ma dang / bha ga'i dri ma dang / rtags kyi dri ma dang / mchan khung gi dri ma ste lus thams cad kyi dri ma rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i dri ma dang sna'i dri ma dang mig gi dri ma dang lce'i dri ma dang / bshang lam gyi dri ma dang / bha ga'i dri ma dang / rtags kyi dri ma dang / mchan khung gi dri ma ste lus thams cad kyi dri ma rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the impurities of the ear, nose, eye, tongue, anus, vagina, penis, and armpit are the impurities of the entire body.

original: dam tshig brgyad ni lha min mo rnams kyi grangs bzhin du ste /
analyzed: dam tshig brgyad ni lha min mo rnams kyi grangs bzhin du ste /
translated: The eight commitments are in the order of the number of the celestial women.

original: khyi gdong ma dang phag gdong ma dang ce sbyang gdong ma dang / stag gdong ma dang / bya rog gdong ma dang / bya rgod gdong ma dang mkha' lding gdong ma dang / 'ug gdong ma ste 'di rnams kyi dam tshig brgyad do //
analyzed: khyi gdong ma dang phag gdong ma dang ce sbyang gdong ma dang / stag gdong ma dang / bya rog gdong ma dang / bya rgod gdong ma dang mkha' lding gdong ma dang / 'ug gdong ma ste 'di rnams kyi dam tshig brgyad do //
translated: The eight commitments of the eight yoginis are the eight commitments of the eight goddesses, Dog Face, Pig Face, Jackal Face, Tiger Face, Crow Face, Vulture Face, Garuḍa Face, and Owl Face.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma rnams ni 'jigs ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma rnams ni 'jigs ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: The eight yoginis are Bhairava and so on.

original: gang zhig brgyad pa brgyad de drug cu rtsa bzhi po de rnams kyi dam tshig ni sen mo nyi shu dang so sum cu rtsa gnyis dang rtsa rgyu ba'i dbye bas thod pa dum bu bcu gnyis rnams te dam tshig drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang zhig brgyad pa brgyad de drug cu rtsa bzhi po de rnams kyi dam tshig ni sen mo nyi shu dang so sum cu rtsa gnyis dang rtsa rgyu ba'i dbye bas thod pa dum bu bcu gnyis rnams te dam tshig drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The commitments of these sixty-four are the twenty nails, the thirty-two teeth, and the twelve sections of the skull, which are the channels through which the vital winds move.

original: de bzhin du rigs brgya'i dbye bas dam tshig brgya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs brgya'i dbye bas dam tshig brgya ste /
translated: Thus, there are one hundred commitments through the classification of one hundred families.

original: rigs gsum dang ni rigs lnga nyid //
analyzed: rigs gsum dang ni rigs lnga nyid //
translated: The three families and the five families

original: rang bzhin gcig ste rigs brgya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig ste rigs brgya'o //
translated: are of one nature, the one hundred families.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rigs sum cu rtsa drug dang rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi gcig nyid rigs brgyar rig par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rigs sum cu rtsa drug dang rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi gcig nyid rigs brgyar rig par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The yogis and yoginis should know that the thirty-six clans and the sixty-four clans are one, that is, the hundred clans.

original: da ni gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi dam tshig gi rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi dam tshig gi rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the purity of the commitments of the places, etc., is stated.

original: bshad pa dang gci ba dang khrag dang sha zhes pa sna tshogs mtha' dag sems can rnams kyi lus la gnas pa rnams ni gnas kyi dbye ba dag la bzhi'o //
analyzed: bshad pa dang gci ba dang khrag dang sha zhes pa sna tshogs mtha' dag sems can rnams kyi lus la gnas pa rnams ni gnas kyi dbye ba dag la bzhi'o //
translated: The four, feces, urine, blood, and flesh, which are all varieties, are in the bodies of sentient beings, and are the divisions of the places.

original: rna ba dang sna dang mig dang lce dang bshang lam dang bha ga zhes pa drug ni zhing gi dbye ba la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna ba dang sna dang mig dang lce dang bshang lam dang bha ga zhes pa drug ni zhing gi dbye ba la 'gyur ro //
translated: The six, ear, nose, eye, tongue, anus, and vagina, are the divisions of the fields.

original: de bzhin du rang dang bad kan dang shig dang srin bu dang / chu ser dang @170b zhag dang ba spu dang skra ste brgyad ni tshan do ha yi dbye ba rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang dang bad kan dang shig dang srin bu dang / chu ser dang @170b zhag dang ba spu dang skra ste brgyad ni tshan do ha yi dbye ba rnams so //
translated: Likewise, the eight, phlegm, pus, lice, worms, lymph, fat, body hair, and head hair, are the divisions of the tsandalas.

original: de bzhin du rgyu ma dang mkhris pa dang rus pa dang rkang dang mchin pa dang glo ba dang rtsa dang pags pa dang snying dang tshil bu ste bcu ni 'dus pa'i dbye ba rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu ma dang mkhris pa dang rus pa dang rkang dang mchin pa dang glo ba dang rtsa dang pags pa dang snying dang tshil bu ste bcu ni 'dus pa'i dbye ba rnams so //
translated: Likewise, the ten [realms] of the intestines, bile, bones, marrow, liver, lungs, channels, skin, heart, and fat are the divisions of the composite.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i dri ma dang sna'i dri ma dang mig gi dri ma dang lce'i dri ma dang bha ga'i dri ma dang bshang lam gyi dri ma dang rtags kyi dri ma dang mchan khung gi dri ma ste yan lag brgyad kyi dri ma 'di brgyad
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i dri ma dang sna'i dri ma dang mig gi dri ma dang lce'i dri ma dang bha ga'i dri ma dang bshang lam gyi dri ma dang rtags kyi dri ma dang mchan khung gi dri ma ste yan lag brgyad kyi dri ma 'di brgyad
translated: Likewise, the eight impurities of the ear, nose, eye, tongue, bhaga, anus, armpit, and groin are the eight impurities.

original: ni dur khrod kyi rab tu dbye ba rnams so //
analyzed: ni dur khrod kyi rab tu dbye ba rnams so //
translated: These are the divisions of the charnel grounds.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol du 'jig rten gyi khams la gnas la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pas dam tshig rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol du 'jig rten gyi khams la gnas la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pas dam tshig rnams gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, externally, the commitments are taught by the purities of the world systems of Abhasvara and so forth.

original: 'dir dus me dang zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan ni gnas kyi dbye bas spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi dam tshig bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dir dus me dang zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan ni gnas kyi dbye bas spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi dam tshig bzhi'o //
translated: Here, the four commitments of Locanā and so forth are the divisions of the abodes of Kālāgni, Candra, Sūrya, and Rāhu.

original: sa skyes dang zla skyes dang sngags pa dang pa sngags dang spen pa dang gdengs can zhes pa mjug rings te /
analyzed: sa skyes dang zla skyes dang sngags pa dang pa sngags dang spen pa dang gdengs can zhes pa mjug rings te /
translated: Earth-born, moon-born, mantra-born, mantra-born, Saturn-born, and hooded-serpent-born, that is, having a long tail.

original: 'di rnams ni zhing gi dbye bas gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni zhing gi dbye bas gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams so //
translated: These are the pledges of the goddesses beginning with Rūpavajrā, by the division of the fields.

original: de bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang sa las skyes pa dang chu las skyes pa dang / me las skyes pa dang rlung las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang sa las skyes pa dang chu las skyes pa dang / me las skyes pa dang rlung las skyes pa ste /
translated: Similarly, earth, water, fire, wind, earth-born, water-born, fire-born, and wind-born.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'byung ba brgyad po rnams ni tshan do ha yi dbye ba rnams te ;
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'byung ba brgyad po rnams ni tshan do ha yi dbye ba rnams te ;
translated: The eight stable and moving elements are the divisions of the Tsandóhas,

original: 'byung po las skyes pa rnams kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: 'byung po las skyes pa rnams kyi dam tshig go //
translated: the pledges of those born from the elements.

original: slar yang de nas ro drug po rnams dang dri dang kha dog dang sgra dang reg bya ste /
analyzed: slar yang de nas ro drug po rnams dang dri dang kha dog dang sgra dang reg bya ste /
translated: Again, the six tastes, smell, color, sound, and touch,

original: bcu ni 'dus pa'i dbye ba rnams te khro bo las skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bcu ni 'dus pa'i dbye ba rnams te khro bo las skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: the ten are the divisions of the assembly, of those born from wrath.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams dang kha dog la sogs pa bzhi po rnams dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag gis zad pa ni dur khrod kyi rab tu dbye ba rnams te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams dang kha dog la sogs pa bzhi po rnams dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag gis zad pa ni dur khrod kyi rab tu dbye ba rnams te /
translated: The exhaustion of earth, etc., and the four, color, etc., by the exhalation and inhalation of breath are the charnel grounds.

original: lha min mo rnams kyi dam tshig brgyad do //
analyzed: lha min mo rnams kyi dam tshig brgyad do //
translated: These are the eight commitments of the celestial maidens.

original: gnas la sogs pa phyi nang gi dam tshig rnam par dag pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa phyi nang gi dam tshig rnam par dag pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the purity of the outer and inner commitments of the places, etc.

original: da ni gnas zhes pa la sogs pas nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa'i gnas rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni gnas zhes pa la sogs pas nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa'i gnas rnams gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “place,” etc., he speaks of the places, such as the neighboring places.

original: 'dir thun mong gis byis pa rnams yul du 'khyam pa'i don du dz'a lam dha ra la sogs pa rnams gnas la sogs par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir thun mong gis byis pa rnams yul du 'khyam pa'i don du dz'a lam dha ra la sogs pa rnams gnas la sogs par gsungs so //
translated: Here, in order for the ordinary children to wander in the land, Jālamdhara, etc., are spoken of as the places, etc.

original: de nyid ni thams cad du khyab par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid ni thams cad du khyab par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That [place] itself does not pervade everywhere,

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rigs sum cu rtsa @171a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rigs sum cu rtsa @171a * //
translated: for the thirty-six clans of yoginīs

original: drug ni grong khyer gcig tu'ang gnas so //
analyzed: drug ni grong khyer gcig tu'ang gnas so //
translated: dwell in a single city.

original: gang gis na 'dir sa gzhi thams cad du khyab par dam pa dang po'i rgyud du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis na 'dir sa gzhi thams cad du khyab par dam pa dang po'i rgyud du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said in the Tantra of the First of the Supreme🔽that it pervades the entire earth.

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas sa thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas sa thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The First Supreme Buddha pervades all the stages,

original: bod la sogs pa dang rgya nag la sogs pa'i yul rnams na yang gnas la sogs pa yod do //
analyzed: bod la sogs pa dang rgya nag la sogs pa'i yul rnams na yang gnas la sogs pa yod do //
translated: and there are also places such as Tibet and China.

original: de nyid ni bsdus pa'i rgyud gzhan du ma bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid ni bsdus pa'i rgyud gzhan du ma bstan to //
translated: It is not taught in other condensed tantras.

original: yul thams cad dang grong thams cad du gnas la sogs pa gsungs pa ni gnas ni sgrol ma la sogs khyim ste rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yul thams cad dang grong thams cad du gnas la sogs pa gsungs pa ni gnas ni sgrol ma la sogs khyim ste rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The places such as the abode are taught in all the countries and all the towns. The abode is the house of Tara and so forth, which are of four kinds.

original: de bzhin du sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i khyim ni zhing rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i khyim ni zhing rnam pa drug go //
translated: Similarly, the house of Shabdavajra and so forth are the six fields.

original: tsartsi k'a la sogs pa'i khyim ni tshan do ha rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: tsartsi k'a la sogs pa'i khyim ni tshan do ha rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: The house of Charcika and so forth are the eight chandohas.

original: rmugs byed ma la sogs pa'i khyim ni 'dus pa rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: rmugs byed ma la sogs pa'i khyim ni 'dus pa rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The house of Chamundayo and so forth are the ten gatherings.

original: khyi gdong ma la sogs pa'i khyim ni dur khrod rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: khyi gdong ma la sogs pa'i khyim ni dur khrod rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: The houses of the dog-faced and so on are the eight charnel grounds.

original: mchog gi sar gnas rtsa ba'i gnas dang gsang bar bcas pa ni yum gyi khyim rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mchog gi sar gnas rtsa ba'i gnas dang gsang bar bcas pa ni yum gyi khyim rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The two houses of the mother are the supreme stage, the root place and the secret place.

original: de dag rab tu gsal bar sa la mthar skyes ma dang mthar skyes ma zhes pa g-yung mo dang gtum mo'i khyim ste /
analyzed: de dag rab tu gsal bar sa la mthar skyes ma dang mthar skyes ma zhes pa g-yung mo dang gtum mo'i khyim ste /
translated: They are clearly the houses of the yoginis and caṇḍālīs called Anangā and Anangāvatī.

original: de ltar dmangs rigs la sogs pa'i khyim ni gnas la sogs pa'i ming gis rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dmangs rigs la sogs pa'i khyim ni gnas la sogs pa'i ming gis rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the houses of the śūdra and so on are to be known by the yogin by the names of the places and so on. This is the rule everywhere.

original: da ni gnas zhes pa la sogs pas nang du gnas la sogs pa'i ming gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni gnas zhes pa la sogs pas nang du gnas la sogs pa'i ming gsungs te /
translated: Now, the places and so on of the inner are stated beginning with “place” and so on.

original: 'dir dam tshig 'dus pa la gnas ni thams cad du bud med kyi padma'o //
analyzed: 'dir dam tshig 'dus pa la gnas ni thams cad du bud med kyi padma'o //
translated: Here, in the assembly of pledges, the place is everywhere the lotus of the woman.

original: nye ba'i rnams kyi sgras skyes pa'i rdo rjer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i rnams kyi sgras skyes pa'i rdo rjer 'gyur ro //
translated: The term “and so on” means the vajra of the man.

original: de bzhin du bud med rnams kyi skye mched drug ni zhing ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med rnams kyi skye mched drug ni zhing ngo //
translated: Similarly, the six sense bases of the woman are the field.

original: skyes pa rnams kyi ni nye ba'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams kyi ni nye ba'i zhing ngo //
translated: For men, they are the secondary fields.

original: de bzhin du bud med rnams kyi mnyam gnas la sogs pa'i rlung brgyad ni tshang do ha'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med rnams kyi mnyam gnas la sogs pa'i rlung brgyad ni tshang do ha'o //
translated: Similarly, for women, the eight winds of the equalizing and so forth are the tsandoh.

original: skyes pa rnams kyi ni nye ba'i tshan do ha'o //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams kyi ni nye ba'i tshan do ha'o //
translated: For men, they are the secondary tsandoh.

original: de bzhin du bud med rnams kyi lce dang lce chung dang lag pa gnyis dang rkang pa gnyis dang / bshang lam gyi g-yas dang g-yon gyi rtsa gnyis dang / gci ba dang khu ba'i rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med rnams kyi lce dang lce chung dang lag pa gnyis dang rkang pa gnyis dang / bshang lam gyi g-yas dang g-yon gyi rtsa gnyis dang / gci ba dang khu ba'i rtsa gnyis te /
translated: Similarly, for women, the tongue, uvula, two arms, two legs, two channels to the right and left of the anus, and the channels of urine and semen

original: las kyi dbang po bcu po 'di rnams ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi dbang po bcu po 'di rnams ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: are the ten channels of action.

original: skyes pa @171b rnams kyi ni nye ba'i 'dus pa'o //🔽sna gnyis dang rna ba gnyis dang mig gnyis dang / kha dang bshang lam las dri ma 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: skyes pa @171b rnams kyi ni nye ba'i 'dus pa'o // sna gnyis dang rna ba gnyis dang mig gnyis dang / kha dang bshang lam las dri ma 'byung ba ste /
translated: For men, they are the secondary channels of action.

original: de ltar bud med rnams kyi dur khrod brgyad do //
analyzed: de ltar bud med rnams kyi dur khrod brgyad do //
translated: The two nostrils, two ears, two eyes, and the mouth and anus are the eight charnel grounds.🔽For men, they are the secondary charnel grounds.

original: skyes pa rnams kyi ni nye ba'i dur khrod do zhes pa ste mtha' dag go //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams kyi ni nye ba'i dur khrod do zhes pa ste mtha' dag go //
translated: Thus, they are the complete set.

original: de bzhin du gnyi ga'i lus la so sor gnas ni g-yon gyi yan lag dang mdun no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyi ga'i lus la so sor gnas ni g-yon gyi yan lag dang mdun no //
translated: Similarly, the two sets of organs are located in the body, the left set in the left side and the front,

original: nye ba'i gnas ni rgyab dang g-yas kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i gnas ni rgyab dang g-yas kyi yan lag ste /
translated: and the right set in the back and the right side.

original: de ltar gnas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar gnas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus there are two sets of locations.

original: de bzhin du g-yon gyi dbang po'i tshogs ni zhing ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon gyi dbang po'i tshogs ni zhing ngo //
translated: Similarly, the left set of sense organs is the field,

original: g-yas kyi dbang po'i tshogs ni nye ba'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: g-yas kyi dbang po'i tshogs ni nye ba'i zhing ngo //
translated: and the right set of sense organs is the neighboring region.

original: de bzhin du rus sbal dang rtsangs pa dang lha sbyin dang nor las rgyal ba ste bzhi ni tshang do ha'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rus sbal dang rtsangs pa dang lha sbyin dang nor las rgyal ba ste bzhi ni tshang do ha'o //
translated: Similarly, the four, tortoise, lizard, Devadatta, and Jyotiska, are the cremation ground,

original: mnyam gnas dang gyen rgyu dang khyab byed dang klu'i tshogs ni nye ba'i tshan do ha'o //
analyzed: mnyam gnas dang gyen rgyu dang khyab byed dang klu'i tshogs ni nye ba'i tshan do ha'o //
translated: and the four, Samanata, Urdhvaja, Vyapti, and Nagacaitya, are the neighboring cremation ground.

original: de bzhin du g-yon gyi las kyi dbang po'i tshogs ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon gyi las kyi dbang po'i tshogs ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the left set of organs of action is the town,

original: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i 'dus pa'o //🔽g-yon gyi rna ba la sogs pa'i bug pa dri ma 'byung ba ni dur khrod do //
analyzed: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i 'dus pa'o // g-yon gyi rna ba la sogs pa'i bug pa dri ma 'byung ba ni dur khrod do //
translated: and the right set of organs of action is the neighboring town.

original: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i dur khrod do //
analyzed: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i dur khrod do //
translated: The left ear and so on are the door of the arising of impurities, and the right ear and so on are the neighboring door of the arising of impurities.

original: de bzhin du lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs par gtogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs par gtogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gzhan gyis te /
translated: Likewise, by the other purities belonging to the hands, feet, etc.

original: mdun dang g-yon gyi yan lag ni gnas so //
analyzed: mdun dang g-yon gyi yan lag ni gnas so //
translated: The front and left limbs are the abodes.

original: rgyab dang g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: rgyab dang g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i gnas so //
translated: The back and right limbs are the near abodes.

original: de bzhin du g-yon gyi dpung pa'i tshigs dang g-yon gyi bral dang dpyi'i tshogs ni zhing ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon gyi dpung pa'i tshigs dang g-yon gyi bral dang dpyi'i tshogs ni zhing ngo //
translated: Likewise, the left shoulder joint, left buttock, and left knee are the fields.

original: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i zhing ngo //
translated: The right is the near field.

original: g-yon gyi nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs dang byin pa dang brla'i tshigs ni tshan do ha'o //
analyzed: g-yon gyi nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs dang byin pa dang brla'i tshigs ni tshan do ha'o //
translated: The left hip joint, left shin, and left ankle are the Chandoha.

original: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i tshan do ha'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i tshan do ha'o //
translated: The right is the near Chandoha.

original: de bzhin du g-yon gyi lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs gnyis ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon gyi lag pa dang rkang pa'i tshigs gnyis ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the two joints of the left hand and foot are the assembly.

original: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i 'dus pa'o //
translated: The right is the near assembly.

original: de bzhin du g-yon gyi ser mo dang sen mo rnams ni dur khrod ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon gyi ser mo dang sen mo rnams ni dur khrod ngo //
translated: Likewise, the left fingers and nails are the charnel grounds.

original: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i dur khrod do //
analyzed: g-yas kyi ni nye ba'i dur khrod do //
translated: The right is the near charnel ground.

original: yang na gnyi ga'i dpung pa'i tshigs gnyis ni zhing ngo //
analyzed: yang na gnyi ga'i dpung pa'i tshigs gnyis ni zhing ngo //
translated: Or, the two shoulder joints of both are the fields.

original: brla'i tshigs gnyis ni nye ba'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: brla'i tshigs gnyis ni nye ba'i zhing ngo //
translated: The two joints of the thigh are the adjacent field.

original: de bzhin du tshan do ha la sogs pa yang ste /🔽lag pa dang rkang pa la gnas pa yang sor mo'i mtha'i mtshams su'o zhes pa dam tshig 'dus pa la gnas la sogs pa'i ming rnal 'byor pas @172a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshan do ha la sogs pa yang ste / lag pa dang rkang pa la gnas pa yang sor mo'i mtha'i mtshams su'o zhes pa dam tshig 'dus pa la gnas la sogs pa'i ming rnal 'byor pas @172a * //
translated: Likewise, the wrist and so forth are the joints.🔽The yogi should know the names of the yoginis abiding in the commitments, and so forth, as follows:

original: rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rig par bya'o //
translated: The fingers and toes are the tips of the fingers and toes.

original: da ni dran pa zhes pa la sogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams kyis rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dran pa zhes pa la sogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams kyis rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, beginning with mindfulness, he teaches the purity of the yoginis by means of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: 'dir lha mo bzhi ni rim pa bzhin du ste /🔽lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni spyan ma dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gos dkar mo'o zhes pa rgyab dang g-yas so //
analyzed: 'dir lha mo bzhi ni rim pa bzhin du ste / lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni spyan ma dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gos dkar mo'o zhes pa rgyab dang g-yas so //
translated: Here, the four goddesses are in order:🔽The application of mindfulness to the body is Locana, and the application of mindfulness to sensation is Mamaki, in the back and right.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni m'a ma k'i dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sgrol ma'o zhes pa g-yon dang mdun te /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni m'a ma k'i dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sgrol ma'o zhes pa g-yon dang mdun te /
translated: The application of mindfulness to mind is Pandara, and the application of mindfulness to phenomena is Tara, in the left and front.

original: lus kyi dbye bas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas gnyis so //
analyzed: lus kyi dbye bas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas gnyis so //
translated: The body divisions are the two, the field and the adjacent field.

original: dus kyi 'khor lor rab tu grags zhes pa rgyud gzhan du rab tu ma grags te /
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lor rab tu grags zhes pa rgyud gzhan du rab tu ma grags te /
translated: The Wheel of Time is well known, not well known in other tantras.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis spas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis spas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the Bhagavat is the mother.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi nang nas byang chub kyi yan lag gcig ni yum rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi nang nas byang chub kyi yan lag gcig ni yum rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ste /
translated: Similarly, from among the seven limbs of enlightenment, one limb of enlightenment is the mother, Vajradhatviśvarī.

original: rigs kyi gnas btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: rigs kyi gnas btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: The limb of enlightenment of equanimity is the abode of the family.

original: gzhan pa rnams kyang sgra yi rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug ces pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan pa rnams kyang sgra yi rdo rje ma la sogs pa drug ces pa ste /
translated: The others are the six, Sound Vajrī, and so on.

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni sgra rdo rje ma dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni reg bya rdo rje ma dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gzugs rdo rje ma ste /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni sgra rdo rje ma dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni reg bya rdo rje ma dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gzugs rdo rje ma ste /
translated: The limb of enlightenment of mindfulness is Sound Vajrī, the limb of enlightenment of the analysis of phenomena is Touch Vajrī, the limb of enlightenment of diligence is Form Vajrī,

original: lus kyi dbye bas nye ba'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi dbye bas nye ba'i zhing ngo //
translated: the body divisions are the adjacent field.

original: de bzhin du dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni dri rdo rje ma dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni rdo rje ma dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni chos kyi khams kyi rdo rje ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni dri rdo rje ma dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni rdo rje ma dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni chos kyi khams kyi rdo rje ma ste /
translated: Likewise, the branch of enlightenment of correct joy is Gandhavajra, the branch of enlightenment of correct pliancy is Vajra, and the branch of enlightenment of correct meditative stabilization is Dharma-realm Vajra.

original: zhing rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: zhing rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: These are the two types of fields.

original: de bzhin du chu gter yang dag spong ba rnams dang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu gter yang dag spong ba rnams dang zhes pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the four branches of enlightenment are the four oceans.

original: sdig pa ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir spong ba ni tsartsi k'a dang sdig pa skyes pa rnams spong ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni khyab 'jug ma dang / mi dge ba ma skyes pa rnams spong ba'i dge ba bskyed pa ni dbang phyug ma dang dge ba skyes pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su bsngo bas spong ba ni dpal chen mo ste /
analyzed: sdig pa ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir spong ba ni tsartsi k'a dang sdig pa skyes pa rnams spong ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni khyab 'jug ma dang / mi dge ba ma skyes pa rnams spong ba'i dge ba bskyed pa ni dbang phyug ma dang dge ba skyes pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su bsngo bas spong ba ni dpal chen mo ste /
translated: The root of merit that is the abandonment of non-virtue that has not arisen is Cārvāka, the abandonment of non-virtue that has arisen is Viṣṇu, the generation of virtue that is the abandonment of non-virtue that has not arisen is Īśvara, and the abandonment of virtue that has arisen through dedicating it to buddhahood is Mahāśrī.

original: nye ba'i tshan do ha bzhi'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i tshan do ha bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four proximate tantras.

original: gzhan pa chu gter lha mo bzhi ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan pa chu gter lha mo bzhi ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang par 'gyur te /
translated: The other four goddesses of the oceans are the four bases of magical powers.

original: de la 'dun pa'i @172b rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni tshangs ma dang / brtson 'grus kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni dbang mo dang / sems kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni phag mo dang / dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni gzhon nu ma'o zhes pa tshan do ha'i dbye ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'dun pa'i @172b rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni tshangs ma dang / brtson 'grus kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni dbang mo dang / sems kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni phag mo dang / dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni gzhon nu ma'o zhes pa tshan do ha'i dbye ba ste /
translated: Here, the base of magical power of aspiration is Brahma, the base of magical power of effort is Vaishnavi, the base of magical power of mind is Varahi, and the base of magical power of investigation is Kumari.

original: de ltar brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are eight.

original: de bzhin du khro mo lnga ni stobs rnams dag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du khro mo lnga ni stobs rnams dag ste /
translated: Similarly, the five wrathful goddesses are the five powers.

original: 'dir dad pa'i stobs ni shin tu sngon mo dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs ni shin tu stobs ma dang / dran pa'i stobs ni rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs ni nga rgyal ma dang / shes rab kyi stobs ni tsun d'a ste /
analyzed: 'dir dad pa'i stobs ni shin tu sngon mo dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs ni shin tu stobs ma dang / dran pa'i stobs ni rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs ni nga rgyal ma dang / shes rab kyi stobs ni tsun d'a ste /
translated: Here, the power of faith is Chattra, the power of effort is Bala, the power of mindfulness is Vajra-asha, the power of samadhi is Maha-mada, and the power of wisdom is Cunda.

original: nye ba'i 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i 'dus pa'o //
translated: This is the close assembly.

original: de bzhin du rab tu gsal zhing nges par dbang po rnams ni lnga nyid do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rab tu gsal zhing nges par dbang po rnams ni lnga nyid do zhes pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the very clear and ascertained faculties are five.

original: de bzhin du dad pa'i dbang po ni rengs byed ma dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ni rmugs byed ma dang / dran pa'i dbang po ni 'od zer can dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni khro gnyer can dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ni drag spyan ma'o zhes pa 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dad pa'i dbang po ni rengs byed ma dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ni rmugs byed ma dang / dran pa'i dbang po ni 'od zer can dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni khro gnyer can dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ni drag spyan ma'o zhes pa 'dus pa ste /
translated: Thus, the faculty of faith is Pukkasi, the faculty of perseverance is Caṇḍālī, the faculty of mindfulness is Ḍombinī, the faculty of samādhi is Ṭakkiṇī, and the faculty of wisdom is Lāmā.

original: de ltar bcu'o //
analyzed: de ltar bcu'o //
translated: Thus, there are ten.🔽The eight branches of the right path are the eight lords of men born from the asuras.

original: yang dag yan lag brgyad kyi lam ni mi yi bdag po lha min dag las skyes pa brgyad du 'gyur zhes pa la 'dir yang dag pa'i lta ba ni khyi gdong ma dang yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni bya rog gdong ma dang / yang dag pa'i ngag ni stag gdong ma dang /
analyzed: yang dag yan lag brgyad kyi lam ni mi yi bdag po lha min dag las skyes pa brgyad du 'gyur zhes pa la 'dir yang dag pa'i lta ba ni khyi gdong ma dang yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni bya rog gdong ma dang / yang dag pa'i ngag ni stag gdong ma dang /
translated: Here, the right view is Śvānavaktrā, right thought is Kākavaktrā, right speech is Vyāghravaktrā,

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni 'ug gdong ma dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni ce sbyang gdong ma dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni mkha' lding gdong ma dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa ni phag gdong ma dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bya rgod gdong ma ste /🔽de ltar na sum cu rtsa bdun rab tu dbye bas srid pa gsum gyi gnas su byang chub phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa de rnams mtha' dag rnal 'byor ma rnams sa yi steng gi gnas su rnal 'byor ba yis rig par bya ste g-yung mo la sogs
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni 'ug gdong ma dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni ce sbyang gdong ma dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni mkha' lding gdong ma dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa ni phag gdong ma dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bya rgod gdong ma ste / de ltar na sum cu rtsa bdun rab tu dbye bas srid pa gsum gyi gnas su byang chub phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa de rnams mtha' dag rnal 'byor ma rnams sa yi steng gi gnas su rnal 'byor ba yis rig par bya ste g-yung mo la sogs
translated: The right action is Uḍḍiyāṇī, the right livelihood is Śavara, the right effort is Garuḍa, the right mindfulness is Varahi, and the right concentration is Gṛdhrāṇī.🔽Thus, the thirty-seven factors of awakening in the three realms are all known by the yogin in the places on the earth of the yoginīs, such as the Yoginī of the Navel, and so on.

original: pa'o // de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyis rnam par sbyangs pa'i gnas la sogs pa ni chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa'o // de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyis rnam par sbyangs pa'i gnas la sogs pa ni chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The places such as the purified place and so on are the characteristics of the dharmakāya.

original: mi yi bdag po phyi dang lus la yang de bzhin zhes pa thams cad du nges pa'o //
analyzed: mi yi bdag po phyi dang lus la yang de bzhin zhes pa thams cad du nges pa'o //
translated: The lord of men should do the same with regard to the external and the body.

original: @173a * // da ni sangs rgyas pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'di rnams bsten pa'i slad du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi spyod pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: @173a * // da ni sangs rgyas pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'di rnams bsten pa'i slad du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi spyod pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to serve these, he declares the rule of conduct for the yogis, beginning with “the Buddhist,” etc.

original: 'dir rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba ni dkyil 'khor thams cad du dbang bskur ba ste mu stegs pa rnams kyi lha dang / lha mo khyab 'jug dang / drag po la sogs pa rnams dang / tsartsi k'a la sogs pa rnam par sbyangs pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la yang sgrub pa po'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba ni dkyil 'khor thams cad du dbang bskur ba ste mu stegs pa rnams kyi lha dang / lha mo khyab 'jug dang / drag po la sogs pa rnams dang / tsartsi k'a la sogs pa rnam par sbyangs pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la yang sgrub pa po'o //
translated: Here, the consecration in the mandala of the king of tantras, the Kālacakra, is the consecration in all mandalas, of the gods and goddesses of the tīrthikas, Viṣṇu, Śiva, etc., and of the yoginīs, Caṇḍikā, etc.

original: des na rnal 'byor pa de nyid thob pa ste dbang bskur ba ni ye shes sam /
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor pa de nyid thob pa ste dbang bskur ba ni ye shes sam /
translated: Therefore, the consecration of that yogi, who has attained reality, is the gnosis,

original: 'jig rten pa'i las rab 'byam bsgrub pa'i don du sangs rgyas par gyur kyang rung zhi ba pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i las rab 'byam bsgrub pa'i don du sangs rgyas par gyur kyang rung zhi ba pa'am /
translated: or the worldly activity, for the sake of accomplishing the extensive.

original: gcer bu pa dad pa mchog tu gyur pa'am /🔽skal ldan nam gtsang gnas sam /
analyzed: gcer bu pa dad pa mchog tu gyur pa'am / skal ldan nam gtsang gnas sam /
translated: The Nirgranthas are called those of supreme faith,🔽those of good fortune, those of pure abodes,🔽🔽

original: de bzhin du bram ze'am thod pa can nam skra 'bral zhes pa zad byed par gyur kyang rung gos dkar pa'am zhing skyong du gyur kyang rung ste dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bram ze'am thod pa can nam skra 'bral zhes pa zad byed par gyur kyang rung gos dkar pa'am zhing skyong du gyur kyang rung ste dag pa'o //
translated: The Nirgranthas, the Naked Ones, are those who are devoted to the highest faith, or are fortunate, or are pure in conduct, or are Brahmans, or are skull-bearers, or are shaven-headed, or are extinctionists, or are white-garbed, or are field-protectors.

original: thub pa'am bsnyon ba'i gzugs can nam rig pa can nam sdig pa med pa'i sems ldan mkhas pa'am /
analyzed: thub pa'am bsnyon ba'i gzugs can nam rig pa can nam sdig pa med pa'i sems ldan mkhas pa'am /
translated: They are pure in that they are sages, or are in the form of ascetics, or are rationalists, or are sinless, or are wise, or are students.

original: slob gnyer pa yang rung ste rnal 'byor pa ni dngos grub don slad mtha' dag yon tan gter te mi yi dbang //
analyzed: slob gnyer pa yang rung ste rnal 'byor pa ni dngos grub don slad mtha' dag yon tan gter te mi yi dbang //
translated: The yogi is a treasure of all good qualities for the sake of spiritual attainment, and is the lord of men.

original: yid la gang 'dod pa'i spyod pa de ji srid grub par gyur gyi bar du spas te bya zhing /
analyzed: yid la gang 'dod pa'i spyod pa de ji srid grub par gyur gyi bar du spas te bya zhing /
translated: One should practice whatever conduct one desires, as long as it is conducive to spiritual attainment.

original: de nas nus pa las 'jig rten las 'das pa mngon du bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nas nus pa las 'jig rten las 'das pa mngon du bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Then, one should manifest the supramundane by means of one's ability. This is the definitive statement of the Tathagata.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las rab tu gnas pa dang tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i cho ga dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i mdor bsdus chen po
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las rab tu gnas pa dang tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i cho ga dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i mdor bsdus chen po
translated: The Stainless Light, a commentary on the Condensed Tantra, the King of Tantras, the Wheel of Time, which is a twelve-thousand-chapter text that follows the root tantra, contains chapters on consecration, the ritual of the feast offering, and the great summary of the yoga practice.

original: ste lnga pa'o /
analyzed: ste lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifth part.

original: // / phyag gi phyag rgya lnga stangs kyis //
analyzed: // / phyag gi phyag rgya lnga stangs kyis //
translated: The one who, with the five mudras of his hands,

original: gang gis lha min dbang skrag mdzad //
analyzed: gang gis lha min dbang skrag mdzad //
translated: Terrifies the lord of the demigods,

original: dus kyi 'khor lo der btud nas //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo der btud nas //
translated: I bow to that Wheel of Time

original: phyag rgya la sogs mtshan nyid bshad //
analyzed: phyag rgya la sogs mtshan nyid bshad //
translated: And explain the characteristics of the mudras and so forth.🔽The one who, with the concise tantra,

original: smra mkhas kyis ni bsdus rgyud kyis //
analyzed: smra mkhas kyis ni bsdus rgyud kyis //
translated: Explains the mudras, gazes, and limbs

original: ji ltar rgyud chen las byung ba //🔽phyag rgya lta stangs yan lag brnga //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyud chen las byung ba // phyag rgya lta stangs yan lag brnga //
translated: As they appear in the great tantra,

original: thams cad 'grel pas rgyas par bya /
analyzed: thams cad 'grel pas rgyas par bya /
translated: I explain all of them in detail in this commentary.

original: 'dir phyag rgya bcing ba'i don du rgan @173b po mthe bo la sogs pa sor mo rnams kyi ming ste rgan po ni mthe bo dang / de nas gnyis pa ni mdzub mo dang / gsum pa ni gung mo dang bzhi pa ni ming med do //
analyzed: 'dir phyag rgya bcing ba'i don du rgan @173b po mthe bo la sogs pa sor mo rnams kyi ming ste rgan po ni mthe bo dang / de nas gnyis pa ni mdzub mo dang / gsum pa ni gung mo dang bzhi pa ni ming med do //
translated: Here, the names of the fingers, beginning with the thumb, are for the purpose of binding the mudra. The elder is the thumb, the second is the index finger, the third is the middle finger, and the fourth is the ring finger.

original: ming med de'i mthar mthe chung ni mtha' dag yon tan gter te nam mkha'i khams nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ming med de'i mthar mthe chung ni mtha' dag yon tan gter te nam mkha'i khams nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: At the end of the ring finger, the little finger is the treasure of all good qualities, because it is the space element.

original: rnal 'byor pa yis slob dpon gyi man ngag gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis slob dpon gyi man ngag gis rig par bya'o //
translated: The yogi should know this through the oral instruction of the master.

original: de ltar phyag rgya bcing ba'i don du ming gi dbye bar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni dri dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / sgra'i yon tan gyi dbang gis de rim pas so //
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya bcing ba'i don du ming gi dbye bar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis zhes pa ni dri dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / sgra'i yon tan gyi dbang gis de rim pas so //
translated: Thus, the division of the names is for the purpose of binding the mudra. By the power of the qualities means that by the power of the qualities of smell, form, taste, touch, and sound, they are in order.

original: de bzhin du bcing ba brjod par gyur na rdo rje bcing bzhes par 'gyur zhing nges pa las khu tshur bcing ba byas par gyur na rdo rje'i khu tshur bcing ba zhes pa nges pa ste de bzhin du zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcing ba brjod par gyur na rdo rje bcing bzhes par 'gyur zhing nges pa las khu tshur bcing ba byas par gyur na rdo rje'i khu tshur bcing ba zhes pa nges pa ste de bzhin du zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, if one says “binding,” it becomes “vajra binding.” If one makes a fist from the certainty, it becomes “vajra fist binding.”

original: da ni rgyal ba'i bdag po'i phyag rgya gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rgyal ba'i bdag po'i phyag rgya gsungs te /
translated: Now the mudrā of the lord of victors is taught.

original: 'dir lag pa gnyi gas rdo rje khu tshur bcings nas /
analyzed: 'dir lag pa gnyi gas rdo rje khu tshur bcings nas /
translated: Here, having made a vajra fist with both hands,

original: khu tshur gyis mthe bo bsdams pa dag brla g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i steng du rdo rje'i 'dug stangs la gnas pa ni rdo rje'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu tshur gyis mthe bo bsdams pa dag brla g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i steng du rdo rje'i 'dug stangs la gnas pa ni rdo rje'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: the fists with the thumbs bound are placed on the right and left thighs in the vajra posture. This becomes the vajra mudrā.

original: da ni mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya gsungs te /
translated: Now the mudrā of Akṣobhya is taught.

original: sngar skyil krung byas nas skyil krung de la lag pa g-yon pa gan rkyal du 'gyur te g-yas pa pus mo g-yas pa'i phyogs nas ji srid sa la reg pa'i bar du sal son par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sngar skyil krung byas nas skyil krung de la lag pa g-yon pa gan rkyal du 'gyur te g-yas pa pus mo g-yas pa'i phyogs nas ji srid sa la reg pa'i bar du sal son par gyur pa ste /
translated: Having previously made the cross-legged posture, in that cross-legged posture, the left hand is placed face down, and the right hand, from the side of the right knee, is extended to the ground.

original: de ltar sa la reg pa mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sa la reg pa mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Thus, touching the earth is the mudrā of Akṣhobhya.

original: slar yang rim pa de nyid kyis te 'on kyang lag pa g-yas pa gan rkyal ni phyag na rin chen gyi mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: slar yang rim pa de nyid kyis te 'on kyang lag pa g-yas pa gan rkyal ni phyag na rin chen gyi mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Again, by the same process, but with the right hand lying flat, is the mudrā of Ratnasaṃbhava, the boon-granting mudrā.

original: de bzhin du skyil krung la lag pa g-yon pa'i steng du lag pa g-yas pa gan rkyal mnyam par gnas pa ni phyag na padma ste /🔽snang ba mtha' yas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyil krung la lag pa g-yon pa'i steng du lag pa g-yas pa gan rkyal mnyam par gnas pa ni phyag na padma ste / snang ba mtha' yas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Likewise, with the right hand lying flat on the left hand in the lap, is the mudrā of Amitābha, the lotus mudrā.

original: de bzhin du lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil gan rkyal du skyil krung gi steng du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil gan rkyal du skyil krung gi steng du ste /
translated: Likewise, with the left hand lying flat in the lap,

original: gzhan pa lag pa g-yas pa'i mthil pus mo g-yas pa'i steng du 'jigs pa med pa rab tu sbyin pa ni phyag na ral gri zhes pa don yod grub pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa lag pa g-yas pa'i mthil pus mo g-yas pa'i steng du 'jigs pa med pa rab tu sbyin pa ni phyag na ral gri zhes pa don yod grub pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: and the right hand lying flat on the right knee, granting fearlessness, is the mudrā of Amoghasiddhi, the sword mudrā.

original: de bzhin du g-yas pa'i khu tshur g-yas min gyi khu tshur la @174a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas pa'i khu tshur g-yas min gyi khu tshur la @174a * //
translated: Likewise, with the right hand in a fist,

original: ste mdzub mo g-yon pa gang yin pa de slar yang gzhan steng du khu tshur bcings pa la mdzub mo rab tu zhugs pa 'di ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya ste 'di ni gsal bar snying khar son pa'o //
analyzed: ste mdzub mo g-yon pa gang yin pa de slar yang gzhan steng du khu tshur bcings pa la mdzub mo rab tu zhugs pa 'di ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya ste 'di ni gsal bar snying khar son pa'o //
translated: The left forefinger is again bent into the other fist, and the forefinger is inserted. This is the mudra of Vairocana's supreme enlightenment, which is clearly located at the heart.

original: de bzhin du gzhan pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya ni lag pa g-yon pa dang / g-yas pa'i mdzub mo mthe bo sbyar ba gdu bu bzhin du gyur cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya ni lag pa g-yon pa dang / g-yas pa'i mdzub mo mthe bo sbyar ba gdu bu bzhin du gyur cing /
translated: Similarly, the other dharmacakra mudra is the left and right forefingers joined to the thumbs, becoming like a bracelet.

original: zlum po g-yon pa'i sen mo 'dus pa la g-yas pa'i sen mo 'dus pa ston pa'i sbyor bas gung mo la sogs pa brkyang ba ming med dang / mthe chung cung zad steng du'o zhes pa snying ga'i phyogs su chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: zlum po g-yon pa'i sen mo 'dus pa la g-yas pa'i sen mo 'dus pa ston pa'i sbyor bas gung mo la sogs pa brkyang ba ming med dang / mthe chung cung zad steng du'o zhes pa snying ga'i phyogs su chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: The left nail is gathered, and the right nail is shown to be gathered. The middle finger, etc., are extended by the application of the ring finger and little finger slightly above. This is the dharmacakra mudra at the heart.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the definitive enumeration of the six tathagatas.

original: da ni mchog gi phyag rgya gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni mchog gi phyag rgya gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the supreme mudra is stated:

original: 'dir rang gi lus la go cha chen po'i don du lag pa g-yon la shin tu gang ba'i dri med ri bong 'dzin pa zhes pa ni 'dir /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi lus la go cha chen po'i don du lag pa g-yon la shin tu gang ba'i dri med ri bong 'dzin pa zhes pa ni 'dir /
translated: Here, the left hand is for the sake of the great armor. The “stainless rabbit-holder filled to the left” is

original: aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs bcva lnga'i bdag nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs bcva lnga'i bdag nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: the moon maṇḍala, the nature of the fifteen vowels beginning with A.

original: lag pa g-yon la shin tu gang ba'i dri med ri bong 'dzin pa cha bcva lnga yongs su rdzogs pa'o //🔽aa ai ri au li /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon la shin tu gang ba'i dri med ri bong 'dzin pa cha bcva lnga yongs su rdzogs pa'o // aa ai ri au li /
translated: The stainless rabbit-holder filled to the left is the complete fifteen parts.🔽A I R I U L🔽A E AR O AL HA YA RA WA LA

original: aa ae aar ao aal ha ya ra wa la zhes pa ni dbyangs rnams so //
analyzed: aa ae aar ao aal ha ya ra wa la zhes pa ni dbyangs rnams so //
translated: are the vowels.

original: de bzhin du lag pa g-yas la rdo rje nyi ma dbyangs bcva lnga'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa g-yas la rdo rje nyi ma dbyangs bcva lnga'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Similarly, the vajra sun is in the right hand, the nature of the fifteen vowels.🔽LA WA RA YA HA A LA AO A RA AI A LAU RI AI A A

original: l'a w'a r'a y'a h'a a'a la aoo a'a ra aee a'a l'i a'u r'i a'i a'a zhes pa ni yang dag par gang ba'i nyi ma'o //
analyzed: l'a w'a r'a y'a h'a a'a la aoo a'a ra aee a'a l'i a'u r'i a'i a'a zhes pa ni yang dag par gang ba'i nyi ma'o //
translated: is the completely full sun.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di dag yang dag sbyar ba rdo rje 'jigs byed de drag po'i rdo rje khro bo las skyes zhes pa /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di dag yang dag sbyar ba rdo rje 'jigs byed de drag po'i rdo rje khro bo las skyes zhes pa /
translated: These sun and moon are the union of Vajrabhairava, born from the wrathful vajra anger.

original: hum yig las skyes pa'i rtse mo lnga pa bsgoms nas /
analyzed: hum yig las skyes pa'i rtse mo lnga pa bsgoms nas /
translated: Having visualized the five-pronged vajra born from the syllable hūṃ,

original: rdo rje de dang 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rdo rje'i phyag rgyas yan lag thams cad la reg par bya ste cod pan dang bcas zhes pa gtsug tor dang bcas pa'i mgo nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthar zhes pa rkang pa'i sen mo'i mthar thug pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: rdo rje de dang 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rdo rje'i phyag rgyas yan lag thams cad la reg par bya ste cod pan dang bcas zhes pa gtsug tor dang bcas pa'i mgo nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthar zhes pa rkang pa'i sen mo'i mthar thug pa nyid du'o //
translated: one should touch all the limbs with that vajra and the vajra-seal to be described, beginning with the head together with the crown-protrusion, and ending with the toes, ending with the tips of the toes.

original: 'di ni rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i dpal ldan mchog gi phyag rgya ste thams cad srung zhing sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i dpal ldan mchog gi phyag rgya ste thams cad srung zhing sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'o //
translated: This is the glorious supreme seal of the king Kālacakra, which protects all and steals away the stains of sin.

original: de bzhin du phyag rgya 'dis gang zhig cung zad gzung bar bya ba'i @174b dngos po sa skyes chu skyes kyi dam tshig dang mngal skyes sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyag rgya 'dis gang zhig cung zad gzung bar bya ba'i @174b dngos po sa skyes chu skyes kyi dam tshig dang mngal skyes sam /
translated: Similarly, whatever thing is to be grasped by this seal, whether born of earth or born of water, born of a womb,

original: drod gsher las skyes pa'am /🔽sogs pa'i sgras rus ba las skyes pa'i dam tshig gam /
analyzed: drod gsher las skyes pa'am /🔽sogs pa'i sgras rus ba las skyes pa'i dam tshig gam /
translated: or born of heat and moisture,🔽or born of bone,

original: de bzhin du du bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / dpa' bo dang bcas te sha dang bcas pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas sbyang ba dang rgyas pa dang rab tu 'bar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du du bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / dpa' bo dang bcas te sha dang bcas pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas sbyang ba dang rgyas pa dang rab tu 'bar bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should eat the smoke, drink the smoke, and with the hero and with the flesh, one should purify, expand, and inflame in the sequence to be explained.

original: de bzhin du bla ma dang ni zhabs dag la yang ste lha'i sku la rang gi rkang pa bgrod pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bla ma dang ni zhabs dag la yang ste lha'i sku la rang gi rkang pa bgrod pa'i don du'o //
translated: Likewise, one should touch the guru and the feet, for the purpose of traversing the divine body with one's own feet.

original: gang gang bya ba nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur pa'i dngos po gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gang bya ba nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur pa'i dngos po gang yin pa ste /
translated: Whatever thing is employed for whatever action,

original: yon tan dbang gis zhes pa snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang dri la sogs pa'i yul gyi dbang gis bya ba de la phyag rgya des reg nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan dbang gis zhes pa snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang dri la sogs pa'i yul gyi dbang gis bya ba de la phyag rgya des reg nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: by the power of the qualities, by the power of the objects of sattva, rajas, tamas, smell, and so on, having touched that action with that seal, one should employ it.

original: sa la sogs la dkyil 'khor gyi don dang / rkang pa bgrod pa'i don du rnal 'byor pas phyag rgya 'di yis bsnun par bya ste mchog gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs la dkyil 'khor gyi don dang / rkang pa bgrod pa'i don du rnal 'byor pas phyag rgya 'di yis bsnun par bya ste mchog gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: For the purpose of the mandala of earth, and so on, and for the purpose of traversing the feet, the yogi should strike with this seal, the supreme seal.

original: da ni khro bo'i mgon po'i phyag rgya gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni khro bo'i mgon po'i phyag rgya gsungs te /
translated: Now, the seal of the wrathful lord is stated.

original: 'dir lag pa dag gis rdo rje bcings pa zhes pa la 'dir lag pa g-yas pa dang lag pa g-yon pa'i mkhrig ma steng dang 'og tu rab tu zhugs shing dpung pa dang / nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs kyi steng du rdo rje khu tshur gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lag pa dag gis rdo rje bcings pa zhes pa la 'dir lag pa g-yas pa dang lag pa g-yon pa'i mkhrig ma steng dang 'og tu rab tu zhugs shing dpung pa dang / nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs kyi steng du rdo rje khu tshur gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: Here, the vajra-binding with the hands means that the right and left wrists are placed above and below, and the vajra fists are placed on top of the joints of the shoulders and forearms.

original: de bzhin du lag pa g-yon pa yang rdo rje bcings pas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa g-yon pa yang rdo rje bcings pas te /
translated: Likewise, the left hand is also in the vajra-binding.

original: nges par khro bo'i mgon po chen po'i phyag rgyar 'gyur zhes pa rdo rje shugs kyi'o //
analyzed: nges par khro bo'i mgon po chen po'i phyag rgyar 'gyur zhes pa rdo rje shugs kyi'o //
translated: It becomes the mudra of the great wrathful lord, the vajra-speed.

original: de bzhin du mdzub mo thog mtha' bcings shing zhes pa ni 'dir mdzub mo dag phan tshun du lcags kyu bcings shing mtha' zhes pa mthe chung gnyis po dag bcings te lag pa'i rgyab sbyar bas khu tshur bcings la mthe bo dag khu tshur gyi nang du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzub mo thog mtha' bcings shing zhes pa ni 'dir mdzub mo dag phan tshun du lcags kyu bcings shing mtha' zhes pa mthe chung gnyis po dag bcings te lag pa'i rgyab sbyar bas khu tshur bcings la mthe bo dag khu tshur gyi nang du'o //
translated: Likewise, the index fingers are bound at the ends means that the index fingers are bound in an opposing hook, and the ends, i.e., the two little fingers, are bound and the backs of the hands are joined to form a fist, with the thumbs inside the fists.

original: de ltar gtso bo srid pa gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i zhes pa 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i ste snying khar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gtso bo srid pa gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i zhes pa 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i ste snying khar gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus, the principal one is the “total victory over the three worlds,” that is, the total victory over the three worlds, which is located in the heart.

original: mtshan ma'i rnam pa dag kyang lhag ma rnams te rab gsal nges par lha dang lha mo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rnam pa dag kyang lhag ma rnams te rab gsal nges par lha dang lha mo rnams kyi'o //
translated: The remaining ones are the forms of the signs, which are the gods and goddesses, who are clearly defined.

original: de bzhin du klu rnams kyi phyag rgya ni lag pa dag gis rdo re bcings pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du klu rnams kyi phyag rgya ni lag pa dag gis rdo re bcings pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the mudrā of the nāgas is the “binding of the stones with the hands.”

original: 'dir g-yon pa'i dpung pa dag nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshogs kyi @175a * //
analyzed: 'dir g-yon pa'i dpung pa dag nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshogs kyi @175a * //
translated: Here, the left arm is on top of the collection of the forearms,🔽and the right arm and forearm are bound on top of the left arm and forearm,

original: steng du g-yas pa'i dpung pa dang nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs bcings pa dang / lag pa g-yon pa'i nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs lag pa g-yas pa'i nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs kyi steng du ste /
analyzed: steng du g-yas pa'i dpung pa dang nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs bcings pa dang / lag pa g-yon pa'i nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs lag pa g-yas pa'i nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs kyi steng du ste /
translated: and the left hand is on top of the right hand.

original: lag pa g-yon pa dang g-yas pa g-yo ba'i gdengs ka'i rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa dang g-yas pa g-yo ba'i gdengs ka'i rnam pa dag go //
translated: The left and right hands are in the form of hoods that move.

original: de ltar g-yo ba'i gdengs ka'i rnam pa gdengs can rnams kyi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de ltar g-yo ba'i gdengs ka'i rnam pa gdengs can rnams kyi phyag rgya ste /
translated: Such is the mudra of the hooded ones, the form of the hood of the moving ones.

original: de ltar g-yas su bskor bas kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar g-yas su bskor bas kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that it is also done by turning to the right.

original: da ni mthe bo zhes pa la sogs pas mtshan ma'i phyag rgya gsungs pa /🔽'dir rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgya la lag pa sbyar ba byas nas mthe bo dag sbyar zhing mthe chung gnyis sbyar la de dag padma'i 'dab ma dang mtshungs la gung mo gnyis mnyam par dbus su brkyang ste /
analyzed: da ni mthe bo zhes pa la sogs pas mtshan ma'i phyag rgya gsungs pa / 'dir rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgya la lag pa sbyar ba byas nas mthe bo dag sbyar zhing mthe chung gnyis sbyar la de dag padma'i 'dab ma dang mtshungs la gung mo gnyis mnyam par dbus su brkyang ste /
translated: Now, beginning with “the thumbs,” he teaches the symbolic mudra.

original: mdzub mo gnyis gung mo dag gi rgyab kyi char phyed 'khyog pa zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa dang / ming med 'og tu bskum pa rang gi lag mthil son gyur pa de ltar phyag rgya 'di ni rdo rje can gyi rdo rje rtse mo lnga par 'gyur te bstan par bya ba'o zhes pas te /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis gung mo dag gi rgyab kyi char phyed 'khyog pa zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa dang / ming med 'og tu bskum pa rang gi lag mthil son gyur pa de ltar phyag rgya 'di ni rdo rje can gyi rdo rje rtse mo lnga par 'gyur te bstan par bya ba'o zhes pas te /
translated: Here, having made the gesture of the five-tined vajra, the thumbs are joined, the two little fingers are joined, and they are like lotus petals. The two middle fingers are extended straight up in the center. The two index fingers are bent in half at the level of the back of the middle fingers, in the form of a half-moon. The two pinkies are bent under, resting on the palm of the hand. In this way, this mudra becomes the five-tined vajra of the vajra holder.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i mchog gi phyag rgya yang 'di'o //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i mchog gi phyag rgya yang 'di'o //
translated: This is also the supreme mudra mentioned before.

original: de bzhin du rtsibs kyi rnam pa sor mo rnams te lag pa gnyi ga la gnas mthe bo la sogs mtha' dag rnams zhes pa ni rdo rje'i phyag rgya gzhan te shes rab la 'khyud pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsibs kyi rnam pa sor mo rnams te lag pa gnyi ga la gnas mthe bo la sogs mtha' dag rnams zhes pa ni rdo rje'i phyag rgya gzhan te shes rab la 'khyud pa'i don du'o //
translated: Similarly, the fingers are in the form of spokes, on both hands, all of them, beginning with the thumbs, are the other vajra mudra, for the purpose of embracing wisdom.

original: de bzhin du lag pa gnyis ni rdo rje bcings pa snga ma bzhin du rdo rje'i khu tshur gyis rdo rer 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa gnyis ni rdo rje bcings pa snga ma bzhin du rdo rje'i khu tshur gyis rdo rer 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, the two hands are the vajra bond as before, the vajra fists become the vajra,

original: g-yas pa steng du byas shing g-yon pa gang yin pa 'og tu khu tshur gyis dril bur 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du khu tshur phyed pa ming med dang mthe chung gi khu tshur gyi nang du mthe bo'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa steng du byas shing g-yon pa gang yin pa 'og tu khu tshur gyis dril bur 'gyur ro // de bzhin du khu tshur phyed pa ming med dang mthe chung gi khu tshur gyi nang du mthe bo'o //
translated: the right one is made uppermost, and the left one is the bell with the fist below.🔽Similarly, the half-fist is the thumb in the fist of the ring finger and little finger.

original: de ltar khu tshur phyed par mdzub mo dang ni gung mo sbyar ba mda' dang mtshungs pa dag kyang ral gri rnon por 'gyur zhes pa steng du ral gri'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khu tshur phyed par mdzub mo dang ni gung mo sbyar ba mda' dang mtshungs pa dag kyang ral gri rnon por 'gyur zhes pa steng du ral gri'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Thus, the half-fist with the index and middle fingers joined like an arrow also becomes the sharp sword, the sword mudra above.

original: de bzhin du mthe bo khu tshur phyed pa dang / mdzub mo la sogs zhes pa mdzub mo dang / gung mo dang / ming med rtse gsum gyi rnam pa slar yang bkram pa dag ste khu tshur phyed pa yis ni rtse gsum gyi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthe bo khu tshur phyed pa dang / mdzub mo la sogs zhes pa mdzub mo dang / gung mo dang / ming med rtse gsum gyi rnam pa slar yang bkram pa dag ste khu tshur phyed pa yis ni rtse gsum gyi phyag rgya ste /
translated: Likewise, the half-fist of the thumb, and the index finger, etc., that is, the index finger, the middle finger, and the ring finger in the form of a three-pronged [vajra], again spread out, are the mudra of the three-pronged [vajra] with the half-fist.

original: thams cad du yul gyi don la bdun pa'o //🔽@175b de bzhin du dpal ldan gri gug khu tshur bcings shing mthe chung zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa gdul dka' rnams 'jigs par byed par 'gyur zhes pa gri gug gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yul gyi don la bdun pa'o // @175b de bzhin du dpal ldan gri gug khu tshur bcings shing mthe chung zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa gdul dka' rnams 'jigs par byed par 'gyur zhes pa gri gug gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Everywhere, the seventh case [dative] is for the sake of the object.🔽Likewise, the glorious curved knife is the mudra of the curved knife, the fist bound with the little finger in the form of a half-moon, terrifying the difficult to tame.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i steng du khu tshur bcings shing gung mo'i steng du mthe bo dang 'og tu mdzub mo ste mda' yi mchog gi phyag rgya la zhes pa ni mda'i phyag rgya'o //
