analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i steng du khu tshur bcings shing gung mo'i steng du mthe bo dang 'og tu mdzub mo ste mda' yi mchog gi phyag rgya la zhes pa ni mda'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Likewise, the mudra of the supreme arrow is the mudra of the arrow, the fist bound above the ear with the middle finger above the thumb and the index finger below, [the other fingers] like an arrow.

original: lcags kyu la rdo rje khu tshur bcings shing mdzub mo khu tshur gyi steng du lcags kyu'i rnam par shin tu 'khyog po ni lcags kyu'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu la rdo rje khu tshur bcings shing mdzub mo khu tshur gyi steng du lcags kyu'i rnam par shin tu 'khyog po ni lcags kyu'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The hook gesture is made by forming a vajra fist and bending the index finger over the fist in the shape of a hook.

original: de bzhin du mthe cung dang mthe bo dag gis khu tshur dang ; mdzub mo dang / ming med 'og tu mda' dang mtshungs par sbyar zhing de dag gi steng du gung mo ni mdung las te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthe cung dang mthe bo dag gis khu tshur dang ; mdzub mo dang / ming med 'og tu mda' dang mtshungs par sbyar zhing de dag gi steng du gung mo ni mdung las te /
translated: Similarly, the spear gesture is made by forming a fist with the thumb and ring finger, and placing the index and little fingers together like an arrow, with the middle finger above them in the shape of a spear.

original: de ltar mdung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mdung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Thus, it is the spear gesture.

original: de bzhin du thad kar khu tshur dang dpung pa rab tu brkyang ba dbyug pa la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thad kar khu tshur dang dpung pa rab tu brkyang ba dbyug pa la ste /
translated: Similarly, the club gesture is made by forming a fist with the arms extended straight out to the sides.

original: de ltar dbyug pa'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dbyug pa'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it becomes the club gesture.

original: de bzhin du lag mthil shin tu mnyam la steng du mthe bo rab tu brkyang zhing thad ka'i char mdzub mo la sogs pa bzhi sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag mthil shin tu mnyam la steng du mthe bo rab tu brkyang zhing thad ka'i char mdzub mo la sogs pa bzhi sbyar ba ste /
translated: Similarly, the plow gesture is made by placing the palms together evenly, extending the thumbs upward, and joining the four fingers such as the index finger and so on in a straight line.

original: de ltar dgra sta'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dgra sta'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it becomes the plow gesture.

original: de bzhin du steng du khu tshur gnyis dang khu tshur gnyis kyi steng du yang mdzub mor 'gyur te lha min bdag po glang chen ni log 'dren te de'i pags pa dag la'o zhes pa glang po che'i pags pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du steng du khu tshur gnyis dang khu tshur gnyis kyi steng du yang mdzub mor 'gyur te lha min bdag po glang chen ni log 'dren te de'i pags pa dag la'o zhes pa glang po che'i pags pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Likewise, above, the two fists become two fingers, and above the two fists, the two fingers become the lord of the demigods, the elephant, the seducer, and his skin.

original: de bzhin du mche ba la ni lag pa gnyi ga'i mthil du khu tshur bcings shing mthe chung zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa g-yas dang g-yas min ni kha la bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mche ba la ni lag pa gnyi ga'i mthil du khu tshur bcings shing mthe chung zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa g-yas dang g-yas min ni kha la bstan par bya ste /
translated: Thus, for the tusk mudrā, make a fist with both hands, and the two little fingers are in the form of a half-moon, facing right and left.

original: de ltar mche ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mche ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Thus, it is the tusk mudrā.

original: lag pa g-yas kyi mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dang glang po che'i pags pas mche ba'i phyag rgya'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas kyi mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dang glang po che'i pags pas mche ba'i phyag rgya'i nges pa'o //
translated: The mudrā of the right-hand signs and the elephant skin are the ascertainment of the tusk mudrā.

original: da ni lag pa g-yon pa'i mtshan ma'i phyag rgya gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni lag pa g-yon pa'i mtshan ma'i phyag rgya gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the mudrā of the left-hand signs is stated:

original: de bzhin du khe ta ka la ste phub la dpung pa g-yon pa rab tu brkyang zhing lag pa'i mthil ni steng du son pa mi 'jigs pa'i lag mthil lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du khe ta ka la ste phub la dpung pa g-yon pa rab tu brkyang zhing lag pa'i mthil ni steng du son pa mi 'jigs pa'i lag mthil lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, the mudrā of the shield is to extend the left arm and place the palm of the hand above, like the palm of the hand of one who is fearless.

original: de ltar phub kyi phyag rgya'o //🔽de bzhin du kha tv'am ga la khu tshur bug pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar phub kyi phyag rgya'o // de bzhin du kha tv'am ga la khu tshur bug pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is the mudrā of the shield.

original: mdzub mo dang / gung mo dang / @176a * //
analyzed: mdzub mo dang / gung mo dang / @176a * //
translated: Likewise, the mudrā of the sword is to make a fist with the right hand,🔽with the index, middle,🔽and ring fingers joined to the thumb.

original: ming med dang mthe bo rnams sbyar zhing phrag pa'i gnas su mthe chung steng du rab tu brkyang pa ste /
analyzed: ming med dang mthe bo rnams sbyar zhing phrag pa'i gnas su mthe chung steng du rab tu brkyang pa ste /
translated: The little finger is extended above the shoulder.

original: de ltar kha tv'am ga'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar kha tv'am ga'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Thus, it is the mudrā of the sword.

original: de bzhin du thod pa la sor mo bug pa med pa'i lag pa pad 'dab lta bu gan rkyal ni thod pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thod pa la sor mo bug pa med pa'i lag pa pad 'dab lta bu gan rkyal ni thod pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Likewise, the mudrā of the skull cup is to make the hand with the fingers closed into a fist, like the petals of a lotus, and turn it face up.🔽Thus, it is the mudrā of the skull cup.

original: de bzhin du gzhu la rab tu brkyang ba'i lag pa gan rkyal khu tshur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhu la rab tu brkyang ba'i lag pa gan rkyal khu tshur te /
translated: Likewise, the mudrā of the bow is to make a fist with the right hand and turn it face down.

original: de ltar gzhu'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhu'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Thus, it is the mudrā of the bow.

original: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyi steng du gung mo dag ni mdzub mo 'khyog po rten pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyi steng du gung mo dag ni mdzub mo 'khyog po rten pa ste /
translated: Likewise, on the left fist, the two middle fingers are bent and supported by the crooked index fingers.

original: gnyis kyis dbus su bug pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis dbus su bug pa'o //
translated: The two thumbs are in the middle, hollow.

original: de ltar rdo rje zhags pa ste 'di ni lag pa gcig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje zhags pa ste 'di ni lag pa gcig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Thus is the vajra lasso. This is the mudra of one hand.

original: gzhan ni lag pa gnyis kyis cig car gyis te chu lha la sogs pa'i g-yas pa gang du rdo rje lcags kyu ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni lag pa gnyis kyis cig car gyis te chu lha la sogs pa'i g-yas pa gang du rdo rje lcags kyu ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The other is done simultaneously with both hands. For Varuna and so forth, the right hand is as seen for Vajra Hook.

original: de ltar zhags pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhags pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Thus is the mudra of the lasso.

original: de bzhin du sbyar ba ste 'dus pa'i ser mo lnga po rnams kyi dbus su gung mo byas nas steng du brkyang pa'i phyag ces pa ni rin po che'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar ba ste 'dus pa'i ser mo lnga po rnams kyi dbus su gung mo byas nas steng du brkyang pa'i phyag ces pa ni rin po che'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Likewise, the five yellow assembled ones are joined, and the middle fingers are made in the middle, extended upward. This is the mudra of the jewel.

original: lag pa g-yon pa'i padma'i phyag rgyal mthe bo dang mthe chung sbyar te mdzub mo la sogs pa ni phyogs rnams su'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa'i padma'i phyag rgyal mthe bo dang mthe chung sbyar te mdzub mo la sogs pa ni phyogs rnams su'o //
translated: In the lotus mudra of the left hand, the thumb and little finger are joined, and the index finger and so forth are in the directions.

original: de ltar sor mo rnams rnam par phye ba padma 'dab ma bzhi pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de ltar sor mo rnams rnam par phye ba padma 'dab ma bzhi pa lta bu ste /
translated: Thus the fingers are spread out like the four petals of a lotus.

original: lag pa gnyi ga dag gis padma 'dab ma brgyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag pa gnyi ga dag gis padma 'dab ma brgyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: With both hands, it becomes an eight-petaled lotus.

original: de ltar padma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar padma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Thus is the lotus seal.

original: de bzhin du da ma ru la gung mo dang ming med dag gis khu tshur bcings shing /
analyzed: de bzhin du da ma ru la gung mo dang ming med dag gis khu tshur bcings shing /
translated: Likewise, for the ḍamaru, the middle finger and the ring finger are bound into a fist.

original: mdzub mo lcags kyu'i rnam pa dang / mthe bo'i sen mo'i steng du mthe chung phyed 'khyog pa'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo lcags kyu'i rnam pa dang / mthe bo'i sen mo'i steng du mthe chung phyed 'khyog pa'o //
translated: The index finger is in the form of a hook, and the little finger is half-bent on top of the thumb nail.

original: de bzhin du tho ba la khu tshur bcings pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tho ba la khu tshur bcings pa'o //
translated: Likewise, for the hammer, [the fingers] are bound into a fist.

original: 'khor lo la sor mo thams cad rtsibs kyi rnam par rab tu brkyang ba lag pa gcig la ste lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo la sor mo thams cad rtsibs kyi rnam par rab tu brkyang ba lag pa gcig la ste lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil sbyar ba'o //
translated: For the wheel, all the fingers are fully extended in the form of spokes on one hand, with the palms of both hands joined.

original: de bzhin du mdzub mo dang mthe bo dag sbyar te mthe bo'i 'og tu mthe chung la sogs pa khu tshur dang / mthe bo dang mdzub mo rab tu brkyang ba dag dung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzub mo dang mthe bo dag sbyar te mthe bo'i 'og tu mthe chung la sogs pa khu tshur dang / mthe bo dang mdzub mo rab tu brkyang ba dag dung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Likewise, the thumb and index finger are joined, and the little finger and so forth are in a fist under the thumb, and the thumb and index finger are fully extended—this is the conch seal.

original: me long ni mngon du phyogs shing shin tu mnyam pa'i lag mthil g-yon pa ste /
analyzed: me long ni mngon du phyogs shing shin tu mnyam pa'i lag mthil g-yon pa ste /
translated: The mirror is the left palm, facing forward and very level.

original: me long gi phyag rgyal sor mo rnams bug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: me long gi phyag rgyal sor mo rnams bug pa med pa'o //
translated: The mirror gesture is the fingers without holes.

original: de bzhin du mdzub mo dang por byas nas mthe chung gi mthar @176b thug pa ste mthe bo'i steng du mdzub mo 'khyog po zlum po'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzub mo dang por byas nas mthe chung gi mthar @176b thug pa ste mthe bo'i steng du mdzub mo 'khyog po zlum po'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Similarly, having made the index finger first, up to the end of the little finger, the index finger is bent on top of the thumb, in the form of a circle.

original: de'i steng du gung mo'o //🔽gung mo'i steng du ming med do //
analyzed: de'i steng du gung mo'o // gung mo'i steng du ming med do //
translated: On top of that is the middle finger.🔽On top of the middle finger is the ring finger.

original: ming med kyi steng du mthe chung ngo //
analyzed: ming med kyi steng du mthe chung ngo //
translated: On top of the ring finger is the little finger.

original: de ltar lcags sgrog gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lcags sgrog gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Thus it is the chain gesture.

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i mgo bo la mthe bo la sogs bzhi po phan tshun sbyar bas gdong dang mtshungs shing 'og tu gdong rnams te mthe chung bskum pa ni mgo bo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i mgo bo la mthe bo la sogs bzhi po phan tshun sbyar bas gdong dang mtshungs shing 'og tu gdong rnams te mthe chung bskum pa ni mgo bo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Similarly, on the head of Brahmā, the four fingers beginning with the thumb are mutually joined, like a face, with the faces below, and the little finger is bent. This is the head gesture.

original: de bzhin du lag pa dag gis dung gi phyag rgya sbyar ba cod pan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa dag gis dung gi phyag rgya sbyar ba cod pan du 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, the conch gesture of the hands joined is the crown.

original: steng du mdzub mo gnyis sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: steng du mdzub mo gnyis sbyar ba'o //
translated: On top, the two index fingers are joined.

original: lag pa gnyi ga'i mthil gyi phyi phyogs sbyar te rgyab tu sor mo lnga po rnams ni rna rgyan la ni rna rgyan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyi ga'i mthil gyi phyi phyogs sbyar te rgyab tu sor mo lnga po rnams ni rna rgyan la ni rna rgyan gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The backs of the two hands are joined together, and the five fingers are like earrings.

original: de bzhin du lag pa'i rgyab tu sor mo rnams ni rim par yongs su bkod cing phan tshun bcings pa mgul pa'i rgyan la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa'i rgyab tu sor mo rnams ni rim par yongs su bkod cing phan tshun bcings pa mgul pa'i rgyan la ste /
translated: In the same way, the fingers are arranged in order on the back of the hand, and the fingers are bound together.

original: de ltar mgul rgyan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mgul rgyan gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the necklace mudrā.

original: de bzhin du ske rags la g-yon pa dang g-yas pa dag gi sor mo gsum ni ming med dang / gung mo dang / mdzub mo dag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ske rags la g-yon pa dang g-yas pa dag gi sor mo gsum ni ming med dang / gung mo dang / mdzub mo dag ste /
translated: In the same way, for the girdle, the three fingers of the left and right hands are the ring finger, middle finger, and index finger.

original: sor mo rtse mo sbyar zhing mthe chung dang / mthe bos khu tshur bcings pa ni ske rags kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sor mo rtse mo sbyar zhing mthe chung dang / mthe bos khu tshur bcings pa ni ske rags kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The tips of the fingers are joined, and the little finger and thumb are clenched into a fist. This is the girdle mudrā.

original: de bzhin du lag pa gnyi ga'i mthe bo gnyis dang gung mo gnyis sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa gnyi ga'i mthe bo gnyis dang gung mo gnyis sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, the two thumbs and two middle fingers of both hands are joined together.

original: de dag gis zlum skor lta bur byas shing sor mo lhag ma rnams kyis khu tshur bcings pa ni rkang gdub la ste /
analyzed: de dag gis zlum skor lta bur byas shing sor mo lhag ma rnams kyis khu tshur bcings pa ni rkang gdub la ste /
translated: They are made like a circle, and the remaining fingers are clenched into a fist. This is the anklet mudrā.

original: rkang gdub kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rkang gdub kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the seal of the anklet.

original: de bzhin du dpung rgyan nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpung rgyan nam /
translated: Likewise, the seal of the armlet🔽or bracelet is formed by joining the thumb and index finger in a circle.

original: gdu bu la mthe bo sbyar ba dang / mdzub mo sbyar ba zlum skor lta bur 'gyur zhes te bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan ma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gdu bu la mthe bo sbyar ba dang / mdzub mo sbyar ba zlum skor lta bur 'gyur zhes te bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan ma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the seal of the signs of the Blessed One.

original: da ni mthe bo zhes pa la sogs pas rigs kyi phyag rgya gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni mthe bo zhes pa la sogs pas rigs kyi phyag rgya gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “the thumb,” he teaches the family seals.

original: 'dir rdo rje khu tshur gyi steng du mthe bo bstan pa ni mkha' 'gro ma thams cad kyi thun mong du rigs kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje khu tshur gyi steng du mthe bo bstan pa ni mkha' 'gro ma thams cad kyi thun mong du rigs kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the thumb displayed on top of the vajra fist becomes the family seal common to all dakinis.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje khu tshur gyi steng du mdzub mo rab tu brkyang ba ni gsang ba pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje khu tshur gyi steng du mdzub mo rab tu brkyang ba ni gsang ba pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the index finger fully extended on top of the vajra fist is the secret one,

original: gnod sbyin rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: the family seal of the yakshas.

original: de bzhin du khu tshur bcings pa las gung mo rab tu brkyang ste bstan pa ni dri za rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du khu tshur bcings pa las gung mo rab tu brkyang ste bstan pa ni dri za rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the middle finger fully extended and displayed from the clenched fist becomes the family seal of the gandharvas.

original: @177a * // de bzhin du ming med ni gdengs can rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: @177a * // de bzhin du ming med ni gdengs can rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, the mudrā without a name is the family of the nāgas.

original: mthe chung bstan pa ni 'byung po rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthe chung bstan pa ni 'byung po rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The mudrā of the little finger is the family of the bhūtas.

original: de bzhin nyid du steng du sor mo bzhi po rnams kyis khu tshur bcings te lag pa'i mthil rab tu gsal bar bstan pa ni srin po rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du steng du sor mo bzhi po rnams kyis khu tshur bcings te lag pa'i mthil rab tu gsal bar bstan pa ni srin po rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the mudrā of the four fingers above, clenched into a fist, with the palm of the hand clearly displayed, is the family of the rākṣasas.

original: khu tshur bcings te bstan pa ni grub pa rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du dpung pa dang nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs ni lha rnams kyi rigs so //🔽de bzhin du lag pa'i rgyab kyi mthil ni tshangs pa'i srin po'i'o //
analyzed: khu tshur bcings te bstan pa ni grub pa rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur ro // de bzhin du dpung pa dang nye ba'i dpung pa'i tshigs ni lha rnams kyi rigs so // de bzhin du lag pa'i rgyab kyi mthil ni tshangs pa'i srin po'i'o //
translated: The mudrā of the clenched fist is the family of the siddhas.🔽In the same way, the joints of the shoulder and upper arm are the family of the gods.🔽In the same way, the back of the hand is the family of the Brahm-rākṣasas.

original: de bzhin du nye ba'i dpung pa dang / lag pa'i tshigs bstan pa ni ro langs rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nye ba'i dpung pa dang / lag pa'i tshigs bstan pa ni ro langs rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, the joints of the upper arm and forearm are the family of the vetālas.

original: de ltar phyag rgya rnam pa brgyad ni rigs brgyad las skyes pa rnams la lag pa g-yon pas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya rnam pa brgyad ni rigs brgyad las skyes pa rnams la lag pa g-yon pas bstan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the eight gestures are shown with the left hand to those born in the eight clans.

original: da ni lag pa zhes pa la sogs pas dud 'gro'i gdong can rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgya gsungs te /🔽'dir lag pa gcig gam /
analyzed: da ni lag pa zhes pa la sogs pas dud 'gro'i gdong can rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgya gsungs te / 'dir lag pa gcig gam /
translated: Now, the gestures of the animal-faced [deities] are stated beginning with [the verse] hand [and so on].

original: gnyi ga'i mthil du sor mo lnga po rnams phyed 'khyog pa seng ge'i sder mo'i rnam pas sder mo can rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i mthil du sor mo lnga po rnams phyed 'khyog pa seng ge'i sder mo'i rnam pas sder mo can rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Here, the gesture of the maned [deities] is the five fingers on one or both palms half-bent in the form of a lion's claw.

original: de bzhin du khu tshur bcings pa las lag pa gnyi ga'i khu tshur gyi steng du mdzub mo gnyis po phyed 'khyog pa zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pas mgo bor bstan pa ni rva can rnams kyi'o zhes pa rva can rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khu tshur bcings pa las lag pa gnyi ga'i khu tshur gyi steng du mdzub mo gnyis po phyed 'khyog pa zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pas mgo bor bstan pa ni rva can rnams kyi'o zhes pa rva can rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Similarly, the gesture of the horned [deities] is the two index fingers half-bent in the form of a half-moon on top of the fists of both hands, shown on the head.

original: de bzhin du lag pa'i mthil gyi rgyab sbyar nas mthe chung gnyis phan tshun bcings shing mdzub mo dang / gung mo dang / srin lag gshibs te brkyang nas mthe bo dag gi gdong sbyar ba ni de ltar bya khyung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa'i mthil gyi rgyab sbyar nas mthe chung gnyis phan tshun bcings shing mdzub mo dang / gung mo dang / srin lag gshibs te brkyang nas mthe bo dag gi gdong sbyar ba ni de ltar bya khyung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Likewise, the backs of the hands are joined, the two little fingers are bound together, the index, middle, and ring fingers are extended and aligned, and the tips of the thumbs are joined. This is the mudrā of Garuḍa.

original: de bzhin du sor mo lnga po rtse mo'i tshigs 'khyog pa bstan pa gdengs can rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de bzhin du sor mo lnga po rtse mo'i tshigs 'khyog pa bstan pa gdengs can rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Likewise, the five fingers are extended with the tips of the joints bent. This is the mudrā of the families of the nāgas.

original: / de bzhin du 'bar pa'i phyag rgya la gung mo dang / ming med dang / mthe chung brkyang ste lag pa gnyi ga'i mdzub mo gnyis po phan tshun mdud de mgo bo'i steng du kha 'og tu bstan nas /
analyzed: / de bzhin du 'bar pa'i phyag rgya la gung mo dang / ming med dang / mthe chung brkyang ste lag pa gnyi ga'i mdzub mo gnyis po phan tshun mdud de mgo bo'i steng du kha 'og tu bstan nas /
translated: Likewise, the blazing mudrā: the middle, ring, and little fingers are extended, and the two index fingers are crossed and placed above the head, facing down.

original: mthe bo dag sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: mthe bo dag sbyar ba'o //
translated: The thumbs are joined.

original: mchog gi lag mthil dag @177b gi rnam pa de nyid kyis te /
analyzed: mchog gi lag mthil dag @177b gi rnam pa de nyid kyis te /
translated: This is the form of the supreme palms.

original: 'on kyang mdzub mo brkyang pa ni gzhan pa ste 'bar ba'i phyag rgya gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mdzub mo brkyang pa ni gzhan pa ste 'bar ba'i phyag rgya gnyis pa'o //
translated: However, the index fingers are extended. This is the second blazing mudrā.

original: rigs kyi phyag rgya dud 'gro'i gdong can rnams la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi phyag rgya dud 'gro'i gdong can rnams la bstan par bya'o //
translated: One should show the gesture of the family to those with animal faces.

original: da ni mdzub mo zhes pa la sogs pas dpa' bo dang / dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma rnams phan tshun du phebs par smra ba'i phyag rgya gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni mdzub mo zhes pa la sogs pas dpa' bo dang / dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma rnams phan tshun du phebs par smra ba'i phyag rgya gsungs pa /
translated: Now, beginning with “the index finger,” he teaches the gesture of the hero and the heroine, which is the greeting between them.

original: 'dir yang dang gang du phrad pa tsam gyis khu tshur bcings nas steng du phyogs pa'i mdzub mo mthe bo la mngon par phyogs shing sbyar ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang dang gang du phrad pa tsam gyis khu tshur bcings nas steng du phyogs pa'i mdzub mo mthe bo la mngon par phyogs shing sbyar ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: Here, having merely met, one should show the gesture of the clenched fist with the index finger facing upward and joined to the thumb.

original: de bstan na legs par 'ongs sam du 'gyur ro //🔽rnal 'byor pa la rnal 'byor mas sam /
analyzed: de bstan na legs par 'ongs sam du 'gyur ro // rnal 'byor pa la rnal 'byor mas sam /
translated: When that is shown, it means “Welcome!”🔽The yoginī to the yogin,

original: rnal 'byor ma la rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma la rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: or the yogin to the yoginī.

original: gnyis kyis te mdzub mo dang / gung mo rgyab tu yang dag par ldan pa dag gis shin tu legs par 'ongs pa brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyis te mdzub mo dang / gung mo rgyab tu yang dag par ldan pa dag gis shin tu legs par 'ongs pa brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: With both, that is, with the index finger and the middle finger joined together in the back, one should say “Welcome!”

original: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i mthe bo khu tshur bcings pas skal bzang dge ba rab tu brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i mthe bo khu tshur bcings pas skal bzang dge ba rab tu brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, with the left thumb clenched in a fist, one should say “Good fortune, virtue, and well-being!”

original: de bzhin du sor mo'i se go la rdebs pa mthe bo dang / mdzub mo dag gis khyod ni 'di ru sngags pa mchog tu nges par brjod par 'gyur ro //🔽mthe bo dang ni ming med dag gis se gol byas na dam tshig bcas pa'i chang gis khyod ni tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sor mo'i se go la rdebs pa mthe bo dang / mdzub mo dag gis khyod ni 'di ru sngags pa mchog tu nges par brjod par 'gyur ro // mthe bo dang ni ming med dag gis se gol byas na dam tshig bcas pa'i chang gis khyod ni tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: Likewise, by snapping the fingers with the thumb and forefinger, one says, “You are certainly the best of magicians here.”

original: zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By snapping the fingers with the thumb and little finger, one says, “You are satisfied by the pledge-liquor.”

original: de bzhin du phyag 'tshal ba'i sbyor bas sor mo thams cad rtse mo brkyang pas skal bzang legs par 'ongs pa brjod par 'gyur rnal 'byor pa la yang //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyag 'tshal ba'i sbyor bas sor mo thams cad rtse mo brkyang pas skal bzang legs par 'ongs pa brjod par 'gyur rnal 'byor pa la yang //
translated: Likewise, by extending all the fingers in the gesture of salutation, one says, “Welcome, good fortune.”

original: de bzhin du g-yon gyi yan lag reg pas rtag tu khyod ni bdag gi gnyen gcig pu dag rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon gyi yan lag reg pas rtag tu khyod ni bdag gi gnyen gcig pu dag rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: Likewise, by touching the left arm, one says, “You are always my only friend.”

original: de bzhin du skye gnas la reg pas khyo bo ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye gnas la reg pas khyo bo ste /
translated: Likewise, by touching the genitals, one says, “Husband.”

original: de bzhin du mchu dang / nu ma'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du mchu dang / nu ma'am /
translated: Likewise, by touching the lips, the breasts,

original: sen mo 'debs pas kyang khyo por brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sen mo 'debs pas kyang khyo por brjod pa'o //
translated: or by snapping the fingers, one says, “Husband.”

original: ser mo phan tshun bcings pa zhes pa ni lag pa dag sbyar ba byas nas mthe chung la sogs pa sor mo phan tshun bcings te bcings pa de las mdzub mo dang / ming med bcings shing mthe bo dang gung mo rab tu brkyang pas dam tshig la 'dus pa brjod par byed do //🔽phebs par @178a * //
analyzed: ser mo phan tshun bcings pa zhes pa ni lag pa dag sbyar ba byas nas mthe chung la sogs pa sor mo phan tshun bcings te bcings pa de las mdzub mo dang / ming med bcings shing mthe bo dang gung mo rab tu brkyang pas dam tshig la 'dus pa brjod par byed do // phebs par @178a * //
translated: This is said to be the “pledge assembly.”

original: smra ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the seal of speaking frankly.

original: da ni mchu dang zhes pa la sogs pas smod pa'i phyag rgya gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni mchu dang zhes pa la sogs pas smod pa'i phyag rgya gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to explain the seal of contempt, he says “lips,” etc.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe gang dang gang du pho nya mos mthong bar gyur na sgrub pa po mthong nas mchu la sogs pa yo ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe gang dang gang du pho nya mos mthong bar gyur na sgrub pa po mthong nas mchu la sogs pa yo ba ston par byed do //
translated: Here, when the messenger sees the adept, she shows contempt for him by moving her lips, etc.

original: der mchu yo ba dang / smin ma yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang // de bzhin du mgo bo la 'phrug par byed na khyod shin tu cher rmongs pa rjod par byed de gang gi tshe phyag rgya'i brda mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der mchu yo ba dang / smin ma yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang // de bzhin du mgo bo la 'phrug par byed na khyod shin tu cher rmongs pa rjod par byed de gang gi tshe phyag rgya'i brda mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, moving the lips, moving the eyebrows, not moving, and likewise scratching the head, she says, “You are very confused,” because she does not know the symbolic language of the seals.

original: de bzhin du gal te des mche ba'i dbus su mthe chung bkod na de'i tshe mthe chung des 'jigs pa rab tu bar byed do //🔽yang na mdzub mo snying ga'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te des mche ba'i dbus su mthe chung bkod na de'i tshe mthe chung des 'jigs pa rab tu bar byed do // yang na mdzub mo snying ga'am /
translated: Likewise, if he places his little finger in the middle of his fangs, then with that little finger he should frighten her.🔽Or, if he places his forefinger on his heart

original: khar bkod na 'jigs pa brjod par byed do //
analyzed: khar bkod na 'jigs pa brjod par byed do //
translated: or in his mouth, he should frighten her.

original: de bzhin du mthe bo khu tshur bcings pa byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthe bo khu tshur bcings pa byas te /
translated: Likewise, he should make a fist with his thumb.

original: khu tshur bcings pa de las de nyid kyis sa la rdebs pas pa'am /
analyzed: khu tshur bcings pa de las de nyid kyis sa la rdebs pas pa'am /
translated: With that fist he should beat the ground,

original: lag pa dang / rkang pa rdebs par gyur na nga yis bza' bar bya'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: lag pa dang / rkang pa rdebs par gyur na nga yis bza' bar bya'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: or he should beat his hands and feet, saying, “I will eat you.”

original: phyag rgya'i brda mngon par mi shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa smod pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i brda mngon par mi shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa smod pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Because of not understanding the sign of the seal, it is said to be the seal of contempt.

original: de bzhin du zas kyi don du ming med kyis lce la reg na zos pa dang / de bzhin du lag pa g-yon pas lto dang so la bsnun pa dag gis ma zos pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zas kyi don du ming med kyis lce la reg na zos pa dang / de bzhin du lag pa g-yon pas lto dang so la bsnun pa dag gis ma zos pa'o //
translated: Likewise, if he touches his tongue with his ring finger for the sake of food, he has eaten. Likewise, if he strikes his stomach and teeth with his left hand, he has not eaten.

original: de bzhin du lag pa'i rgyab ston par gyur na song zhig ces nges par rab tu brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa'i rgyab ston par gyur na song zhig ces nges par rab tu brjod pa ste /
translated: Likewise, if she shows the back of her hand, it is said to be a definite indication to go.

original: mngon du phyogs pa ston par gyur na 'dug cig ces brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pa ston par gyur na 'dug cig ces brjod pa'o //
translated: If she shows her face, it is said to be a sign to come.

original: de bzhin du byin pa nyid pa dang / brla nyed par gyur na skal bzang khyod de ring ngal so zhig pa rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du byin pa nyid pa dang / brla nyed par gyur na skal bzang khyod de ring ngal so zhig pa rjod par byed do //
translated: Likewise, if she shows her thighs, it is said to be a sign to rest today, good fortune.

original: de bzhin du rkang pa rab tu skyod pas gnyid log cig ces pa'i nges pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa rab tu skyod pas gnyid log cig ces pa'i nges pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: Likewise, if she moves her feet, it is a sign to sleep.

original: de bzhin du bus mo zung ngag skyong bas bdag la shin tu dga' ba gyis zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bus mo zung ngag skyong bas bdag la shin tu dga' ba gyis zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Likewise, if she moves her buttocks, it is a sign to make love to me.

original: de bzhin du rang gi yan lag kun la lag pa g-yon pas reg pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi yan lag kun la lag pa g-yon pas reg pa'am /
translated: Likewise, if she touches all her limbs with her left hand,

original: khar lag pa g-yon pa bkab ste /
analyzed: khar lag pa g-yon pa bkab ste /
translated: or covers her mouth with her left hand,

original: de ltar byed na khyod dang lhan cig bdag la 'dus pa med do zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar byed na khyod dang lhan cig bdag la 'dus pa med do zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: it is said to be a sign that she has no union with you.

original: rje bo la sogs pas bsrungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rje bo la sogs pas bsrungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: This is because she is protected by her master and so forth.

original: de bzhin du rang gi lag pa phan tshun bcings te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi lag pa phan tshun bcings te /
translated: Likewise, one should cross one’s hands,

original: mthe bo dang mdzub mo dbus nas rnam par phyung na de'i tshe phyag rgyas de ring bdag gi khyim du 'khor lo 'dus pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: mthe bo dang mdzub mo dbus nas rnam par phyung na de'i tshe phyag rgyas de ring bdag gi khyim du 'khor lo 'dus pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: and having extended the thumb and forefinger in the middle, one should say, “Today the wheel-assembly will come to my house.”

original: khyod kyang 'dug @178b cig ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: khyod kyang 'dug @178b cig ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is, “You also come.”

original: mthe bo ming med rtse mo ston pa dag gis rnam mang dam tshig rnams kyis khyod la ji ltar 'dod par mchod par bya ste zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mthe bo ming med rtse mo ston pa dag gis rnam mang dam tshig rnams kyis khyod la ji ltar 'dod par mchod par bya ste zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: One should show the tips of the thumb and ring finger, and say, “I worship you with many pledges as you desire.”

original: de bzhin du rkang pa la ni 'phrug par byed par gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa la ni 'phrug par byed par gyur na /
translated: Likewise, if one touches the feet,

original: phyi rol gyi 'khor lo 'dus pa rnams la 'gro ba yang brjod pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'khor lo 'dus pa rnams la 'gro ba yang brjod pa ste /
translated: one should say, “Go to the outer wheel-assembly.”

original: khyod kyang shog cig ces pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyang shog cig ces pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is, “You also come.”

original: de bzhin du mdzub mo lcags kyu'i rnams pas phan tshun bcings bar gyur na rdo rje'i grogs po khyod ni de ring 'jigs pa 'phrog par byed ces pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzub mo lcags kyu'i rnams pas phan tshun bcings bar gyur na rdo rje'i grogs po khyod ni de ring 'jigs pa 'phrog par byed ces pa ste /
translated: Likewise, if one crosses the forefingers in the shape of hooks, one should say, “Today, vajra-friend, you will take away my fear.”

original: de ltar dam tshig 'dus pa'i phyag rgya nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dam tshig 'dus pa'i phyag rgya nges pa'o //
translated: Thus is the seal of the assembly of pledges ascertained.

original: da ni skra zhes pa la sogs pas shin tu khros pa rnams kyi phyag rgya gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni skra zhes pa la sogs pas shin tu khros pa rnams kyi phyag rgya gsungs pa /
translated: Now, beginning with “hair,” he teaches the seal of those who are very wrathful.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe sgrub pa po log pa'i nga rgyal gyis brnyas pa byed dam /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe sgrub pa po log pa'i nga rgyal gyis brnyas pa byed dam /
translated: Here, when the practitioner is disrespected by false pride,

original: nus pa dang ldan pa ma gtogs par phyag rgya'i lan ston par byed na /
analyzed: nus pa dang ldan pa ma gtogs par phyag rgya'i lan ston par byed na /
translated: and if he shows the response of the seal except if he is able,

original: de'i tshe nus pa dang ldan pa rang gi skra rnams rang gi sos gcod par byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe nus pa dang ldan pa rang gi skra rnams rang gi sos gcod par byed de /
translated: then at that time, the able one should cut his hair with his own teeth.

original: de ltar skra ni rang gi so yis gcod par byed par gyur na phyag rgyas kyi mi yi phyugs khyod bdag gis 'dir ni ltung bar bya zhes pa 'di brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar skra ni rang gi so yis gcod par byed par gyur na phyag rgyas kyi mi yi phyugs khyod bdag gis 'dir ni ltung bar bya zhes pa 'di brjod pa'o //
translated: Thus, if the hair is cut with one’s own teeth, the seal should say, “I will make you fall here, you animal of a man.”

original: de bzhin du so la sos phan tshun 'dar bar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du so la sos phan tshun 'dar bar byed de /
translated: Likewise, the teeth should be made to chatter with the teeth.

original: de 'dar bar gyur na kye mi yi phyugs khyod kyi sha ni 'di dag de ring bdag gis bza' bar bya zhes pa 'di brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dar bar gyur na kye mi yi phyugs khyod kyi sha ni 'di dag de ring bdag gis bza' bar bya zhes pa 'di brjod pa'o //
translated: If they chatter, the seal should say, “Alas, today I will eat your flesh, you animal of a man.”

original: de bzhin du lce mchu g-yo bar byed par gyur na khyod kyi lus las khrag ni btung bar bya'o zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du lce mchu g-yo bar byed par gyur na khyod kyi lus las khrag ni btung bar bya'o zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Likewise, if the tongue moves, he should say, “I will drink your blood from your body.”

original: de bzhin du mchu la so yis 'debs par byed na khyod kyi rgyu ma lto bar gnas 'di bdag gis bza' bar bya kye mi yi phyogs khyod gang du 'gro zhes rjod par byed pa ste khros par gyur pa phyag rgya ston par byed na nus pa dang
analyzed: de bzhin du mchu la so yis 'debs par byed na khyod kyi rgyu ma lto bar gnas 'di bdag gis bza' bar bya kye mi yi phyogs khyod gang du 'gro zhes rjod par byed pa ste khros par gyur pa phyag rgya ston par byed na nus pa dang
translated: Likewise, if the lips are bitten with the teeth, he should say, “I will eat your intestines, which are in your belly.”

original: phral ba des phyag rgya'i lan bstan par mi bya zhing de rnams la phyag byas nas /
analyzed: phral ba des phyag rgya'i lan bstan par mi bya zhing de rnams la phyag byas nas /
translated: If the angry one displays a mudrā, he should not display a mudrā in return, but should pay homage to them.

original: snying gar lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil bzhag la rang gi lus g-yon skor gyis yongs su bskor zhing de nas lag pa g-yon pas steng du phyag byas nas 'gro bar bya ste /
analyzed: snying gar lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil bzhag la rang gi lus g-yon skor gyis yongs su bskor zhing de nas lag pa g-yon pas steng du phyag byas nas 'gro bar bya ste /
translated: Placing the palm of the left hand on his heart, he should circumambulate them clockwise, and then, with his left hand raised in homage, he should depart.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig rtsod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig rtsod par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not quarrel with them.

original: byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la nges pa gang byin pa de des bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la nges pa gang byin pa de des bya'o //
translated: Whatever boon is given to the childish yogins, that should be done by him.

original: rnam pa @179a * //🔽gzhan du 'chi ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: rnam pa @179a * // gzhan du 'chi ba 'thob ste /
translated: The form of the seal is as follows:🔽One should make the seal of the wrathful messenger.

original: khros pa'i pho nya mo nus pa dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: khros pa'i pho nya mo nus pa dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule of the Blessed One.

original: da ni phan tshun phyag rgya bstan pa la lan gyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni phan tshun phyag rgya bstan pa la lan gyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: Now, in the teaching of the seals of each other, the characteristics of the response are stated.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i phyag gi mtshan ma gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin ni phyag rgya rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i phyag gi mtshan ma gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin ni phyag rgya rnams so //
translated: Here, the nature of the signs of the left and right hands of the Blessed One Kālacakra are the seals.

original: de las kyang phan tshun du phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan te /
analyzed: de las kyang phan tshun du phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan te /
translated: And from that, the seals and the response-seals of each other are:🔽the vajra and the vajra-bell, the sword and the shield, the trident and the khaṭvāṅga, the flaying knife and the skull-cup, the arrow and the bow, the goad and the noose,

original: rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu dag dang / ral gri dang phu ba dag dang / rtse gsum dang kha tv'am ga dag dang / gri gug dang thod pa dag dang / mda' dang gzhu dag dang / lcags kyu dang zhags pa dag dang /
analyzed: rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu dag dang / ral gri dang phu ba dag dang / rtse gsum dang kha tv'am ga dag dang / gri gug dang thod pa dag dang / mda' dang gzhu dag dang / lcags kyu dang zhags pa dag dang /
translated: the axe and the wooden sword, the wheel and the mirror, the pestle and the plough, the flag and the banner, the trident and the spear, the conch and the discus, the mace and the club, the sword and the text, the lotus and the gem, the elephant and the horse, the bull and the goat, the sheep and the deer, the peacock and the cock, the cat and the mouse, the dog and the pig, the snake and the tortoise, the fish and the frog, the scorpion and the spider, the bee and the mosquito, the owl and the crow, the pigeon and the sparrow, the partridge and the peacock, the swan and the crane, the curlew and the goose, the parrot and the myna bird, the cuckoo and the dove, the peacock and the partridge, the peacock and the swan, the peacock and the curlew, the peacock and the goose, the peacock and the parrot, the peacock and the myna bird, the peacock and the cuckoo, the peacock and the dove, the peacock and the partridge, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock, the peacock and the peacock,

original: da ma ru dang rin po che dag dang / tho ba dang padma dag dang / 'khor lo dang dung dag dang / mdung dang mo long dag dang / dbyug pa dang lcags sgrog dag dang / dgra sta dang tshangs pa'i mgo dag dang / glang po che'i pags pa dang sdigs mdzub dag dang /🔽dbu rgyan dang rna rgyan dag dang / mgul rgyan dang lag gdub dag dang / ske rags dang rkang gdub dag dang / rva can dang sen mo can dag dang / klu dang mkha' lding dag dang / lag pa dang rkang pa dag dang / kha dang bshang lam dag dang /
analyzed: da ma ru dang rin po che dag dang / tho ba dang padma dag dang / 'khor lo dang dung dag dang / mdung dang mo long dag dang / dbyug pa dang lcags sgrog dag dang / dgra sta dang tshangs pa'i mgo dag dang / glang po che'i pags pa dang sdigs mdzub dag dang / dbu rgyan dang rna rgyan dag dang / mgul rgyan dang lag gdub dag dang / ske rags dang rkang gdub dag dang / rva can dang sen mo can dag dang / klu dang mkha' lding dag dang / lag pa dang rkang pa dag dang / kha dang bshang lam dag dang /
translated: The damaru and the jewel, the hammer and the lotus, the wheel and the conch, the spear and the plow, the club and the iron chain, the battle-ax and the head of Brahma, the elephant skin and the threatening gesture,🔽the crown and the ear ornament, the necklace and the armlet, the girdle and the anklet, the horned and the clawed, the nāgas and the garuḍas, the hands and the feet, the mouth and the anus,

original: bha ga dang rtags dag dang / nu ma dang mchu dag dang / mig dang smin ma dag dang / thig le dang mig sman dag dang / rab tu khro ba dang gtsug pung  dgrol ba dag dang / pus mo dang brla dag dang /
analyzed: bha ga dang rtags dag dang / nu ma dang mchu dag dang / mig dang smin ma dag dang / thig le dang mig sman dag dang / rab tu khro ba dang gtsug pung  dgrol ba dag dang / pus mo dang brla dag dang /
translated: the bhaga and the penis, the breasts and the lips, the eyes and the eyebrows, the bindu and the collyrium, the very wrathful and the untied topknot, the knees and the thighs,

original: mgrin pa dang dpral pa dag dang / lte ba dang snying ga dag dang / skra mtshams dang sindhu ra dag dang / mche ba dang mthe chung dag dang / mthe bo dang ming med dag dang / mdzub mo dang gung mo dag go //
analyzed: mgrin pa dang dpral pa dag dang / lte ba dang snying ga dag dang / skra mtshams dang sindhu ra dag dang / mche ba dang mthe chung dag dang / mthe bo dang ming med dag dang / mdzub mo dang gung mo dag go //
translated: the throat and the forehead, the navel and the heart, the top of the head and the forehead, the fangs and the little fingers, the thumbs and the ring fingers, and the index and middle fingers.

original: de ltar phyag rgya du ma bstan pa na phyag rgya'i lan du mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya du ma bstan pa na phyag rgya'i lan du mar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when many seals are taught, there are many seal responses.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi chos dang sa la sogs pa'i de nyid kyi dbye pas thams cad du rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi chos dang sa la sogs pa'i de nyid kyi dbye pas thams cad du rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: It is certain that the yogī should know everything by the divisions of the reality of the dharmas of wisdom and method, the stages, and so on.

original: da ni sgeg pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgya mtha' yas pa rnams te /
analyzed: da ni sgeg pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgya mtha' yas pa rnams te /
translated: Now, there are infinite seals, such as the flirtatious.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin shes nas de rnams thams cad rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin shes nas de rnams thams cad rig par bya'o //
translated: Having understood their nature, all of them should be known.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sgeg pa'i sbyor ba yis ni sgeg @179b par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bzhad pa'i sbyor bas bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: sgeg pa'i sbyor ba yis ni sgeg @179b par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bzhad pa'i sbyor bas bzhad pa'o //
translated: By the union of flirtation, there is flirtation. By the union of laughter, there is laughter, O lord of men.

original: gar gyi sbyor ba yis ni gar du 'gyur te rnam pa mang po'i rol mo'i sbyor bas rol mo'o //🔽glu yi sbyor ba yis ni glu ste mchog gi yon tan rnams mang dri yi sbyor ba dag gis dri //
analyzed: gar gyi sbyor ba yis ni gar du 'gyur te rnam pa mang po'i rol mo'i sbyor bas rol mo'o // glu yi sbyor ba yis ni glu ste mchog gi yon tan rnams mang dri yi sbyor ba dag gis dri //
translated: By the application of dance, there is dance, and by the application of many kinds of music, there is music.🔽By the application of song, there is song, and by the application of incense, there is incense, with the many qualities of the supreme.

original: phreng ba'i sbyor ba yis ni phreng bar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis spos kyi sbyor ba dag gis spos //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sbyor ba yis ni phreng bar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis spos kyi sbyor ba dag gis spos //
translated: By the application of garlands, there are garlands, and by the application of perfume, there is perfume, due to the qualities.

original: mar me'i rnam pas mar me nges par mun pa bcom pa dang ni snod kyi phyag rgya bdud rtsir 'gyur //
analyzed: mar me'i rnam pas mar me nges par mun pa bcom pa dang ni snod kyi phyag rgya bdud rtsir 'gyur //
translated: By the aspect of lamps, there are lamps, which definitely conquer darkness, and by the application of the mudra of the vessel, there is nectar.

original: zhes pa de ltar phyag rgya thams cad slar yang de nas lnga yi dbye bas rnam par phye ba ste //
analyzed: zhes pa de ltar phyag rgya thams cad slar yang de nas lnga yi dbye bas rnam par phye ba ste //
translated: Thus, all mudras are again divided by the division into five.

original: gzhan pa phyag rgya mtha' yas rnams kyang mtha' dag lus la gnas pa rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
analyzed: gzhan pa phyag rgya mtha' yas rnams kyang mtha' dag lus la gnas pa rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
translated: The yogi/nī should know that all the infinite mudras are present in the body.

original: gang gang dngos po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur sa yi steng du de yi rang bzhin dag kyang phyag rgya rnams //
analyzed: gang gang dngos po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur sa yi steng du de yi rang bzhin dag kyang phyag rgya rnams //
translated: Whatever is the nature of things on the earth, those natures are the mudras.

original: zhes pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: ji snyed mig ni rnam g-yeng ba //
analyzed: ji snyed mig ni rnam g-yeng ba //
translated: As many as are the distractions of the eyes,

original: de snyed phyag rgya rab tu grags //🔽phyag rgya phyag rgya'i lan la ni //
analyzed: de snyed phyag rgya rab tu grags // phyag rgya phyag rgya'i lan la ni //
translated: so many are the mudras well known.🔽Who is able to hold fast to the mudra

original: nges pa 'dzin par su yis nus //🔽rnal 'byor rnams kyi ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: nges pa 'dzin par su yis nus // rnal 'byor rnams kyi ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: and the reply to the mudra?🔽As long as the yogi does not generate the superknowledges

original: ji srid mngon shes ma bskyed pa //🔽de srid 'jig rten rtsod don du //
analyzed: ji srid mngon shes ma bskyed pa // de srid 'jig rten rtsod don du //
translated: through the samādhi of yoga,🔽for that long he should not display the reply to the mudra

original: phyag rgya'i lan ni bstan mi bya //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i lan ni bstan mi bya //
translated: for the sake of worldly dispute.

original: zhes pa ni phyag rgya'i brda'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyag rgya'i brda'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of the symbolic language of the mudras.

original: da ni pho nya mo zhes pa la sogs pas lta stangs kyi brda gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni pho nya mo zhes pa la sogs pas lta stangs kyi brda gsungs te /
translated: Now, the gaze is taught, beginning with “the messenger,” and so on.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa mthong ba na pho nya mo zhes pa rnal 'byor ma 'phred la mig lta bar byed na lta stangs des khyod ni gnas gang zhig nas 'ongs zhes pa'i dri ba skal pa bzang la zhes pa rnal 'byor pa la rjod par
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa mthong ba na pho nya mo zhes pa rnal 'byor ma 'phred la mig lta bar byed na lta stangs des khyod ni gnas gang zhig nas 'ongs zhes pa'i dri ba skal pa bzang la zhes pa rnal 'byor pa la rjod par
translated: Here, when the yogi sees the messenger, the yoginī, looking sideways with her eyes, by that gaze she asks, “From what place have you come?”

original: byed do // de nas mgo bor lag pa g-yon pa bzhag ste phyogs su nges par bltas pa rnal 'byor pa yis gnas nas 'ongs pa brjod pa ste lan smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed do // de nas mgo bor lag pa g-yon pa bzhag ste phyogs su nges par bltas pa rnal 'byor pa yis gnas nas 'ongs pa brjod pa ste lan smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, placing the left hand on the head, the yogī should look in the direction and say, “I have come from such and such a place.”

original: steng du lta bas khyod ni dge 'am rjod par byed do //
analyzed: steng du lta bas khyod ni dge 'am rjod par byed do //
translated: If she looks upward, she says, “Are you well?”

original: sa yi steng du gnas pas khyod ni 'dug la ngal so zhig ces pa rjod par byed do //
analyzed: sa yi steng du gnas pas khyod ni 'dug la ngal so zhig ces pa rjod par byed do //
translated: If she looks at the ground, she says, “Sit down and rest.”

original: yon por lta bas khyod song zhig ces pa'o //
analyzed: yon por lta bas khyod song zhig ces pa'o //
translated: If she looks askance, she says, “Go away.”

original: chags pa'i lta bas pho nya mo ni shin tu dga' ba gyis shig ces rjod par byed do //
analyzed: chags pa'i lta bas pho nya mo ni shin tu dga' ba gyis shig ces rjod par byed do //
translated: If she looks with passion, she says, “Make love to me.”

original: zhi ba'i lta bas khyod ni bdag gi grogs po zhes rjod par byed de /
analyzed: zhi ba'i lta bas khyod ni bdag gi grogs po zhes rjod par byed de /
translated: If she looks with a peaceful expression, she says, “You are my friend.”

original: phebs @180a * //
analyzed: phebs @180a * //
translated: If she looks with a smile, she says, “Come here.”

original: par smra ba'i lta stangs kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: par smra ba'i lta stangs kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of the gaze of frank speech.

original: da ni 'jigs pa'i lta stangs rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni 'jigs pa'i lta stangs rnams gsungs te /
translated: Now the fearful gazes are taught.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe khro gnyer byas nas khro bo'i lta ba ston par byed na /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe khro gnyer byas nas khro bo'i lta ba ston par byed na /
translated: Here, when she frowns and displays a wrathful gaze,

original: de'i tshe khro gnyer khro bo'i lta ba des rnal 'byor pa la 'jigs pa rab tu gsal bar byed de mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe khro gnyer khro bo'i lta ba des rnal 'byor pa la 'jigs pa rab tu gsal bar byed de mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the yogi should clearly see the wrathful look of frowning, because of ignorance.

original: de bzhin du skra la lta bas bdag ni ma rungs pa zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skra la lta bas bdag ni ma rungs pa zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: Similarly, by looking at the hair, one should say, “I am wicked.”

original: skal bzang la ni zhes pa rnal 'byor pa la rang gi rang bzhin zur 'di dag gis so //
analyzed: skal bzang la ni zhes pa rnal 'byor pa la rang gi rang bzhin zur 'di dag gis so //
translated: “ Fortunate” refers to the yogi’s own nature.

original: de bzhin du mdzod spur lta bas bdag ni mchog go zhes rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzod spur lta bas bdag ni mchog go zhes rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: By looking at the ūrṇā, one should clearly say, “I am supreme.”

original: de bzhin du sna la lta bas yon tan rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sna la lta bas yon tan rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: Similarly, by looking at the nose, one should clearly say, “I am endowed with good qualities.”

original: mchu la lta bas rang gi skal ba bzang po rab tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: mchu la lta bas rang gi skal ba bzang po rab tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: By looking at the lips, one should clearly say, “I am fortunate.”

original: de bzhin du rang gi nu ma zung la lta na bdag ni phyag rgya bzang mo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi nu ma zung la lta na bdag ni phyag rgya bzang mo zhes brjod do //
translated: Similarly, by looking at one’s two breasts, one should say, “I am a good seal.”

original: snying gar lta bas bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: snying gar lta bas bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid do zhes brjod do //
translated: By looking at the heart, one should say, “I am the nature of meditation.”

original: de bzhin du lag pa zung la lta na bdag ni rab tu gtum mo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa zung la lta na bdag ni rab tu gtum mo zhes brjod do //
translated: Similarly, by looking at the two arms, one should say, “I am fierce.”

original: de bzhin du phrag par lta bas bdag ni nus ma zhes brjod do //🔽de bzhin du sen mo dang bcas pa'i lag mthil la lta na bdag ni srin mo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du phrag par lta bas bdag ni nus ma zhes brjod do // de bzhin du sen mo dang bcas pa'i lag mthil la lta na bdag ni srin mo zhes brjod do //
translated: In the same way, looking at the shoulders, she says, “I am the powerful one.”🔽In the same way, looking at the palms of the hands with the nails, she says, “I am the demoness.”

original: de bzhin du rgyab tu lta bas bdag ni klu mo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyab tu lta bas bdag ni klu mo zhes brjod do //
translated: In the same way, looking at the back, she says, “I am the serpent-goddess.”

original: de bzhin du lte bar lta bas bdag ni dam tshig can zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du lte bar lta bas bdag ni dam tshig can zhes brjod de /
translated: In the same way, looking at the navel, she says, “I am the one who has the vow.”

original: mi'i dbang po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i dbang po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: “Lord of men” is Tibetan for “king.”

original: de bzhin du gsang bar lta bas bdag ni dag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsang bar lta bas bdag ni dag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In the same way, looking at the secret part, she says, “I am the pure one.”

original: de bzhin du brlab lta bas bdag ni shin tu dga' la gdul bar dka' zhes brjod do ;🔽/ de bzhin du pus mor lta bas bdag ni grub pa zhes pa brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du brlab lta bas bdag ni shin tu dga' la gdul bar dka' zhes brjod do ; / de bzhin du pus mor lta bas bdag ni grub pa zhes pa brjod do //
translated: In the same way, looking at the thighs, she says, “I am the one who is very happy and difficult to subdue.”🔽In the same way, looking at the knees, she says, “I am the accomplished one.”

original: de bzhin du rkang pa la lta bas bdag ni rdzu 'phrul sbyin pa mo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa la lta bas bdag ni rdzu 'phrul sbyin pa mo zhes brjod do //
translated: In the same way, looking at the feet, she says, “I am the one who gives magical power.”

original: de bzhin du rkang pa'i mthe bor nges par lta bar byed na lta stangs des bdag ni srid par rdo rje'i sku ste dpa' mo gcig pu'o hes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa'i mthe bor nges par lta bar byed na lta stangs des bdag ni srid par rdo rje'i sku ste dpa' mo gcig pu'o hes brjod do //
translated: Likewise, if one looks at the big toe of the foot, that gaze expresses, “I am the vajra body in existence, the sole heroine.”

original: de bzhin du rkang pa dag gi sor mo kun gyi rtse mor lta bas srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bdag ni kun du 'gro ma sna tshogs yum mo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa dag gi sor mo kun gyi rtse mor lta bas srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bdag ni kun du 'gro ma sna tshogs yum mo zhes brjod do //
translated: Likewise, by looking at the tips of all the toes of the feet, one should say, “I am the universal mother, the variety of the three worlds.”

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa nus pa dang ldan pa yang bdag nyid kyi yon tan rnams pho nya mo rnams la rab tu @180b gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa nus pa dang ldan pa yang bdag nyid kyi yon tan rnams pho nya mo rnams la rab tu @180b gsal bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, the yogi who is endowed with power makes his own qualities clear to the messengers.

original: de ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas pho nya mo rnams kho na'i lta stangs te /
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas pho nya mo rnams kho na'i lta stangs te /
translated: Thus, in the sequence that is taught, the messengers’ gazes

original: slar yang rang bzhin rnams kyis rnam pa mang por rig par bya'o zhes pa ni lta stangs kyi brda'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang rang bzhin rnams kyis rnam pa mang por rig par bya'o zhes pa ni lta stangs kyi brda'i nges pa'o //
translated: should be known in many ways by the natural expressions. This is the definition of the signs of the gazes.

original: de bzhin du brda dngos po gang gi ming gang yin pa de'i yi ge dang pos de gzung bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du brda dngos po gang gi ming gang yin pa de'i yi ge dang pos de gzung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, one should know that whatever is the name of any object is grasped by its first letter.

original: gnas skabs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: by the power of the occasion.

original: dper na sandha pa khyer la shog ces brjod pa na khrus la gos dang / zas la lan tshva dang / 'gro ba la rta dang / g-yul la ral gri'o zhes pa'i rigs pas dang po'i yi ge'i brda yis dngos po'i chos thams cad rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sandha pa khyer la shog ces brjod pa na khrus la gos dang / zas la lan tshva dang / 'gro ba la rta dang / g-yul la ral gri'o zhes pa'i rigs pas dang po'i yi ge'i brda yis dngos po'i chos thams cad rig par bya'o //
translated: For example, when it is said, “Bring the sandalwood,” one understands the cloth for bathing, the salt for food, the horse for traveling, and the sword for battle.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa la dam tshig dang mi ldan pa'i sems can gyi nang du rnal 'byor pa'am rnal 'byor mas dgongs pa'i skad gzhan nam brdas brjod par bya'o zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa la dam tshig dang mi ldan pa'i sems can gyi nang du rnal 'byor pa'am rnal 'byor mas dgongs pa'i skad gzhan nam brdas brjod par bya'o zhes pa ni thams cad du nges pa'o //
translated: In the assembly circle and so forth, the yogi or yoginī should speak with the language of intention or with the symbolic language among sentient beings who do not have the commitments. This is certain in all cases.

original: da ni slob ma rnams kyi sbyin pa'i don du rang gi lus la sogs pa'i cha'i nges pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni slob ma rnams kyi sbyin pa'i don du rang gi lus la sogs pa'i cha'i nges pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to give to the disciples, the certainty of the parts of one’s body and so forth is stated:

original: drug pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: drug pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The sixth and so forth.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe rdo rje slob dpon gyis khyim pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe rdo rje slob dpon gyis khyim pa'am /
translated: Here, when the vajra master gives the initiation to a householder,

original: dge tshul lam /
analyzed: dge tshul lam /
translated: a novice,

original: dge slong la dbang bskur ba na des dam bca' ba 'di bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong la dbang bskur ba na des dam bca' ba 'di bya ste /
translated: When the consecration of the monk is performed, he should make this vow:

original: bdag gis dus thams cad du dngos po thams cad kyi drug cha sbyin par dbul bar bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis dus thams cad du dngos po thams cad kyi drug cha sbyin par dbul bar bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: “I will always give away one sixth of all my possessions.”

original: de la dang por re zhig drug cha lus kyi nang nas lag pa rkang pa lus dag las zhes pa lag pa gnyis dang rkang pa gnyis dang lus te /
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig drug cha lus kyi nang nas lag pa rkang pa lus dag las zhes pa lag pa gnyis dang rkang pa gnyis dang lus te /
translated: In this regard, first of all, one sixth of the body is the hands, feet, and body.

original: lnga po 'di rnams kyi nang nas drug pa yan lag mchog ni slob dpon la phyag 'tshal ba'i don du sbyin par rab tu dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: lnga po 'di rnams kyi nang nas drug pa yan lag mchog ni slob dpon la phyag 'tshal ba'i don du sbyin par rab tu dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Of these five, the sixth, the best limb, is given away for the sake of worshipping the master.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang ldan pa'i bla ma la de phul na mchog gi phyag rgya rjes su rig pas 'bul ba po ni bde ba'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang ldan pa'i bla ma la de phul na mchog gi phyag rgya rjes su rig pas 'bul ba po ni bde ba'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is offered to the guru endowed with the Buddha and Bodhisattva natures, the one who offers it with the supreme seal and awareness will attain the state of bliss.

original: de bzhin du las kyi dbang po rnams kyi nang nas ngag dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du las kyi dbang po rnams kyi nang nas ngag dbul bar bya ste /
translated: In the same way, of the action faculties, one should give away the speech.

original: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / bshang lam dang / bha ga la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams las drug pa ngag gi dbang po ni bden par smra ba'i don du ngag dbul bar bya'o zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //🔽de bzhin du mig dang rna @181a * //
analyzed: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / bshang lam dang / bha ga la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams las drug pa ngag gi dbang po ni bden par smra ba'i don du ngag dbul bar bya'o zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o // de bzhin du mig dang rna @181a * //
translated: The Bhagavān’s definitive statement is that from among the faculties of the hands, feet, anus, vagina, and so on, the sixth, the faculty of speech, should be offered for the purpose of speaking the truth.

original: ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus kyi dbang po rnams kyi nang nas drug pa yid de yon tan dang bcas g-yo sgyu'i spros pa dang bral ba sems can gyi don du dbul bar bya ste sbyin pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus kyi dbang po rnams kyi nang nas drug pa yid de yon tan dang bcas g-yo sgyu'i spros pa dang bral ba sems can gyi don du dbul bar bya ste sbyin pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Similarly, from among the faculties of the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, and body, the sixth is the mind. It should be offered to sentient beings, free of the elaborations of deceit and hypocrisy, along with its qualities. This is the definition of generosity.

original: de bzhin du khams kyi cha shas zhes pa ni gser dang rin po che dang 'bru la sogs pa sems med pa'i rdzas rnams ni khams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams kyi cha shas zhes pa ni gser dang rin po che dang 'bru la sogs pa sems med pa'i rdzas rnams ni khams te /
translated: Similarly, the “parts of the elements” are the inanimate substances of gold, jewels, grain, and so on.

original: yun ring gi dang / glo bur du byung ba'i khams de rnams las drug gi cha shas ni rnal 'byor ma la sogs pa mchod pa'i don du dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: yun ring gi dang / glo bur du byung ba'i khams de rnams las drug gi cha shas ni rnal 'byor ma la sogs pa mchod pa'i don du dbul bar bya'o //
translated: From among those elements, both those that have existed for a long time and those that have arisen newly, the sixth part should be offered for the purpose of worshipping the yoginīs and so on.

original: de bzhin du sems dang bcas pa rkang gnyis pa dang rkang bzhi pa rnams kyi drug gi cha shas dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dang bcas pa rkang gnyis pa dang rkang bzhi pa rnams kyi drug gi cha shas dbul bar bya ste /
translated: Likewise, one should offer the sixth part of the two-legged and four-legged beings with mind.

original: cha shas lnga ni bdag nyid dang rtsa lag nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: cha shas lnga ni bdag nyid dang rtsa lag nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The five parts should be set aside for one's own enjoyment and for the enjoyment of one's relatives.

original: de bzhin du de nyid cha yis gzhan zhes pa gzugs bzang chung ma la sogs pa zla ba'i nang du lan lnga 'dod pa'i sbyin pa dbul bar bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid cha yis gzhan zhes pa gzugs bzang chung ma la sogs pa zla ba'i nang du lan lnga 'dod pa'i sbyin pa dbul bar bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Likewise, one should offer the five parts of the moon, such as a good form, a wife, and so on, to the deity. This is the rule of the Tathagata.

original: rnam pa gzhan du sngags kyi tshul la 'dod pa sbyin pa ma gtogs par bskal pa mtha' yas pa dag gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub tu mi 'gyur zhing las kyi phyag rgya dang / ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub tu yang mi 'gyur te chags pas zil gyis mnan pa rigs la zhon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du sngags kyi tshul la 'dod pa sbyin pa ma gtogs par bskal pa mtha' yas pa dag gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub tu mi 'gyur zhing las kyi phyag rgya dang / ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i dngos grub tu yang mi 'gyur te chags pas zil gyis mnan pa rigs la zhon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, in the way of mantra, one will not attain the siddhi of the great seal by means of infinite eons, except for the giving of desire, and one will not attain the siddhi of the action seal and the wisdom seal, because one is overwhelmed by attachment and is mounted on the family.

original: de ltar drug cha dbul ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar drug cha dbul ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the rule of the six shares is certain.

original: da ni sems can gang dag ces pa la sogs pas snying rje'i dbang bskur ba gsungs pa 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams te 'gro ba drug po rnams las sems can gang dag dbang ma bskur ba rnam gsum srid par gnas rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdo
analyzed: da ni sems can gang dag ces pa la sogs pas snying rje'i dbang bskur ba gsungs pa 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams te 'gro ba drug po rnams las sems can gang dag dbang ma bskur ba rnam gsum srid par gnas rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdo
translated: Now, beginning with “those sentient beings,” the anointment of compassion is stated. Here, in the world systems, from among the six classes of migrating beings, those sentient beings who are not anointed, abiding in the three existences, are summoned by the vajra hook of omniscient gnosis.🔽Having merely meditated on them, with supreme compassion, in the maṇḍala, the buddhas anoint with feces, urine, blood, and semen, and likewise, with the vajra amṛta, the bodhicitta.

original: rje lcags kyus bkug nas bsgoms pa tsam de rnams la mchog gi snying rjes dkyil 'khor du ni sangs rgyas rnams te bshang pa dang / gci ba dang / khrag dang / rkang rnams dang de bzhin du rdo rje'i bdud rtsi ste khu bas mngon par dbang bskur ba dri med ri bong can gyi lus dang de nas rdo rje can gyi lam thob par 'gyur pa zhes rnam par bsgoms shing de nas rdo rje slob dpon gyis dri ma
analyzed: rje lcags kyus bkug nas bsgoms pa tsam de rnams la mchog gi snying rjes dkyil 'khor du ni sangs rgyas rnams te bshang pa dang / gci ba dang / khrag dang / rkang rnams dang de bzhin du rdo rje'i bdud rtsi ste khu bas mngon par dbang bskur ba dri med ri bong can gyi lus dang de nas rdo rje can gyi lam thob par 'gyur pa zhes rnam par bsgoms shing de nas rdo rje slob dpon gyis dri ma
translated: Having meditated on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the vajra master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit, and then, having obtained the path of the vajra holder, the master should meditate on the stainless body of the rabbit

original: rnam par bral zhing byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas pa de rnams thams cad rang gi gnas su gtang bar bya'o zhes pa ni snying rje'i dbang gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bral zhing byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas pa de rnams thams cad rang gi gnas su gtang bar bya'o zhes pa ni snying rje'i dbang gi nges pa'o //
translated: All of them should be sent to their own places. This is the certainty of the power of compassion.

original: da ni rdzas @181b rnams mid pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas kun spangs kyi slob ma la dbang bskur ba'i nges pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rdzas @181b rnams mid pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas kun spangs kyi slob ma la dbang bskur ba'i nges pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, beginning with the substances are not accepted, he teaches the certainty of the consecration of the disciple who has abandoned all.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe kun spangs kyi slob ma la rdzas med na de'i tshe bla mas rdzas rnams med pa'i mngon par dbang bskur rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis kun spangs la ni sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe kun spangs kyi slob ma la rdzas med na de'i tshe bla mas rdzas rnams med pa'i mngon par dbang bskur rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis kun spangs la ni sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Here, when the disciple who has abandoned all does not have the substances, then the master should give the consecration of the non-existence of the substances to the one who has abandoned all by the command of the Lord of Victors.

original: rim pa ji lta bas dbang bdun dang / de nas bum pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bas dbang bdun dang / de nas bum pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In accordance with the stages, the seven consecrations and then the three types of vase and so forth should be given.

original: de bzhin du bzhi pa du ba la sogs pa'i lam sbyin par bya zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzhi pa du ba la sogs pa'i lam sbyin par bya zhes pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the path of smoke and so forth of the fourth consecration should be given.

original: tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be expressed with words.

original: de bzhin du mtha' dag yon tan gter ni rtsa yi rnal 'byor ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtha' dag yon tan gter ni rtsa yi rnal 'byor ldan pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the one endowed with the yoga of the nāḍīs, the treasure of all good qualities,

original: mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'i skad cig tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'i skad cig tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
translated: should be described with words of the moment of unchanging great bliss.

original: de la bsten pa'i don du las kyi phyag rgya med par gyur na lag pa'i phyag rgya sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bsten pa'i don du las kyi phyag rgya med par gyur na lag pa'i phyag rgya sbyin par bya ste /
translated: If the karma consort is not available for the purpose of relying on that, then the hand consort should be given.

original: rang gi snying gi dbang son lag pa'i phyag rgya ni skyon rnams kun las rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi snying gi dbang son lag pa'i phyag rgya ni skyon rnams kun las rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: The hand consort who has come to the heart is free from all faults,

original: byang chub kyi sems brtan par byed pa'i ched du'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems brtan par byed pa'i ched du'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: for the purpose of stabilizing the bodhicitta.

original: gzhan rnams la ni ste khyim pa rnams la ni rgyal ba mchog gi snying po zhes pa rdo rje'i tshig yum gyi mchod pas rnam par dman par sbyin pa nyid du mi bya zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni ste khyim pa rnams la ni rgyal ba mchog gi snying po zhes pa rdo rje'i tshig yum gyi mchod pas rnam par dman par sbyin pa nyid du mi bya zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gi nges pa'o //
translated: For others, that is, for householders, the essence of the supreme victors, that is, the vajra words, should not be given in a diminished form by the worship of the mother.

original: da ni dbang gi mthar zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba gsungs te 'dir dbang gi mjug tu stod kor dang bcas pa'i gos zung bum pa'i steng du byin pa gang yin pa de rnal 'byor ma bum pa srung zhing skyong ba rnams la🔽sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni dbang gi mthar zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba gsungs te 'dir dbang gi mjug tu stod kor dang bcas pa'i gos zung bum pa'i steng du byin pa gang yin pa de rnal 'byor ma bum pa srung zhing skyong ba rnams la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Now, “at the end of the empowerment” and so forth explains the request for the maṇḍala to depart. Here, at the conclusion of the empowerment, the pair of garments with the upper garment that was placed on the vase should be given to those who guard and protect the yoginī’s vase.
