original: gzhan yang de bzhin stod kor dang ni gos zung dag so so'i sgo na gnas pa srung zhing skyong ba rnams la rab tu sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin stod kor dang ni gos zung dag so so'i sgo na gnas pa srung zhing skyong ba rnams la rab tu sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the upper garment and the pair of garments should be given to those who guard and protect the individual doors.

original: sngon du ji ltar 'byor pas cod pan la sogs pa sbyin par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: sngon du ji ltar 'byor pas cod pan la sogs pa sbyin par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: It is certain that previously, one should give the crown, and so on, according to one’s wealth.

original: de bzhin du mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs la bdag nyid nus pas de bzhin gzhan tshogs kyi 'khor lor dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams la'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs la bdag nyid nus pas de bzhin gzhan tshogs kyi 'khor lor dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams la'o ;
translated: In the same way, one should give to the assembly of yogins and yoginīs, the lords of heroes and heroines, according to one’s ability.

original: / de nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo gshegs su gsol te mthar ni sbyin sreg byas nas slob dpon gyis sngar bzhin du mchod pa byas te /🔽shar gyi sgor bcom ldan 'das la mngon du phyogs pas rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu bzung nas rdo rje bcings pas rang gi snying ga'i padmar ye shes sems @182a * //
analyzed: / de nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo gshegs su gsol te mthar ni sbyin sreg byas nas slob dpon gyis sngar bzhin du mchod pa byas te / shar gyi sgor bcom ldan 'das la mngon du phyogs pas rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu bzung nas rdo rje bcings pas rang gi snying ga'i padmar ye shes sems @182a * //
translated: Then, having requested the assembly to depart, and having made the fire offering at the end, the master, having made offerings as before,🔽facing the Bhagavat at the eastern door, holding the vajra and vajra bell, having entered the vajra binding as before,

original: dpa' rab tu gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: dpa' rab tu gzhug par bya ste /
translated: he should cause the gnosis being at his heart lotus to enter.

original: dbang po la sogs pa 'jig rten pa rnams ni rang gi gnas su'o //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa 'jig rten pa rnams ni rang gi gnas su'o //
translated: The worldly beings such as Indra should be caused to enter their own places.

original: de nas aa shva dtha'i 'dab ma 'am /
analyzed: de nas aa shva dtha'i 'dab ma 'am /
translated: Then, with a leaf of the Aśvattha tree,

original: rang gi lag pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi lag pa'am /
translated: or with his own hand,

original: rdo rjes tshangs pa'i thig gi lam nas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i rdo rje ji srid pa dbyi bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rjes tshangs pa'i thig gi lam nas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i rdo rje ji srid pa dbyi bar bya'o //
translated: or with the vajra, he should erase the path of the Brahmā line from the vajra of the great bliss cakra.

original: de nas rang gi mgor rdul tshon cung zad bkod nas padma la sogs pa dbyi bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi mgor rdul tshon cung zad bkod nas padma la sogs pa dbyi bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having placed a little bit of colored powder on his head, he should erase the lotus, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the rule for requesting the maṇḍala to depart.

original: de nas mtha' dag rdul tshon glang po che'i steng du gdugs dang / rnga yab dang / rgyal mtshan dang / mchod pa dang bcas pas khyer nas rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i dag pa'i chu rlung la'o //
analyzed: de nas mtha' dag rdul tshon glang po che'i steng du gdugs dang / rnga yab dang / rgyal mtshan dang / mchod pa dang bcas pas khyer nas rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i dag pa'i chu rlung la'o //
translated: Then, all the colored powders are carried on the back of an elephant, together with an umbrella, a yak-tail fan, a victory banner, and offerings, to the pure water of the ocean, which is the wind.

original: bum pa gang du khyer ba'i bum pa de chus gang bar byas nas slar yang glang po che'i phrag par bzhag ste dkyil 'khor gyi khang par khyer la 'ong ngo //
analyzed: bum pa gang du khyer ba'i bum pa de chus gang bar byas nas slar yang glang po che'i phrag par bzhag ste dkyil 'khor gyi khang par khyer la 'ong ngo //
translated: The vase that is carried is filled with water, and then it is placed on the elephant's back and carried to the maṇḍala house.

original: glang po med na bde ba'i gdan la khyogs byas nas dgyer bar bya'o //
analyzed: glang po med na bde ba'i gdan la khyogs byas nas dgyer bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no elephant, one should be carried on a comfortable seat.

original: rdul tshon gshegs su gsol ba'o //
analyzed: rdul tshon gshegs su gsol ba'o //
translated: That is the request for the colored powders to depart.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi khang bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi khang bar 'ongs te /
translated: Then, having arrived in the maṇḍala house,

original: ba'i lcibs nye bar byugs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi khang par lo lnga nas brtsams te lo bcu'i bar gyi gzhon nu ma bcu la 'o ma dang / mar dang / 'o thug dang / khanda dang / la du la sogs pa mang pa'i zas rnams kyis snga dro yang dag par mchod cing de nas t'a ma b'u la dang /
analyzed: ba'i lcibs nye bar byugs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi khang par lo lnga nas brtsams te lo bcu'i bar gyi gzhon nu ma bcu la 'o ma dang / mar dang / 'o thug dang / khanda dang / la du la sogs pa mang pa'i zas rnams kyis snga dro yang dag par mchod cing de nas t'a ma b'u la dang /
translated: In the temple of the mandala anointed with cow dung, the ten young women from five to ten years of age are to be worshipped in the morning with food rich in milk, ghee, milk-rice, khanda, and lard.🔽Then, the tāmbūla,

original: dri dang / spos dang / me tog dang / 'bras bur bcas pa dang / bum pa'i mgrin pa bcings pa'i ras yug dag ni gzhon nu ma rnams la zhes pa bu mo rnams la byin nas /
analyzed: dri dang / spos dang / me tog dang / 'bras bur bcas pa dang / bum pa'i mgrin pa bcings pa'i ras yug dag ni gzhon nu ma rnams la zhes pa bu mo rnams la byin nas /
translated: incense, perfume, flowers, and fruits, along with the cloth tied around the neck of the vase, are given to the young women.

original: slob dpon slob mar bcas pa mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs ni dpa' bo'i ston mos ji ltar 'dod par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon slob mar bcas pa mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs ni dpa' bo'i ston mos ji ltar 'dod par mchod par bya'o //
translated: The entire assembly of the master and disciples should be worshipped with the hero’s feast as desired.

original: de la 'di ni dpa' bo'i ston mo'i cho ga ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni dpa' bo'i ston mo'i cho ga ste /
translated: Here is the procedure for the hero’s feast.

original: 'dir slob dpon yongs su brtag pa las rdo rje slob dpon rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon yongs su brtag pa las rdo rje slob dpon rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, the master is considered to be of three types:

original: mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'o //
analyzed: mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'o //
translated: supreme, middling, and inferior.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: de nyid bcu ni yongs shes pa //
analyzed: de nyid bcu ni yongs shes pa //
translated: The ten essential principles are thoroughly known.

original: gsum las dge slong mchog yin zhing //
analyzed: gsum las dge slong mchog yin zhing //
translated: The monk is the best of the three,

original: 'bring po dge tshul zhes bya ste //
analyzed: 'bring po dge tshul zhes bya ste //
translated: and the novice monk is called the middle one,

original: khyim gnas de las tha ma'o //
analyzed: khyim gnas de las tha ma'o //
translated: and the householder is the lowest of them.

original: zhes pa rgyud kyi nges pa las dge slong dang / dge tshul dang / khyim pa de rnams kyi dbang bskur bas rgan pa 'am gzhon pa nyid thun mong gis gcig tu 'dus pa de'i phyir dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gral ni shar @182b du mngon par phyogs par gyur par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rgyud kyi nges pa las dge slong dang / dge tshul dang / khyim pa de rnams kyi dbang bskur bas rgan pa 'am gzhon pa nyid thun mong gis gcig tu 'dus pa de'i phyir dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gral ni shar @182b du mngon par phyogs par gyur par bya'o //
translated: From the ascertainment of the tantra, the empowerment of those monks, novice monks, and householders, whether senior or junior, is combined into one. Therefore, the row of vajra holders, monks, should face east.

original: dge tshul gyi gral ni byang du mngon par phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge tshul gyi gral ni byang du mngon par phyogs pa'o //
translated: The row of novice monks should face north.

original: khyim pa'i slob dpon gyi gral ni lhor mngon par phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i slob dpon gyi gral ni lhor mngon par phyogs pa'o //
translated: The row of the master of the house should face south.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma'i gral dang / dge tshul ma'i gral dang / dge bsnyen ma'i gral ni so sor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma'i gral dang / dge tshul ma'i gral dang / dge bsnyen ma'i gral ni so sor ro //
translated: Likewise, the row of nuns, the row of novice nuns, and the row of laywomen are individual [rows].

original: de rnams la rgan pa dang gzhon pa la sogs pas gdan rnams sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la rgan pa dang gzhon pa la sogs pas gdan rnams sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Seats should be given to them, whether senior or junior, and so on.

original: de la dge slong rnams las gang zhig dbang gis rgan pa ste /
analyzed: de la dge slong rnams las gang zhig dbang gis rgan pa ste /
translated: Among the monks, the one who is senior by seniority is the most senior.

original: 'on kyang rmongs pa dang gzhon pa ni slob dpon chen po rgyud ston pa po yin na de dag las rgyud ston pa po gang yin pa de dpa' bo'i ston mo la tshogs kyi gtso bo ste rgan po ni khyim gzhan du so sor yang dag par mnyes
analyzed: 'on kyang rmongs pa dang gzhon pa ni slob dpon chen po rgyud ston pa po yin na de dag las rgyud ston pa po gang yin pa de dpa' bo'i ston mo la tshogs kyi gtso bo ste rgan po ni khyim gzhan du so sor yang dag par mnyes
translated: However, if the one who is ignorant and junior is the great master who teaches the tantra, then among them, the one who teaches the tantra is the chief of the assembly in the hero's feast. The senior one should be individually satisfied in another house.

original: par bya'o // de bzhin du rgan po chos ston pa po ma yin pa'i man ngag dang ldan pa gzhan yang ste sems can gyi don byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par bya'o // de bzhin du rgan po chos ston pa po ma yin pa'i man ngag dang ldan pa gzhan yang ste sems can gyi don byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the senior one who is not a teacher of the Dharma, but possesses the instructions, and also the other one who is not able to benefit sentient beings,

original: gzhan yang dge tshul dang khyim pa sngon du dbang bskur ba rnams ni ji srid mngon par shes pa ma bskyed kyi bar du dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa las rgan por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge tshul dang khyim pa sngon du dbang bskur ba rnams ni ji srid mngon par shes pa ma bskyed kyi bar du dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa las rgan por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the novices and householders who have previously been initiated do not become senior to the fully ordained vajra holder until they have generated the superknowledges.

original: ci ste 'ga' zhig rtsod pa byed na yang de'i tshe nus pa dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste 'ga' zhig rtsod pa byed na yang de'i tshe nus pa dri bar bya'o //
translated: If there is any dispute, then at that time, their abilities should be inquired about.

original: gal te mngon shes la sogs pa ston par byed na de'i tshe tshogs kyi gtso bo'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon shes la sogs pa ston par byed na de'i tshe tshogs kyi gtso bo'o //
translated: If he displays supernormal knowledge and so on, then he is the chief of the assembly.

original: ci ste yang dag pa'i spyod pa btang nas brdzun gyi dbang bskur gyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang rtsod pa byed na de'i tshe rang gi gnas su bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang dag pa'i spyod pa btang nas brdzun gyi dbang bskur gyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang rtsod pa byed na de'i tshe rang gi gnas su bskrad par bya'o //
translated: But if he abandons right conduct and, through the empowerment of falsehood, acts with pride and disputes, then he should be expelled from his position.

original: ci ste phyung bas chad pa khas len na de'i tshe chad pa'i bdag pos bza' ba dang ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i chad pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste phyung bas chad pa khas len na de'i tshe chad pa'i bdag pos bza' ba dang ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i chad pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: But if he accepts the punishment for being expelled, then the lord of the punishment should give the punishment of food, drink, and so on.

original: de ltar dge slong dang / dge tshul dang / khyim pa rnams la go rims bzhin bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar dge slong dang / dge tshul dang / khyim pa rnams la go rims bzhin bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Thus, food, drink, and so on should be given to the monks, novices, and householders, respectively.

original: de rnams thams cad nyid ni shar du sngar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad nyid ni shar du sngar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: All of them should be placed in the east in order.

original: de rnams kyi dbus su dkyil 'khor byas nas bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo la dang por bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa phul te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbus su dkyil 'khor byas nas bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo la dang por bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa phul te /
translated: Having made the maṇḍala in the middle of them, first offer food, drink, and so on to Lord Kālacakra.

original: de nas dge slong la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams dang dbang bskur ba gzhan rnams dang de rnams kyi drung na gnas pa rnams la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dge slong la sogs pa'i slob dpon rnams dang dbang bskur ba gzhan rnams dang de rnams kyi drung na gnas pa rnams la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should give to the masters, such as the bhikṣus, and to the others who are bestowing the empowerment, and to those who are present in the presence of those [masters].

original: de ltar mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs ni ji ltar 'dod par mchod byas te /
analyzed: de ltar mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs ni ji ltar 'dod par mchod byas te /
translated: Thus, having worshipped the entire assembly of the family as one wishes,

original: de nas slob dpon gyis slob ma la ni gnang ba rab tu byin nas tshogs kyi sbyin pa'i don du de'i tshe bdag nyid kyi nus pas tshogs la yon phul nas rab mchog @183a * //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis slob ma la ni gnang ba rab tu byin nas tshogs kyi sbyin pa'i don du de'i tshe bdag nyid kyi nus pas tshogs la yon phul nas rab mchog @183a * //
translated: then the master should give permission to the disciple, and having offered a gift to the assembly for the sake of the gift of the assembly with his own ability at that time, the supreme

original: tshogs kyi rigs kun du dga' bar byas pa ni rang rang gnas su gshegs su gsol bar bya'o zhes pa ni dpa' bo'i ston mo'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi rigs kun du dga' bar byas pa ni rang rang gnas su gshegs su gsol bar bya'o zhes pa ni dpa' bo'i ston mo'i nges pa'o //
translated: one should delight the entire assembly of the family and request them to go to their own places. This is the rule for the hero’s feast.

original: da ni dgra zhes pa la sogs pas 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad zhi bar byed pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dgra zhes pa la sogs pas 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad zhi bar byed pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to pacify all fears and harms, [the Bhagavān] declares “enemy” and so forth.🔽Here, some son of good family should draw the maṇḍala, receive the empowerment,

original: 'dir rigs kyi bu gang la la zhig gis dkyil 'khor bris nas dbang bskur blangs te /
analyzed: 'dir rigs kyi bu gang la la zhig gis dkyil 'khor bris nas dbang bskur blangs te /
translated: and

original: rnal 'byor ma sngar gsungs pa rnams kyi zhabs dang nang du aa ba dh'u t'i la sogs pa rnams kyi zhabs nyin zhag so sor dran par byed na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma sngar gsungs pa rnams kyi zhabs dang nang du aa ba dh'u t'i la sogs pa rnams kyi zhabs nyin zhag so sor dran par byed na /
translated: If one recalls the feet of the yoginis mentioned previously, and the feet of Avadhuta, etc.,

original: de la 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: every day, all fears will be destroyed.

original: dgras 'jigs pa dang / seng ges 'jigs pa dang / glang po ches 'jigs pa dang / mes 'jigs pa dang / lto 'phyes 'jigs pa dang / chom rkun gyis 'jigs pa dang / zhags pas 'cher bas 'jigs pa dang / rgya mtsho 'khrugs pas 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: dgras 'jigs pa dang / seng ges 'jigs pa dang / glang po ches 'jigs pa dang / mes 'jigs pa dang / lto 'phyes 'jigs pa dang / chom rkun gyis 'jigs pa dang / zhags pas 'cher bas 'jigs pa dang / rgya mtsho 'khrugs pas 'jigs pa dang /
translated: Fears of enemies, of lions, of elephants, of fire, of snakes, of robbers, of being bound by a noose, of the ocean being agitated,

original: sha zas 'jigs pa dang / nad kyis 'jigs pa dang / dbang po'i nye bar 'tshe bas 'jigs pa dang / dbul ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa dang / bud med dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa dang / mi'i bdag po 'khrugs pas 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: sha zas 'jigs pa dang / nad kyis 'jigs pa dang / dbang po'i nye bar 'tshe bas 'jigs pa dang / dbul ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa dang / bud med dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa dang / mi'i bdag po 'khrugs pas 'jigs pa dang /
translated: fears of flesh-eaters, of disease, of harm to the organs, of the suffering of poverty, of the suffering of being separated from a woman, of the agitation of the lord of men,

original: rdo rje ltung bas 'jigs pa dang / don nyams pas 'jigs pa ste de ltar 'jigs pas bcu drug po rnams dang / gzhan rnams kyang rab tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ltung bas 'jigs pa dang / don nyams pas 'jigs pa ste de ltar 'jigs pas bcu drug po rnams dang / gzhan rnams kyang rab tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: By fear of falling like a diamond, and by fear of the loss of meaning, in this way, by fear, the sixteen and the others also are greatly lost.

original: 'di rnams ni rgya cher le'u dang por bstod pa'i sgo nas brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni rgya cher le'u dang por bstod pa'i sgo nas brjod zin to //
translated: These are stated in the first chapter by way of praise.

original: des na 'dir gsal bar ma byas so //
analyzed: des na 'dir gsal bar ma byas so //
translated: Therefore, they are not clarified here.🔽In this way, the consecration in the mandala of the Wheel of Time is the consecration in all the yoginī and yogin tantras,🔽and one becomes the teacher of all the tantras, the bestower of the permission to practice all the mantras, and the practitioner of all the powers.🔽 🔽The consecration in the mandala of the Wheel of Time is the consecration in all the yoginī and yogin tantras,

original: de ltar dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba ni rnal 'byor ma dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud thams cad du dbang bskur bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba ni rnal 'byor ma dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud thams cad du dbang bskur bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: and one becomes the teacher of all the tantras, the bestower of the permission to practice all the mantras, and the practitioner of all the powers.🔽 🔽The consecration in the mandala of the Wheel of Time is the consecration in all the yoginī and yogin tantras,🔽and one becomes the teacher of all the tantras, the bestower of the permission to practice all the mantras, and the practitioner of all the powers.🔽 🔽The consecration in the mandala of the Wheel of Time is the consecration in all the yoginī and yogin tantras,🔽and one becomes the teacher of all the tantras, the bestower of the permission to practice all the mantras, and the practitioner of all the powers.🔽 🔽The consecration in the mandala of the Wheel of Time is the consecration in all the yoginī and yogin tantras,🔽and one becomes the teacher of all the tantras, the bestower of the permission to practice all the mantras, and the practitioner of all the powers.🔽 🔽The consecration in the mandala of the Wheel of Time is the consecration in all the yoginī and yogin tantras,🔽and one becomes the teacher of all the tantras, the bestower of the permission to practice all the mantras, and the practitioner of all the powers.🔽 🔽The consecration in the mandala of the Wheel of Time is the consecration in all the yoginī and yogin tantras,

original: rgyud thams cad kyi ston pa po dang / sngags thams cad kyi rjes su gnang ba sbyin pa po dang / dngos grub thams cad kyi sgrub pa po ste /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi ston pa po dang / sngags thams cad kyi rjes su gnang ba sbyin pa po dang / dngos grub thams cad kyi sgrub pa po ste /
translated: and one becomes the teacher of all the tantras, the bestower of the permission to practice all the mantras, and the practitioner of all the powers.🔽 🔽The consecration in the mandala of the

original: dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyud ston pa po rdo rje slob dpon ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ji lta ba dang / dus kyi 'khor lo dang po'i sangs rgyas ji lta ba de bzhin du thar pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyud ston pa po rdo rje slob dpon ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ji lta ba dang / dus kyi 'khor lo dang po'i sangs rgyas ji lta ba de bzhin du thar pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: The Vajra Master who teaches the Kalachakra Tantra should be seen by those who seek liberation as being just like the Bhagavat Manjushri and just like the Primordial Buddha Kalachakra.

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rjes su 'brangs nas dbang gi le'u'i rgyas 'grel bris pa'o //🔽bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las phyag rgya dang lta stags dang dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba dang dpa' bo'i ston mo'i mdor bsdus chen
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rjes su 'brangs nas dbang gi le'u'i rgyas 'grel bris pa'o // bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las phyag rgya dang lta stags dang dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol ba dang dpa' bo'i ston mo'i mdor bsdus chen
translated: Following the Supreme Primordial Buddha, I have written the commentary on the initiation chapter.

original: po ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: po ste drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth chapter of the Stainless Light, a commentary on the King of Tantras, the Glorious Kalachakra, which is a commentary on the root tantra in twelve thousand verses, a summary of the Kalachakra Tantra, on mudras, on the mandala, on the invitation of the deities, and on the great feast of the heroes.

original: dbang gi le'u'i rgyas 'grel rdzogs so /
analyzed: dbang gi le'u'i rgyas 'grel rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the initiation chapter is complete.

original: // / @183b # //  dpal dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: // / @183b # //  dpal dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Kalachakra.

original: sh'akya thub pa gang gis yid las byung rnams shes rab ye shes stobs kyis rang nyid kyi //
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa gang gis yid las byung rnams shes rab ye shes stobs kyis rang nyid kyi //
translated: I pay homage to the one who, by the power of the wisdom of the mind,

original: rdo rje nas bkug rang gi dpral ba dang ni rdo rje gtsug tor chen por drangs gyur pa //
analyzed: rdo rje nas bkug rang gi dpral ba dang ni rdo rje gtsug tor chen por drangs gyur pa //
translated: drew forth the mind-born gods from his vajra and led them to his forehead and the great vajra-usnīṣa,

original: gang gis dmigs bcas rdul med stong pa nyid dang dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje bzang po yis //🔽lha mi lha min klu yi bla ma kun gyi ston pa gcig pu de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang gis dmigs bcas rdul med stong pa nyid dang dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje bzang po yis // lha mi lha min klu yi bla ma kun gyi ston pa gcig pu de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: the one who, by the excellent emptiness free from the dust of reference points and by compassion free from reference points,🔽is the sole teacher of all the gods, humans, demigods, and nāgas.

original: gang la rgyu dang mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: gang la rgyu dang mtshan nyid med //
translated: I pay homage to the one who is without cause and characteristics,

original: g-yo dang de bzhin rim med pas //
analyzed: g-yo dang de bzhin rim med pas //
translated: without movement and without sequence,

original: k'a la tsa kra'i mngon brjod pa //
analyzed: k'a la tsa kra'i mngon brjod pa //
translated: the one who is the subject matter of the Kālacakra.

original: gnyis med de la btud byas shing //🔽gang zhig k'a sogs yi ge rnams kyis sprul pa dang // longs spyod rdzogs dang bzang po'i chos dang dag pa yi //
analyzed: gnyis med de la btud byas shing // gang zhig k'a sogs yi ge rnams kyis sprul pa dang // longs spyod rdzogs dang bzang po'i chos dang dag pa yi //
translated: I bow to the nondual one.🔽I bow my head to that Tathāgata, the first buddha without sectarian bias,🔽the one who teaches the four bodies—the emanation body, the enjoyment body, the excellent dharma body, and the pure body—

original: sku bzhi gsung pa dang po'i sangs rgyas ris med pa //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa de la spyi bos rab btud nas //
analyzed: sku bzhi gsung pa dang po'i sangs rgyas ris med pa //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa de la spyi bos rab btud nas //
translated: with the letters such as ka and so forth.

original: bde bar gshegs pas lung bstan cing //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas lung bstan cing //
translated: And the Sugata has prophesied,

original: 'jam dpal gyis ni bskul gyur pas //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis ni bskul gyur pas //
translated: And has been inspired by Manjushri,

original: drang srong rnams dang 'gro kun gyis //
analyzed: drang srong rnams dang 'gro kun gyis //
translated: For the sake of the sages and all beings,

original: bsod nams ye shes 'bras thob slad //🔽dpal ldan ye shes le'u yi //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes 'bras thob slad // dpal ldan ye shes le'u yi //
translated: To attain the fruits of merit and wisdom,🔽I, Padmakara, will compose🔽An extensive commentary on the glorious Wisdom Chapter,

original: rgyas 'grel 'jig rten dbang po ni //
analyzed: rgyas 'grel 'jig rten dbang po ni //
translated: The lord of the world,

original: chu skyes 'dzin pa'i sprul pa'i sku //
analyzed: chu skyes 'dzin pa'i sprul pa'i sku //
translated: The emanation body holding the lotus,

original: padma dkar po bdag gis bri //
analyzed: padma dkar po bdag gis bri //
translated: The white lotus.

original: 'dri dpal ldan ka l'a pa'i grong gi lho ma la ya'i skyed mos tshal gyi dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i shar sgo'i mthar /
analyzed: 'dri dpal ldan ka l'a pa'i grong gi lho ma la ya'i skyed mos tshal gyi dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i shar sgo'i mthar /
translated: In the southern Malaya pleasure grove of the glorious Kalapasi town, at the eastern gate of the Shri Kalachakra mandala house,

original: rin po che'i sgo khyams na nor bu rin po che chen po'i seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i sgo khyams na nor bu rin po che chen po'i seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa /
translated: in a jeweled portico, seated on a lion throne of great precious jewels,

original: 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku mi'i dbang po grags pa tshangs pa'i drang srong nyi ma'i shing rtas gsol ba btab par gyur pas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku mi'i dbang po grags pa tshangs pa'i drang srong nyi ma'i shing rtas gsol ba btab par gyur pas /
translated: the emanation body of Manjushri, the human lord known as the sage Brahma rakshata, was requested by Suryadeva.

original: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las ye shes kyi le'u la zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i lan gyi gsung tshigs su bcad pa dang pos gsungs pa /
analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las ye shes kyi le'u la zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i lan gyi gsung tshigs su bcad pa dang pos gsungs pa /
translated: In the chapter on pristine awareness in the Supreme Original Buddha, Sucandra requests teachings, and the Tathagata responds with the first verse.

original: gtso bo'i sgrub thabs rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa gang zhig khyod kyis gsungs pa dag ni cung zad shes //
analyzed: gtso bo'i sgrub thabs rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa gang zhig khyod kyis gsungs pa dag ni cung zad shes //
translated: You know a little of the principal sadhana with the supreme victor that you have taught.

original: slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo lha mi'i bla ma khams kyi dbye ba rnams kyis dkyil 'khor dang // sangs rgyas rnams dang rnal 'byor ma rnams dag gi rigs drug a'a li k'a li dag la gnas pa nyid //🔽zla ba bzang po'i tshig gsan @184a * //
analyzed: slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo lha mi'i bla ma khams kyi dbye ba rnams kyis dkyil 'khor dang // sangs rgyas rnams dang rnal 'byor ma rnams dag gi rigs drug a'a li k'a li dag la gnas pa nyid // zla ba bzang po'i tshig gsan @184a * //
translated: I wish to hear again, O guru of gods and humans, the mandalas of the divisions of the elements, the families of the buddhas and yoginis abiding in the vowels and consonants.

original: nas ni rgyal ba'i bdag pos khams kyi dbye bas dkyil 'khor la sogs gsungs //
analyzed: nas ni rgyal ba'i bdag pos khams kyi dbye bas dkyil 'khor la sogs gsungs //
translated: Having heard Sucandra's words, the lord of victors taught the mandalas and so forth of the divisions of the elements.

original: zhes pa'o // 'dir tshigs su bcad pa dang pos dang po'i sangs rgyas las zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'dir tshigs su bcad pa dang pos dang po'i sangs rgyas las zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas lan gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the first verse is the request of Sucandra to the primordial Buddha, and the reply of the Tathagata.

original: 'jam dpal gyis don la rton pa nyid kyis yang dag par bsdus pa de nyid rgyas 'grel gyis dgrol bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis don la rton pa nyid kyis yang dag par bsdus pa de nyid rgyas 'grel gyis dgrol bar bya ste /
translated: The summary by Manjusri of the very same [topic] by means of the very reliance on the meaning will be unraveled by means of the extensive commentary.

original: gtso bo'i zhes pa la sogs pa la 'dir sgrub thabs kyi le'u las /
analyzed: gtso bo'i zhes pa la sogs pa la 'dir sgrub thabs kyi le'u las /
translated: The verse beginning with the principal and so forth. Here, in the chapter on the means of achievement, it says:

original: gang zhig gtso bo dus kyi 'khor lo'i sgrub thabs de bzhin gshegs pa dang bcas pa gang zhig khyod kyis gsungs pa de ni bdag gis cung zad shes te de'i phyir slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo kye lha mi'i bla ma sh'akya thub pa lus la
analyzed: gang zhig gtso bo dus kyi 'khor lo'i sgrub thabs de bzhin gshegs pa dang bcas pa gang zhig khyod kyis gsungs pa de ni bdag gis cung zad shes te de'i phyir slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo kye lha mi'i bla ma sh'akya thub pa lus la
translated: Whatever means of achieving the principal Wheel of Time, together with the Tathagatas, that you have taught, I have understood a little of that, and so I wish to hear it again. Oh, Sakyamuni, the guru of gods and men, in your body, speech, and mind,

original: khams kyi dbye ba rnams kyis zhes pa rus pa la sogs pa'i khams rnam par dag pa rnams kyis dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor dang / gzhan yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs drug nyan par 'tshal te gang zhig a'a li k'a li dag la gnas pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khams kyi dbye ba rnams kyis zhes pa rus pa la sogs pa'i khams rnam par dag pa rnams kyis dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor dang / gzhan yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs drug nyan par 'tshal te gang zhig a'a li k'a li dag la gnas pa zhes pa ni /
translated: I wish to hear which are located in the vowels and consonants,

original: aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs la gnas pa dang / ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed la gnas pa 'chad par 'gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs la gnas pa dang / ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed la gnas pa 'chad par 'gyur pa rnams so //
translated: which are located in the vowels beginning with a and the consonants beginning with ka, as will be explained.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma rnams ngag gi de dag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma rnams ngag gi de dag ste /
translated: Likewise, the yoginis are their speech.

original: phung po drug po rnams kyi rigs drug ji lta ba de bzhin du khams drug po rnams kyi yang aa la sogs pa dang ka la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po drug po rnams kyi rigs drug ji lta ba de bzhin du khams drug po rnams kyi yang aa la sogs pa dang ka la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Just as the six clans of the six aggregates, so also the six clans of the six elements are located in the vowels beginning with a and the consonants beginning with ka.

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig 'di gsan nas te de nas rgyal ba'i bdag po zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa sku bzhi'i bdag nyid sgrib pa med pa'i phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig 'di gsan nas te de nas rgyal ba'i bdag po zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa sku bzhi'i bdag nyid sgrib pa med pa'i phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having heard these words of Sucandra, then the Lord of Victors, the one with the nature of the four bodies such as the Innate, the one with the unobstructed aggregates, and so on,

original: de rnams kyi bdag po ni skyed par byed pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po ni skyed par byed pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: the Lord of those, the one who generates them, the perfect Buddha, the first Buddha,

original: khams kyi dbye bas dkyil 'khor la sogs zhes pa rigs drug la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur pa rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: khams kyi dbye bas dkyil 'khor la sogs zhes pa rigs drug la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur pa rnams gsungs te /
translated: the one with the divisions of the elements, the mandalas, and so on, the ones who will be explained as the six clans, and so on,

original: ston pa dang / gsol ba 'debs pa po'i 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang / gsol ba 'debs pa po'i 'brel pa'o //
translated: the connection between the teacher and the one who requests.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di la rkang pa gsum gyis zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di la rkang pa gsum gyis zla ba bzang pos gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: In this verse, the first three lines are the request of Sucandra.

original: rkang ba bzhi pa nas brtsams te ji srid le'u yongs su rdzogs pa de srid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lan gyi gsung ste /
analyzed: rkang ba bzhi pa nas brtsams te ji srid le'u yongs su rdzogs pa de srid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lan gyi gsung ste /
translated: Beginning from the fourth line up to the end of the chapter, that is the reply of the Tathagata.

original: rgyud 'di la slar yang gsol ba gdab ba med do zhes pa ni nges @184b pa'o ;
analyzed: rgyud 'di la slar yang gsol ba gdab ba med do zhes pa ni nges @184b pa'o ;
translated: There is no further request in this Tantra.

original: / da ni khams rnam par dag pas dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ka ba rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / da ni khams rnam par dag pas dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ka ba rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the purity of the mandala by way of the purity of the elements is stated:🔽The bones of the body are the pillars of the body mandala.

original: 'dir lus kyi rus pa rnams kyis lus la sku'i dkyil 'khor la ka ba rnams mdzod cig ces pa brtags pas so //
analyzed: 'dir lus kyi rus pa rnams kyis lus la sku'i dkyil 'khor la ka ba rnams mdzod cig ces pa brtags pas so //
translated: Here, the bones of the body are the pillars of the body mandala.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje phreng ba dang sa'i khor yug dang / rtsig pa yang rus pa rnams kyis te mdzod ces pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum du 'brel lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje phreng ba dang sa'i khor yug dang / rtsig pa yang rus pa rnams kyis te mdzod ces pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum du 'brel lo //
translated: Likewise, the vajra garland and the wall and the surrounding mountains are also by way of the bones.

original: rnam par dag pa 'dir srus pa'i phye ma la sogs pa rdul tshon gyis nang du blugs par bya'o //🔽sha khrag chu dang bshad pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni sha rnam par dag pas lha ste shar du rdul tshon gdab pa'o ;🔽/ khrag rnam par dag pas gshin rje ste lhor rdul tshon gdab pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa 'dir srus pa'i phye ma la sogs pa rdul tshon gyis nang du blugs par bya'o // sha khrag chu dang bshad pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni sha rnam par dag pas lha ste shar du rdul tshon gdab pa'o ; / khrag rnam par dag pas gshin rje ste lhor rdul tshon gdab pa'o //
translated: In this purity, the powders of the bones and so forth are to be put inside the colored powders.🔽The flesh, blood, water, and excrement are the gods.🔽The flesh is the purity of Indra, and the colored powder is to be put in the east.

original: chu rnam par dag pas nor sbyin te byang du rdul tshon gdab pa'o //
analyzed: chu rnam par dag pas nor sbyin te byang du rdul tshon gdab pa'o //
translated: Blood is the purity of Yama, and the colored powder is to be put in the south.🔽Water is the purity of Kubera, and the colored powder is to be put in the north.

original: bshang pa rnam par dag pas gzhan te nub tu rdul tshon gdab pa'o //
analyzed: bshang pa rnam par dag pas gzhan te nub tu rdul tshon gdab pa'o //
translated: In the west, one should lay down the colored powder with the pure feces.

original: dbus su khu ba rnam par dag pas rdul tshon gdab ba'o //
analyzed: dbus su khu ba rnam par dag pas rdul tshon gdab ba'o //
translated: In the center, one should lay down the colored powder with the pure semen.

original: gang du rdul tshon drug pa yin pa der ni rdul rnam par dag pas rdul tshon gdab pa'o //
analyzed: gang du rdul tshon drug pa yin pa der ni rdul rnam par dag pas rdul tshon gdab pa'o //
translated: Wherever there is a sixth colored powder, there one should lay down the colored powder with the pure blood.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa shal sogs pa rnam par dag pas rim pa bzhin du don yod grub pa dang / rin chen dbang po dang / 'od dpag med dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rdo rje sems dpal ste drug go //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa shal sogs pa rnam par dag pas rim pa bzhin du don yod grub pa dang / rin chen dbang po dang / 'od dpag med dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rdo rje sems dpal ste drug go //
translated: Thus, Amoghasiddhi, Ratnasaṃbhavam, Amitābha, Vairocana, Akṣobhya, and Vajrasattva are the six, in that order, with the pure hair of the head, etc.

original: mkhris pa zhes pa mkhris pa'i khams kyis nyi ma'i gdan rnams dang / bad kan gyi khams kyis zla ba'i gdan rnams te nyi ma'i ri bong can yang zhes so //
analyzed: mkhris pa zhes pa mkhris pa'i khams kyis nyi ma'i gdan rnams dang / bad kan gyi khams kyis zla ba'i gdan rnams te nyi ma'i ri bong can yang zhes so //
translated: The bile is the seats of the suns with the element of bile, and the phlegm is the seats of the moons with the element of phlegm.

original: chu rgyus rnams kyis chu skyes rnams te zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan gyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: chu rgyus rnams kyis chu skyes rnams te zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan gyi 'og tu'o //
translated: The veins are the lotuses below the seats of the suns and moons.

original: ra ba lnga'i re kh'a zhes pa la re kh'a dang po ni sa las skyes pa'i mthe bo rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: ra ba lnga'i re kh'a zhes pa la re kh'a dang po ni sa las skyes pa'i mthe bo rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The “lines of the five walls” are the lines: the first line is with the pure big toe born from earth.

original: gnyis ba ni chu las skyes pa'i mdzub mo rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: gnyis ba ni chu las skyes pa'i mdzub mo rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The second is with the pure index finger born from water.

original: gsum pa me las skyes pa'i gung mo rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: gsum pa me las skyes pa'i gung mo rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The third is with the pure middle finger born from fire.

original: bzhi pa ni rlung las skyes pa'i ming med rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rlung las skyes pa'i ming med rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The fourth is with the pure ring finger born from wind.

original: lnga pa ni nam mkha' las skyes pa'i mthe chung rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: lnga pa ni nam mkha' las skyes pa'i mthe chung rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The fifth is with the pure little finger born from space.

original: de ltar rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la ra ba lnga'i re kh'a mdzod ces pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la ra ba lnga'i re kh'a mdzod ces pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the mandala of colored powder, there are the lines of the five walls.

original: dus kyi rtsa yis gtso bo'i chu skyes zhes pa ni aa ba dh'u t'i rnam par dag pas gtso bo'i padma'o //🔽lhag ma rnams ni la la n'a la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa @185a * //
analyzed: dus kyi rtsa yis gtso bo'i chu skyes zhes pa ni aa ba dh'u t'i rnam par dag pas gtso bo'i padma'o // lhag ma rnams ni la la n'a la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa @185a * //
translated: “ The principal lotus is with the channel of time” means that the principal lotus is with the pure avadhūtī.

original: gnyis kyi mthar thug pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi mthar thug pa rnams kyis te /
translated: “ The rest are with lalanā and so on” means that the rest are with the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: chu rgyus rnams kyis zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: chu rgyus rnams kyis zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The channels are the sinews.

original: g-yo ba me yi khor yug la sogs pags pa la sogs kyis zhes ba 'dir rlung gi khor yug ni pags pas so //
analyzed: g-yo ba me yi khor yug la sogs pags pa la sogs kyis zhes ba 'dir rlung gi khor yug ni pags pas so //
translated: Here, the wind-encircling-mandala is the skin.

original: me'i khor yug ni khrag dang drod kyi khams kyis so //
analyzed: me'i khor yug ni khrag dang drod kyi khams kyis so //
translated: The fire-encircling-mandala is the blood and the heat element.

original: chu'i khor yug ni rdul gyis so //
analyzed: chu'i khor yug ni rdul gyis so //
translated: The water-encircling-mandala is the lymph.

original: nyi ma'i sgo rnams zhes pa sgo bcu gnyis po rnams bug ba bcu gnyis po rnams kyis te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i sgo rnams zhes pa sgo bcu gnyis po rnams bug ba bcu gnyis po rnams kyis te /
translated: The doors of the sun are the twelve doors, the twelve openings.

original: rna ba la gnyis dang / sna la gnyis dang / mig la gnyis dang / kha la gcig dang / gci ba dang / bshad ba dang / khu ba'i bug pa gsum dang / nu ma gnyis la gnyis so //
analyzed: rna ba la gnyis dang / sna la gnyis dang / mig la gnyis dang / kha la gcig dang / gci ba dang / bshad ba dang / khu ba'i bug pa gsum dang / nu ma gnyis la gnyis so //
translated: There are two for the ears, two for the nose, two for the eyes, one for the mouth, three for the excrement, urine, and semen openings, and two for the breasts.

original: de ltar bug pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar bug pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: Thus there are twelve openings.

original: bug pa bcu gnyis rnam par dag pas rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la mdzod cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: bug pa bcu gnyis rnam par dag pas rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la mdzod cig ces pa'o //
translated: The twelve doors are purified by the twelve colored sand mandalas.

original: dkyil 'khor la nor bu'i rang bzhin bkod pa do shal la sogs pa gang yin pa de so yi phreng bas mdzod cig dur khrod brgyad du 'khor lo gang yin pa de rnams ni sor mo rnams kyi sen mo yis zhes pa lag pa dang /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la nor bu'i rang bzhin bkod pa do shal la sogs pa gang yin pa de so yi phreng bas mdzod cig dur khrod brgyad du 'khor lo gang yin pa de rnams ni sor mo rnams kyi sen mo yis zhes pa lag pa dang /
translated: The garland and so forth that is the nature of the jewel in the mandala, that should be made with the row of teeth. The wheel that is in the eight charnel grounds, that should be made with the nails of the fingers and toes.

original: rkang pa'i sen mo rnam par dag pas mdzod cig ba spu rnams kyis rdo rje me lce zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi rdo rje phreng ba dang / rdo rje 'bar ba ba spu rnams kyis mdzod cig ste /
analyzed: rkang pa'i sen mo rnam par dag pas mdzod cig ba spu rnams kyis rdo rje me lce zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi rdo rje phreng ba dang / rdo rje 'bar ba ba spu rnams kyis mdzod cig ste /
translated: The vajra flame with the body hairs, the outer vajra garland and the vajra flame should be made with the body hairs.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi ni mtha' ru phyogs dang phyogs bral dag la gnas pa'i rdo rje me lce ba spu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi ni mtha' ru phyogs dang phyogs bral dag la gnas pa'i rdo rje me lce ba spu rnams kyis so //
translated: With the body hairs of the vajra flame at the end of the mandala in the directions and intermediate directions.

original: de ltar nges par sku yi rdo rje khams drug gi bdag nyid sa la sogs pa'i dbye bas mchog gi yon tan rnam mad dkyil 'khor gyi ni rnam par gsungs zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nges par sku yi rdo rje khams drug gi bdag nyid sa la sogs pa'i dbye bas mchog gi yon tan rnam mad dkyil 'khor gyi ni rnam par gsungs zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the vajra body, which is the nature of the six elements, is said to be the mandala of the various supreme qualities by the division of earth and so forth. This is the definition of the mandala.

original: da ni lha'i tshogs kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa gsung gi rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir aa sogs ka sogs dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi bdag nyid ni gsung rdo rje ste dbyangs dang gsal byed yongs su gyur pa'i lha'i tshogs mtha' dag rgyal🔽ba'i rigs dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: da ni lha'i tshogs kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa gsung gi rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir aa sogs ka sogs dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi bdag nyid ni gsung rdo rje ste dbyangs dang gsal byed yongs su gyur pa'i lha'i tshogs mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Here, the nature of the vowels and consonants beginning with a and ka is Vajra Speech, and the entire host of deities that are the transformation of the vowels and consonants are the victors’ families.

original: des na gsung gi rdo rje ni lha'i rnam pa nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: des na gsung gi rdo rje ni lha'i rnam pa nyid du gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, Vajra Speech is stated to be the very form of the deities.

original: de nyid rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la lha'i rnam par mdzod cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la lha'i rnam par mdzod cig ces pa'o //
translated: That is to say, “Please be in the form of the deities in the maṇḍala of colored powder.”🔽“Vajra Mind” by the six emptinesses is the purity of the eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness,

original: stong pa drug gis thugs kyi rdo rje zhes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang /🔽yid kyi rnam par @185b shes pa rnam par dag pas rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: stong pa drug gis thugs kyi rdo rje zhes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang /🔽yid kyi rnam par @185b shes pa rnam par dag pas rnam pa drug ste /
translated: and mental consciousness.

original: stong pa drug dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams sgrib pa med pa thugs rdo rjer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa drug dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams sgrib pa med pa thugs rdo rjer 'gyur ro //
translated: The six emptinesses and the objects such as form become the mind vajra.

original: rnam gsum srid bar gnas bas kun la khyab pa gtso bo'i rnam pa gcig bur mdzod cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: rnam gsum srid bar gnas bas kun la khyab pa gtso bo'i rnam pa gcig bur mdzod cig ces pa'o //
translated: The three existences are pervaded by the one aspect of the principal one, which is the abode.🔽Similarly, the three minds to be held by the wisdom vajra, abiding in the three existences, are the emptiness that is the nature of the mother of variety.

original: de bzhin du ni ye shes rdo rje gzung bar bya ba'i sems rnams gsum gyi srid pa la gnas pa sna tshogs yum gyi rang bzhin stong ba nyid kyi gzugs srid ba'i 'jigs 'dzoms rtog pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i shes rab gtso mor dkyil 'khor🔽la mdzod cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni ye shes rdo rje gzung bar bya ba'i sems rnams gsum gyi srid pa la gnas pa sna tshogs yum gyi rang bzhin stong ba nyid kyi gzugs srid ba'i 'jigs 'dzoms rtog pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i shes rab gtso mor dkyil 'khor la mdzod cig ces pa'o //
translated: The mandala of the principal one, the wisdom that is the abode of the fear of existence, is free from all concepts.🔽Thus, the body, speech, mind, and gnosis elements in the body are the outer mandala, the assembly of deities, the principal one, and the principal one, the mother, respectively, in the relative sense.

original: de ltar lus la sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi khams rnams ni phyi rol du dkyil 'khor dang lha'i tshogs dang gtso bo dang gtso mo'i zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu ste don dam pas ni sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos dang
analyzed: de ltar lus la sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi khams rnams ni phyi rol du dkyil 'khor dang lha'i tshogs dang gtso bo dang gtso mo'i zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu ste don dam pas ni sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos dang
translated: In the ultimate sense, the emanation, enjoyment, and dharma bodies are the three vajras, the three mandalas, and the three purities.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes 'grub po //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes 'grub po //
translated: is innate.🔽Now, the six classes of the types are stated: the group, etc.

original: da ni sngags drug gi rigs rnams gsungs pa sde pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ka la sogs pa'i sde pa drug ni ka tsa ta ta pas zhes pa'o //🔽sde ba ka la sogs pa rim par yongs su bkod pa de rnams kyi rigs drug ni rgyal ba rnams kyi rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams te de la rdo rje ni ka sde'i rigs dang ral gri ni tsa de'i rigs bar rin chen ni ta
analyzed: da ni sngags drug gi rigs rnams gsungs pa sde pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ka la sogs pa'i sde pa drug ni ka tsa ta ta pas zhes pa'o // sde ba ka la sogs pa rim par yongs su bkod pa de rnams kyi rigs drug ni rgyal ba rnams kyi rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams te de la rdo rje ni ka sde'i rigs dang ral gri ni tsa de'i rigs bar rin chen ni ta
translated: Here, the six groups beginning with ka are ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, and sa.🔽The six classes of the types of those, which are the groups ka, etc., arranged in order, are the vajra, etc., the signs of the victors.

original: sde'i rigs dang 'khor lo ni ta sde'i rigs dang chu skyes ni pa sde'i rigs so //
analyzed: sde'i rigs dang 'khor lo ni ta sde'i rigs dang chu skyes ni pa sde'i rigs so //
translated: There, the vajra is the type of the ka group, the sword is the type of the ca group, the jewel is the type of the ṭa group, the wheel is the type of the ta group, and the lotus is the type of the pa group.

original: de bzhin du gri gug ni sa sde'i rigs de nyid ces ba mtha' gcig tu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gri gug ni sa sde'i rigs de nyid ces ba mtha' gcig tu'o //
translated: Likewise, the flaying knife is the type of the sa group.

original: sde pa'i rigs nges pa'o //
analyzed: sde pa'i rigs nges pa'o //
translated: The types of the groups are ascertained.

original: slar yang sde pa re re la yang mtha' dag rgyal ba mchog gi dbye ba lnga rnams dag gis dbye zhes pa ni 'dir gang du gcig yin pa der kun 'byung gi bden pas rigs lnga rnams su 'gyur te des na 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi slad
analyzed: slar yang sde pa re re la yang mtha' dag rgyal ba mchog gi dbye ba lnga rnams dag gis dbye zhes pa ni 'dir gang du gcig yin pa der kun 'byung gi bden pas rigs lnga rnams su 'gyur te des na 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi slad
translated: Therefore, for the sake of mundane powers,

original: du de rnams kyi tha snyad do //
analyzed: du de rnams kyi tha snyad do //
translated: there are conventions of those.🔽Therefore, each school is individually divided into five schools from the elements of earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: de'i phyir sde pa re re la yang so sor yi ge'i dbye ba sa'i dngos po dang chu'i dngos po dang me'i dngos po dang rlung gi dngos po dang nam mkha'i dngos po las so sor sde pa rnam pa lngar dbye ste ka kha ga gha nga zhes
analyzed: de'i phyir sde pa re re la yang so sor yi ge'i dbye ba sa'i dngos po dang chu'i dngos po dang me'i dngos po dang rlung gi dngos po dang nam mkha'i dngos po las so sor sde pa rnam pa lngar dbye ste ka kha ga gha nga zhes
translated: Thus, ka kha ga gha ṅga,

original: pa dang de bzhin du tsal sogs pa ste bsdu ba'i rim pas klog pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang de bzhin du tsal sogs pa ste bsdu ba'i rim pas klog pa'o //
translated: and likewise ca and so on, are read in the sequence of the collection.

original: so sor sdud pa'i rim pas klog pas ni slar yang nga la sogs pa rnams nam mkha' la sogs bskyed pa'i rim pas bklags pa ste de rnams kyang gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: so sor sdud pa'i rim pas klog pas ni slar yang nga la sogs pa rnams nam mkha' la sogs bskyed pa'i rim pas bklags pa ste de rnams kyang gsungs pa dang por zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: By the stage of withdrawal, one should read “I” and so on, which are the creation stage of space and so on.

original: 'dir dang po re zhig stong pa ni @186a * //
analyzed: 'dir dang po re zhig stong pa ni @186a * //
translated: Here, first, “empty” is🔽the letter a, and “in the middle” is the letter ha, which is included by mentioning it.

original: nga nya na ma na dang de bzhin du thka dang dang po'i dbyangs zhes pa aa yig dang de'i dbus su lhung ba ni de smos pas bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i brda skad kyis ha yig kyang nam mkha'i dbye ba'o zhes grub po //
analyzed: nga nya na ma na dang de bzhin du thka dang dang po'i dbyangs zhes pa aa yig dang de'i dbus su lhung ba ni de smos pas bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i brda skad kyis ha yig kyang nam mkha'i dbye ba'o zhes grub po //
translated: Thus, the letter ha is established as the division of space.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi dbye ba ai yig dang gha dzha dha bha dha sha rnams dang ya yig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi dbye ba ai yig dang gha dzha dha bha dha sha rnams dang ya yig go //
translated: Similarly, the division of wind is the letter i and the letters gha, jha, dha, bha, and dha, and the letter ya.

original: me yi ri dang ga dza da ba nga sha rnams dang ra'o //
analyzed: me yi ri dang ga dza da ba nga sha rnams dang ra'o //
translated: The division of fire is the letters ga, jha, da, bha, and dha, and the letter ra.

original: chu yi au dang sha tsha tha pha tha wa rnams dang wa'o //
analyzed: chu yi au dang sha tsha tha pha tha wa rnams dang wa'o //
translated: The division of water is the letters u, shha, sha, sa, and ha, and the letter wa.

original: sa yi li dang ka tsa ta pa ta sa rnams dang la'o //
analyzed: sa yi li dang ka tsa ta pa ta sa rnams dang la'o //
translated: The division of earth is the letters la, ka, ca, ta, pa, and ta, and the letter la.

original: de ltar mchog gi rgyal ba'i rigs ni rnam pa lnga yis ka la sogs pa'i sde rnams rnam par phye zhes pa ste rdo rje dang ral gri dang rin po che dang padma dang 'khor lo'i rigs rnams kyis gsungs pa'i yi ge nga la sogs pa rnams rig🔽par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mchog gi rgyal ba'i rigs ni rnam pa lnga yis ka la sogs pa'i sde rnams rnam par phye zhes pa ste rdo rje dang ral gri dang rin po che dang padma dang 'khor lo'i rigs rnams kyis gsungs pa'i yi ge nga la sogs pa rnams rig par bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: it should be known that the letters ṅa and so on are taught by the families of the vajra, sword, jewel, lotus, and wheel.🔽Now, the families of the uṣṇīṣa are taught: uṣṇīṣa, and so on.

original: da ni gtsug tor gyi rigs rnams gsungs pa gtsug tor zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gtsug tor chen po'i rigs chen gang yin pa de ni stong pa lnga ste 'jig rten khams kyi le'ur brjod zin to //
analyzed: da ni gtsug tor gyi rigs rnams gsungs pa gtsug tor zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gtsug tor chen po'i rigs chen gang yin pa de ni stong pa lnga ste 'jig rten khams kyi le'ur brjod zin to //
translated: Here, the great family of the great uṣṇīṣa is the five voids, which have been described in the chapter on the world systems.

original: rigs gsum ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje ste aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs gsum ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje ste aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'o //
translated: The three families are the vajra of body, speech, and mind, namely, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

original: aa sogs zhes pa ni aa ai ri au li ste lha'i tshogs rgyas gdab pa'i slad du phyag rgya'i rigs mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aa sogs zhes pa ni aa ai ri au li ste lha'i tshogs rgyas gdab pa'i slad du phyag rgya'i rigs mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The a and so on are a i r i u u l i, the families of the seals Akṣobhya and so on, in order to seal the assembly of deities.

original: 'jig rten snang byed rigs chen dang zhes pa ni ha ya ra wa laksha dang ldan pa'i ka sogs sde pa mtha' dag rnams te gsal byed sum cu rtsa drug go //🔽ha ya ra wa lar ldan dbyangs dang bcas pa'i sde pa rnams te ha la sogs pa dbyangs dang bcas pa drug cu sngar gsungs pa rnams dang / ka la sogs pa dbyangs dang bcas pa sum brgya drug cu dang slar yang yon tan dang 'phel ba dang ya nar bsgyur pas phye ba stong brgyad cu ni 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten snang byed rigs chen dang zhes pa ni ha ya ra wa laksha dang ldan pa'i ka sogs sde pa mtha' dag rnams te gsal byed sum cu rtsa drug go // ha ya ra wa lar ldan dbyangs dang bcas pa'i sde pa rnams te ha la sogs pa dbyangs dang bcas pa drug cu sngar gsungs pa rnams dang / ka la sogs pa dbyangs dang bcas pa sum brgya drug cu dang slar yang yon tan dang 'phel ba dang ya nar bsgyur pas phye ba stong brgyad cu ni 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The great class of the illuminators of the world are the groups beginning with ka, endowed with ha, ya, ra, wa, and la, that is, the thirty-six consonants.🔽The groups endowed with the vowels endowed with ha, ya, ra, wa, and la, that is, the sixty previously mentioned beginning with ha, and the three hundred and sixty beginning with ka, endowed with the vowels, and again divided by the qualities, the increases, and the ya-replacement, are the class of the mundane and supramundane.

original: gsal byed brtsegs pa ni rig sngags 'chang gi dbang por 'gyur te ka sogs mtha' dag brtsegs par gnas pa'i sde pa brgyad rnams zhes pa ni kkhggahda tstshdzdzhnya ntrhadhna ppbbhma htrhadhhna skrashaka llryha lwryksha zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsal byed brtsegs pa ni rig sngags 'chang gi dbang por 'gyur te ka sogs mtha' dag brtsegs par gnas pa'i sde pa brgyad rnams zhes pa ni kkhggahda tstshdzdzhnya ntrhadhna ppbbhma htrhadhhna skrashaka llryha lwryksha zhes pa'o //
translated: The consonants in a heap are the lords of the mantra-holders. The eight groups of the consonants beginning with ka, all in a heap, are ka kha ga gha ṅa, ca cha ja jha ña, ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa, ta tha da dha na, pa pha ba bha ma, ya ra la va, śa ṣa sa ha, and kṣa.

original: da ni ka la sogs pa'i yi ge so so re re la rgyud so so re re gsungs pa ka sogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ka la sogs pa'i gsal byed sum cu ha ya ra wa la ksha dang bcas pa ni sum cu rtsa drug
analyzed: da ni ka la sogs pa'i yi ge so so re re la rgyud so so re re gsungs pa ka sogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ka la sogs pa'i gsal byed sum cu ha ya ra wa la ksha dang bcas pa ni sum cu rtsa drug
translated: The consonants such as ka and so on, together with the thirty-six,

original: nyid de de rnams ni yi ge zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyid de de rnams ni yi ge zhes bya'o //
translated: are called “letters.”🔽Those letters are divided by the vowels.🔽The vowels are the twelve short and long vowels such as a, the twelve qualities and augmentations to be placed, and the twelve short and long ya-varta vowels.

original: yi ge de rnams dbyangs kyi rnam par 'gyur @186b bas phye ba zhes pa la dbyings ni aa yig la sogs pa thung du dang ring po bcu gnyis dang yon tan dang 'phel bar gzhag par bya ba bcu gnyis dang / ya nar bsgyur pa thung du dang ring po bcu gnyis te dbyangs kyi rnam par 'gyur pa 'di rnams kyis drug drug gis phye bar gyur pa na ro yis bsgyur ba'i ro zhes pa sum cu rtsa drug ni 'khor lo'i mgon po rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge de rnams dbyangs kyi rnam par 'gyur @186b bas phye ba zhes pa la dbyings ni aa yig la sogs pa thung du dang ring po bcu gnyis dang yon tan dang 'phel bar gzhag par bya ba bcu gnyis dang / ya nar bsgyur pa thung du dang ring po bcu gnyis te dbyangs kyi rnam par 'gyur pa 'di rnams kyis drug drug gis phye bar gyur pa na ro yis bsgyur ba'i ro zhes pa sum cu rtsa drug ni 'khor lo'i mgon po rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: When those vowels are divided into six groups, the thirty-six that are transformed by the ras are the lords of the wheels.

original: yi ge so so re re la sum cu rtsa drug gi dbye bas phye bar 'gyur te de ltar na thams cad la sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: yi ge so so re re la sum cu rtsa drug gi dbye bas phye bar 'gyur te de ltar na thams cad la sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: Each individual letter is divided into thirty-six parts, and thus all of them have thirty-six parts.

original: rgyud sum cu rtsa drug po rnams la gsal byed sum cu rtsa drug gi rang bzhin gyis 'khor lo'i mgon por yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud sum cu rtsa drug po rnams la gsal byed sum cu rtsa drug gi rang bzhin gyis 'khor lo'i mgon por yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The thirty-six continuums are also the lord of the wheel, by nature the thirty-six consonants.

original: dang por gsal byed ka gtso bos ka rdo rje'i rgyud gsungs te de la dkyil 'khor du gtso bo sku ni gcig pa dbyangs gcig gis phye ba ste dpa' bo gcig pa ni aa yig dang bcas pa'i gsal byed ka'o //
analyzed: dang por gsal byed ka gtso bos ka rdo rje'i rgyud gsungs te de la dkyil 'khor du gtso bo sku ni gcig pa dbyangs gcig gis phye ba ste dpa' bo gcig pa ni aa yig dang bcas pa'i gsal byed ka'o //
translated: First, the lord Ka uttered the Ka-vajra Tantra. In it, the principal body in the mandala is one, divided by one vowel, the single hero, the consonant Ka with the vowel A.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa gnyis zhes pa aa yig gnyis dang ldan pa ni gtso bo shes rab ma yis 'khyud par 'gyur te k'a'o //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa gnyis zhes pa aa yig gnyis dang ldan pa ni gtso bo shes rab ma yis 'khyud par 'gyur te k'a'o //
translated: The one with retinue is two, endowed with two A vowels, the principal embraced by the wisdom lady, Ka.

original: lnga yi bdag nyid lnga yis 'gyur te zhes pa ni k'a ki kri ku kli zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lnga yi bdag nyid lnga yis 'gyur te zhes pa ni k'a ki kri ku kli zhes pa'o //
translated: The five natures are five, Ka, Ki, Kri, Ku, Kli.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa dgu ni 'khor lo'i mgon po dgu bdag nyid ces pa ni k'a ki k'i kri kr'i ku k'u kli kl'i zhes pa'o //🔽dbyangs kyi grangs kyi bdag nyid bcu gsum dgu dang phyogs rnams kyis kyang zhes pa ni bcu gsum gyis bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid de sngar brjod pa rnams kya kra kwa kla ya na ra bsgyur pa 'di rnams dang ldan pa ni sgro skyong rnams dang bcas pa🔽bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid do //🔽'di yang yon tan rnams kyis phye ba bcu dgu'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te ka ke ka ra ko ka la kam zhes pa 'di rnams dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa dgu ni 'khor lo'i mgon po dgu bdag nyid ces pa ni k'a ki k'i kri kr'i ku k'u kli kl'i zhes pa'o // dbyangs kyi grangs kyi bdag nyid bcu gsum dgu dang phyogs rnams kyis kyang zhes pa ni bcu gsum gyis bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid de sngar brjod pa rnams kya kra kwa kla ya na ra bsgyur pa 'di rnams dang ldan pa ni sgro skyong rnams dang bcas pa bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid do // 'di yang yon tan rnams kyis phye ba bcu dgu'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te ka ke ka ra ko ka la kam zhes pa 'di rnams dang bcas pa'o //

original: mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid ni lhag ma'i dbyangs thung du dang ring po dang // yon tan dang 'phel bar gzhag par bya ba rnams kyis te lhag ma'i dbyangs rnams nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid ni lhag ma'i dbyangs thung du dang ring po dang // yon tan dang 'phel bar gzhag par bya ba rnams kyis te lhag ma'i dbyangs rnams nyid kyis so //
translated: The characteristics of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields of the entire family of the assembly are by the remaining short and long vowels, and by the qualities and augmentations.

original: khro bo drug tu ha sogs kyis 'gyur zhes pa ni gang du phyogs bcu rnams su khro bo bcur 'gyur pa der gzhan khro bo drug po de rnams su ha la sogs pa ya na ra bsgyur pa'i ring po rnams kyis 'gyur te kha kh'a ky'a kr'a kw'a
analyzed: khro bo drug tu ha sogs kyis 'gyur zhes pa ni gang du phyogs bcu rnams su khro bo bcur 'gyur pa der gzhan khro bo drug po de rnams su ha la sogs pa ya na ra bsgyur pa'i ring po rnams kyis 'gyur te kha kh'a ky'a kr'a kw'a
translated: The six wrathful ones are by the long ha, etc. Where there are ten wrathful ones in the ten directions, there the other six wrathful ones are by the long ha, etc.

original: kw'a zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kw'a zhes pa'o //
translated: kha kha kā kā kva kva

original: gang du khro bo'i dbang po yin pa de kham kha: zhes pa khro bo bcu gnyis ni rigs drug gi rgyud de rigs gcig gi rgyud la yang dbyangs drug rigs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: gang du khro bo'i dbang po yin pa de kham kha: zhes pa khro bo bcu gnyis ni rigs drug gi rgyud de rigs gcig gi rgyud la yang dbyangs drug rigs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Where there is the Lord of Wrath, there is kham kham. The twelve wrathful ones are in the tantra of the six families. In the tantra of one family, by the division of the families, there are six vowels. This is the rule.

original: rang rigs phyogs su gnas pa ni nam mkha'i khams steng dang ye shes kyi khams 'og tu gnas pa ste lha gzhan rnams ni rlung gi dbyangs la sogs pa'i dbye ba yis shar dang lho dang byang dang nub tu gnas so //
analyzed: rang rigs phyogs su gnas pa ni nam mkha'i khams steng dang ye shes kyi khams 'og tu gnas pa ste lha gzhan rnams ni rlung gi dbyangs la sogs pa'i dbye ba yis shar dang lho dang byang dang nub tu gnas so //
translated: The element of space is above, and the element of gnosis is below. The other deities are in the east, south, west, and north, by the divisions of the tones of the wind, and so forth.

original: de ltar so sor ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed ni yi ge'i dbye ba rnams kyis te dbyangs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis ro yis bsgyur pa'i ro zhes pa sum cu rtsa drug gi dbye bas phye ba ni rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor rgyud ces pa
analyzed: de ltar so sor ka yig la sogs pa'i gsal byed ni yi ge'i dbye ba rnams kyis te dbyangs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis ro yis bsgyur pa'i ro zhes pa sum cu rtsa drug gi dbye bas phye ba ni rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor rgyud ces pa
translated: Thus, the individual consonants such as ka, and so forth, are the divisions of the letters, and the divisions of the vowels are the thirty-six divisions of the rasas.🔽The yoginīs and the yoginī tantras are

original: ste kun rdzob kyis gang du rnal 'byor ma rnams yang dag par rgyu zhing gtso bo mi g-yo ba de ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud do //
analyzed: ste kun rdzob kyis gang du rnal 'byor ma rnams yang dag par rgyu zhing gtso bo mi g-yo ba de ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud do //
translated: where the yoginīs move about conventionally, and the principal one is unmoving.

original: gang du thabs yang dag par rgyu zhing shes rab mi g-yo ba de ni thabs kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: gang du thabs yang dag par rgyu zhing shes rab mi g-yo ba de ni thabs kyi rgyud do //
translated: Where the method moves about, and the wisdom is unmoving, that is the method tantra.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni thams cad shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid sbyor ba'i rgyud nyid de de @187b skad du kye'i rdo rje las gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni thams cad shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid sbyor ba'i rgyud nyid de de @187b skad du kye'i rdo rje las gsungs pa /
translated: The Hevajra Tantra says:

original: he yig gis ni snying rje che //
analyzed: he yig gis ni snying rje che //
translated: The syllable he is great compassion.

original: badzra shes rab ces brjod de //
analyzed: badzra shes rab ces brjod de //
translated: Vajra is said to be wisdom.

original: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud //
translated: The tantra is the nature of means and wisdom.

original: de ni nga yis bshad kyis nyon //
analyzed: de ni nga yis bshad kyis nyon //
translated: Listen to what I will explain.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir kye'i rdo rje ni shes rab kyi rgyud du mi 'gyur te shes rab kyi rgyud nyon zhes gsungs pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir kye'i rdo rje ni shes rab kyi rgyud du mi 'gyur te shes rab kyi rgyud nyon zhes gsungs pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Thus Hevajra is not a wisdom tantra because it does not say listen to the wisdom tantra.

original: / de bzhin du 'dus pa las /
analyzed: / de bzhin du 'dus pa las /
translated: Similarly, the Guhyasamaja Tantra says:

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: The union of means and wisdom

original: rnal 'byor zhes par mngon par brjod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes par mngon par brjod //
translated: is called yoga.

original: 'dus pa sbyor bar rab gsungs te //
analyzed: 'dus pa sbyor bar rab gsungs te //
translated: Union is said to be union,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mngon rjod byed //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mngon rjod byed //
translated: it is the expression of all buddhas.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir 'di ni thabs kyi rgyud du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir 'di ni thabs kyi rgyud du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is not a means tantra.

original: de bzhin du dang po'i sangs rgyas las /
analyzed: de bzhin du dang po'i sangs rgyas las /
translated: Similarly, the Adibuddha Tantra says:

original: thabs kyi lus kyis rnal 'byor min //
analyzed: thabs kyi lus kyis rnal 'byor min //
translated: Not by the body of means alone,

original: shes rab gcig pus 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: shes rab gcig pus 'gyur ma yin //
translated: nor by wisdom alone,

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: but by the union of means and wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnal 'byor gsungs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnal 'byor gsungs //
translated: the Tathagata taught yoga.

original: zhes so // de bzhin yi ge so so ni ro yis bsgyur pa'i ro zhes pa rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi dkyil 'khor la ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbang po'o //🔽rigs gcig gi rgyud du grub pa gang yin pa de nyid rigs gsum dang rigs lnga dang stong dang 'bum dang bye ba'i dbye bas tha dad pa ni 'dus pa la sogs pa dang kye'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams la grangs med de sems can mtha'
analyzed: zhes so // de bzhin yi ge so so ni ro yis bsgyur pa'i ro zhes pa rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi dkyil 'khor la ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbang po'o // rigs gcig gi rgyud du grub pa gang yin pa de nyid rigs gsum dang rigs lnga dang stong dang 'bum dang bye ba'i dbye bas tha dad pa ni 'dus pa la sogs pa dang kye'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams la grangs med de sems can mtha'
translated: Thus, each syllable is transformed by the taste, that is, by the taste of the yoginis and yogins of the thirty-six mandalas of the Yoga and Yogini Tantras.

original: yas pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis so zhes pa ni rgyud kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: yas pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis so zhes pa ni rgyud kyi nges pa'o //
translated: That which is established as a Tantra of a single lineage, differentiated by the divisions of three lineages, five lineages, one thousand, one hundred thousand, and ten million lineages, is countless in the Guhyasamaja and Hevajra Tantras and so forth, due to the power of the intentions of infinite sentient beings. This is the determination of the Tantras.

original: da ni sngags kyi lha rnams kyi nang gi dag pa gsungs pa phung po zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir phung po lngas lnga'i bdag nyid dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi lha rnams kyi nang gi dag pa gsungs pa phung po zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir phung po lngas lnga'i bdag nyid dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the purity of the inner deities of the mantra is stated: “The five aggregates” and so on. Here, the five aggregates become the nature of the five.

original: phung po lnga dang 'byung ba rnams dgu'i bdag nyid dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga dang 'byung ba rnams dgu'i bdag nyid dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The five aggregates and the elements become the nature of nine.

original: las kyi dbang po bzhi dang bcas pas bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi dbang po bzhi dang bcas pas bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Together with the four faculties of action, they become the nature of thirteen.

original: yul drug dang bcas pas bcu dgu'i bdag nyid dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul drug dang bcas pas bcu dgu'i bdag nyid dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Together with the six objects, they become the nature of nineteen.

original: dbang po drug dang bcas pas nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po drug dang bcas pas nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Together with the six faculties, they become the nature of twenty-five.

original: las kyi dbang po'i bya ba lnga dang bcas shing las kyi dbang po lnga po rab tu zhugs pa na rang 'od kyi shes rab dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid do /
analyzed: las kyi dbang po'i bya ba lnga dang bcas shing las kyi dbang po lnga po rab tu zhugs pa na rang 'od kyi shes rab dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid do /
translated: Together with the five actions of the faculty of action and the five faculties of action engaged, together with one’s own light and wisdom, they become the nature of thirty-two.

original: las kyi dbang po drug pa dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba drug pa dang ldan pa ni sum cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: las kyi dbang po drug pa dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba drug pa dang ldan pa ni sum cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The one who is endowed with the six faculties of action and the six actions of the faculties is the one with the nature of thirty-four.

original: phung po dang khams drug pa dag dang ldan pa ni sum cu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: phung po dang khams drug pa dag dang ldan pa ni sum cu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid do //
translated: The one who is endowed with the six aggregates and six elements is the one with the nature of thirty-six.

original: de ltar @188a * //
analyzed: de ltar @188a * //
translated: Thus,

original: phung po drug dang khams drug dang dbang po drug dang yul drug dang las kyi dbang po drug dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba drug ste khams rnams ni dkyil 'khor pa rnams so //
analyzed: phung po drug dang khams drug dang dbang po drug dang yul drug dang las kyi dbang po drug dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba drug ste khams rnams ni dkyil 'khor pa rnams so //
translated: the six aggregates, the six elements, the six faculties, the six objects, the six faculties of action, and the six actions of the faculties—these elements are the mandala deities.

original: de rnams la khyab par byed pa thugs dang ye shes ni thams cad du gtso bo ste de ltar dbyangs kyi dbye bas mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs ni sbyang bar bya zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams la khyab par byed pa thugs dang ye shes ni thams cad du gtso bo ste de ltar dbyangs kyi dbye bas mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs ni sbyang bar bya zhes so //
translated: The all-pervading mind and gnosis are the principal ones everywhere. Thus, the entire class of the assembly is to be purified by the divisions of the vowels.

original: stong pa gzhom med la sogs zhes pa ni 'dir ye shes la sogs pa stong pa drug ste mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs phung po drug rnam par dag pa rnams kyis lha rnams rgya yis gdab pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa gzhom med la sogs zhes pa ni 'dir ye shes la sogs pa stong pa drug ste mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs phung po drug rnam par dag pa rnams kyis lha rnams rgya yis gdab pa ste /
translated: The six empty ones, beginning with the indestructible empty one, are the six families of the Victor, the six aggregates of gnosis, and so on, which are purified.🔽From the crown to the end of the lotus, the families of the unequal and equal are on the seat in the center of the wheel.

original: gtsug tor nas ni chu skyes mtha' ru mi mnyam mnyam pa'i rigs la 'khor lo'i dbus kyi gdan la'o zhes pa ni 'dir gtsug tor gyi 'khor lor thig le la mi bskyod pa aa'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor nas ni chu skyes mtha' ru mi mnyam mnyam pa'i rigs la 'khor lo'i dbus kyi gdan la'o zhes pa ni 'dir gtsug tor gyi 'khor lor thig le la mi bskyod pa aa'o //
translated: Here, in the wheel of the crown, Akṣobhya is in the bindu, a.

original: de bzhin du snying gar sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor la don yod grub pa ai'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying gar sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor la don yod grub pa ai'o //
translated: Similarly, in the heart, Amoghasiddhi is in the maṇḍala of Rāhu, i.

original: dpral bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la snang ba mtha' yas au ste mi mnyam pa'i 'khor lo la mi mnyam pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: dpral bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la snang ba mtha' yas au ste mi mnyam pa'i 'khor lo la mi mnyam pa'i rigs so //
translated: In the forehead, Amitābha is in the maṇḍala of the moon, u. The unequal family is in the unequal wheel.

original: de bzhin du lte bar dus kyi me la rnam par snang mdzad li'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lte bar dus kyi me la rnam par snang mdzad li'o //
translated: Similarly, in the navel, Vairocana is in the fire of time, li.

original: mgrin par nyi ma la rin chen dbang mo'i ri'o //
