analyzed: de'i kl'i rlung gi rtsibs la'o // dbang ldan du kh'u dang bden bral du gr'i dang mer gh'i dang 'og tu d'a ste me dang lho'i sgo'i dbus kyi dur khrod kyi 'khor lo'i steng du'o zhes pa chu srin gyi dus sbyor la'o //
translated: Its “ka” wind is on the spoke.🔽In the northeast, the “khu” (khau); in the southwest, the “gar” (gra); in the southeast, the “gha” (gha); and in the nadir, the “da” (da), that is, in the south, in the center of the charnel ground wheel of the fire door.

original: de nas bum pa'i dus sbyor la steng du nga ste me dang shar gyi sgo'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: de nas bum pa'i dus sbyor la steng du nga ste me dang shar gyi sgo'i dbus su'o //
translated: Then, in the Aquarius period, the “nga” (nga) above, that is, in the east, in the center of the charnel ground wheel of the east door.

original: shar gyi rtsibs la ghi dang lho'i rtsibs la gri dang byang gi rtsibs la khu dang nub kyi rtsibs la kli'o //
analyzed: shar gyi rtsibs la ghi dang lho'i rtsibs la gri dang byang gi rtsibs la khu dang nub kyi rtsibs la kli'o //
translated: On the eastern spoke is gha, on the southern spoke is gha, on the northern spoke is ksha, and on the western spoke is ksha.

original: sgo dang sgo'i bar du ha ksha dang ldan nam mkha'i mthil na gnas pa'i sde par bcas pa rnams zhes pa ni 'dir sde pa drug po rnams kyi stong pa'i dkyil 'khor 'bab par byed pa'i ye ge ring po dang thung du bcu gnyis bo rnams te thk'a
analyzed: sgo dang sgo'i bar du ha ksha dang ldan nam mkha'i mthil na gnas pa'i sde par bcas pa rnams zhes pa ni 'dir sde pa drug po rnams kyi stong pa'i dkyil 'khor 'bab par byed pa'i ye ge ring po dang thung du bcu gnyis bo rnams te thk'a
translated: Between the doors and the doors, endowed with ha ksha, the twelve long and short syllables that cause the empty maṇḍala of the six classes to fall, are the hosts that abide in the foundation of space.

original: tthka n'a na m'a ma n'a na ny'a nya d'a nga zhes pa ni dur khrod bcu gnyis kyi lha mo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: tthka n'a na m'a ma n'a na ny'a nya d'a nga zhes pa ni dur khrod bcu gnyis kyi lha mo rnams kyi'o //
translated: Tha ka, tha ka, na na, ma na, na nya, nya da, ṅa, are the twelve goddesses of the charnel grounds.

original: gzhan ni thun mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas dus sbyor gsum gsum gyi mthar ha h'a ksha ksh'a zhes pa yi ge bzhi ste byang dang dbang ldan dang lho dang bden bral gyi dur khrod bzhi rnams su'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni thun mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas dus sbyor gsum gsum gyi mthar ha h'a ksha ksh'a zhes pa yi ge bzhi ste byang dang dbang ldan dang lho dang bden bral gyi dur khrod bzhi rnams su'o //
translated: The other four syllables, ha ha, ksha ksha, are at the end of each of the three periods, divided into the four periods, in the four charnel grounds of north, northeast, south, and southwest.

original: de ltar dur khrod bcu drug po rnams la lha mo bcu drug dang 'khor lo drug po rnams la bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad do //🔽snying po'i padma'i 'dab ma la lha mo brgyad de de rnams kyi sa bon ni shar gyi 'dab ma la aa dang lho'i 'dab ma la aa:dang byang gi 'dab ma la aam dang nub kyi 'dab ma la a'a dang me'i 'dab ma la ha dang bden bral gyi
analyzed: de ltar dur khrod bcu drug po rnams la lha mo bcu drug dang 'khor lo drug po rnams la bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad do // snying po'i padma'i 'dab ma la lha mo brgyad de de rnams kyi sa bon ni shar gyi 'dab ma la aa dang lho'i 'dab ma la aa:dang byang gi 'dab ma la aam dang nub kyi 'dab ma la a'a dang me'i 'dab ma la ha dang bden bral gyi
translated: Thus, there are sixteen goddesses in the sixteen charnel grounds, and forty-eight in the six wheels.

original: 'dab ma la @194b ha:dang dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la ham dang rlung gi 'dab ma la h'a'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma la @194b ha:dang dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la ham dang rlung gi 'dab ma la h'a'o //
translated: There are eight goddesses on the petals of the heart lotus. Their seed syllables are: on the eastern petal, a; on the southern petal, āḥ; on the northern petal, am; on the western petal, a; on the southeast petal, ha; on the southwest petal, haḥ; on the northwest petal, haṃ; and on the northeast petal, haḥ.

original: de rnams kyi bar bar gyi 'dab ma brgyad po rnams la thod pa brgyad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bar bar gyi 'dab ma brgyad po rnams la thod pa brgyad do //
translated: In the spaces between those petals, there are eight skull cups.

original: dbus su rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo he ru ka gtso bo ste hum phrem mo //
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo he ru ka gtso bo ste hum phrem mo //
translated: In the center is Vajraḍāka and Bhagavat Kālacakra Heruka, the principal one, with the hūṃ garland.

original: mkha' 'gro ma dang mkha' 'gro 'di rnams kyis bon gyi mthar rdo rje ste de dang bcas pa'i ming sl'i rdo rje ma dang w'u rdo rje ma zhes pa la sogs pa kl'i rdo rje ma'i mthar thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma dang mkha' 'gro 'di rnams kyis bon gyi mthar rdo rje ste de dang bcas pa'i ming sl'i rdo rje ma dang w'u rdo rje ma zhes pa la sogs pa kl'i rdo rje ma'i mthar thug pa rnams so //
translated: These dakinis and dakas are named after the vajra at the end of the Bon, that is, with the vajra, such as Salavajra, Vavajra, and so on, up to Kalivajra.

original: 'di rnams kyi mkha' 'gro bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad ni bsam pa'i dbye bas shi rdo rje dang shri rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi mkha' 'gro bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad ni bsam pa'i dbye bas shi rdo rje dang shri rdo rje'o //
translated: These forty-eight dakinis are divided into the wish-granting vajra and the glory-vajra.

original: gang du mkha' 'gro ma'i sa bon ring po yin pa der mkha' 'gro'i sa bon thung du dang gang du thung du yin pa der ring po ste /
analyzed: gang du mkha' 'gro ma'i sa bon ring po yin pa der mkha' 'gro'i sa bon thung du dang gang du thung du yin pa der ring po ste /
translated: Wherever the dakini seed is long, there the daka seed is short, and wherever it is short, there it is long.

original: sl'i rdo rje ma dang shi rdo rje zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs so //
analyzed: sl'i rdo rje ma dang shi rdo rje zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs so //
translated: Salavajra and Shivajra are wisdom and means.

original: wu rdo rje ma dang shr'i rdo rje zhes pa ste de bzhin du 'chad par 'gyur pa thams cad la'o //
analyzed: wu rdo rje ma dang shr'i rdo rje zhes pa ste de bzhin du 'chad par 'gyur pa thams cad la'o //
translated: Vavajra and Shrīvajra are the same, and so on for all that will be explained.

original: de ltar na dkyil 'khor la mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom pa nyis 'gyur mchod par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dkyil 'khor la mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom pa nyis 'gyur mchod par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the mandala is to be worshipped with the double-entwined net of dakinis.

original: 'dir sdig pa dang gzhu la sogs pa lugs las bzlog pas dgong pa gang yin pa de spros pas gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir sdig pa dang gzhu la sogs pa lugs las bzlog pas dgong pa gang yin pa de spros pas gsungs te /
translated: Here, the setting of the directions and subdirections by the reverse order of the zodiac signs, Scorpio, Sagittarius, and so on, is taught by the elaboration.

original: 'dir yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa kun rdzob ma yin pas don dam pa'i bden par gzhu dang sdig pa la sogs pa lugs las bzlog pas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa dgod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa kun rdzob ma yin pas don dam pa'i bden par gzhu dang sdig pa la sogs pa lugs las bzlog pas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa dgod pa'o //
translated: Here, the setting of the directions and subdirections by the reverse order of the zodiac signs, Scorpio, Sagittarius, and so on, is the ultimate truth, not the relative, since the cessation of the twelve links is the ultimate truth.

original: kun rdzob kyis chu srin dang bum pa la sogs pa rim pas nye ba'i 'thung gcod la sogs pa dgod pa ste rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis las so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyis chu srin dang bum pa la sogs pa rim pas nye ba'i 'thung gcod la sogs pa dgod pa ste rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis las so //
translated: The setting of the directions and subdirections by the relative, such as Capricorn and Aquarius, and so on, is the relative truth, since the twelve links of dependent origination are the relative.🔽As for the setting of the directions and subdirections by the reverse order of the three wheels, one is the setting of the directions and subdirections by the reverse order of Caṇḍālī, Caṇḍākṣī, and so on.

original: ji ltar 'khor lo gsum gyi sdom pa las gcig ni rab gtum ma dang gtum pa'i mig can ma la sogs pa lugs las bzlog pas gnas la sogs pa dgod pa ste gnyis pa ni brtson 'grus chen mo la sogs pa rim pas nye ba'i dur khrod la🔽sogs pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor lo gsum gyi sdom pa las gcig ni rab gtum ma dang gtum pa'i mig can ma la sogs pa lugs las bzlog pas gnas la sogs pa dgod pa ste gnyis pa ni brtson 'grus chen mo la sogs pa rim pas nye ba'i dur khrod la🔽sogs pas so //
translated: The second is the setting of the directions and subdirections by the reverse order of Mahāvīryā, and so on, in the subcontinents, beginning with the Subcontinent of 2.2.2.2.

original: 'dir ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la kun rdzob gang yin pa de don dam pa zhes pa las shes par bya'o /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la kun rdzob gang yin pa de don dam pa zhes pa las shes par bya'o /
translated: Here, it should be understood that whatever is conventional in worldly convention is ultimate.

original: de ltar rlung la sogs rtsibs rnams la ni nyi ma'i rgyu ba'i dbang gis zhes pa g-yas kyi rtsal srog rgyu ba'i dbang gis ring po rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar rlung la sogs rtsibs rnams la ni nyi ma'i rgyu ba'i dbang gis zhes pa g-yas kyi rtsal srog rgyu ba'i dbang gis ring po rnams so //
translated: Thus, “by the power of the movement of the sun in the spokes such as air,” by the power of the movement of the life-force in the right channel, are the long vowels.

original: steng sogs rtsibs la zla ba'i rgyu ba'i dbang @195a * //🔽gis zhes pa g-yon gyi rtsal srog rgyu ba'i dbang gis thung du rnams so zhes pa ni dgod pa gsungs pa ste rim pa yis kyang kun rdzob kyis nye ba'i 'thung gcod la sogs pas chu srin la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams la ka tsa ta pa ta
analyzed: steng sogs rtsibs la zla ba'i rgyu ba'i dbang @195a * // gis zhes pa g-yon gyi rtsal srog rgyu ba'i dbang gis thung du rnams so zhes pa ni dgod pa gsungs pa ste rim pa yis kyang kun rdzob kyis nye ba'i 'thung gcod la sogs pas chu srin la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams la ka tsa ta pa ta
translated: “By the power of the movement of the moon in the spokes such as above,”🔽by the power of the movement of the life-force in the left channel, are the short vowels. This is the teaching of the layout.🔽Also, by the sequence, the long and short vowels such as ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, ya, and so on, are laid out in the maṇḍalas of Makara, and so on, by the relative Avadhūti, and so on.

original: sa'i sde pa rnams kyi yi ge ka yig la sogs pa rnams l'i yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyis phye ba ring po dang thung du rnams dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i sde pa rnams kyi yi ge ka yig la sogs pa rnams l'i yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyis phye ba ring po dang thung du rnams dgod par bya'o //
translated: The long and short vowels such as the letter ka, and so on, of the class of the letter la, and so on, are laid out in the class of the letter ka, and so on, by the power of the vowels such as ā, i, and so on.

original: don dam pas thka la sogs pa thung du'i aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyis phye ba rnams gzhu dang sdig pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: don dam pas thka la sogs pa thung du'i aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyis phye ba rnams gzhu dang sdig pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The long vowels a ā i ī u ū ṛ ṝ ḷ ḹ e ai o au aṃ aḥ are divided by the short vowels a ā i ī u ū ṛ ṝ ḷ ḹ e ai o au aṃ aḥ, by the bow, the scorpion, etc.

original: de ltar rlung mtshams la sogs pa'i rtsibs rnams las la sogs pa ste g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor 'bab pa las so //
analyzed: de ltar rlung mtshams la sogs pa'i rtsibs rnams las la sogs pa ste g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor 'bab pa las so //
translated: Thus, from the spokes of the wind direction, etc., are ka, etc., from the descent of the right mandala.

original: steng la sogs pa'i rtsibs rnams la nam mkha' la sogs pa ste g-yon gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pa las so zhes pa ni nang gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: steng la sogs pa'i rtsibs rnams la nam mkha' la sogs pa ste g-yon gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pa las so zhes pa ni nang gi nges pa'o //
translated: From the spokes of the upper direction, etc., are ṅa, etc., from the descent of the left mandala. This is the inner certainty.

original: 'dir lhag ma tshigs su bcad pa lnga ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'dir lhag ma tshigs su bcad pa lnga ni go sla'o //
translated: Here, the remaining five verses are easy to understand.

original: da ni lha mo rnams kyi gnas la sogs pa'i gnas gsungs pa lhun po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni lha mo rnams kyi gnas la sogs pa'i gnas gsungs pa lhun po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the abode, etc., of the goddesses is stated: Meru, etc.

original: 'dir lhun po'i phyogs brgyad rnams la steng du rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mthar thug pa ste 'og tu sa la sems can gyi don gyi slad du yang dag par rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'dir lhun po'i phyogs brgyad rnams la steng du rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mthar thug pa ste 'og tu sa la sems can gyi don gyi slad du yang dag par rgyu'o //
translated: Here, in the eight directions of Meru, above, the Yoginī wheel extends to the end of the wind maṇḍala, and below, on the earth, it moves for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du rgya mtsho'i dkyil 'khor dang / me'i dkyil 'khor dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / nam mkha'i mthar ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgya mtsho'i dkyil 'khor dang / me'i dkyil 'khor dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / nam mkha'i mthar ro zhes pa ste /
translated: Likewise, in the middle of the ocean, in the middle of fire, in the middle of wind, and in the middle of space.

original: 'jig rten khams kyi dkyil 'khor la dpag tshad 'bum phrag lnga ji srid par ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams kyi dkyil 'khor la dpag tshad 'bum phrag lnga ji srid par ro //
translated: As far as the middle of the world system is five hundred thousand yojanas.

original: sems can rnams kyi lus la skra'i mthar thug par khyab par byed pa nyid de bcom ldan 'das dang rnal 'byor ma yang dag par rgyu ba las so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus la skra'i mthar thug par khyab par byed pa nyid de bcom ldan 'das dang rnal 'byor ma yang dag par rgyu ba las so //
translated: It pervades the bodies of sentient beings down to the tips of the hair. It is the movement of the Bhagavat and the yoginis.

original: 'dir lhun po'i steng la dpag tshad stong phrag lnga bcu ni bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lhun po'i steng la dpag tshad stong phrag lnga bcu ni bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa'o //
translated: Here, the Meru mountain is fifty thousand yojanas above the ground. It is the sixteen-petaled lotus of the essence of the Bhagavat.

original: de'i sum cha ni lte ba ste lte ba'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i sum cha ni lte ba ste lte ba'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: One-third of that is the navel. Above the navel is the mandala of the sun.

original: nyi ma'i steng du dus kyi 'khor lo'i zhabs g-yas pa'i 'og tu bdud dang zhabs g-yon pa'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa ste de yang drag po'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i steng du dus kyi 'khor lo'i zhabs g-yas pa'i 'og tu bdud dang zhabs g-yon pa'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa ste de yang drag po'o //
translated: Above the sun is the right foot of the Wheel of Time. Below it is Mara. Below the left foot is the affliction, which is also Rudra.

original: 'dab ma brgyad la dub ma @195b la sogs pa'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang de rnams kyi bar bar gyi 'dab ma rnams la bdud rtsis gang ba'i thod pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad la dub ma @195b la sogs pa'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang de rnams kyi bar bar gyi 'dab ma rnams la bdud rtsis gang ba'i thod pa brgyad do //
translated: On the eight petals are the eight Vajra dakinis, beginning with Vajra-Dutl, and between them are the eight skull-bowls filled with nectar.

original: de ltar 'dab ma bcu drug ni dga' ba'i 'khor lo ste dga' ba bcu drug gi dbye bas lha mo rnams dang thod pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dab ma bcu drug ni dga' ba'i 'khor lo ste dga' ba bcu drug gi dbye bas lha mo rnams dang thod pa rnams so //
translated: Thus, the sixteen petals are the wheel of joy, and the goddesses and skull-bowls are divided into sixteen joys.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni thig le bzhi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhal bzhi pa ste phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi 'gags pa'i phyir phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni thig le bzhi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhal bzhi pa ste phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi 'gags pa'i phyir phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The Lord has four faces because he holds the four drops, and he has twenty-four arms because he blocks the twenty-four directions.

original: lhag pa'i zla ba'i phyogs gnyis 'gags pa'i phyir gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ste sngar gsungs pa'i rdo rje shugs so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i zla ba'i phyogs gnyis 'gags pa'i phyir gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ste sngar gsungs pa'i rdo rje shugs so //
translated: He has two more arms than the victorious ones because he blocks the two remaining lunar fortnights, and he has the previously mentioned vajra speed.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i zhal gcig ni stong pa nyid de phyag gnyis ni mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dag go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i zhal gcig ni stong pa nyid de phyag gnyis ni mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dag go //
translated: The Blessed Lady has one face, which is emptiness, and two arms, which are signlessness and wishlessness.

original: gri gug dang / phyag rgya dang / thod pa la sogs pa ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gri gug dang / phyag rgya dang / thod pa la sogs pa ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: The sword, the seal, the skull-cup, etc. are uncompounded.

original: de nas padma'i phyi rol du lhun po'i phyogs brgyad rnams su thad ka'i char sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad kyis dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga ni ye shes kyi khams kyi 'khor lo ste de'i sum cha'i sa la gri gug gi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: de nas padma'i phyi rol du lhun po'i phyogs brgyad rnams su thad ka'i char sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad kyis dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga ni ye shes kyi khams kyi 'khor lo ste de'i sum cha'i sa la gri gug gi phreng ba'o //
translated: Then, outside the lotus, in the eight directions of Meru, in a straight line, the wheel of the element of consciousness is twenty-five thousand yojanas in extent, the measure of the circle of the earth. The garland of swords is on one third of that.

original: cha gnyis kyis rtsibs brgyad do //
analyzed: cha gnyis kyis rtsibs brgyad do //
translated: The eight spokes are on two thirds.

original: de bzhin du rgya mtsho'i phyed la sa'i 'khor lo ste phyed phyi ma la chu'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgya mtsho'i phyed la sa'i 'khor lo ste phyed phyi ma la chu'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Similarly, the circle of earth is on half of the ocean, and the circle of water is on the second half.

original: de bzhin du me'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyed la me'i 'khor lo ste phyed phyi ma la rlung gi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyed la me'i 'khor lo ste phyed phyi ma la rlung gi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Similarly, the circle of fire is on half of the circle of fire, and the circle of wind is on the second half.

original: de bzhin du rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi phyed la nam mkha'i 'khor lo ste phyed phyi ma la rdul tshon gyi sa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi phyed la nam mkha'i 'khor lo ste phyed phyi ma la rdul tshon gyi sa'o //
translated: Similarly, the circle of space is on half of the circle of wind, and the colored earth is on the second half.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la dur khrod bcu drug rnams so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la dur khrod bcu drug rnams so zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: In the center of the sky-maṇḍala are the sixteen charnel grounds.

original: 'dir skra'i mthar khru lnga ni lus so //
analyzed: 'dir skra'i mthar khru lnga ni lus so //
translated: Here, five cubits at the end of the hair is the body.

original: des na nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la phyi rol gyi dur khrod rnams te de'i rnam par dag pas 'jig rten gyi khams kyang dpag tshad 'bum phrag lnga'o zhes pa 'khor lo sngom pa chen po la'o //
analyzed: des na nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la phyi rol gyi dur khrod rnams te de'i rnam par dag pas 'jig rten gyi khams kyang dpag tshad 'bum phrag lnga'o zhes pa 'khor lo sngom pa chen po la'o //
translated: Therefore, the external charnel grounds are in the center of the sky-maṇḍala. Since those are purified, the world system is also five hundred thousand yojanas.

original: de ltar rim pa bzhin du lhun po'i phyogs brgyad rnams su ye shes kyi khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la gnas rnams te gzhu 'gags pas rga shi 'gag pa'i phyir ro //🔽phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i @196a * //
analyzed: de ltar rim pa bzhin du lhun po'i phyogs brgyad rnams su ye shes kyi khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la gnas rnams te gzhu 'gags pas rga shi 'gag pa'i phyir ro // phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i @196a * //
translated: In that way, in the eight directions of Meru, the places are on the spokes of the maṇḍala of the element of wisdom, because the cessation of the bow-string stops old age and death.

original: gnas rnams te sdig pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas rnams te sdig pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The near places are on the spokes in the intermediate directions, because the cessation of sin stops birth.

original: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //
translated: Similarly, there are two charnel grounds.

original: de nas sa'i khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la zhing bzhi ste srang 'gags pas srid pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas sa'i khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la zhing bzhi ste srang 'gags pas srid pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, on the spokes of the directions of the wheel of the earth element, there are four fields, because the cessation of the scales stops existence.

original: phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i zhing rnams te bu mo 'gag pas len pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i zhing rnams te bu mo 'gag pas len pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the spokes of the intermediate directions, there are the secondary fields, because the cessation of the maiden stops grasping.

original: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //
translated: Similarly, there are two charnel grounds.

original: de nas chu'i khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la tshan do ha bzhi ste seng ge 'gags pas sred pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas chu'i khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la tshan do ha bzhi ste seng ge 'gags pas sred pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, on the spokes of the directions of the wheel of the water element, there are four chandi, because the cessation of the lion stops craving.

original: phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i tshan do ha rnams te karka ta 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i tshan do ha rnams te karka ta 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the spokes of the intermediate directions, there are the secondary chandi, because the cessation of the crab stops sensation.

original: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //
translated: Similarly, there are two charnel grounds.

original: de nas me'i khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la 'dus pa bzhi ste 'khrig pa 'gags pas reg pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas me'i khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la 'dus pa bzhi ste 'khrig pa 'gags pas reg pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, on the spokes of the directions of the wheel of the fire element, there are four gatherings, because the cessation of copulation stops contact.

original: phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i 'dus pa rnams te glang 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i 'dus pa rnams te glang 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the spokes of the periphery, there are the four near abodes, because the ox stops the six sense bases.

original: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //
translated: Likewise, there are two charnel grounds.

original: de nas rlung gi khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la dur khrod bzhi ste lug 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas rlung gi khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la dur khrod bzhi ste lug 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, on the spokes of the periphery of the wind maṇḍala, there are the four charnel grounds, because the ram stops name and form.

original: phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i dur khrod rnams te nya 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i dur khrod rnams te nya 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the spokes of the periphery, there are the four near charnel grounds, because the fish stops consciousness.

original: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //🔽de nas nam mkha'i khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la 'thung gcod dam khyim bzhi ste bum pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so // de nas nam mkha'i khams kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi rtsibs rnams la 'thung gcod dam khyim bzhi ste bum pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, there are two charnel grounds.🔽Then, on the spokes of the periphery of the space maṇḍala, there are the four abodes of the kumbhaṇḍas, because the vase stops formation.

original: phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i 'thung gcod rnams te chu srin 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs bral gyi rtsibs rnams la nye ba'i 'thung gcod rnams te chu srin 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the spokes of the periphery, there are the four near abodes of the kumbhaṇḍas, because the crocodile stops ignorance.

original: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dur khrod gnyis so //
translated: Likewise, there are two charnel grounds.

original: dus sbyor gyi thun mtshams bzhi 'gags pas gzhan dur khrod bzhi'o //
analyzed: dus sbyor gyi thun mtshams bzhi 'gags pas gzhan dur khrod bzhi'o //
translated: Since the four periods of the conjunctions are blocked, there are four other charnel grounds.🔽Or, since the sixteen phases of the moon are blocked, there are sixteen charnel grounds.

original: yang na zla ba'i cha bcu drug 'gags pas dur khrod bcu drug rnams te de skad du /
analyzed: yang na zla ba'i cha bcu drug 'gags pas dur khrod bcu drug rnams te de skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis @196b ldan ;
analyzed: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis @196b ldan ;
translated: The twelve aspects of the truth of reality

original: / de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig ces so //
analyzed: / de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig ces so //
translated: Are the sixteen aspects of reality.

original: thun tshod brgyad 'gags pas lha mo brgyad de yang na gza' rnams 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun tshod brgyad 'gags pas lha mo brgyad de yang na gza' rnams 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the eight periods are blocked, there are eight goddesses.

original: don dam pa'i rten la sgrib pa med pa'i lha mo rnams rten pa'i rang bzhin no zhes pa don dam pa'i bden par ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rten la sgrib pa med pa'i lha mo rnams rten pa'i rang bzhin no zhes pa don dam pa'i bden par ro //
translated: Or, since the planets are blocked, the goddesses are the nature of the support of the ultimate reality, which is free of obscurations.

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis kyang gnas la sogs par sngags kyi lha rnams skye ba bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis kyang gnas la sogs par sngags kyi lha rnams skye ba bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavān also taught in the Root Tantra that the mantras of the deities are born in places such as Dhānyakaṭaka and so on, in terms of the conventional reality of the world.

original: k'a ma r'u pa dz'a lar grags //
analyzed: k'a ma r'u pa dz'a lar grags //
translated: It is renowned as Kāmarūpa.

original: p'urnna gi ri de bzhin gnas //
analyzed: p'urnna gi ri de bzhin gnas //
translated: Pūrṇagiri is likewise a place.

original: ao di y'a na bzhi par 'gyur //
analyzed: ao di y'a na bzhi par 'gyur //
translated: Oḍiyāna is the fourth.

original: shi shri lpu sri der gtso mo //
analyzed: shi shri lpu sri der gtso mo //
translated: Śiśupālī is the chief in Śrīparvata.

original: go d'a pa r'i r'a me sha //
analyzed: go d'a pa r'i r'a me sha //
translated: Godāvarī, Rāmeśvara,

original: de b'i ko ta m'a la ba //
analyzed: de b'i ko ta m'a la ba //
translated: Devakōṭa, and Mālava,

original: nye ba'i gnas bzhi 'di rnams su //
analyzed: nye ba'i gnas bzhi 'di rnams su //
translated: in these four subcontinents

original: sl'i w'u shr'i sh'i gtso mo'o //
analyzed: sl'i w'u shr'i sh'i gtso mo'o //
translated: are the chief goddesses of the Śālva, Śaivala,

original: aar bu da mummu ni zhing //
analyzed: aar bu da mummu ni zhing //
translated: Ārbuda, and Muñja regions.

original: ao dram k'a ra n+ya pa ta //
analyzed: ao dram k'a ra n+ya pa ta //
translated: Oḍra, Kāmarūpa, and Karṇāṭa,

original: dhi dri thu tli zhes lha mo //
analyzed: dhi dri thu tli zhes lha mo //
translated: and Draviḍa are the goddesses🔽in the continents of Jambū, Pūrvavideha,

original: rnams rten nor 'dzin gzhi la'o //
analyzed: rnams rten nor 'dzin gzhi la'o //
translated: and Godānīya.

original: tri sha ku ni nye ba'i zhing ;
analyzed: tri sha ku ni nye ba'i zhing ;
translated: Triśakuni is the subcontinent

original: / de bzhin kar m'a ra p'a tra //
analyzed: / de bzhin kar m'a ra p'a tra //
translated: of Karaṃsapāṭa,

original: ko sha la dang l'a da'i yul //
analyzed: ko sha la dang l'a da'i yul //
translated: and Kośala and Lāḍa are the countries

original: tl'i th'u dr'i dh'i der gtso mo //
analyzed: tl'i th'u dr'i dh'i der gtso mo //
translated: of Tāmraliptaka.

original: ka ling ga ha ri ke la //
analyzed: ka ling ga ha ri ke la //
translated: Kaliṅga, Harikeḷa,

original: tsan dra dvi pa lam pa kam //
analyzed: tsan dra dvi pa lam pa kam //
translated: Candradvīpa, and Lampāka

original: tshan do ha ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: tshan do ha ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: are the four Cīna regions.

original: bhi pri phu pli der gtso mo //
analyzed: bhi pri phu pli der gtso mo //
translated: Bhīmapura and Pūgapura are the chief cities.

original: k'a na tsi kong ka na ka dang // hi m'a la ya nye ba yi ;
analyzed: k'a na tsi kong ka na ka dang // hi m'a la ya nye ba yi ;
translated: Kāñcī, Koṅkaṇa, and Himālaya

original: / tshan do bzhi pa nee p'a la nyid //
analyzed: / tshan do bzhi pa nee p'a la nyid //
translated: are the four subcontinents of Nepal.

original: pl'i ph'u br'i bh'e der gtso mo //
analyzed: pl'i ph'u br'i bh'e der gtso mo //
translated: Pāripāṭaka and Bhīmapura are the chief cities.

original: m'a tra gri ha pra y'a gam //
analyzed: m'a tra gri ha pra y'a gam //
translated: Mātṛgrāma, Prayāga,

original: ko pla gi ri gri ha'i lha //
analyzed: ko pla gi ri gri ha'i lha //
translated: and Koṅkaṇa are the holy places.

original: 'dus pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'dus pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te //
translated: There are four assemblies:

original: dhi dri thu tli der gtso mo //
analyzed: dhi dri thu tli der gtso mo //
translated: Dhī, Dhri, Thū, and Thli are the chief ones.

original: soo r'a shtra dang k'a sm'i ra //
analyzed: soo r'a shtra dang k'a sm'i ra //
translated: Sau, Rā, Śa, and Tra,

original: su wa rnna gling sing ha la //
analyzed: su wa rnna gling sing ha la //
translated: Suva, Rna, Glin, and Siha,

original: nye ba'i 'dus pa 'di rnams su //
analyzed: nye ba'i 'dus pa 'di rnams su //
translated: In these assemblies,

original: tl'i th'u dr'i dh'i gtso mo'o //
analyzed: tl'i th'u dr'i dh'i gtso mo'o //
translated: Tali, Thū, Dhari, and Dhi are the chief ones.

original: na ga ra ma he na dra ri //
analyzed: na ga ra ma he na dra ri //
translated: Nagara, Mahendra, and Dhari,

original: sin dhu'i yul ki r'a ta ka //
analyzed: sin dhu'i yul ki r'a ta ka //
translated: Sindhu, Yul, and Kirāta,

original: dur khrod rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te //
analyzed: dur khrod rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te //
translated: There are four charnel grounds:

original: dzhi dzri tshu tsli der gtso mo //
analyzed: dzhi dzri tshu tsli der gtso mo //
translated: Jhi, Jri, Tsu, and Tshli are the chief ones.

original: ma ru'i yul dang ga hva ra nyid //
analyzed: ma ru'i yul dang ga hva ra nyid //
translated: Maru, Yul, and Gahvara,

original: ku la t'a dang sa ma la //🔽de bzhin nye ba'i dur khrod gsungs //🔽tsl'i tsh'u dzr'i dzh'i der gtso mo //🔽ca ra tra ke ra na nyid //🔽bi na dhya goo m'a ri ka'i grong //🔽rnam bzhi 'thung gcod zhes par grags //🔽ghi gri khu kli der gtso mo //🔽nye khyim bi ra dz'a: kong ga //🔽tri pu r'i shr'i ha tta ka /
analyzed: ku la t'a dang sa ma la // de bzhin nye ba'i dur khrod gsungs // tsl'i tsh'u dzr'i dzh'i der gtso mo // ca ra tra ke ra na nyid // bi na dhya goo m'a ri ka'i grong // rnam bzhi 'thung gcod zhes par grags // ghi gri khu kli der gtso mo // nye khyim bi ra dz'a: kong ga // tri pu r'i shr'i ha tta ka /
translated: Kulatā, and Samala,

original: rnam pa 'di bzhir grags pa ste //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di bzhir grags pa ste //
translated: Likewise, the four nearby charnel grounds are taught:🔽Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, Tshali, T

original: @197a * // kl'i kh'u gr'i gh'i der gtso mo //
analyzed: @197a * // kl'i kh'u gr'i gh'i der gtso mo //
translated: The principal one is in the Kālākulahara.

original: thka sogs bcu gnyis pho nya mo //
analyzed: thka sogs bcu gnyis pho nya mo //
translated: The twelve beginning with Tak are the messengers.

original: stong pa'i dkyil 'khor gtso mo ste //
analyzed: stong pa'i dkyil 'khor gtso mo ste //
translated: The principal one is in the maṇḍala of emptiness.

original: ha sogs bzhi ni phyi rol gyi //
analyzed: ha sogs bzhi ni phyi rol gyi //
translated: The four beginning with Ha are the outer ones.

original: dur khrod la ste bcu drug aa //
analyzed: dur khrod la ste bcu drug aa //
translated: The sixteen are in the charnel grounds.

original: a'a aam aa: ha h'a ham ha: //🔽pho nya mo de pad 'dab la //
analyzed: a'a aam aa: ha h'a ham ha: // pho nya mo de pad 'dab la //
translated: A Ā Āḥ Ha Ha Haṃ Haḥ.

original: brgyad nyid la ni thod pa rnams //
analyzed: brgyad nyid la ni thod pa rnams //
translated: Those messengers are on the eight petals of the lotus.🔽The skull cups are on the tips of the spokes.

original: lte ba'i rtse mor gtso bo ste //
analyzed: lte ba'i rtse mor gtso bo ste //
translated: The principal one is in the center.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa yis //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa yis //
translated: The twelve limbs are blocked.

original: dus sbyor rnams ni mi 'bab phyir //
analyzed: dus sbyor rnams ni mi 'bab phyir //
translated: The junctures do not flow.

original: sa rnams bcu gnyis zhes grags pa //
analyzed: sa rnams bcu gnyis zhes grags pa //
translated: The twelve stages are renowned.

original: gnas la sogs pa don dam mo //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa don dam mo //
translated: The ultimate is the location, and so on.

original: ma rig la sogs lugs mthun gyis //🔽chu srin sogs pa kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: ma rig la sogs lugs mthun gyis // chu srin sogs pa kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: The relative is the order of ignorance, and so on.

original: gzhu la sogs pa lugs bzlog gis //
analyzed: gzhu la sogs pa lugs bzlog gis //
translated: The order in reverse is the bow, and so on.

original: rga shi la sogs de dag rnams //🔽sgrib ba med pa'i chos kyis ni //
analyzed: rga shi la sogs de dag rnams // sgrib ba med pa'i chos kyis ni //
translated: Those are old age and death, and so on.

original: dag pa'i chos kyi rab dbye las //
analyzed: dag pa'i chos kyi rab dbye las //
translated: The pure Dharma is classified as the Dharma free of obscurations.

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams lus kyi khams //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams lus kyi khams //
translated: The ḍākinīs are the elements of the body.

original: rnam pa bdun cu gnyis rab gsungs //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun cu gnyis rab gsungs //
translated: The seventy-two aspects are well proclaimed.

original: kun rdzob sngags grub gang de dag / khyim sogs rnams su gtso mo ste //
analyzed: kun rdzob sngags grub gang de dag / khyim sogs rnams su gtso mo ste //
translated: Those who have accomplished the mantra on the relative level are the main ones in the houses and so forth.

original: de nas de rnams sa bon yig / gnas sogs dang por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de rnams sa bon yig / gnas sogs dang por gyur pa'o //
translated: Then, those seed syllables are the first of the places and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows:

original: k'a dz'a p'u ao zhes pa ni gnas rnams la'o //
analyzed: k'a dz'a p'u ao zhes pa ni gnas rnams la'o //
translated: Kā jvā pū o is for the places.

original: go r'a de m'a zhes pa ni nye ba'i gnas rnams la'o //
analyzed: go r'a de m'a zhes pa ni nye ba'i gnas rnams la'o //
translated: Go rā de mā is for the nearby places.

original: aa mu ao k'a zhes pa ni zhing rnams la'o //
analyzed: aa mu ao k'a zhes pa ni zhing rnams la'o //
translated: A mu o kā is for the fields.

original: tri ka ko l'a zhes pa ni nye ba'i zhing rnams la'o //🔽ka ha tsa la zhes pa ni tshan do ha rnams la'o //
analyzed: tri ka ko l'a zhes pa ni nye ba'i zhing rnams la'o // ka ha tsa la zhes pa ni tshan do ha rnams la'o //
translated: Tri ka ko lā is for the nearby fields.🔽Ka ha ca la is for the charnel grounds.

original: k'am ko hi ne zhes pa ni nye ba'i mtshan do ha rnams la'o //
analyzed: k'am ko hi ne zhes pa ni nye ba'i mtshan do ha rnams la'o //
translated: Kāṃ ko hi ne is for the nearby charnel grounds.

original: m'a pra ko gri zhes pa ni 'dus pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: m'a pra ko gri zhes pa ni 'dus pa rnams la'o //
translated: Mā pra ko gri is for the assemblies.

original: soo ka su sim zhes pa ni nye ba'i 'dus pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: soo ka su sim zhes pa ni nye ba'i 'dus pa rnams la'o //
translated: Sau ka su sim is for the nearby assemblies.

original: na ma si ki zhes pa ni dur khrod rnams la'o //
analyzed: na ma si ki zhes pa ni dur khrod rnams la'o //
translated: Na ma si ki is for the charnel grounds.

original: ma ga ku sa zhes pa ni nye ba'i dur khrod rnams la'o //
analyzed: ma ga ku sa zhes pa ni nye ba'i dur khrod rnams la'o //
translated: Ma ga ku sa is for the nearby charnel grounds.

original: tsa ke bim ko zhes pa ni 'thung gcod rnams la'o //
analyzed: tsa ke bim ko zhes pa ni 'thung gcod rnams la'o //
translated: The words ca and bim are for the drinking-cutters.

original: pi ko tri shi zhes pa ni nye ba'i 'thung gcod rnams la'o //
analyzed: pi ko tri shi zhes pa ni nye ba'i 'thung gcod rnams la'o //
translated: The words ko and tri are for the near-drinking-cutters.

original: de bzhin du dur khrod bcu drug rnams la ste rlung gi sgo'i g-yon dang g-yas dag tu /
analyzed: de bzhin du dur khrod bcu drug rnams la ste rlung gi sgo'i g-yon dang g-yas dag tu /
translated: Similarly, the sixteen charnel grounds are in the left and right doors of wind.

original: kam ka la la kam dang ko la ha la la ko ste yang na thka thk'a'o //
analyzed: kam ka la la kam dang ko la ha la la ko ste yang na thka thk'a'o //
translated: The words kam and kam are for the left and right doors of wind, or tak and tak.

original: de bzhin du nub dang rlung gi sgor p'u ste gan dha @197b la p'u dang sarba dam sha la sa ste yang na na n'a'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nub dang rlung gi sgor p'u ste gan dha @197b la p'u dang sarba dam sha la sa ste yang na na n'a'o //
translated: Similarly, the words pu and pu are for the west and wind doors, or na and na.

original: byang gi sgor kl'i na la kl'i dang dbang ldan du b'a la mri tyu la b'a ste yang na ma m'a'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgor kl'i na la kl'i dang dbang ldan du b'a la mri tyu la b'a ste yang na ma m'a'o //
translated: The words kali and kali are for the north door, or ma and ma.

original: lho dang bden bral gyi sgor sha ba da ha na la sha dang gho ra yud dha la gho ste yang na na n'a'o //
analyzed: lho dang bden bral gyi sgor sha ba da ha na la sha dang gho ra yud dha la gho ste yang na na n'a'o //
translated: The words sha and sha are for the south and south-west doors, or na and na.

original: shar dang me'i sgor sh'u la bhe da la sh'u la dang autstshi shta bha ksha la au ste yang na nya ny'a'o //
analyzed: shar dang me'i sgor sh'u la bhe da la sh'u la dang autstshi shta bha ksha la au ste yang na nya ny'a'o //
translated: The words shu and shu are for the east and south-east doors, or nya and nya.

original: me'i sgo'i g-yon dang g-yas dag tu bh'i ma la bh'i dang bha yam ka ra la bha ste /🔽yang nang d'a'o //
analyzed: me'i sgo'i g-yon dang g-yas dag tu bh'i ma la bh'i dang bha yam ka ra la bha ste / yang nang d'a'o //
translated: and bhayamkara🔽.

original: dbang ldan gyi sgo'i g-yon dang g-yas dag tu /
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi sgo'i g-yon dang g-yas dag tu /
translated: On the left and right of the Indra door,🔽hahakara🔽and atatathaha

original: ha h'a k'a ra la ha dang aa tta tta h'a sa la a'a ste yang na ha h'a'o //
analyzed: ha h'a k'a ra la ha dang aa tta tta h'a sa la a'a ste yang na ha h'a'o //
translated: ha ha to Hākara, and a ta ta ha sa to Aṭṭahāsa, or else ha ha.

original: bden bral gyi sgo'i g-yon dang g-yas dag tu /
analyzed: bden bral gyi sgo'i g-yon dang g-yas dag tu /
translated: On the left and right of the Nairrta door,🔽raudranada🔽and petakara🔽.

original: roo dra n'a da la roo dang phe ta k'a ra la phe ste yang na ksha ksh'a'o zhes pa ni dur khrod bcu drug gi lha mo rnams kyi sa bon no //
analyzed: roo dra n'a da la roo dang phe ta k'a ra la phe ste yang na ksha ksh'a'o zhes pa ni dur khrod bcu drug gi lha mo rnams kyi sa bon no //
translated: These are the seed syllables of the goddesses of the sixteen charnel grounds.

original: de ltar mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sngom pa nyis 'gyur ni 'jig rten pa'i yul gyi tha snyad kyis byis pa'i skye bo rnams bsgral ba'i slad du gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sngom pa nyis 'gyur ni 'jig rten pa'i yul gyi tha snyad kyis byis pa'i skye bo rnams bsgral ba'i slad du gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the double grid of dakinis is taught by worldly conventions in order to liberate childish beings.

original: rnam par dpyad na k'a ma r'u pa dang dz'a la dha ra la sogs pa gnas la sogs pa yin pa ni brdzun te grong bye ba'i lhag pa'i lha dang ldan pa'i yul gcig la yang gnas la sogs pa rnam gsungs pa'i phyir dang de bzhin du bod
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na k'a ma r'u pa dang dz'a la dha ra la sogs pa gnas la sogs pa yin pa ni brdzun te grong bye ba'i lhag pa'i lha dang ldan pa'i yul gcig la yang gnas la sogs pa rnam gsungs pa'i phyir dang de bzhin du bod
translated: When analyzed, the statements that Kāmarūpa, Jālandhara, and so on are the places and so forth are false because the places and so forth are not mentioned in the one country that possesses the remaining deities of the ten million cities.

original: dang / rgya nag dang / rgya nag chen po la sogs pa'i yul rnams dang / grong bye ba'i lhag pa'i lha dang ldan pa'i yul dgu bcu rtsa drug rnams su ma gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir pho nya mo rnams khyab par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang / rgya nag dang / rgya nag chen po la sogs pa'i yul rnams dang / grong bye ba'i lhag pa'i lha dang ldan pa'i yul dgu bcu rtsa drug rnams su ma gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir pho nya mo rnams khyab par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the countries of Tibet, China, and Great China and so on and the ninety-six countries that possess the remaining deities of the ten million cities are not mentioned.🔽Therefore, the goddesses do not pervade.

original: des na rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des na rtsa ba'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus the Bhagavān said in the Root Tantra:🔽The place is in the east, Videha,

original: gnas ni shar du lus 'phags dang // lho ru 'dzam bu'i gling dang ni //🔽nub tu nub kyi ba lang spyod //
analyzed: gnas ni shar du lus 'phags dang // lho ru 'dzam bu'i gling dang ni // nub tu nub kyi ba lang spyod //
translated: in the south, Jambudvīpa,🔽in the west, Godānīya,

original: byang du byang gi sgra mi snyan //
analyzed: byang du byang gi sgra mi snyan //
translated: in the north, Kuru.

original: phyogs bral nye ba'i gling rnams ni //
analyzed: phyogs bral nye ba'i gling rnams ni //
translated: The subcontinents are in the directions.

original: nye ba'i gnas 'gyur sa gzhi la'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i gnas 'gyur sa gzhi la'o //
translated: The neighboring places are the earth.

original: de bzhin zhing la sogs pa kun ;
analyzed: de bzhin zhing la sogs pa kun ;
translated: Similarly, all the fields, etc.

original: / rgya mtsho'i dkyil 'khor sogs rnams la zhes so //
analyzed: / rgya mtsho'i dkyil 'khor sogs rnams la zhes so //
translated: are in the middle of the ocean, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'khor lo gsum gyi sdom pa dang kye'i rdo rje las bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma dang phyi ma'i gsung 'gal ba gang yin pa de ni dbang po rnon po'i sems can rnams kyi 'dzin pa dgrol ba'i slad du ste @198a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor lo gsum gyi sdom pa dang kye'i rdo rje las bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma dang phyi ma'i gsung 'gal ba gang yin pa de ni dbang po rnon po'i sems can rnams kyi 'dzin pa dgrol ba'i slad du ste @198a * //
translated: Therefore, in the three-wheel tantras and in Hevajra, the Bhagavān has said contradictory things in the earlier and later parts in order to free the grasping of sharp-faculty sentient beings.

original: 'dir 'khor lo sdom pa las gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de dag ni kye'i rdo rje las zhing dang nye ba'i zhing la sogs pa 'khrags 'khrugs su gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir 'khor lo sdom pa las gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de dag ni kye'i rdo rje las zhing dang nye ba'i zhing la sogs pa 'khrags 'khrugs su gsungs so //
translated: Here, the places and neighboring places, etc. that are mentioned in the Cakrasaṃvara tantra are the fields and neighboring fields, etc. that are mentioned in a confused way in the Hevajra tantra.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub rnams kyang phyi rol gyi gnas la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub rnams kyang phyi rol gyi gnas la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the mundane feats of the yogins and yoginīs do not occur in the external places, etc.

original: nang du ma reg pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa'i dus sbyor bcu gnyis rnams te rga shi la sogs pa 'gags pa'i gzhu la sogs pas gnas la sogs pa rnams rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: nang du ma reg pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa'i dus sbyor bcu gnyis rnams te rga shi la sogs pa 'gags pa'i gzhu la sogs pas gnas la sogs pa rnams rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The twelve houses such as Aries are to be understood as the places of the cessation of the twelve limbs such as old age and death.

original: gnas la sogs pa de rnams su de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i dbyings rnams lha'i gzugs kyis byon pa'am gshegs pa 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa dang da ltar byung ba na yod pa dang
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa de rnams su de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i dbyings rnams lha'i gzugs kyis byon pa'am gshegs pa 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa dang da ltar byung ba na yod pa dang
translated: In those houses and so on, the realms of the Tathagata's pure aggregates, elements, sense bases and so on, in the form of deities, have come or gone in the past, exist in the present,

original: ma 'ongs pa na 'byung bar 'gyur te dbang byed pa dang longs spyod pa dang thim pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na 'byung bar 'gyur te dbang byed pa dang longs spyod pa dang thim pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: and will occur in the future, through the divisions of domination, enjoyment and dissolution.

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'khor lo gsum gyi sdom pa las longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa dang bdag po nyid du thun mtshams dang thun tshod dang dus sbyor phyed kyi dbye bas lha mo bzhi dang brgyad dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams gsungs so
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'khor lo gsum gyi sdom pa las longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa dang bdag po nyid du thun mtshams dang thun tshod dang dus sbyor phyed kyi dbye bas lha mo bzhi dang brgyad dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams gsungs so
translated: In the conventional sense, the four goddesses are taught in the three wheels, by the divisions of the half periods, periods, and double periods, as enjoyment, dissolution, domination, and ownership.

original: // 'dir 'khor lo drug gi sdom pa chen po las dus sbyor gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pas dbang byed pa dang thim pa'o zhes pa ste 'dir dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog gis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: // 'dir 'khor lo drug gi sdom pa chen po las dus sbyor gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu 'bab pas dbang byed pa dang thim pa'o zhes pa ste 'dir dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog gis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: Here, in the great vow of the six wheels, the mandala of the periods is the falling of the double periods, which are domination and dissolution. Here, domination is the consecration of the life force.

original: de nyid ni longs spyod pa ste bdag po nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni longs spyod pa ste bdag po nyid do //
translated: That itself is enjoyment, which is ownership.

original: thim pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar bya ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: thim pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar bya ba'i gnas so //
translated: Dissolution is the place to be gone.

original: des na rgyab tu lha mo dbang byed thim pa zhes pa 'dir ni mdun du de nyid lnga yi rang bzhin rnams kyis te zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par mdzad de 'dir g-yas kyi rtsal chu srin gyi dus sbyor chu tshod lnga'i bdag nyid kyi chu tshod
analyzed: des na rgyab tu lha mo dbang byed thim pa zhes pa 'dir ni mdun du de nyid lnga yi rang bzhin rnams kyis te zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par mdzad de 'dir g-yas kyi rtsal chu srin gyi dus sbyor chu tshod lnga'i bdag nyid kyi chu tshod
translated: Therefore, the line “the goddess Vaśaṃkara dissolves into the back” is expanded here as “into the front by the natures of those five.”

original: dang po la sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dang po la sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The first of the five nāḍīs of the crocodile time period is the earth maṇḍala.🔽In the navel, from among the twelve petals, the life force flows to the west of the crocodile petal.

original: lte bar 'dab ma bcu gnyis las chu srin gyi 'dab ma'i nub phyogs kyi cha la srog rab tu 'bab ste rlung gi rtsibs la zhes pa ni brtags pa'o //
analyzed: lte bar 'dab ma bcu gnyis las chu srin gyi 'dab ma'i nub phyogs kyi cha la srog rab tu 'bab ste rlung gi rtsibs la zhes pa ni brtags pa'o //
translated: The line “on the vāyu petal” is a designation.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe srog gi nus pa'i lha mo sa'i dkyil @198b 'khor la dbang byed pas gnas pa de'i tshe 'gro bar bya ba chu'i dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe srog gi nus pa'i lha mo sa'i dkyil @198b 'khor la dbang byed pas gnas pa de'i tshe 'gro bar bya ba chu'i dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
translated: Here, when the goddess of the power of the life force controls the earth maṇḍala, at that time, the object of movement dissolves into the water maṇḍala.

original: slar yang skye ba 'dzin pa ni snga ma 'gags shing phyi ma skye ba ste kha thon dang mar me la sogs pa'i dpe bzhin du 'dir yang 'chi ba'i tha ma dang skye ba'i cha can gyi chos dag la'o //
analyzed: slar yang skye ba 'dzin pa ni snga ma 'gags shing phyi ma skye ba ste kha thon dang mar me la sogs pa'i dpe bzhin du 'dir yang 'chi ba'i tha ma dang skye ba'i cha can gyi chos dag la'o //
translated: Again, the taking up of birth is the cessation of the former and the arising of the latter, as in the case of recitation and a lamp, and so on.

original: des na sa'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa dang chu'i dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
analyzed: des na sa'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa dang chu'i dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
translated: Thus, the earth mandala is dominated and dissolves into the water mandala.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa dang me'i dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa dang me'i dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
translated: The water mandala is dominated and dissolves into the fire mandala.

original: me'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
translated: The fire mandala is dominated and dissolves into the wind mandala.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa dang stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa dang stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
translated: The wind mandala is dominated and dissolves into the space mandala.

original: stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa dang ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o zhes pa ni chu srin la'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa dang ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o zhes pa ni chu srin la'o //
translated: The space mandala is dominated and dissolves into the gnosis mandala.🔽This is the crocodile.

original: de nas bum pa'i 'dab ma la dbu mar yang dag par rgyu ba gang yin pa de ni 'khor lo'i steng du gsungs te 'dir gang gi tshe aa ba dh'u t'i ra ye shes kyi 'khor lo la dbang byed pa de'i tshe g-yon gyi rtsar nam mkha'i dkyil🔽'khor la thim pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bum pa'i 'dab ma la dbu mar yang dag par rgyu ba gang yin pa de ni 'khor lo'i steng du gsungs te 'dir gang gi tshe aa ba dh'u t'i ra ye shes kyi 'khor lo la dbang byed pa de'i tshe g-yon gyi rtsar nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
translated: When the rasanā controls the cakra of wisdom, at that time, the air element dissolves into the maṇḍala of space in the left nāḍī.

original: gang gi tshe nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa de'i tshe rlung la thim pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la dbang byed pa de'i tshe rlung la thim pa'o //
translated: When the maṇḍala of space is controlled, at that time, the air element dissolves into the air element.

original: de bzhin du rlung la dbang byed pa dang me la thim pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung la dbang byed pa dang me la thim pa'o //
translated: Similarly, when the air element is controlled, it dissolves into the fire element.

original: me la dbang byed pa dang chu la thim pa'o //
analyzed: me la dbang byed pa dang chu la thim pa'o //
translated: When the fire element is controlled, it dissolves into the water element.

original: chu la dbang byed pa dang sa la thim pa'o //
analyzed: chu la dbang byed pa dang sa la thim pa'o //
translated: When the water element is controlled, it dissolves into the earth element.

original: sa la dbang byed pa dang aa ba dh'u t'i ra ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
analyzed: sa la dbang byed pa dang aa ba dh'u t'i ra ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la thim pa'o //
translated: When the earth element is controlled, it dissolves into the maṇḍala of wisdom of the avadhūti.

original: de bzhin du nya dang lug gi dkyil 'khor rnams la ste de bzhin du khyu mchog dang 'khrig pa dag dang ka rka ta dang seng ge dag dang bu mo dang srang dag dang sdig pa dang gzhu dag la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nya dang lug gi dkyil 'khor rnams la ste de bzhin du khyu mchog dang 'khrig pa dag dang ka rka ta dang seng ge dag dang bu mo dang srang dag dang sdig pa dang gzhu dag la'o //
translated: Likewise, in the maṇḍalas of the fish, the ram, the bull, the couple, the crab, the lion, the maiden, the scales, the scorpion, and the bow.

original: dkyil 'khor drug cu po rnams la longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa rnams te dus sbyor gsum gyi mthar bzhi ni dbu ma la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor drug cu po rnams la longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa rnams te dus sbyor gsum gyi mthar bzhi ni dbu ma la rig par bya'o //
translated: In the sixty maṇḍalas, the enjoyments, the dissolutions, and the dominants are at the end of the three junctures. Four are in the central channel.

original: rlung dang dbang ldan lha min me dang 'og dang mkha' dang lha dang gshin rje gnod sbyin nub tu dkyil 'khor bcu po rnams la ste yang yig gis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
analyzed: rlung dang dbang ldan lha min me dang 'og dang mkha' dang lha dang gshin rje gnod sbyin nub tu dkyil 'khor bcu po rnams la ste yang yig gis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la yang ngo //
translated: In the ten maṇḍalas of the wind, Indra, the asuras, fire, below, space, gods, Yama, and yakṣas in the west, and also in the maṇḍala of pristine consciousness, by the word “also.”

original: chu srin dang bu ma pa la ste de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: chu srin dang bu ma pa la ste de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: In the maṇḍalas of Capricorn and Aquarius, and likewise, in the others.

original: da ni chu srin la sogs pa rnams @199a * //
analyzed: da ni chu srin la sogs pa rnams @199a * //
translated: Now, in the maṇḍalas of Capricorn and so on,

original: kyi rten gyi 'khor lo'i rtsa rnams gsungs pa gtsug tor zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo'i zlum skor dang po la rtsa bzhi dang dbus su gcig go //
analyzed: kyi rten gyi 'khor lo'i rtsa rnams gsungs pa gtsug tor zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo'i zlum skor dang po la rtsa bzhi dang dbus su gcig go //
translated: The channels of the wheel of the navel are taught, beginning with “the wheel of the crown,” and so on. Here, the first circle of the wheel of the crown has four channels and one in the center.

original: de bzhin du snying kha la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying kha la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams la'o //
translated: Similarly, the wheels of the heart, and so on, are also like that.

original: des na chu srin dang bum pa dag la gtsug tor gyi 'khor lor rlung gi rtsibs la sogs pa yang dag par rgyu ste nam mkha' dag pas 'khor lo'i dang po la rdo rje'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: des na chu srin dang bum pa dag la gtsug tor gyi 'khor lor rlung gi rtsibs la sogs pa yang dag par rgyu ste nam mkha' dag pas 'khor lo'i dang po la rdo rje'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: Therefore, in the Capricorn and Aquarius [months], the winds move through the channels of the wheel of the crown, and so on. Since space is pure, the first wheel has the sign of the vajra.

original: des na dkyil 'khor du nam mkha'i 'khor lo la rdo rje'i phreng ba'o //🔽de bzhin du nya dang lug dag la snying kha'i rang bzhin las rlung gi 'khor lo la ral gri'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: des na dkyil 'khor du nam mkha'i 'khor lo la rdo rje'i phreng ba'o // de bzhin du nya dang lug dag la snying kha'i rang bzhin las rlung gi 'khor lo la ral gri'i phreng ba'o //
translated: Therefore, in the mandala, the wheel of space has a vajra garland.🔽Similarly, in the months of Pisces and Aries, the wheel of wind is in the nature of the heart, and it has a sword garland.

original: de bzhin du glang dang 'khrig pa dag la mgrin par gnas pa la ste me'i rang bzhin las me'i 'khor lo la rin po che'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du glang dang 'khrig pa dag la mgrin par gnas pa la ste me'i rang bzhin las me'i 'khor lo la rin po che'i phreng ba'o //
translated: Similarly, in the months of Taurus and Gemini, the wheel of fire is in the nature of the throat, and it has a jewel garland.

original: karka ta dang seng ge dag la mgo po la gnas pa la ste chu'i rang bzhin las chu'i 'khor lo la padma'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: karka ta dang seng ge dag la mgo po la gnas pa la ste chu'i rang bzhin las chu'i 'khor lo la padma'i phreng ba'o //
translated: In Cancer and Leo, the head is located in the head, and from the nature of water, there is a garland of lotuses in the water wheel.

original: bu mo dang srang dag la lte ba'i 'khor lo la ste sa'i rang bzhin las 'khor lo'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: bu mo dang srang dag la lte ba'i 'khor lo la ste sa'i rang bzhin las 'khor lo'i phreng ba'o //
translated: In Virgo and Libra, the navel wheel is located in the navel, and from the nature of earth, there is a garland of wheels.

original: sdig pa dang gzhu dag la gsang ba'i 'khor lor te ye shes kyi rang bzhin las gri gug gi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa dang gzhu dag la gsang ba'i 'khor lor te ye shes kyi rang bzhin las gri gug gi phreng ba'o //
translated: In Scorpio and Sagittarius, the secret wheel is located in the secret place, and from the nature of wisdom, there is a garland of flaying knives.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad brgyad pa 'di rnams la 'og dang steng du nyi na zhag so sor chu srin gyi dus sbyor nas brtsams te srog gi yang dag par rgyu ba 'di rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad brgyad pa 'di rnams la 'og dang steng du nyi na zhag so sor chu srin gyi dus sbyor nas brtsams te srog gi yang dag par rgyu ba 'di rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o //
translated: In these eight-spoked wheels, below and above, the yogī should know the movement of the life-force, beginning with the Capricorn solstice, on each day.

original: 'dir gang dang gang du srog dbang byed pa de dang der dkyil 'khor gyi gtso mo'i ming dang lhan cig bcom ldan 'das kyi rkang pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa'i rkang pa gcig bzung nas srog rab tu 'bab pas bzlas par bya ste bgrang phreng gis ni ma
analyzed: 'dir gang dang gang du srog dbang byed pa de dang der dkyil 'khor gyi gtso mo'i ming dang lhan cig bcom ldan 'das kyi rkang pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa'i rkang pa gcig bzung nas srog rab tu 'bab pas bzlas par bya ste bgrang phreng gis ni ma
translated: Here, wherever the life force is dominant, there, together with the name of the principal goddess of the maṇḍala, one should recite with the descent of the life force, taking one verse from the Blessed One’s forty-eight verses, and not with a rosary.

original: yin no // de bzhin du rkang pa bcu drug gi rkang pa re re bzung nas dur khrod kyi lha mo'i ming dang bcas pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: yin no // de bzhin du rkang pa bcu drug gi rkang pa re re bzung nas dur khrod kyi lha mo'i ming dang bcas pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, taking each verse from the sixteen verses, one should recite together with the name of the goddess of the charnel ground.

original: rkang pa brgyad ni padma'i 'dab ma'i lha mo brgyad dang lhan cig tu zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkang pa brgyad ni padma'i 'dab ma'i lha mo brgyad dang lhan cig tu zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The eight verses are together with the eight goddesses of the lotus petals, as will be explained.

original: de ltar chu srin la sogs pa dus sbyor gnyis gnyis kyi bar du dbyug gu bcu bcu rnams la pho nya mo rnams kyi 'khor lo yang dag par rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ltar chu srin la sogs pa dus sbyor gnyis gnyis kyi bar du dbyug gu bcu bcu rnams la pho nya mo rnams kyi 'khor lo yang dag par rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, in the two-by-two yamas beginning with Makara, the ten staffs are the wheel of the messengers moving correctly.

original: de ltar nyin zhag gi dbyug gu drug cu po @199b rnams kyi dkyil 'khor drug cu po rnams la srog yang dag par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag gi dbyug gu drug cu po @199b rnams kyi dkyil 'khor drug cu po rnams la srog yang dag par rgyu ba'o //
translated: Thus, in the sixty maṇḍalas of the sixty nāḍīs of the day and night, the prāṇa moves correctly.

original: de ltar lus las skyes pa'i phra mo dang mi dang 'byung po dang lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyi rang rang gi nyin zhag dang rang rang gi dkyil 'khor rnams la rnal 'byor ma yang dag par rgyu ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyur gyur pa
analyzed: de ltar lus las skyes pa'i phra mo dang mi dang 'byung po dang lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyi rang rang gi nyin zhag dang rang rang gi dkyil 'khor rnams la rnal 'byor ma yang dag par rgyu ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyur gyur pa
translated: Thus, in the maṇḍalas of the individual days and individual maṇḍalas of the subtle, human, bhūta, deva, and asura beings born from the body, the yoginīs move correctly, becoming the cause of birth and destruction.

original: ste / sgyu 'phrul chen mo drag chen mo //🔽ji ltar 'byung dang sdud byed pas //
analyzed: ste / sgyu 'phrul chen mo drag chen mo // ji ltar 'byung dang sdud byed pas //
translated: The great, powerful, great magical one🔽is the cause of the creation and destruction of the world.

original: rang nyid byed po 'phrog po ltar //
analyzed: rang nyid byed po 'phrog po ltar //
translated: Just as she is the creator and destroyer,

original: rdo rje 'chang dang sangs rgyas dang // shes rab pha rol phyin ma rnams //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang dang sangs rgyas dang // shes rab pha rol phyin ma rnams //
translated: Vajradhara, the Buddha, and Prajñāpāramitā

original: lus can rnams kyi byed po min //🔽sangs rgyas pa la bden gsung gis ;
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi byed po min // sangs rgyas pa la bden gsung gis ;
translated: are not the creators of embodied beings.

original: / byed po 'phrog po bstan pa med //
analyzed: / byed po 'phrog po bstan pa med //
translated: In Buddhism, the creator and destroyer are not taught.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las //
translated: The body, speech, and mind of embodied beings

original: dge dang mi dge gang byed pa //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge gang byed pa //
translated: Whatever is done, virtuous or non-virtuous,

original: de yi 'bras bu sems can spyod //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu sems can spyod //
translated: the result of that is experienced by sentient beings.

original: byed po gzhan ni 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: byed po gzhan ni 'ga' yang med //
translated: There is no other agent at all.

original: ces pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the Bhagavān.

original: da ni gtso bo'i gdan gsungs pa gtso bo'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gtsug tor la sogs pa'i 'khor lo drug po rnams la ka yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi yang dag par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: da ni gtso bo'i gdan gsungs pa gtso bo'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gtsug tor la sogs pa'i 'khor lo drug po rnams la ka yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyis rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi yang dag par rgyu ba'o //
translated: Now, the principal seat is stated beginning with “the principal,” etc. Here, in the six cakras beginning with the uṣṇīṣa, the yoginīs move with the syllables beginning with “ka.”

original: des na gtso bo'i chu skyes te dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su padma gang yin pa de rdo rje kun gyis zhes pa ni thig le bzhi po rnams 'gyur med ces pa mi 'pho ba'i rdo rje nor bur gnas pa rnams kyis rdo rje nor bur gnas pa ni
analyzed: des na gtso bo'i chu skyes te dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su padma gang yin pa de rdo rje kun gyis zhes pa ni thig le bzhi po rnams 'gyur med ces pa mi 'pho ba'i rdo rje nor bur gnas pa rnams kyis rdo rje nor bur gnas pa ni
translated: Therefore, the principal lotus, which is the center of the maṇḍala, is the vajra of all, i.e., the four bindus that are “immobile,” i.e., abiding in the vajra jewel without moving. Abiding in the vajra jewel,

original: padma ste kun nas dga' ba thams cad pa bde ba mnyam pa'i gnas 'pho ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: padma ste kun nas dga' ba thams cad pa bde ba mnyam pa'i gnas 'pho ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: the lotus is the abode of the bliss of all universal joy, because it is itself immovable.

original: rdo rje can ni dus thams cad pa ste rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis dga' bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can ni dus thams cad pa ste rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis dga' bskyed pa'o //
translated: The Vajra-holder is all-pervading, and the Yoginis generate delight.

original: de'i phyir zla bzhu ba mi 'pho ba'i bde ba bla ma'i zhal te ye shes kyi zhal de la ni gang zhig zhugs pa dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid de rnal 'byor par 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o //🔽de ltar 'di'i 'khor lo ni dus su gsungs zhes pa ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos su brjod pa phung po'i bdud la sogs pa bzhi po rnams gsod pa dang 'jigs par byed pa mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo 'di dag go zhes pa ni sgrib pa
analyzed: de'i phyir zla bzhu ba mi 'pho ba'i bde ba bla ma'i zhal te ye shes kyi zhal de la ni gang zhig zhugs pa dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid de rnal 'byor par 'gyur ro zhes pa nges pa'o // de ltar 'di'i 'khor lo ni dus su gsungs zhes pa ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos su brjod pa phung po'i bdud la sogs pa bzhi po rnams gsod pa dang 'jigs par byed pa mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo 'di dag go zhes pa ni sgrib pa
translated: Therefore, the face of the Guru, the face of wisdom, is the moon-like nectar, the bliss that does not move. He who enters that is the very Wheel of Time, and he becomes a yogi. This is the determination.

original: thams cad las nges par grol ba ste lha'i tshogs brtags pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad las nges par grol ba ste lha'i tshogs brtags pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, his wheel is said to be timely, for it kills and terrifies the four demons of the aggregates, etc., which are described as the phenomena of ignorance, etc. This is the wheel of the dakinis. This is the freedom from all obscurations. The other imagined groups of gods are not so.

original: da ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i slad du sngags kyi bzlas pa gsang @200a * //
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i slad du sngags kyi bzlas pa gsang @200a * //
translated: Now, in order to accomplish the mundane siddhis, the mantra recitation is secret.

original: pa shes rab thabs zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dus kyi 'khor lo la shes rab thabs kyi yi ge dag gis zhes pa ni 'dir gang du shes rab kyi sa bon thung du yin pa de'i thabs kyi ni mngon du phyogs pa'i rigs kyi dbang gis🔽ring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa shes rab thabs zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dus kyi 'khor lo la shes rab thabs kyi yi ge dag gis zhes pa ni 'dir gang du shes rab kyi sa bon thung du yin pa de'i thabs kyi ni mngon du phyogs pa'i rigs kyi dbang gis ring por 'gyur ro //
translated: The wisdom and means syllables, etc., are as follows: Here, in the Kālacakra, the wisdom and means syllables are as follows: Where the wisdom seed is short, the means is long by the power of the type.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi ring po yin pa de'i tshe thabs kyi thung du'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi ring po yin pa de'i tshe thabs kyi thung du'o //
translated: When the wisdom is long, the means is short.

original: de ltar gnyi ga'i rigs kyi dbang las mkha' 'gro ma dang mkha' 'gro'i ming zhes pa ni shi rdo rje ma dang sl'i rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa dang de bzhin du sl'i rdo rje ma dang shi rdo rje ste sa dang rlung phan tshun du shes
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga'i rigs kyi dbang las mkha' 'gro ma dang mkha' 'gro'i ming zhes pa ni shi rdo rje ma dang sl'i rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa dang de bzhin du sl'i rdo rje ma dang shi rdo rje ste sa dang rlung phan tshun du shes
translated: Thus, by the power of the type of both, the names of the dakinis and dakas are as follows: Śrīvajra and Salvajra, and likewise Salvajra and Śrīvajra, earth and wind, respectively.

original: rab dang thabs kyi dbye ba las so //
analyzed: rab dang thabs kyi dbye ba las so //
translated: By the division of wisdom and means.

original: de bzhin du chu dang me dag gi shri rdo rje ma dang w'u rdo rje zhes pa dang de bzhin du w'u rdo rje ma dang shri rdo rje zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma dang mkha' 'gro thams cad kyi ming rdo rje gsum po rkang pa gzhan dang bcas
analyzed: de bzhin du chu dang me dag gi shri rdo rje ma dang w'u rdo rje zhes pa dang de bzhin du w'u rdo rje ma dang shri rdo rje zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma dang mkha' 'gro thams cad kyi ming rdo rje gsum po rkang pa gzhan dang bcas
translated: Likewise, the names of all the dakinis and dakas are the three vajras with other feet, divided into beginning, middle, and end.

original: pas thog ma dbus dang tha mar phye ba 'di ni bzlas bya ste zhes pa ni thog mar aom yig go //
analyzed: pas thog ma dbus dang tha mar phye ba 'di ni bzlas bya ste zhes pa ni thog mar aom yig go //
translated: This is the mantra to be repeated: at the beginning is the syllable oṃ.

original: dbus su phreng ba'i sngags kyi rkang pa dang po la sogs pa dang de nas rdo rje pho nya mo'i sa bon rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang bcas pa dang de nas thugs rdo rje h'um yig thung du dang gsung rdo rje ring po ste mthar phat yig go
analyzed: dbus su phreng ba'i sngags kyi rkang pa dang po la sogs pa dang de nas rdo rje pho nya mo'i sa bon rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang bcas pa dang de nas thugs rdo rje h'um yig thung du dang gsung rdo rje ring po ste mthar phat yig go
translated: In the middle are the first foot of the garland mantra and so on, then the seed of the vajra messenger together with the vajra dakini, then the short hūṃ of mind vajra, the long a of speech vajra, and at the end the syllable phaṭ.

original: // de la phreng ba'i sngags ni rkang pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa ste rkang pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams las dang por rkang pa brgyad ni padma'i 'dab ma'i lha mo rnams dang lhan cig go //
analyzed: // de la phreng ba'i sngags ni rkang pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa ste rkang pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams las dang por rkang pa brgyad ni padma'i 'dab ma'i lha mo rnams dang lhan cig go //
translated: The garland mantra is seventy-two syllables. Of those seventy-two syllables, first, the eight syllables are together with the goddesses of the lotus petals.

original: rkang pa bcu drug ni dur khrod kyi lha mo rnams dang lhan cig go //
analyzed: rkang pa bcu drug ni dur khrod kyi lha mo rnams dang lhan cig go //
translated: The sixteen syllables are together with the charnel ground goddesses.

original: rkang pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad ni 'khor lo drug gi dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma'i ming dang lhan cig tu bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad ni 'khor lo drug gi dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma'i ming dang lhan cig tu bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The forty-eight syllables are recited together with the names of the heroes, heroines, and powerful goddesses of the six wheels.

original: 'dir rkang pa brgyad dang dur khrod bzhi'i rkang pa srog gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams ni chu srin la sogs pa la 'pho ba'i dus su dbu mar rab tu zhugs pa bcu gnyis rnams la bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rkang pa brgyad dang dur khrod bzhi'i rkang pa srog gis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams ni chu srin la sogs pa la 'pho ba'i dus su dbu mar rab tu zhugs pa bcu gnyis rnams la bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Here, the eight syllables and the sixteen syllables of the four charnel grounds, which are empowered by life, should be recited on the twelve [syllable groups] that enter the central channel at the time of the transits of Capricorn and so forth.

original: lhag ma rkang pa drug cu rnams ni dkyil 'khor lnga'i byin gyis brlabs kyis srog byin gyis brlabs pa gang gi dkyil 'khor yin pa de'i lhag pa'i lha dang bcas pa'i phreng ba'i sngags rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'grub par 'gyur te rgyu ba'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: lhag ma rkang pa drug cu rnams ni dkyil 'khor lnga'i byin gyis brlabs kyis srog byin gyis brlabs pa gang gi dkyil 'khor yin pa de'i lhag pa'i lha dang bcas pa'i phreng ba'i sngags rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'grub par 'gyur te rgyu ba'i dbye bas so //
translated: The yogis will accomplish them by the division of the movements.🔽They will quickly become siddhis, abiding in the migrations of the six classes of beings.

original: myur du dngos grub tu ni 'gyur te ro yi 'gro ba rnams la gnas pa zhes @200b pa 'gro ba rigs drug la gnas pa ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma thams cad do zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: myur du dngos grub tu ni 'gyur te ro yi 'gro ba rnams la gnas pa zhes @200b pa 'gro ba rigs drug la gnas pa ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma thams cad do zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān’s definitive statement is that all of the vajra dakas and dakinis abide in the migrations of the six classes of beings.

original: 'dir kun rdzob tu lha mo'i phreng ba'i sngags la chu srin la sogs pa dang ka'i sde pa la sogs pas nye ba'i 'thung gcod la sogs pa dgong pa ste de la 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi rkang pa rnams ni 'di lta ste aom a'a: h'um ho: ham
analyzed: 'dir kun rdzob tu lha mo'i phreng ba'i sngags la chu srin la sogs pa dang ka'i sde pa la sogs pas nye ba'i 'thung gcod la sogs pa dgong pa ste de la 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyi rkang pa rnams ni 'di lta ste aom a'a: h'um ho: ham
translated: Here, the mantras of the garland of goddesses are the relative. The mantras of the garland of goddesses are the mantras of the garland of goddesses.

original: ksha: hkshmlwom k'a la tsa kra h'a badzre hum h'um phat ces pa chu srin gyi 'pho ba la rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs lnga bcu rtsa drug bzlas so //
analyzed: ksha: hkshmlwom k'a la tsa kra h'a badzre hum h'um phat ces pa chu srin gyi 'pho ba la rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs lnga bcu rtsa drug bzlas so //
translated: KṢA H KṢA MA Ū KA LA CA KRA HA VAJRA HŪM HŪM PHAṬ - this is for the Capricorn ingress, with fifty-six breaths and a foot.

original: de bzhin du aom dur d'anta da ma ka: dz'a ti dza r'a ma ra n'a na ta ka ha badzre hum h'um phat ces pa bum pa'i 'pho ba la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du aom dur d'anta da ma ka: dz'a ti dza r'a ma ra n'a na ta ka ha badzre hum h'um phat ces pa bum pa'i 'pho ba la'o //
translated: Similarly, OṂ DURDĀNTA DAMAKA JĀTI JĀRAMARĀNĀNTAKA HA VAJRA HŪM HŪM PHAṬ is for the Aquarius ingress.

original: aom tree lo kya bi dza ya y'a badzre hum h'um phat ces pa la'o //
